review: I've played a couple of the previous installments of EBF, and I think this one is definitely the best of them all. It's a simple enough RPG that has lots of free exploration, fun enemies and characters, and an interesting story throughout. I really enjoy this game and I highly recommend it for those who enjoy RPGs and want one that's easy to get into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050169078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4395, 'last_played': 1674698974}
review:
An absolute gem of a game. I can't recommend EBF5 enough, even if it seems like it might not completely be your thing--JRPG-style games aren't much my thing either, but it really didn't matter. It's just too well-made.

Normally I'd write a fairly lengthy review discussing the positives and the negatives, but, honestly, I just don't have a lot to say. The only real negatives I could highlight are that some information is a touch opaque, like the finer details of enemy capture, and the bizarre lack of guidance on the most challenging subset of achievements/medals for the game. A lot of this can be found on the Wiki, but it's never ideal to need to outsource for game information like that, especially when a Fandom Wiki is involved. But, truly, that's the worst I can say. None of that is "required," knowing that sort of thing is just how I am as a person.

The game plays very smoothly, there's no obvious balance issues, there's a huge variety of items to promote and allow different playstyles and team compositions, an excellent degree of complexity and intricacy when it comes to combat as far as stacking and managing buffs/debuffs, exploiting weaknesses, and so forth. There is a dramatic amount of extra/side content, well beyond what is reasonable to expect for this game. And, taking it far further than was necessary, there's mechanics to allow for replayability. Not just optional challenge modifiers and stat-multiplying difficulty levels, but a build-in randomizer, enemy scaling setting, and more.

This is a rare case where in a numbered series of games, each sequel has learned and grown based on prior entries. I cannot commend the team behind the game enough, and I think that anyone who looks at the game and is even vaguely interested in what they see should grab it. It is absolutely worth the full price listed, even if you're not a completionist. This game will comfortably yield a value in excess of a $1:1 hour ratio, unless you're literally speed running it. Fantastic game, fantastic dev, and I can't wait to play any future products from the dev.

review: 真怀念啊，当时玩2的时候我好像才小学三年级，现在都大一了已经，玩过3 和 4 我很喜欢这一款小众的游戏（不是）作为一款童年唯一记得的游戏“幻想大战” ，就这名字就很吸引我，不过再说一下缺点，（一点点）这款游戏玩通关了之后包括一些节假日任务（我是懒鬼）对于我这种喜欢肝游戏的会很不快乐，因为所有都通关了就没有太多的乐趣，包括小彩蛋或者小关卡，就结束之后很空虚，就没有在玩下去的动力.再说一点  6什么时候出啊，（自掘坟墓）希望以后会有更多的乐趣。不过看进度三年一个游戏今年也快了吧，我希望6上线的时候有人踢我一下-3-

author: {'steamid': '76561199173517971', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7923, 'last_played': 1709714657}
review:
把這遊戲玩透透，終於把全成就解完了。

此遊戲為回合類遊戲，屬於歡樂搞笑類型。
[b]優點[/b]

遊戲中的解謎、對話、動作、尋寶等...... 都非常流暢，沒有太困難的地方，玩家可以很自然的被引導至主線上，有耐心的話基本上能夠靠自己完成遊戲。

遊戲對話基本上不長，但因為很有趣會讓人想要看完，主角團並不會太認真的看待戰鬥，嘲諷敵人、嘲諷隊友甚至NPC也會被嘲諷，同時遊戲中也有許多彩蛋，讓人不禁微微一笑。

遊戲BGM也是令人著迷的地方，有熱血、有莊重、有歡樂、有恐怖。

戰鬥過程中，能夠跟寶O夢一樣收服怪物，一些怪物召喚時會有特別對話，不要錯過任何一隻可以抓的怪物。

遊戲難度能夠自行調整，依照自己喜歡的步調，調整成最適合自己的難度，當然如果要成就還是要打最高難度啦~

[b]缺點[/b]

節日成就較麻煩

有微微的恐怖要素((但其實並不太嚇人

[spoiler]有第六代墓碑，欲知詳情，請至遊戲中體會[/spoiler] 

整體來說很推薦來玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198042042588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2895, 'last_played': 1694307936}
review:
Внешне игра замечательна, но чем дальше играешь, тем больше конкретно охреневаешь от её баланса (особенно на эпике):
1) В игре слишком много хрени, которая уничтожает твою команду в один ход. Стан, заморозка, берсерк, конфьюз, сало, рассеивание....и от всего этого ну очень сложно защититься. Можно, но очень проблематично и примерно до середины игры перекрыть всю эту пакость не представляется возможным.
2) Из первого пункта вытекает второй: баффы. Первые два-три хода ты тратишь просто для того, чтобы максимально защитить себя от всего дерьма, что может в тебя полететь и это НЕ опциональная стратегия. В игре после определённого уровня любой противник может вас ваншотнуть или прожать в вас какую-нибудь пакость, после которой вы умрёте буквально на следующий ход/ баффы слетели или вы не можете нормально ходить. Ну просто против вас в один момент появляется враг, который накладывает и рассеивание, и запутанность и стан. Потому что иди в жопу, вот почему. Многие рассказывают, что в игре множества стратегий, но уже после середины игры единственной вашей стратегией будет постоянный бафф и авто-воскрешения иначе любой серьёзный противник доконает вас за два хода. Офигенная вариативность.
3) Баланс мобов это просто шутка. Если обычные мобы ещё неплохие, то уже некоторые элитки имеют столько резистов, сколько у вас никогда не будет. Ну вот просто попадается тебе враг, который имеет всего 2 слабости в элементах, к остальным стихиям полный резист, полный иммунитет ко всем станам и 50% резистов ко всем дебафам и делай ты с ним всё что хочешь. Не важно что игрок даже близко таких параметров никогда не будет иметь, элитный моб круче героя раза в 3. А ещё без бафов на защиту он тебе пол хп сносит с атаки. Круто, правда? Ну ничего, сейчас ты прожмёшь бафы и задаешь ему...опять рассеивание и ты голый, замечательно.
4) Постоянный свап команды. Не знаю кому это нравиться, но по какой вообще причине разработчик сделал возможным играть только за трёх героев, хотя их пять? Причём, чтобы ты постоянно их менял, он специально сделал их узконаправленными и частично неполноценными. То есть у противника часто пять ходов, так как их чаще всего стоит именно пять, а у тебя три и два дебила сидят сзади, отдыхают, ждут пока ты их поменяешь. И убить их можно. И убивают. Классная идея (нет).

ЕБФ5 действительно хорошая игра, особенно мне нравиться что это игра в моём любимом жанре победи/исследуй всю карту, но если вы хотите пройти её на эпике (а эпик не опционален, чтобы открыть весь контент вы должны получить медали за прохождение игры на эпике) то можете распрощаться со своими нервами и приготовиться к анальным приключениям.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235845212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11978, 'last_played': 1694563092}
review:
After around 150 hours of active playtime after getting all medals I say it's quite good.

Some things I don't like is mostly the lack of information the game gives at times, though considering there is a status effect that hides stuff I just gonna assume that you just have to look it all up. The library says just look at the animation to tell if it's magical or physical and I find that kinda silly when moves can look like one type but is the other.

Everything else about the game is fine. It's funny, charming, and I think the difficulty is done right and scales well.

I mostly just made Lance blow everything up in the end. Fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160008998', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6445, 'last_played': 1673405630}
review:
this series caught my eye back in 2010, such a unique artstyle and great culture. I was so invested in EBF4 on flash that I didn't know this game existed until 2 years after its release, and oh man was I surprised to see this game alongside 4 and 3 on steam.

gameplay and replayability is probably the best I've seen EBF have yet, my only nitpick is that the dialogue is not as serious / is goofier than the previous installments but that really shouldn't deter much from the game itself.

do buy this game, alongside 4, 3, and the collection

author: {'steamid': '76561198378513955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10489, 'last_played': 1673207590}
review:
Finished off the last of the 133 achievements the game has to offer yesterday, on my second play-through of the game at 175 hours in the game, and about 90 in the later save file. Promptly spent most of my steam points to be able to showcase that on my profile.

It's worth mentioning that I originally discovered the EBF series through Adventure Story and EBF3 back when flash browser games reigned supreme in the after-school hours, many many years ago. I also bought this game originally about as soon as I discovered it was released on Steam. That all being said...

EBF5 is without a shadow of a doubt the best indie game I've ever played, and I would heartily recommend it to anyone even mildly interested in turn-based strategy, rpg, and such.

The game is brilliant in a multitude of ways, and I wouldn't even know where to begin. Not only does it meet the standards you'd expect of an indie game, but exceeds them in every aspect I can think of. But probably at the number one spot for myself, is just the fact that it has everything. Nothing is missing. There's an abundance of foes, gear, abilities, puzzles, boss fights, lore, character dialogue, secrets, challenges, cryptic clues, areas to explore, storylines, references of inspiration and a stellar soundtrack... Nothing is bare bones. The only moment that left me with a fleeting "That's it, that's all?" was the little bit of in-game extra recognition after achieving all the medals. So if you're reading this, Matt... [spoiler] A little, teeny tiny, extra mini-boss, or quirky foe to capture for some silly 250-SP shenanigans summoning move wouldn't hurt anyone! [/spoiler]

What can be observed in all the stuff that makes it great, is an abundance of heart and soul. The passion in the work shows everywhere. The entire game has such unique, positive character to it, in addition to just generally high production quality, I can only describe it as a masterpiece and an inspiration. A magnum opus, if you will. 

Completed everything the game had to offer. Wasn't disappointed or frustrated by any of it. Going for the epic difficulty battle challenges was probably the most fun I ever had in a single-player game. Gosh, I wish I could do it for the first time again.

TL;DR:

Buy the game. 
It's like, you order a cheeseburger, and your order shows up, but it's a triple deluxe bacon cheeseburger with large fries, twelve onion rings, four different sauces, another, smaller cheeseburger, mozzarella sticks, and then a gallon of Baja Blast, and the waitress smiles at you in a way that still warms you up on a cold January morning six years later.

...remember to save your game before Snowflake!

review: Surprisingly solid JRPG that mocks both itself and the genre as a whole with combat mechanics that hold up really well on their own merit.

author: {'steamid': '76561199069632778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5192, 'last_played': 1692768909}
review:
对于还在小学期间就从某知名盗版网站玩到第三代的我来说，偶然从stm翻到续作属实巨大惊喜，现在已经游戏成就93%啦，全成就冲冲
剧情 音乐 角色设定 互动非常精彩（福利和致敬也很不错）
战斗相比前作添加了天气和更多的状态，难度更加硬核力（把MP改成冷却这一点我不是很认同）
以及作为本作亮点的敌对生物捕捉系统（Buff叠起来神都抓给你看）
力荐给喜欢传统回合制RPG的，这大概是现在最棒的回合制RPG
期待Matt新作

review: 難易度を変更できるゲームは個人的に好きではなく難易度ノーマルで操作しました。難易度ノーマルでは強い敵が突然現れて一撃で倒されることがありストレスが溜まります。また攻撃のミスが多くこれもストレスです。キャラ設定がよくわからず感情移入しにくいです。特定のキャラにしか与えられないごちそうシステムが意味不明。マップは丁寧に作ってあるので歩き回るのは楽しいです。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561199240842563', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4005, 'last_played': 1690591824}
review: This is one of my favorite games I've ever played, and if you're looking to buy it, I couldn't recommend it more. I've played it for over 300 hours (this doesn't line up with the time steam says, because the large majority of it was on the flash demo,) and I still love the game, which is an incredible achievement. I often will lose interest in a game if I play it for that long, especially when I aim for 100%. The game has content everywhere, and seeking out an achievement is a great way to find a lot of it. The game is hilarious, the combat is amazing, the art is great, music is amazing, and nothing feels like the developer is just trying to fill space. Also, whilst this is more specific to me, I think it is important to say that the game has a great censor system, and it's effectiveness shows the attention to detail that is given to the game. Also the game goes on sale often, so if you are willing to wait, you can get it for a lower price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059935984', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2892, 'last_played': 1680703083}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a homage to old JRPGs like Final Fantasy, Chrono Trigger, and Dragon Quest. It's a turn-based, party-based adventure through a variety of themed areas as you slowly uncover the events of the world and how, exactly, your team of rag-tag idiots is going to avert the apocalypse. The writing is pretty good, even if the story is relatively simple, but the character interactions and jokes all land fairly well.

The difficulty is also excellent; you can turn it down and play Pokemon-style, hitting everything with its elemental weakness to kill it, or you can crank the difficulty up and seek out challenge encounters to put your knowledge of the combat systems to the test.

Overall, worth the price, and an excellent experience, especially if you've played the previous entries in Epic Battle Fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199399196972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1686786476}

Es más que todo un juego RPG Casual, claro si no contamos capturar a los Enemigos, pero es de los RPG Actuales más Chill que se puede tener.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838115754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3966, 'last_played': 1701392045}
review:
看到這遊戲就想到當初玩EBF4時flash遊戲還興盛時的模樣了
雖然EBF5算是前幾代改過來的，主角團不必說，怪裡面有很多有玩過3或4的人一看就認得出來的老面孔
不過仍然算是誠意滿滿
這代的戰鬥多了抓怪當寶O夢用這選項，不只平添了不少樂趣跟變化，對於Epic難度下的戰鬥有些也是十分強大的助力
而且接近破關時解鎖的試煉神殿可以讓玩家重溫各式各樣的小怪和BOSS，對於喜歡戰鬥或是想第一輪就解完成就或是全怪物收集的人可說是好地方
V2新增的幾個支線迷宮也算有料，就是水晶洞窟溜冰有點煩，其他都還算有趣

而且除了戰鬥以外，劇情跟場景上也一貫的滿滿的梗
對ACG或是網路文化熟悉的人想必可以在遊玩時偶爾看到一些場景時露出會心一笑的笑容
算是個不錯的RPG作品，買下來絕對不吃虧

author: {'steamid': '76561199207301457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 5032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2705, 'last_played': 1698787329}
review:
这款游戏有毒，4天前买的已经玩了45小时了，地图探索了四分之三。因为在家上班所以不停的摸鱼，现在(周三)突然发现周五要交两个reports...还差20页和一堆数据，red bull 接下来上全靠你了....

Update 20/12/2022：死线前的我和平常的我完全是两种不同的存在，没被开除真的是太好了。日式RPG我玩过不少，从一开始的FF4，5 到恶魔城晓月，伊苏方舟，然后空轨1，2。说实在这一款EB5的除了体量和剧情比空轨差了，游戏性在前50个小时内没有丝毫不如。抓怪兽，肝材料，推箱子的乐趣永远都不会迟到。当然50小时后游戏就不可避免的开始出现很多重复的部分，毕竟地图只有那么大，再多的副本体量也不会出现质的变化。这是一款很被低估的游戏，如果觉得贵可以试着对比一下FF1-6，这款游戏只是单纯的不是很出名而已。

author: {'steamid': '76561198058030689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12551, 'last_played': 1659718193}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 has by far my favorite combat out of any JRPG I've played.
This can be split into four major points. Enemy design, combat mechanics, out-of-combat team building, the encounter system, and difficulty. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 excels in all five of these aspects.

[b]Enemy design[/b] is what most strongly sets this game apart from other JRPGs. The bosses in EBF5 are designed in [i]very[/i] deliberate ways. Different combinations of elemental attacks, status conditions, (de)buffs, enrage phases/attacks, and most importantly, very meaningful adds. The common way to fight most JRPG bosses is to establish sustain, and then deal a bit of damage every turn until the boss is dead. This fundamentally does not work in this game. The presence of respawning threatening adds keeps the fights extremely dynamic. They're too dangerous to keep alive, but you can't spend all of your actions killing them either, so clever balance must be struck. Bosses will buff themselves or debuff you, which needs to be addressed, or you won't be able to keep up with the damage. Bosses are not a priori immune to statuses, so those are avenues to consider. Once a boss gets low, it will often use a strong self buff or use a limit break that you need to prepare for. Every turn you need to find a unique solution to the problem you now face; you don't reach an equilibirum. And despite all of this complexity, the game slickly avoids a problem of many JRPG bosses: EBF5's bosses don't actually take very long. Most of them take 5-15 minutes to kill, even at the highest difficulty settings. 
But something that amazes me more than the bosses in this game is actually the regular enemy fights. Every single individual fight you do in this game in interesting and needs to be thought through. Regular enemies have many very interesting move sets, and elemental resistances/weaknesses. Regular enemies will buff and debuff, cause statuses, summon weather that benefits them, or come at you in waves you need to set up for. In your usual JRPG, regular enemy fights devolve into "use strongest attack" with everyone, perhaps except your mage to conserve mana. This is not the case here. While most regular enemy fights are ultimately still easy, and the real spectacles are still the bosses, they each play very uniquely and every enemy needs to be addressed differently. The reason this can work is due to its

[b]Encounter system[/b]. This game has neither random encounters now respawning map encounters that chase you. Enemies are present on the overworld, but do not move. Most of them will block either the path forward or towards treasure, and so must be fought to progress. While exploring, you never have to take on any fight you don't want to, and enemies that block the path will not respawn. Furthermore, there is no mana, and health fully restores after every fight (though annoyingly summoning points and limitbreak gauge carry over). As such, every fight can be taken entirely on its own. You don't have to worry about beating fights in mana efficient or quick ways in fear of having to run back to the last inn. You just have to win, then you can save and try your hand at the next fight. You will never lose progress if you lose a battle (as long as you remembered to save), so each one gets to be all the more interesting. 

[b]Combat mechanics[/b] in this game are excellent. They are incredibly versatile without ever being hard to understand. A very big focus of the game is on buffs and debuffs, as well as all sorts of status effects. In many JRPGs, a 40% damage buff is huge. In EBF5, you often sit at over 80. Until the enemy debuffs you down to -20. There are many ways to apply all kinds of buffs to yourself and debuffs to the enemy, as well as statuses that themselves apply debuffs. There are many interesting status effects. On top of the usual DoTs and stuns, there is a status that makes you get crit by the next attack, or that reduces your max HP every turn you have it, or that prevents you from dying in one hit, or that lets you revive once, and much more. The game gives you lots of tools to powerfully interact with each of these, between skills and summons. There is no mana and I don't miss it in any way. Powerful skills instead have longer cooldowns, which makes for much more dynamic gameplay than "okay the first six turns I can use my spells at will and then I have to start using ethers" Another thing I quite like is that there is no initiative system. When you input an action, it is performed immediately, and you can use your characters in any order. Once all of your characters have taken their turn, the enemy goes. This makes for much more proactive turn planning. The game additionally has a backrow system: of your five characters, three can take actions, and the other two are in the back where they cannot act or be targeted. Switching to a backrow character is free, if the front character still has their action. As every character can take vastly different roles, this gives you a lot of flexibility to tackle different problems of different turns in different ways, or set up for powerful combos. This is highlighted by the

[b]Team Construction[/b]. I like job systems and they have a place in many JRPGs, however EBF5 does something much more well suited to its design. Character identity is much more localized, and can freely be switched at any time. Instead of choosing which job you level, much of the different ways a character can perform lie in equipment. Equipment is [i]very[/i] unique EBF5. Every piece has vastly different elemental and status resistances, but also many "passive skills." Improvement of certain damage types, increase of item effects, counter attacks, etc. Anything you would normally expect to be a passive learned by going through job levels is instead in the equipment, and this makes it so you can very easily swap strategies for every boss. In most JRPGs, this would require grinding up a new job, but in EBF5, you simply switch out equipment. This is what lets the bosses be designed in such a way that each needs it own unique strategy, for they are all already at your finger tips. 

[b]The Difficulty[/b] of this game is something I greatly appreciate. In particular the optional additional difficulty settings. The regular difficulty range goes from very easy to epic and, I think, only scales enemy stats. But there are many optional settings that can be turned on to make the game harder beyond that, and many are very interesting. Disabling the ability to grind, enemies build resistances against statuses, extra enemy waves attack immediately. But the one thing I would recommend the most is the Counterattack setting. With this, enemies will often counterattack when you hit them, the chance depending on the enemy. This makes battles MUCH more thought out. Once again, this helps against the simple sustain trend of JRPG bosses. You can't simply heal up and then use the rest of your actions on attacks, you always have to consider "if I attack here, do I have what's necessary after getting countered?" which is both a very unique thought for these games and also incredibly defining for a lot of the tactics. 
With how gameplay oriented this game is, I think it's very important that it features proper high difficulty settings, in order to really make you engage with it. Now, difficulty is somewhat relative. My blind playthrough of this game was on Epic with all difficulty modifiers turned on except hidden HP and turn timer. On one hand this was much harder than any other JRPG I've played. On the other hand, it doesn't really compare to high difficulty strategy games, so if you're experienced with those you will likely not struggle much even with the difficulty cranked up. The last thing I want to mention is that this game is absolutely huge. The main story is already very long, and then there's a LOT of optional endgame content, most of which is really awesome.

最初是在FLASH時代免費在網頁上玩到這款的4代後就沒消息了 沒想到是在STEAM上出到五代了

author: {'steamid': '76561198830198192', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2867, 'last_played': 1656403925}
review:
I have been a fan of this game series for over ten years and have finished it a few times. 3rd game was a giant leap. 4th game has brought little additions, but the 5th game is just the peak.
-Fascinating story(Are we living in a simulation?)
-Nostalgic characters
-Prolonged gameplay time
-A reward system for achievements
-Fun and mysterious secrets(maybe creepy sometimes)
-Satisfactory use of RPG elements
-Pretty sick OST(Check out Phyrnna)
If you want to see the whole story, play all the games in the series (but the 1st and 2nd games are a bit outdated). Seeing how the game series significantly improved over the years by playing the games is an outstanding experience.
Matt Roszak is a great and innovative developer. 
(7th heaven<3)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063942542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12598, 'last_played': 1700612262}
review:
This is an excellent turn-based RPG, it's very well made.

Pros: 
You can collect and upgrade armor and weapons.
You can capture enemies and bosses to use as summons.
Character and enemy animation in combat looks good.
The dialogue for party members and NPCs is funny.
There are powerful optional bosses.
You can play as a cat.

Cons: 
I can't think of any.

Conclusion: 
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a game I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198920503509', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3806, 'last_played': 1674826305}
review:
本来以为ebf系列只是小品级的玩梗游戏
后来发现我错了，ebf5整体质量意外的高，玩起来真的上头
---------
优点不多说了，最出彩的地方还是让人上手即上瘾又不失深度的战斗系统，特别是数值设计。
实在太惊艳了，整个系列打磨多代的质量、各种梗和致敬都能感受到作者对游戏的热爱，发现这游戏纯属偶然（我是在学Rust语言，在Ruffle这个项目的网站上看到作者的）
Flash独立游戏的绝唱

author: {'steamid': '76561198249105078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6454, 'last_played': 1660661335}
review: 친구의 추천으로 우연히 해봤다가 뽑을 수 있는건 골수까지 뽑아서 재미있게 한 게임. JRPG를 기반으로 매력넘치는 캐릭터들과 재미있는 게임성을 가지고있다. 이게임의 최대 변수는 바로 난이도 설정인데 난이도를 어떻게 설정하느냐에 따라 게임 스타일이 유아용 게임에서 닼던수준이 되어버리기 때문에 난이도에 따른 재미를 느껴보는거도 이 게임의 묘미다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251657048', 'num_games_owned': 1049, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1662589160}
review:
It's a lovely, simple turn-based RPG.
The writing is the main draw for me. It has that same humor that a lot of flash-games from the mid 2000s had.
Edgy, goofy, 4th-wall-breaking (before it was cool) ((before it was cringe)), it's just a great time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052256851', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5238, 'last_played': 1663745801}
review:
The EBF series has always tried to simplify the whole notion of a turn-based rpg with waves of enemies. Final fantasy and the like. A love letter to it, this game feels more like a love letter to the previous games, showing the previous designs with no remorse of the simplistic image at the time, taking us through the usual landscapes, through the usual expanding world.

I feel like this game is the one to really simplify the recipe as best as they can, focusing more on the things players care more about.... filling the world with things to battle and find. I feel like the capture system is a bit unpleasant, at times making it feel like you lost something by not catching those enemies the one time they showed. But other parts of it are just... touching. I have never found a game to make me cry as what you encounter after defeating the first four expies.

A great adventure, one that can keep going, as far as I see. True, there is only so much you can redo the recipe with some new additions, but I feel it could make one last push.

author: {'steamid': '76561199255794999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1703236290}
review:
2023/2/17
我们需要EBF6
we need EBF6
L DEEN EBF6
我们必须要EBF6
2023/2/1
马特啊，你要再不出EBF6，我全家老小就G了呀
？/？/?:
先说说某些人觉得这游戏的缺陷
1，宝箱奖励稀少，lj
这其实没啥，EBF本身就没什么好东西，一些打boss的箱子会给装备或者技能，普通的箱子会给比较稀薄的升级材料，解密箱子大多给装备，有些给技能或者重要物品，偶尔有些隐蔽的箱子会给重要物品或者其他（参考安娜书上被树叶遮住的箱子）
2，装备平衡过度
这游戏武器属性是随着角色升级提高的属性也会百分比升级，而且这游戏不是让你一路脑子爆浆一样杀杀杀，稍微调高难度就会让玩家沉浸，不然一个噬魂剑180攻击那谁还用高尔夫球杆子，这样，一些装备会显得毫无意义
3，游戏取消MP改成回合
这个我不知道咋说，你说回合冷却好吧，但是改成回合冷却整个EBF的内味没了，老早的一些食物啥的都会被取消，取而代之的是一些新的食物（有些还是老的）难度直线下降，但也不一定，你说MP他好呢，但是改成回合确实易上手还爽，只要等几个回合就可以爽了，而且顺便联系下主线，但是这样就会滥用强力，而且又有种说不出来的奇怪，
所以建议matt加个免费DLC搞个MP形式的技能，而且DLC可以取消
4，套路化
这个其实也确实这样，不得不说，这游戏套路化确实严重，从一开始就已经有了，虽然有些枯燥，但是？好像停不下来，也不无聊，我不知道咋说

聊完这些，来说说这游戏的优缺点
优点：
动人的音乐
魔性的对话
超棒超流畅的动画
还行的剧情
收集党狂喜的捕捉系统
boss也能抓！
117个成就！
硬核得难度
不错的翻译（可能存在争议
角色装备不只是贴图！
优秀的作画（戳我xp了
软绵绵的？
第七天堂（lsp天堂
易上手的操作（零蛋
停不下来！
缺点：
不想打开
后期枯燥（但又好像还是很有趣？
一堆看不懂的梗
太贵了
没有6代
没有弹幕天堂3
没有冒险故事3

我是一个资深的盗版老玩家乐，今天一‘朋友’送了这个，还是一如既往的味道，但是2.14更新乐啥？感觉跟2.11没区别

review: epic battle fantasy 5 is a game made by matt rozark in 2018 and it got the v2 update in the year 2020 the first game came out in 2009 and was a bad game i give it a 4/10 but it got popular and you can play it with the epic battle fantasy colection on steam or this link https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/493714 the second game is better and was made in 2009 and can be played here https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/508777 and the ebf colection it was better i give it a 6/10 btw these games were just a gauntlet of battles not a jrpg until matt rozark decided to learn how to make one and on sep 12 2010 epic battle fantasy 3 came out it is good not very good but better then every pokemon game and is free on steam and can be plaued here https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/548041 i havent finished it but i give it a 7/10 then matt rozark made ebf4 on mrach 10 2012 i haveint played much of it but its on steam and can be played here https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/612815 ebf5 is my favorite game in the series its kinda a reboot of the 4th game i give it a 9/10 it has some flaws and some ebf fans dont like it that much but its my favorite ebf game and cn be played on steam or here https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/746618 then the ebf colection came out on a date that i dont know of and it is a colection of matt rozarks other games here are the games from worst to best adventure story 3/10 brawl royal 3/10 mecha dress up game 4/10 the kitten game 4/10 ebf1 4/10 ebf2 6/10 catcafe 7/10 bullet heaven 8/10 over all its ok 6/10 you can play it on steam thats the end for now but matt rozark is making a new game so yeah

author: {'steamid': '76561198226345020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1709969302}
review:
This game and series in general is a stroke of brilliancy that I cannot even begin to describe, but I shall attempt to anyway. Also, most of my playtime was offline, so my actual playtime is around 130 hours as of writing this review.

Characters (10/10):
The protagonist and deuteragonists in [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/i] are nothing short of a masterclass in character construction. They have many great lines that are witty and funny, yet their actions are logically consistent in terms of how they interact with the world they're part of. Individually, they have distinct kits that make each of them distinguishable and worth trying out, and the fun is trying to get them to work together harmoniously. Not a single element is either missing or extraneous; this even extends to the NPCs, where not even one of them feels useless. I think my favorite part is the mid-battle commentary; you will find yourself getting invested and attached to the characters every time.

Gameplay (10/10):
A brilliant twist on classic JRPG gameplay that is nothing short of a stroke of genius. [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/i] manages to bring a measure of balance that the earlier titles in this series lacked, via the introduction of the cooldown mechanic, which kills brain-dead strategies like invincible party heal-spam and forces more creative play, without making the difficulty unmanageable. Between the summon system, the weakness and resistance system, the gear system, the tactics system, and the weather system, [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/i] manages to add complexity to turn-based combat in a logical and streamlined manner, such that it never feels confusing to the player. Add in the easter egg/hidden treasure hunting and the elements of exploration, puzzle-solving, the challenge options and the remix modes, even the base game has nearly unlimited replayability. It doesn't feel like a stretch to say that [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/i] has perfected the turn-based JRPG in terms of gameplay.

Art (10/10):
The art in this game is immaculate. The slightly cartoon-like style looks clean and polished in a way that's visually interesting despite being very consistent, and the environments are feel very well thought-out in their design. The gear has an effortlessly cool look and feel to them, avoiding the trap of attempting to be too try-hard and forcing realism where it doesn't belong. The heroes and enemies can occasionally make funny faces as well, which is always a plus.

Story (9/10):
This is where [i] Epic Battle Fantasy 5 [/i] falls just shy of perfection, but this is more of a testament to how strong its other elements are. The story follows a more humorous comedy play path than the more typical serious the-world-is-ending path that most JRPGs take, but this is not necessarily a bad thing. The character development feels natural, and the progression along the storyline feels sensible. The only knock against it its mediocre amount of descriptive detail that makes the world feel less immersive, but this may have stunted the game's pacing, and some random elements that, while making for good easter eggs and fun gameplay, distract a little from the main storyline in a way that makes the overall construction feel slightly messy. These are mostly nit-picks though at an otherwise brilliant game.

Overall, I feel confident in saying that if you could only ever play one turn-based RPG, this would be the one to play.

Final Score: 39/40 (Exceptional)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050455824', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2152, 'last_played': 1652901255}
review:
The most iconic series adobe flash player has ever introduced me (sorry bubble tanks). An almost enumerable amount of differentiation with all the builds you can pull off. Even more when you consider the party line up and difficulties/modifiers. 

To cut it short this is a very classic and silly rendition of a turn-based jrpg if that was not obvious through the trailer, which has loads of content and repeatability extremely well worth the price tag.

I recommend it 100% and urge you to play the series from 3-4-5!

author: {'steamid': '76561199026861794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2968, 'last_played': 1708946409}
review: 地图非常大，剧情很有意思，技能超级多，装备超多，能抓大多数怪物，二周目还能抓最终boss(笑)，自带调整难度的选项，全成就以后会有额外功能。情人节，万圣节，圣诞节，复活节，春节会有额外任务以获得节日装备和技能；本游戏还有定制模式，如全新的一套敌人（难度增加），全新的一套武器(强度大增，部分强度超模)，全新天气系统，打乱装备入手顺序......超多有趣的玩梗和致敬，剧情也很搞笑，每一作都有内置大画廊展示稿子和精美二创。游戏设置内自带和谐选项（嘿嘿嘿）。说起专辑，这个游戏内音乐超级好听！经过n久的努力，终于全成就了呜呜呜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198354630315', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1682034974}
review:
pues   este juego uff  joyita infravalorada

sobre la trama bueno   ni muy compleja ni muy simple . no es muy dificil entenderla pero no dire nada para no dar spoilers  creo que cualquiera podria entenderla y disfrutarlo
la difiicultad puede variar bastante para quienes quieren algo mas tranquilo o un verdadero reto que te haga exprimir tus ultimas 2 neuronas en cada combate ya sea un jefe o un enemigo cualquiera
ya mencione el humor negro que maneja este juego ? me ha echo reir en mas de una ocasion ( no te preocupes si no te gusta este tipo de humor puedes desactivarlo desde el menu de ajustes )
tambien tiene referencias brutales a otros videojuegos/series/peliculas 
ahora en cuanto al gameplay el sistema de combate por turnos se siente bastante fluido podiendo alterar el orden en que actuaran tus personajes  no como en otros juegos donde se siente mas forzado  o es obligatorio  jugar los turnos en orden 
los puzzles opcionales no son tan dificiles pero tampoco tan faciles y si bien como digo son opcionales yo planeo completar el juego al 100% asi que para mi no es opcional ja ja 
los npcs que dan hechizos adicionales no te piden nada muy descabellado como en otros juegos y el que algunos solo esten en fechas especificas como navidad o san valentin  le da un toque especial de  oh no me lo perdi bueno a esperar al año siguiente
yo personalmente le doy un 10/10 a este juego y esperare impacientemente que saquen EBF 6

author: {'steamid': '76561199123179549', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6254, 'last_played': 1708303440}
review: It's a very good game though it can be hard to 100 percent the game, but You don't even need too, and "newgame+" gives some replay value. I played 120+ hours and got most equips and skills and completed about 80-90 percent of the game. Though I haven't played the entire ebf series I think it's the best (maybe ebf4 might better but I'm not sure). It takes about 20-40 hours to finish the main story. I think it's a good game and for $25 it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383386928', 'num_games_owned': 1462, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9035, 'last_played': 1697870750}
review: Probably my favorite RPG released in the 2010s, and that's saying something. Simple to understand yet having a high skill ceiling, lots of choices, fantastic graphical style, amazing soundtrack, and a story that's simple, but does its job. And so much content... The only thing that may be an issue is slowdown since it's made in Flash which is a notoriously unoptimized engine (pick 1 Player Game and turn off graphical effects if your CPU isn't that great), but I'm gonna look back at it fondly for years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798567278', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 50, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1712021056}
review:
Sinceramente juegazo.
Si has jugado las entregas anteriores y lees los dialogos y ves las imagenes y los cuadros te entra una nostalgia terrible, encima tambien puedes luchar contra jefes antiguos y capturarlos para usarlos mas adelante.
Es una lastima que sea la última entrega, llevo 20 horas pero aún me quedan muchas por echar ya que planeo conseguir todos los logros, algún dia rejugare el EBF4 y los viejos para acordarme de como el juego evolucionó y de lo bien hecho que estaba.
Ojala que saquen otra entrega y si los desarrolladores planean sacar algo más con gusto pagaré otros 20 euros para jugarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198119700599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3871, 'last_played': 1663331474}
review:
다 좋은데 오락기 몹 중에 호벅 이거 어떻게 잡는거임??? 설명은 때리지 말라고 써있고 한대라도 치면 대미지가 말이 안되는데

-> 호벅 공략법은, 대미지를 입히고 분노상태(몸이 빨갛게 변함)일 때 다시 생체대미지 등으로 회복시키면 분노상태가 풀리는걸 반복하면 됨

author: {'steamid': '76561198113753579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6122, 'last_played': 1696292911}
review:
Not only does this game have by far the most complex and rewarding combat system I've ever experienced in an RPG, but there's such an extreme amount of genuine love and care put into every aspect of the game that it's obvious from the start that the dev enjoyed what he was making.

This is a game that was made for Flash, and it's very reminiscent of games of that era. It just has a level of polish and an amount of content you've probably never seen before in a Flash game. I mean, hell, look at how many hours I've put into it so far. If that's not worth the price I paid for it, I don't know what is.

There's roughly 65 hours of content in this game, and the majority of that is entirely optional. On top of that, it's got insane replayability, thanks to the sheer amount of playthrough customization options available at the start of the game.

Also, there's an angry bird in it that's been shot to death with arrows. That alone makes the whole thing worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198879361424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16152, 'last_played': 1676649198}
review:
After almost 4 years of owning the game, postponing the difficult stuff until v2 came out, and forcing myself to get stars on all achievements possible, I can finally say that this trip is finally over. I bought it because of nostalgia I had towards previous installments (which I only played EBF3, and the free version of EBF4), and now I can only look at this game like everything is permamently behind me. Great game, love the story, but now I only see this game for the nostalgia. I've done everything I could, and now all I can do is wait for official mods to be added to the beta options (you promised Matt). Custom game just doesn't cut it.
(If the review seems negative, believe me that I can't really say anything other than all of it being worth it, and that I'm glad I played it because my childhood wouldn't be complete without it now that I'm an adult)

author: {'steamid': '76561198254598601', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8681, 'last_played': 1708529096}
review:
It's prety good game not the best but not the worst either so something like 8/10 

The story passable. its not really worth paying attention but it has some good bits.

This game has some good exploration,gear upgrading and summons. exploration can get stale if you play more than one full playtrough this game but that can bee levitating by playing with remix settings which "kinda Randomized". gear is prety self explanatory get gear from shop,guests and chests pick the ones you like or use cleary the best ones personally i like gear that has counter attack but i kinda is anoying if you are capturing some enemy for your collection pro tip capture least one copy of every enemy if possible since they have some prety nice abilities for exsample dmg and debuff skills and capturing will increse your sp so you can summon more if needed or use all on the spoler monster and, Pro tip [spoiler] if you want you can try to capture viking monolith in ice caves its a surprise tool that will help you later since when casting viking monolith it gives your active party one turn more except the one who casts him [/spoiler]

Combat is very straightforward. You use gear that resist enemy damage, boost damage based on enemy weakness for example Captain's Coat Boosts the damage of water skills. Some gear buffs your team member or debuffs enemy or randomly use some summons which usually deal damage or just some nice buffs. All of that gear you found has element well almost all some are more or less physical witch has some use.

Music its good imo probably best part in any ebf game

Performance could be better since animations make game laggy at times butt personally i dont mind it. this is a flash game at its heart so give it some slack.

Overall its a good game if you like semi hard rpg where you can dump 40+ hours on hardest difficulty i highly recommend that you play this game on epic difficulty if you want achiements other wise hard or normal "this review is made in mind that you play this game 100% through or close to that"

author: {'steamid': '76561198068578275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7212, 'last_played': 1660418856}
review:
The culmination of a at least a decade of games and movies made in flash, ported over to Steam.
This will likely be the final EBF to ever be released, not counting the collection, and it manages to end off on a high note.
Even with how amazing it is though, I have to say, I'm actually pretty sad that I finished it, since I don't have many reasons to keep playing at this point, aside from New Game + I suppose.
Basically, the game is worth the purchase if you enjoy turn-based combat with crude humor, or if you've played any of the other EBF games growing up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076074153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1659717343}
review:
It's okay game. 6/10

The story is passable but halfway though the game, i stop reading it since it just joke and meme. It isn't really important at all.

This game is all about Battle, Solving puzzle and exploration. I enjoy the hidden mechanic, puzzle solving a lot
The battle system start off strong but it become blend at the mid to end game. After you acquire enough gear, most of the gear you find in later stage didn't really out perform your current gear. Maybe it have some higher stat or good element but it won't fundamentally change your playstyle.

There are a lot of unique mechanic didn't interact with any equipment, making all those extra equipment pretty stock standard, for example, equipment that give you "curse" for bigger stat, you cannot just counter it  with 100% curse stat.

Other example is gear that give you auto defense didn't trigger gear that give bonuses when you are defending.

So the game battle is very straightforward. You use gear that resist enemy damage, boost damage based on enemy weakness, buff your team, debuff enemy if possible, then deal damage. All those gear you found is for different element setup in different battle.

I tried to search for more interesting tactic online but so far, i think it is what it is. Very disappointed with the battle mechanic. I think the dev can do better to come out with slightly more complex battle system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416722449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11933, 'last_played': 1702860406}

author: {'steamid': '76561198283495470', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1655463028}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 has provided an adequately fun and enjoyable RPG experience. Some story elements felt a bit on the nose - the most notable being the introduction of the fascist organisation - but this didn't impact my gameplay experience too much. The gameplay itself is enjoyable, providing the strategic flair I expect of a good RPG. I particularly enjoyed the puzzles of figuring out the right loadouts and attacks required to take down bosses while at the highest "Epic" difficulty (not an easy task for a first timer).

However, there is one major flaw in this game, which is the reason why I write this review: [b]poor optimisation[/b]. I use a fairly low-end PC, which typically does not impact the types of games I play. Some games are a bit more demanding, but proper resource management can usually prevent issues. However, this game would often get unapologetically laggy, which I imagine has dragged on the playtime. Over 15 hours (recorded) I managed to reach Anna's house before ultimately growing tired of the lag and dropping the game. From what I've gathered through discussion pages and personal experience, this lag is the result of a suboptimal animation system? In any case, none of the in-game optimisation options were able to alleviate the issue, which I find inexcusable for a game that - at least in theory - should have no qualms with low-end PCs.

From my perspective as a player with a low-end PC, I cannot recommend this game. If you do not have this hardware plight, however, you may have better luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334368946', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 2520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1661772746}
review:
面面俱到的RPG，整体质量很好，两男两女一只猫，五名属性各异的角色组成的冒险小队，介于可爱与魔性之间的画风，超级多的收集要素，装备对话中潜藏着各种作品的彩蛋和梗。路线设计体现出了作者优秀的整体规划能力，面对不同属性怪物需要不断改变阵容搭配的过程也是相当有趣。
但如果你说不出来为什么要在毫无提醒的前提下搞jump scare，这波我只能给你零分。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001633270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1660570214}
review:
This is a review of this game on steam deck.I did not finish the game. Its just early use.  I didn't see a lot of talk about steam deck so I thought I would add my early experiences.  

Valve says its verified. I *now know* that verified doesn't mean much or is open to some kind of interpretation. The fonts are legible but very small. Its not comfortable to read, especially when its in a huge box and the text is all squashed at the top. I actually missed that dialog was going on in one instanced. Bigger problem is that controls go away. Work for a bit then you need to use the touch screen. So the joy stick will move the character, from there you need to use touch screen for all the controls or the touchpad and depressing it for selections. Also it started to default into Russian or some other language. It actually skipped the PIA select language every time it was loaded screen. With the weight of this device using the touch screen that much is not really fun.  On the switch this game would be fun.

Its to bad because this is exactly the kind of game that is great for the steam deck.  So I am punting on steam deck for this game and will play it on the pc. Its an old game so I don't expect them to fix or add anything.
developer_response:
I definitely would NOT recommend playing this on the Steam Deck, the controls are not designed for it, and a few users have had some issues starting the game.

I'll ask Valve to change the Steam Deck rating from "Verified" to "Playable", which is what it should have been.

I think you should give the game another try on a PC though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198096937353', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3270, 'last_played': 1657451356}
review:
简陋的画质✖
可有可无的剧情✖
RPG该有的全都有✔
各种玩梗让人会心一笑✔
隐藏探索收集量大管饱✔
复杂经典的回合制战斗系统✔
谜题迷宫非常有挑战性和乐趣✔
---------------------------------------------------------------------
说实话本作前前后后入坑了三次
第一次：不是吧2020年还有这种画质的游戏？寄
第二次：不是吧怎么这游戏怎么乱七八糟这么多系统啊？数值平衡也开玩笑一样...寄
第三次：好评太多了肯定有过人之处啊再试最后一次！
现在：好好玩好有意思！爱了爱了

Сюжет топ
Музыка топ, Phyrnna хорошо постаралась.
Игре есть много разных отсылок, и случаи которые называю "Офигенная цензура" . Потому что название серии игр, сериала, или аниме. Где название франшизы, только букву заменяют на * 
По мере прохождения фоновые персонажи, могут быть в другом месте.
Ближе, концу игры ты понимаешь, что это скоро будет конец приключений.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080966172', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1677651092}
review:
Может игра и неплохая. Точнее я почти в этом уверен. Но блин, какие же у неё бешеные системные требования. Тормозит она у меня примерно так же, как и Final Fantasy 13-2. Впрочем, и в ту, и в другую, всё равно можно играть. Однако Epic Battle Fantasy, помимо этого, имеет и пару багов (которые, как я понял, напрямую связаны с тормозами). А они следующие:
[olist][*]Иногда ручное сохранение может происходить очень долго (настолько, что я в таких случаях, просто плевал на всё, перезапускал игру и проходил битву на максимальной сложности - заново). Помимо этого, ещё и автосохранения, толи работают по какому-то не совсем понятному принципу, толи время от времени сбоят и сохраняют не всегда. Но к счастью, помимо этого есть возможность «Сохранять прогресс в текстовый файл» и да, вот это уже - работает как надо.
[*]Иногда при запуске Epic Battle Fantasy, происходит сброс настроек. При этом всегда (или почти) сбрасываются абсолютно все опции, поэтому это легко можно отследить, если заранее изменить цвет меню (что я вам советую сделать). Так что, если вы видите, что ваше чадо играет с кровью, с “нецензурной лексикой” и … остальным, - не спешите обвинять его во всех смертных грехах, … может быть, просто, у него в очередной раз, слетели настройки в игре.[/olist]
В общем, со всеми глюками можно бороться, а тормоза терпимые. Но к моменту, когда я “нашёл антидоты к багам”, я начал разочаровываться уже в самой игре, и, в конце концов, потеряв к ней последний интерес - бросил.
developer_response:
The CPU requirements for the game will be quite high if you play it in a high resolution - I recommend playing it on a lower resolution or in windowed mode, and turn off anti-aliasing. Those are the two biggest factors affecting performance. 

The saving issues are also related to lag - if you have a smoother framerate, saving should happen correctly. 

Sorry about the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089309986', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1658167103}

author: {'steamid': '76561198288692181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 17919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12022, 'last_played': 1672808648}
review: Apparently, traditional JRPG-styled gameplay can be fun! I never thought that was possible until I played the EBF series. Each game has been a huge improvement over the last both in terms of refinement and content. With this being the fifth game, it is absolutely massive and has a lot of replay value on top of that. You're free to play around with different builds no matter how high you set the difficulty, but make sure your brain is ready when you need it. You have a lot of different actions to choose from, and there are many enemies that do as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198973848406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2956, 'last_played': 1705711081}
review:
I remember in my younger days, playing Epic Battle Fantasy 3 and 4. These games are such an integral part of my childhood, that playing the this game just felt so amazing. As a long time rpg fan, this game is absolutely amazing, and so, so fun.
I can't really describe why I love it so much, but I hope that my little review can encourage others to try it too, especially if you're a long-time fan of these games and even if you're not! It's just a fantastic game for rpg fans with a unique twist in humour and gameplay.

Special thanks to Matt Roszak for making these games. I hope you make more, because I love the characters of your game just so, so much. Thank you for a good section of my childhood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053716831', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 7981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7981, 'last_played': 1655955403}
review:
If you enjoy a light-hearted but challenging RPG you can take at your own pace, look no further.

There's lots to unpack here, whether it be perfecting each characters' skills/equips to be able to take on anything, beating all the bosses on the hardest difficulty, collecting all the capturable summons, or whatever you find the most personally interesting, EBF5 has it all in a way no predecessor in the series has quite been able to live up to. Yet it still requires no previous experience with them to stand on its own two feet, having adequate (not egregious) tips as you get started to learn all the new mechanics, and rewards experimentation so you can find a strat you like best (personally I really liked stacking haste gear).

The price point is more than fair considering the 100+ hrs of play I was able to derive from this, compounded when you factor in 100% completion, NG+, or custom runs.

Kupo really outdid himself with this one, and is as much a testament to his growth as a developer, as it is his commitment to deliver for his fans. If he chooses to make more, I wish him all the best and will happily support, been here since his Newground days, and what a journey it's been! Here's hoping for a playable Phyrnna someday (outside of Bullet Heaven series).

author: {'steamid': '76561199247126702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10569, 'last_played': 1655897207}
review:
올업적 달성하고 에픽난이도+올챌린지로 한번 더 클리어 했습니다.
게임은 턴제rpg로써 상당한 수작 입니다. 턴제rpg 매니아인 저로서는 아주 즐겁게 플레이 했습니다.
야리코미 요소도 꽤나 풍부한 편이고, 소개 영상을 보시면 알겠지만 전투 퀄리티도 괜찮습니다. 
솔직히 할인할때 안사셔도 제값 충분히 한다고 봅니다. 제작진분이 한땀한땀 공들여서 만들었다는게 느껴지네요 ㅎ

다만 조금 아쉬웠던점도 있었네요.. 
일단 스토리 부분이 좀 아쉬웠는데요. 뭐 스토리가 나쁘다 이런게 아니고
기본적으로 전작을 알아야만 이해하기 쉽게 만들었습니다.
전작을 플레이 하지 않고 플레이 하시는 분들 입장에선 그냥 스토리는 아 그렇구나 하는 정도?
게임 끝나고 영문 위키에서 전작 스포 하나하나 챙겨봤네요; 스토리를 중요시 하는 분들이시면 이점 참고하시면 되겠습니다. 
그밖에 2회차 요소가 없었다던지.. 인터페이스가 살짝 불편하다던지.. 자잘한 점들도 아쉬웠지만..

다집어치우고 어쨌던간 결론은 게임 자체는 개인적으로 상당한 수작이였다는거..
6편이 출시된다면 바로 구매해서 플레이할 의향 있습니다
6편 제작한다는 소식은 아직까진 없는거 같은데 어서 나왔으면 하는 바램입니다 ㅠㅠ

author: {'steamid': '76561198203153899', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 1919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1655454221}
review:
名前からもわかるゆるいFFのパロディRPG
シリーズ物だが日本語化されているのは今作だけで、特に過去作を知らなくても問題なく遊べた
クリアしたらキャラクターたちに愛着湧いたので他作品も日本語化してほしい

凄くカジュアルに遊べるRPGでマウスだけでプレイできるし敵はシンボルエンカウントで無駄な戦闘を避けれる。
フィールドにいる間は自動で体力回復する（数秒待つだけで全回復する）し、どこでもセーブができる。
ボス的含めて戦闘は全部逃走確定。

バランス調整が面白くて最初はごり押しだけで行けるけど、だんだんきちんと装備やスキルを強化しないと敵を倒しづらくなっていく。
そして強化をきちんとすると弱かったキャラがものすごく強くなったり逆に強かったキャラがいまいちに感じたりするなどちゃんとRPGとしての楽しさがある。
特にラスボスまで行くと属性を気にしながらパーティーフル回転してようやく倒せるのでなかなか達成感あった。

クリア中でもできるがサブクエ要素と実績がかなり多めなのでストーリーだけで物足りない人にも対応している。

author: {'steamid': '76561198409861151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3914, 'last_played': 1659155046}
review:
Mecânicas profundas, personagens carismáticos, tanto inimigos quanto aliados, história hilaria, uma aventura descontraída e épica! A dificuldade deste jogo é bem customizável, podendo ir de EXTREMAMENTE DIFÍCIL até um passeio no parque, para aqueles que querem se aprofundar no sistema de combate delicioso desse jogo, selecione a dificuldade épica e se divirta, você sera obrigado a tirar todo o proveito possível de todas as mecânicas do jogo para conseguir zerar, agora, se você só quer se divertir pela aventura divertida, engraçada e envolvente, selecione a dificuldade normal ou inferior e se divirta.
 - Belos gráficos
 - Horas de conteúdo
 - Dublagem PT-BR
 - Engraçado ao ponto de ter o "jeitinho brasileiro"
 - Profundidade e ótimos desafios
 - Nostálgico

author: {'steamid': '76561198799209586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1655558804}
review:
Это было прекрасное приключение, веселое, захватывающее и увлекательное... Если любите jrpg старой школы - смело приобретайте, десятки часов фана гарантированы. Отличные герои, забавный сюжет, в игре легко разобраться, но механик тут хватает, скучно уж точно не будет. В современном игропроме таких приключений еще надо поискать и не факт, что быстро найдется, столь же увлекательное и веселое.
Пойду, пожалуй, начну New game+

author: {'steamid': '76561198013158726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 2155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1655834812}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a highly addictive and extremely enjoyable RPG that is incredibly well-produced and has a considerable amount of depth. I've never played any of the EBF games before but decided to take a punt after seeing so many positive reviews and I'm so glad I did. 

At its core, the game is a 2D RPG focusing on collecting items and utilising them in turn-based battles whilst strengthening your party. The art style is amazing as are the variety of outstanding animations. The battle system is simple but has many tactical layers which makes combat really challenging especially as the game progresses. Items you collect, skills you unlock and even foes you capture will all play a pivotal role in every fight. 

There are many combat events throughout but I never felt like the game was bloated and some of the battles were absolutely thrilling! All of this is backed by an excellent soundtrack too. The world is made up of of an 11x10 grid system and and there is many secrets to uncover and NPC's to interact with. I also quite liked the story and some of the writing was absolutely hilarious. It's all very lighthearted and never gets in the way.

Although this is the fifth instalment in the series, it is ideal of newcomers as the game essentially acts as a reboot of the original I believe and is also full-fleshed out with more features than previous titles. Overall this is an excellent purchase and the story alone will easily reward you with 30 hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561199210217057', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2665, 'last_played': 1692600496}
review:
面面俱到的RPG，整体质量很好，两男两女一只猫，五名属性各异的角色组成的冒险小队，介于可爱与魔性之间的画风，超级多的收集要素，装备对话中潜藏着各种作品的彩蛋和梗。路线设计体现出了作者优秀的整体规划能力，面对不同属性怪物需要不断改变阵容搭配的过程也是相当有趣。
角色性格鲜明，每张地图基本都有隐藏秘密之类的真的超赞，只要购买正式版，便能在其中体验到5大挑战区域，不要太实惠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043965400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1655745033}
review:
J'ai connu EBF grâce à Kongregate,un site de jeux flash, j'ai commencé par EBF 2 qui était à l'époque juste un RPG avec des combats qui s'enchaînent, sans exploration de maps, il était déjà simple et complet (et Lance était un boss d'ailleurs, je m'en souviens), puis vint EBF 3, qui commença à nous proposer son côté exploration et son humour décalé qui brisait souvent le 4ème mur, il était génial pour un fan de RPG comme moi, ensuite ce fut au tour de EBF 4 de sortir, il était encore mieux.... et enfin EBF 5, qui monte encore d'un cran dans la qualité ET la quantité !

Vous avez là un jeu créé de la passion du RPG, du jeu video, ça se sent tout le long de cette belle expérience, j'ai fini le jeu la première fois qu'il est sorti en version flash, je l'ai téléchargé par la suite (de manière parfaitement légale...) pour avoir le contenu premium, et je l'ai terminé à nouveau... j'ai donc décidé de l'acheter, car Matt (le développeur principal) le mérite largement, et cette série mérite encore une suite, et je peux enfin mettre une (légère) contribution à ces années de nostalgie que ce jeu me rappelle...

Merci Matt, merci EBF, merci à tout les jeux flash

author: {'steamid': '76561198278818635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1654854066}
review: 抓个怪，血多抓不到，血少让天气或被动打死，麻痹投降等一切控制技能都不吃，抓了一个半小时都没抓到，玩尼玛比
developer_response: Please look at a walkthrough if you're having trouble catching monsters. There's plenty of tools to use - a lot of status effects help (poison, stun, syphon, burn, freeze, etc), some equipment improves your chances, and debuffing evade is especially useful (debuffing defence and magic defence also helps). You don't need to lower HP very low.

developer_response: This is not intended to be an "idle" game - go play something else if you want auto-battles. The store page makes it clear that this is a turn-based RPG with mouse controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813484579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1675996840}
review:
遊戲是非常傳統的RPG運作方式，劇情也很無厘頭，
其中很多設定都能客制化，要挑戰或是輕鬆打都可以自訂，
蒐集要素十足，解謎有趣也不會太難，
戰鬥搭配也很多樣化，各式元素特性和極限技可以打造出具有特色的主角群，
不會刻意刁難玩家的設計反而讓人更會玩下去，
整體而言蠻好玩的，值得入手！

評分：9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044791069', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1662047366}
review:
Rebooting the story is a bold move considering all the characterizations and world building that has gone into the game, but a necessary one. What happens next after you kill god in an RPG?

Yet another great entry into the franchise, with this particular entry being the best of the lot in terms of gameplay. One great change in combat flow they've made from previous entries was allowing swapping party members without taking up a turn during combat. This in turn also has a tactical advantage, allowing reserve characters to heal passively and allowing different types of moves to be used throughout a fight. 

Map exploration is a little confusing, even comparing itself against EBF4. Individual sections of maps intersect with other zones which are only accessible after finding key items in the story. However, I very much enjoy the extra sections included such as the dungeons and achievement hall.

All in all, if you're looking for a JRPG-like experience, this game definitely serves its purpose and is also a fun game to dip your toes into.

Not gonna lie though, dialogue in this game is kinda cringe and feels awfully dated. I was in my early teens when playing the first one of these and after all these years, the language has not changed one iota. The late 2000s are calling and want you to give them back their dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372715431', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 6444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6432, 'last_played': 1654575572}
review:
不用说啥了 作为一个玩游戏不玩二周目 全收集麻烦就索性不收集 对回合制战斗无感喜欢打即时反应的pvp玩家 之前上头买了个八方旅人40小时成就39/88弃坑了 但是到EBF5这 107小时 成就133/133还意犹未尽
我愿称之为史上最强rpg
打完之后发的分享：说实话从来没有想到过能够会这么痴迷这样一款rpg游戏 道具技能组合繁杂多样 流派五花八门 千奇百怪的怪物 各种乱七八糟的效果状态（而且都能遇到/用上）恰到好处的吐槽 rpg最精髓的细节互动（所有的新东西都会有相对应的吐槽/解说）还有各种梗和次元壁穿透 如果你喜欢回合制rpg 喜欢探寻宝箱和解密 这将会是你的不二之选

author: {'steamid': '76561198039897946', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 6189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5373, 'last_played': 1665318696}
review:
個人的にはSFC～PS時代のJ-RPGやり込んでた人間には絶対にオススメしたい。
戦闘はいつでも逃げ出せる＋出現場所固定＋難易度設定いじって自分の好きなレベルでストレスフリー、一方で通常難易度でも弱点をうまくついたりバフ・デバフを利用したりしないと雑魚相手でも苦戦する事もあって考える楽しみがある。
隠しアイテム、隠しマップ、召喚獣コレクションと収集楽しむようなやり込み派にも向いてるし、パズル等のミニゲームも豊富。
メタネタやブラックジョークも満載で、装備品を着替えたり魔法や技を繰り出したりするとキャラクターが色んなコメントを戦闘中に出したりとサービス満載。
DevのJ-RPGへの熱意と愛情を強く感じられる素晴らしい1本。

author: {'steamid': '76561198222922960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3817, 'last_played': 1652376110}
review: I absolutely adore this game and the whole series as a whole. I love how you pick and choose your weapons and customizations, the references, the humor... It's all funny and awesome all at the same time. I adore the fact you can just build up your units with whatever armor you decide, and battle with them that way, with varying levels of success depending on your skill. Yeah sure some things are hard, but it's satisfying when you complete them entirely. I hope I can see more of their adventures in the future, even if there is no EBF6+. I'll let everyone know when I beat the game in Epic Difficulty and get all the medals, because I'm doing my damndest to do it. While also rereading everything again just for the funny stuff. Love the game though! <3

review:
As a person who played these Epic Battle Fantasy Flash games on Newgrounds before, if the increase in quality of EBF1~4 was linear, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a game Magnitudes more expansive and polished than the previous games.

The Fights are graphically pleasing and well balanced, the story and writing is consistant with the tone of all the previous EBF games, Having that certain Western Anime-Spoof feeling.

I'm not a person who usually leaves reviews, but considering this game was so great, despite being made by 1 man. I urged me to leave a positive Review

author: {'steamid': '76561198167775366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 6830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5553, 'last_played': 1696531047}
review:
This is an amazing game for so many reasons. I'd been following this series for a while and turned my nose up at first when the fourth had a premium paid version, but bought it later and thoroughly enjoyed it. and the fifth so far improves in every way.
Funny dialogue, powerful weapons, and several options to customize gameplay, this game is almost a perfect parody/tribute to classic JRPGs of old.
Perhaps my favorite is the ability to play Dressup, so to speak. Many other games don't change the character's appearance at all when you change equipment, or will stop at changing weapons. But in this game, you can change the appearance of weapons, armor, headgear, and add little trinkets to all 5 characters. It is genuinely fun to pop on and mix and match different equips and see what equips appear differently on different characters.
The only thing I'm not super crazy about is the overload of dialogue. Oftentimes when you're battling, or walking across the screen, dialogue screens will pop up. If it were just passive dialogue you could ignore, I wouldn't have a problem. But it always brings the game to a halt and demands you click through it to remove it. The game's story driven dialogue adds quite a bit but so much of the text is inane banter or "hints" that point out a pretty standard gameplay convention. If you're in the mood to read through and have a laugh, it's great but, especially on later playthroughs, it's tiresome. There's so much pure meaningless dialogue that I end up skipping the story dialogue out of habit from clicking away so much other garbage.
furthermore, this game has an underlying glitch theme where glitched versions of enemies regularly spawn. If they behaved like normal, it would be fine, but having them have incredibly randomized stats makes them a pain. It's not uncommon to have your whole party taken out by one of these glitch enemies because you can't hit it and it oneshots everyone. It happens far too often for it to be a fun easter egg, and it becomes exhausting.
But don't let that stop you, this game is still a great time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073476686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3520, 'last_played': 1691125945}

review: 最喜欢的一款游戏之一,matt加油!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061098771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3968, 'last_played': 1702707744}
review:
Gameplay (9/10)
With one of my main pet peeves in EBF4, the inconsistent backup system (characters not getting party buffs in the backup) fixed, I can't really find anything wrong with the battles anymore... The fights are enjoyable, especially on Epic difficulty, where they give you quite a challenge even if you permanently keep your buffs on. I was never a pokemon fan, so the foe capture system does not strike a special nostalgia nerve in me, but it's still fun to beat up a boss with another boss nonetheless. And the character build variety is huge, while I have found a combo that works for me, there are dozens of other ways to build characters and to specialize them against certain fights.

Audio (10/10)
The angelic Phyrnna delivers once again, and oh man, this series overall has one of the best videogame soundtracks I've ever seen, the tracks are non-intrusive, while also giving you a good vibe. Seriously, it wouldn't be an EBF game without her beautiful music, I often catch myself listening to it even out of game. The game's hitsounds and other ambient sounds feel just appropriate as well.

Story (7/10)
Honestly, stories are sometimes just an excuse to beat sh*t up, and this one does the job just fine. To make an amazing game you don't need to have 10/10 from each category, sometimes every aspect being "good enough" works too. Don't think too hard about it.


Overall verdict (10/10)
You need to play through the entire EBF franchise at least once, or you're missing out. Thank you Matt and Phyrnna for continuously delivering amazing games through most of my internet-dwelling years.

review: I really love this game. I played it about a year back on Newgrounds and remembered about the dlc content recently and decided I wanted to play it again. I do have a problem though? I've playing for around 30 hours now and booted up the game once more tonight and all my saved progress was gone? I was wondering if anyone had the same problem and new how to fix it? It's not the biggest issue but I got through around half the game and don't feel like replaying it all over again until I've finished the game so I can do achievement hunting. Thank you for the great game and I really can't wait to see if there will ever be another!

author: {'steamid': '76561198338140612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2442, 'last_played': 1700761994}
review:
When I found it among the recommended, I went crazy.
I have played and completed almost 100% of the previous EPBs and I must say that n.  5 was also very satisfying.
Engaging plot, revisited and modified compared to the previous ones; funny characters as always. A good balance of exploration, small puzzles, combats and difficulties.
Game style always similar to the previous ones, I would dare to say more complete and with some pleasant news in the management of the characters.
It's a very simple game, without too much effort and enjoyable to play.
I recommend it both to those unfamiliar with the saga and to those who are passionate about it.

review: Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a great game that long-time fans of the series will love and enjoy for hours on end. It still has the EBF humor and charm that made the first 4 games so great and I'd recommend it to anyone interested in a turn-based rpg that's comedic and silly the whole way through while also having a great story and fun combat mechanics

author: {'steamid': '76561198295941152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3598, 'last_played': 1664080255}
review: Este jogo é maravilhoso, um dos maiores motivos para eu ama-lo desde o primeiro da franquia é o estilo de combate lembrar o do grande Final Fantasy (além de suas referencias claras a esse e outros jogos e animes). Acompanho o desenvolvimento do Matt em seus jogos a anos e sempre me senti muito satisfeito com sua Matt para este jogo sair maravilhoso e bom para muita gente, quando em suas traduções do jogo existe a opção de 10 idiomas, quantidade de jogos de grandes empresas renomadas ainda não fazem, incluindo nosso querido PT-BR. Comprem está obra prima, deem risada com as histórias e se divirtam ainda mais com a jogabilidade <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198141643943', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1643698763}
review:
This is a very good RPG. It's fun, it doesn't take itself too seriously, and there's a ton of secrets. If you're not strictly a casual player, play it on Epic for the best experience. 

Also: I'd recommend playing EBF4 before this one. It's older, but it got a massive update (literally "EBF4 2.0") that overhauled several aspects of the game. You'll miss a ton of references and callbacks if you go in without playing it -- though it isn't required to understand or enjoy the game. Just gives some context. EBF 1 and 2 are just old flash games, and EBF3 is enjoyable but doesn't offer any huge amount of context or anything. Either way, enjoy! This game has a 98% user rating for a reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122077960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1634, 'last_played': 1655813551}
review:
しっかり作られたRPG。とりあえず最後まで楽しめました。
難点は戦闘時の攻撃エフェクトに長い時間かかるのが多めなこと。
加速かスキップが欲しかったですね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198154208702', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4610, 'last_played': 1710266870}
review:
真正意义上的好游戏，十分满分我给二十分，我愿称之为RPG类型的集大成之作。
从最开始的简单回合制再到今天的ebf5，长期的打磨给予了这个游戏足够的深度与丰富的内容，不论是游戏小白还是发烧友都能在这个游戏里找到属于他们自己的天地。各式有想法的技能、动作，夹杂在探索以及战斗过程中层出不穷的梗，无论什么时候看到都能会心一笑的玩笑话，还有暖人心房的小日常，都足以将这个游戏推上神坛。即便有些地方设计并不合理以及不成熟，但终究是瑕不掩瑜。
这游戏的战斗机制其实非常有意思。对我来说这是极少数异常状态极其有存在感的RPG类型游戏，在高难战斗中的任何一步都可能影响到你最后的结果，不得不说耐人寻味。挑战高难敌人时，你不但需要严谨的装备搭配以及切换，什么时候使用什么技能上什么buff，再加上回合间各种随机触发的事件，都将ebf5的战斗乐趣不断拔高，再加上可以自行调节难度以及开关作弊选项，任何人都可以在这里享受到他所想要的东西。
另有游戏内的各种各样的内容，我匮乏的语言无法将我所想全部表现出来，但我仍愿意称其为永远的神。即便是原价购入，我也觉得是物超所值。
还有6什么时候出啊（）

author: {'steamid': '76561198095044801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3450, 'last_played': 1648715998}
review: 三年前曾经玩过一次，当时觉得一般般，也就是画面风格比较符合我的口味，美漫画面+日漫剧情+可调整的难易度，但是不太喜欢里面的装备系统，总感觉基础数值属性过于同质化，不符合一贯的日式RPG游戏，随着游戏进度的推进获得的装备属性会越来越强大，后面一度因为这个原因玩了一半弃坑了；三年后的今天历尽千帆，玩尽了所有的新老回合制游戏再玩史诗幻想突然觉得，这个游戏简直太棒了，棒到让我一个游戏龄十年的玩家，又回到当时刚接触游戏时带给我的吸引和激动，上班都想着摸鱼研究下装备配置，总之一句话，非常讨喜的画风和人设，极为丰富的装备系统，有趣好玩的战斗机制，无处不在的地图小细节（收集强迫症狂喜），让人捧腹或者会心一笑的游戏对话和吐槽，包括对角色内心戏的刻画，以及天马行空却又不无现实逻辑的剧情，好吧，一句话根本概况不了这个游戏的优点，这是我那么多游戏中唯一促使我写了推荐测评的，真有你的matta！

author: {'steamid': '76561198318197881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4738, 'last_played': 1647233341}
review:
全実績解除したのでレビュー
放置時間もそこそこあったので達成までおよそ70時間超
諸手を上げてオススメ

とにかくユーザーフレンドリーなRPG
過去作は未プレイで最初は独特なキャライラストに抵抗があったが何の事はない、すぐに好きになった
詳細レビューは他のアニキ達が載せているので、個人的に印象深かったポイントを列挙

・戦闘中、メインパーティと控えとの交代にターン消費をしないので戦略性がすごく高い
・戦闘終了後、時間経過でHPが自然回復
・捕獲システムがあり、ボス含むほぼ全ての敵を捕獲可能（FFの召喚獣のように使用できる）
・一見何もないような場所にアイテムや宝箱があったり、徐々に解禁されていく要素も相まって探索がすごく楽しい（クリア後ですら最序盤のマップに何度も足を運んだ）
・キャラの装備を変更すると、戦闘中だけでなく会話時のサムネイルでも見た目が変わる点に作者のこだわりを感じた
・おそらく誰もがやるであろう「会話送りでボタン連打していたら同じNPCに再度話しかけちゃう」現象にも配慮されており、移動することで会話キャンセルが可能（この時点で本作の大ファンになった）
・あちこちに様々なアニメ、ゲームなどのネタが組み込まれており、さりげないものだとマップを歩いているだけでニヤリとする
・戦闘難易度は5段階からいつでも変更可能で、さらに公式でチート・ハンデ機能が備わっておりプレイヤー各自でさらに細かな調整が可能（ただしチート使用時は一部実績解除が不可）
・このグラフィックからは想像できないかもしれないが、下手なホラーゲームより怖い場面がある
・ストーリーを進めていく中でパズル系の謎解き要素も多々あるが、作者自身がYoutubeで攻略動画を上げているので詰まることはない

近年のJRPGではグラフィックやUIが綺麗なだけの中身の薄っぺらいタイトルが散見されるが、最初から最後までこんなに楽しくゲームができたのは小学生以来かもしれない
シリーズ5作目というだけあり、とても洗練されている
実績解除にあたり苦戦したことはいくつかあるが、個人的には不満は何もなし
RPG好きで興味がある人ならセールを待たず即購入しても後悔しないと思う
むしろ2000円でも安すぎるくらい


ーーー 追記 ーーー
このゲームには特定の日付にゲームを起動すると受けられる祝日クエストというものがあり、実績解除には達成不可欠
プレイ時期が悪いと1年近く待たなければならない場合があるが、PCのシステム設定から手動で日付を変更することで対処可能
ワープ用のスライムがたくさんいるエリアに現れるNPCから受注可能で、それぞれ雑魚敵からクエストアイテムがドロップするようになる
以下はクエストの種類と受注可能時期

[spoiler] ・春節　　　　　　　1/18～2/25
・バレンタインデー　2/7～2/21
・イースター　　　　3/14～4/30
・ハロウィン　　　　10/1～11/7（おそらく）
・クリスマス　　　　12/1～1/7（おそらく）[/spoiler] 

ゲーム起動時にしか日付を参照しないので、セキュリティ的にも起動後はすぐに設定を戻すことをおすすめ
