author: {'steamid': '76561198015127044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4711, 'last_played': 1582852139}
review:
Unironically a great turn-based RPG with [b][i]no[/i] random encounters[/b], and combat focusing on cooldown management and enemy prioritization. Quite strategically challenging on Epic difficulty — with basically [b]no grinding[/b] (optional areas scale to your level).

For example you're always choosing whether to do straight damage, buff, heal, debuff, status ailment, set up for elemental combo...etc. Enemies have specific attacks & weaknesses that you can plan around. All equipment has comparable pros and cons, unlike other RPG's where you get straight upgrades. You can change gear mid-battle (spending a turn) for different elemental offense/defenses, status resistances, or other passives — so it's usually fine if you don't pick the best loadout beforehand for each encounter.

Endgame content is a well-designed challenge instead of just ultra-high enemy stats. You win by being skilled at the game rather than grinding your character's level.

Despite being called "5", you could start with this one. Or go back to "3" if you want to appreciate the improvements (like Persona 3 vs 5).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007440268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1958, 'last_played': 1615731265}
review:
너무 즐겁다
상성맞추기 포획딜계산 보물상자루팅 스킬장비업글
딱히 대단한 줄거리도 없고 진짜 JRPG 기본기만 있는데 그 기본기가 너무 재밌는 거임
한번 키면 대여섯 시간 어어 하다가 넘겨버리고. 고작 일주일만에 플탐이 33시간이 잡혔다.
이거만 하고 끌까? 아니다 이거까지 하고. 다음 맵엔 뭐 있지? 이 맵까지만 할까...? 마지막으로 끄기 전에 스킬업 해야지... 템도 다시 보고. 완료한 퀘스트 다 보고하고 꺼야겠다... 이 길은 뭐지? ... 히든 퍼즐맵... 쉬워보이는데 깨고 끄면 되겠군.... 상자 앞을 막고 있는 이거만 잡으면... 어 이 몹 아직 포획 안했어!!! ... (...)
하루 평균 5시간 이렇게 달렸는데도 아직까지 숨은 요소가 많다. 야리코미 좋아하면 ebf5는 천국일듯?
난 파고들 생각은 없는데 그냥 할 때 재밌게 해서. 앞으로의 시리즈도 챙겨볼 거 같음.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354511979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 26220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20158, 'last_played': 1699466875}
review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy franchise as a whole appreciates the design philosophy and intricacies of old-school JRPGs. EBF5 in particular takes what made those games addicting and fun and cranks that up to 12. 
If you're not a fan of JRPGs, this probably won't appeal to you. Most of the humor falls between incidental and self-aware, and while none if it's BAD, it's still geared towards a specific niche. The gameplay, too. 

However, if you ARE a fan, by all means buy this already. As of now, you're paying $20 for what amounts to one of the most well-balanced and engaging RPGs of not only the franchise, but easily the GENRE. It's hard to go over everything that makes this game good without going super in-depth about builds and situations, since the game is designed around building your characters both for specific situations AND specific builds, but here are a few factors that make EBF5 better than the competition

-Difficulty: The game's designed around it's second highest difficulty in every situation; this gives the game as a whole a more well-rounded appeal. For those who want an easier experience, they have 3 lower options to make the game range from relaxed to insta-win, but for those who want a genuinely brutal RPG they can crank it up to Epic (a difficulty that does, in turn, offer more achievements for those who play for glory), and on top of that the latest update added a slew of cheats and challenges that can change the whole experience to be either more fun or, for the masochists among us, quite the opposite.

-Equipment: Unlike most RPGs, equipment is percent bonuses. This means that it doesn't get worse over time, and considering the range of effects equipment has, most of the pieces are balanced to be useful even in the late-game, making building your characters much, MUCH more involved than just finding the best piece for each class. 

-Growth: The experience curve of the game is so well-balanced and calculated that just by going after treasure and secrets, you WILL be properly leveled; you have the option of overleveling, but its never required, and if you skip treasure, you'll generally be weaker than intended, making the game harder in both respects. Plus, the skill system makes going after enemies much more rewarding, as skills getting improved makes them not only stronger, but it adds to their statuses, their effects, etc. 

-Resistances: Instead of being a few specific amounts or all-or-nothing in terms of calculation, resistances are percentages. If an enemy has 70% fire resistance, hitting them with a fire attack will deal 30%. Of course, hitting them with a 50% fire attack will do, of course, 65%. Then if the enemy has 200% fire resistance, you can hit them with a 50% fire attack, which will do 0, unless they're also wet in which case the fire portion does half and you end up doing 25% total: 50% unabsorbed, the 50% that IS absorbed is reduced by 50% to make it 25% absorbed. All in all, it's a bunch of math, and basically EVERY attack is going to need to be run through a beautifully arbitrary calculator. 

-Combos: Statuses increase or decrease damage of specific types. Some statuses work on elements, a couple work on damage types, you even have some that affect crit rates more directly (which is cool, as truly random crits aren't a thing). On top of that, stat buffs and debuffs are extremely dynamic, and setting them up can take a little time or a lot depending on the situation. This leads to some bosses being setup-fodder which are incredibly strong to counteract the fact you're going to seriously affect their stats, while others are basically immune to most setup, leading to the combo game shifting to your own party to try and weather the pain they'll inflict on you, and your equipment setup can drastically affect how both of these types of bosses play out too.


Moral of the story, if you like RPGs, BUY THIS ONE IT'S SO GOOD AND SO WELL-MADE.
If you don't, I mean hey, you've probably spent $20 on worse games, or spent more on games you still never play, might still be worth a shot. Who knows, this might be what gets you into the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561199115528572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1707346573}
review: I cannot recommend this game enough. It has just about everything you could want from an RPG, a surprisingly good story, funny characters, challenging bosses, witty dialogue, difficult puzzles, an achievement system, and yes even fanservice. My only gripe with this game is that I couldn't play as the fascists. If Matt is reading this somehow, I would like to see a version where Lance is the starting character, maybe some DLC or something. That minor nitpick aside, get this game, my personal favorite RPG I've ever played. Support Matt and his team, they did an amazing job. This game has a ridiculous amount of content for a mere 20 bucks, its a steal. All of Matt's games have been pretty great (with the exception of EBF 1 and 2, but those are good starting places, and everyone has to start somewhere. Matt really hit his stride with EBF 3 and all of his games have been solid 8/10s, with the exception of this one which is a 10.) and I hope to see him go far. Keep doing your thing man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163415598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6440, 'last_played': 1688179144}
review:
I'm not usually an JRPG guy, I've played Final Fantasy, Octopath Traveler, not my type of games. This one is different.
The Epic Battle Fantasy series has been a part of my life for years now, I started playing 3 on Kongregate a long long time ago and instantly fell in love.

The linear style of 1 and 2 didn't appeal to me that much but the music, the art, it was amazing, 3 adding a story, a world, it was perfect. I would then go on to play Epic Battle Fantasy 4 for years, never getting it on steam but buying the Battle Mountain expansion on Kongregate and raging at how hard it was for me. 

When 5 was announced I followed the development from the beginning. I saw every piece of concept art, played the combat demo on the website, I knew this version was going to be just as special as the last, if not more. I bought this game the day it released on steam, and completed my first play through not long after. I recently sat down to start another play through and grind for all of the achievements earlier this year, as I had not tried the new 2.0 update content, it took me a couple days, but it was well worth it.

This series managed to stay an amazing, captivating adventure for me since I was a 10 year old little kid, to now, as a 19 year old little kid. While other series lose their charm after the nostalgia value wears off, this series keeps getting everything right year after year. The UI is simple, intuitive, yet offers so much, the loadout save feature is something I wish more RPG's had. The art is charming, simple, and fun, every enemy is thought out and polished, the characters not only have different battle sprites for every outfit/weapon combination in the game, but have overworld sprites for them too. The background art takes overused, boring settings and breathes light into them, the 2D cutscene art is adorable, the pixel art can either be cute or terrifying, but the good kind, the battle animations never get tired, and every single piece of this art blends amazingly with the games soundtrack. The games soundtrack, produced by Phyrnna is simply a masterpiece. I've spent an entire day analyzing it before seriously! The soundtrack is a perfect blend of originality, and samplings and remixes of previous Epic Battle Fantasy, or Phyrnna tracks. When I heard the music box remix of Estavius, the town theme from Epic Battle Fantasy 3 play in the warp cat zone for the first time, I got a tear jerking blast of nostalgia, the jukeboxes scattered around the games map had the same effect. I don't want to spoil the game but there's a lot more opportunities to  get that nostalgia blast if you loved the previous games in the series as much as I did. The whole soundtrack is honestly a blast to sit down and experience, the art and fanart of this game as well, but how does the mechanics of the game itself tie in? amazingly in fact, the battle system is perfected the fifth time around, doing away with mana in favor of a turn based cooldown system on more powerful skills, a change I really love, AP returns for the 3rd time letting you choose what skills to upgrade, when, from a big list for each character. Bonus skills return too, powerful or unorthodox skills that can be used by more than one character, but only one at a time, making the boring fetch quests you have to do to get them, more rewarding. The backup system is more refined in this game than in 4, this time around you have another character to play with, and no penalty for switching the backup characters around mid fight. The enemies can also have attacks that hit the characters in backup, and overall, have a lot of flashy, fun moves to attack you with. The new status effects are implemented perfectly, along with the returning classics like stun and freeze, you also have chill, light, heavy, scorch, good luck, bad luck, haste, and many others, that don't just deal damage over time, lower your stats, or make you unable to move for a certain amount of turns like in the previous games, these status effects introduce a ton of new depth into the battle system, like chill for example, while enemies are inflicted with chill, they take 50% increased ice and water damage and bio damage (including from poison or virus) is reduced by 50%, it's removed by fire damage and actually cancels out fire based status effects like burn scorch or berserk, it doubles the chance to get frozen by moves that inflict freeze, and any incoming wet status effect gets turned into freeze when mixed with chill. This is one status effect that has an immense amount of strategy attached to it, and there are many more of those in this game. Speaking of strategy, there are dozens of outfits and weapons in this game, each character gets their own pool of weapons, and there are male and female outfits, containing a body piece, and a head piece. You can mix and match these outfits and weapons in hundreds of different combinations whether to play against a certain bosses elemental weakness or to buff your teammates or to tank damage, an extra layer of customization comes in the form of accessories, little trinkets that each character can have 3 of at a time that provide small boosts or resistances. The battle system is massive and nuanced, the summoning system also had a big rework this time, instead of a static list of summon-able creatures, nearly every foe in the game can be captured and used to aid you in later battles, each with their own unique effect upon summoning them, as if the elemental combat didn't make this game pokemon inspired enough. This aspect of capturing and summoning foes is completely optional, a reoccurring theme in this game. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 has a lot of optional content, from entire dungeons and hidden boss fights to an entire set of trading cards that boost things like gold received upon victories if you take time to scout them out. My favorite optional area is probably the Grand Gallery, an art gallery full of treasure and fan art made by fans of the game more talented than I'll ever be that opens new rooms the more achievements you've unlocked, giving incentive to a completionist route. The dialogue in this game is also fantastic as always, it's witty, hilarious, and chock full of references. this dialogue is everywhere, during battles, in the overworld, hell there's sometimes different dialogue for events in the overworld based on who's leading your party, and it's all amazing. 

There's still so many things I can talk about like the weather system and the games story and setting, but I want anyone reading this to experience the game fully for themselves, explore the world, collect the secrets, do all the optional content, it's super worth it. This is, was, and will continue to be my favorite game series of all time, and this is currently my favorite game in this series. Thank you Matt Roszak for putting entertainment into my life for over 10 years, I wish you success in any future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044715229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2772, 'last_played': 1613351790}
review:
As a fan of EBF 3+4, I was so glad someone gifted me EBF 5. 

If you're looking for a fun and goofy RPG, with a surprisingly deep battle system, then look no further!

Its a great starting point for anyone wanting to try the series. The story is mainly a reboot but for the older fans there is plenty here to pick up on and piece together for a truly satisfying story. 

The changes to the battle system, not using MP but now a cooldown system for skills is a nice balancer. It also changes pacing of battle entirely from spamming certain stuff to strategically setting up equipment to match elemental weaknesses of enemies or for setting up combos. If you get confused about how the battle system works, there's a library in Greenwood Village that really helps you understand the nuances. Thanks for that, it helped a lot as a refresher for me since my last playthrough of an EBF game had been some years.

There's just so much loot to look for on every map in the game, quests to complete, and of course secret areas to explore and enemies to battle!

I've already spent over 45 hours as of writing this review on the game, and I still have tons of achievements to gather so I can see the rest of the art gallery in game. And I need to build bonds with my team members so they can get a better ending too.

If this has to be the final EBF game this is quite a way to go out with a bang that's for sure~

author: {'steamid': '76561198317601110', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2371, 'last_played': 1613370565}
review:
평점 : 4.0/5.0
클리어 : 20/2/15
장르 : 턴제 RPG
플레이타임 : 40시간 (노멀~에픽 난이도 혼합으로 엔딩까지)


상당히 잘만든 수작 RPG.

게임을 즐기던 주인공의 게임기가 모종의 사고로 꺼져, 폭력성이 나타난 주인공이 하키스틱을 들고 모험을 떠나는 이야기.

딱히 마나같은 개념이 없고, 비전투중에는 체력이 자동으로 차기도 해서 일반적인 RPG에서 느껴지는 피로감은 꽤나 덜한편. 마우스 조작 덕분에 숨겨진 길을 찾는것도 쉽기도 하고, 여러 도움이되는 대사, 오브젝트도 존재하는 등 여러모로 고전 RPG의 요소들을 패러디하여 시스템에 녹여낸 모습이 보인다. 물론 도움말기능을 끄거나, 키보드로 직접 조작해 불합리함을 느껴보는것도 가능하다. 

군데군데 오브젝트 설명이나 동료간의 대화에서 나타나는 개그나 패러디적 요소도 재밌고, 퍼즐도 소코반류랑 빙판 퍼즐을 좀 많이 돌려쓰긴 하지만 그렇게 과하진 않고 적당히 즐길만 하다. 위에서 말한 길을 포함해서 이곳저곳 숨겨진 보물상자나 스팟을 찾는것도 또하나의 재미. 


난이도는 노멀로도 비교적 긴장감있게 즐길만 하다. 

다만, 어려움 난이도부터는 해당 보스의 약점을 보완하거나 강점을 부각하는 패턴 (디스펠 한방에 무력화되는 버프를 거는 패턴이 있으면 가속까지 같이 부여해서 바로 공격한다던가, 생체 흡수인 보스의 패턴에 질병이 추가되서 피를 채운다거나 등등)이 추가되거나 강화되고, 데미지나 체력이 뻥튀기되어 골때리게 변하는 경우가 많다. 자동부활이나 기합, 투명/인챈트를 전제로 하지 않으면 못넘기는 패턴이 대다수.

특히, 삐끗하면 전열 전멸로 꼬이는 에픽난이도에서 보스 포획으로 넘어가면, 확률도 확률이고 보스는 대부분의 디버프에 면역이라 보스 전투 하나에 1시간 넘게 걸리는 경우도 허다하다. 

여튼 난이도도 게임 도중에 자유롭게 변경 가능하고, 더 어렵게/쉽게 하고싶은 사람들을 위한 커스텀 설정도 지원하기 떄문에, 각자의 게임 취향에 맞춰서 즐기면 될듯. 여러모로 보통~하드코어 난이도까지 제대로 지원하는 게임.

개인적인 추천으로는 일단 어려움으로 시작해서, 본인의 난이도에 따라 조정하면 좋을듯 하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167032869', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9930, 'last_played': 1702800144}
review:
Unlike a certain game with a 4 in the title, 6 years (or more if you count the browser version) didn't pass between my start and finish of this game. I remember opening this after I bought it with the coupon and doing the loading screen achievement before closing the game for about a year. I started playing a day or two after finishing the last one, got a decent way in, and stopped playing for a month or two before resuming and en- completing it. Yes, completing it. 115.6 hours in the past two weeks.
For what actually happened, before I start complaining, assume anything I don't mention I liked and remember that I recommend this game.

Spoilers, but any of the big stuff will be hidden with the spoiler text.
So the beginning of the game was good, no real complaints as I went through it (on Epic because that is the only difficulty), spared Nolegs by accident and found how to spare Natz because Nolegs is made out of feathers and needed lovable to not die every other turn in most of the fights. Went on to get run over and lose Natz before I loaded my save and killed the enemies guarding chests before I strategically got run over a second time. Got Anna to hopelessly surrender before she died of poison (still got both achievements) immediately after (didn't know much about status effects and capturing enemies at this point), and headed into the fortress.

Skip ahead a bit, and I'm fighting the totems. They were the first arcade fight that I managed to finish, though I did attempt and fail the chair fight beforehand. The arcade fights were hard, but a lot of them were only really difficult from the gimmicks. The snakes and phoenixes respawn if you don't kill them all on the same turn, which felt really artificial, especially since it was a free action for whatever reason. Also the phoenixes auto revive was better than the type that the player gets and revives it at full health for some reason, which really extends the fight to 3x the length, mostly because equipment auto skills and counters tended to kill them at bad times (I refuse to turn them off). The Maw's fight was extremely hard the first time through, but then during the arcade boss rush I used a summon that gave brave to the party and it became as disappointing of a fight as Godcat was after I grinded those two levels, though I guess this can be more considered as a solved puzzle rather than a hard fight since it isn't the final boss. The bushes, chairs, pumpkins, and maybe even Coralia were pretty straight forward.

The dark player fights were all difficult in their own special way, and they were all fights I enjoyed, partially from the nostalgia of the EBF4 fights, partially because they were challenging. Except the Nolegs fight why does he have no resistances, 5 million health, a song with lyrics that loops every two minutes, and I was there for so long the whole fight was Rainbow Rafflesia 2.0. Good thing there isn't a dark player rush, because then it would have to include that fight.

The marathons for the most part were pretty easy to breeze through. The monster marathon was easy to get past since every golem has no resistance to freeze and the dragons are downgraded from the last game. In EBF4 the stronger dragons that appeared later on threatened to wipe the front line if you didn't handle their elements and exploit their weaknesses. Maybe I was the one that changed, and not the dragons, but by comparison the ones in this game felt like pushovers (except for the Origami Dragon, whose strength rivaled my expectations). The monsters were randomly grouped too, which probably made the fight that much easier since 5 dragons at once would still probably be extremely hard to fight against.
The mini-boss and boss marathons were pretty easy and straightforward to beat, and the mega boss marathon was a good challenge, and it could've been annoyingly hard if I didn't search for a Neon Valhalla strategy. The boss itself was a good fight to endure as I kept making sure to deal more damage than it healed, but in a boss rush? No, I'm not suffering any more than I have to, which is not at all.
The endless battle was mostly just a test of patience, since I already finished the marathon where the monsters are predetermined, so it wasn't that much harder.

The Battle Arena was a bit difficult, but ended up as another test of patience since equipping the flairs that give auto revive, refill health to max upon reviving, and give regenerate pretty much just mean that I could spam defend until auto revive activated and I could attack without having to worry. The only risks were attacking without it and hoping I could tank the enemies attacks, which I did a lot.
The Data Bunker was a nice challenge, the two player fights made sure to have mostly single target attacks while the three player fights turned the difficulty up with normal bosses, adding the extra challenge of not being able to rely on backup being able to hop in after the front line gets wiped and revive everyone.
I looked up a strategy for the [spoiler] Glitch [/spoiler] since I had absolutely no clue how to fight something that absorbed all elements, and eventually fine tuned a one turn kill to a one turn capture after 6 fights (I saw the cutscene every time and had to wait for it to be over to try again).
[spoiler] Snowflake [/spoiler] was a lot easier than I anticipated, a friend told me how annoying it was for him to apply all the status effects to capture him, but I just did that throughout the fight because I couldn't do much else (no elemental weaknesses to attack or resistances to avoid at all), so at the end the boss just had practically max debuffs and status effects.

Some of the biggest challenges were getting some of the medals. Retaliation and New Strats needed their respective modifiers active but didn't require I turn on scaling foes, so I just went to early areas and grinded the fights until I got the achievements, which was probably a lot less trouble than beating enemies my level in the final area. Extreme Difficulty noted in the description that it didn't have to be done on Epic, so I headed to the Data Bunker, set the difficulty to Zero, and turned on a few cheats before starting the first EBF1 simulation and killing the boss there. Getting a triple crit was annoying for a few minutes, but was ultimately over pretty quickly. Finishing off Card Shark was relatively easy because I already had about 45 cards and didn't have to do that much backtracking. The Sixth Sense achievement took a LOT of backtracking since I was at the final area and already explored the optional areas when I noticed that I was only at ~150 secrets found, so I had to run around most of the map looking for secrets that I missed. The achievement for capturing foes I got naturally because I impulsively captured almost every enemy I could except for the dark player Natalie and The Maw, which I could probably go back to now that I know to equip capture equipment on before fighting them. The Adventure Remix achievement has ridiculous requirements, start a custom game to get ALL THE WAY TO GREENWOOD? That's like halfway through the game, and maybe it's because you have all the party members by that point, but compared to EBF4 you take a really long time getting all of them, to the point where you've cleared three or four entire areas just to get there.

The hardest fight in the game, IMO, was the final boss. Wow, who would've thought that [spoiler] The Devourer [/spoiler] would live up to both his title and name, huh? There's no gimmick either, he's just plain strong. I tried to fight him three or four times before giving up and looking at a guide or two for strategies, because I have to get all the way through the [spoiler] Cosmic Gigalith [/spoiler], which has like 5 or 6 million health to burn through, just to get to him, and way too much of my time would be taken if I did that every time I wanted to test a new strategy.

Good game, nice challenges on Epic. 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198048554641', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1705936197}
review:
Un juego hilarante con personajes divertidos, grandes batallas y mucha estrategia. Con la dificultad ajustable, es posible acumular experiencia para las batallas difíciles y luego cambiar la dificultad nuevamente, o simplemente jugar todo el juego en cualquier dificultad que elijas. Las batallas de jefes son muy únicas y requieren una estrategia diferente para cada una. Mi parte favorita es la colección de equipos y las interacciones entre ellos, llevando tus resistencias a más del 100% y realmente curando los ataques enemigos.

Si no sabes si vale la pena comprar este juego, definitivamente no hay nada que dudar. Hay una razón por la cual esta serie tiene una comunidad tan fuerte después de tantos años y la gente compra inmediatamente. 
Pondrás mucho tiempo en el juego, apuntarás a conseguir todos los logros y amarás este juego. En serio, no puedo garantizarlo lo suficiente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152261631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1710627824}
review: The Epic Battle Fantasy games hold a special place in my childhood. Their great fun lighthearted turn based combat RPGs. 5 Is definitely the most refined of the games, with good UI and controls and nearly timeless graphics (Cartoons and pixel art tend to be this way). However I wasn't a fan of the more sexualized/vulgar turn the game took over the previous games. Luckily there is an option to fix this in the settings (The Cleavage option and mature option respectively). Nolegs as the new character was a bit disappointing and I almost never used him, this is probable because I have a bias against anthropomorphic animals. But the other four are great. All in all I would recommend this game, not to everyone, but it's worth a playthrough.

review: I've played through most of these games even before I knew how to internet (not completely tho) and enjoyed them a lot. I only recently gained access to steam and stuff and this is the first paid product I have gotten, and I have to say it was completely worth it. Not only does it tap on my nostalgia, it is also a great game with great controls and gameplay with a story balanced between silly and serious, and I whole-heartedly reccomend this game to anyone who's played any of the other games or is looking for something to pass the time in a fun, easy to put down and pick up, way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194790365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 41, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1712034257}
review:
Oi, if you plan on reading this whole thing, there's spoilers

this is the best game i've probably ever played
there's nothing i hate about it (except hydras, fuck hydras) and absolutely adore how the removal of MP was handled. the story at the beginning is pretty simple at first sight, but by the end, so many secrets point out to the bigger picture that by the end, it all made sense. it makes you think "oh, it's a glitch, a fun little 4th wall break". by the end? guess what, that's part of the plot. i adore all of the characters that all have a use in battle, having no character be left out (except NoLegs in the offense field, because he's better with lower health enemies, which limits him as mostly support with 9 lives and sushi cat). my only gripe with them is that most of the character development happens in the optional dungeons and the end of the game, but the character interactions (even if it's scattered between a lot of one off quips and characters describing their surroundings) are absolute gold
while i didn't 100% my first save file, it's not because i didn't feel like it, it's because there's just SO MUCH TO DO, and i even did all the side-missions (not the holidays ones, except christmas, got the game around then). the Final boss has the coolest "ultimate" attack i've ever seen in any game, oh excuse me, he has 2 OF THE COOLEST ATTACKS I'VE EVER SEEN. he's just that, a final boss, but he has so much presence for the while he appears
After the end there's only one thing that lingers in my mind. and that's that i SERIOUSLY WANT AN EBF6, but it's hard to put in the plot, but ehhhh, i'm not a game designer.

The end-score is 11 out of fucking 10. this game is now in my top 3 of all time, and i cannot wait to see what this series holds in the future.
Thank you Matt Roszak. you are a blessing in an age where it seems that the world only has bad news

author: {'steamid': '76561197971194222', 'num_games_owned': 1353, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1610932719}
review:
This series just keeps getting better and better :)
I pretty much like all of the changes to the formula - the cooldowns, the skill system, saving loadouts, capture mechanic - all great!
I also like how there's 5 characters now and everyone fullfills their role (unlike ebf4 where you had matt for physical damage, natz for magic damage and the other two just tagging along as supports)
Can't wait for part 6 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053570898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3170, 'last_played': 1606973114}
review:
よくある古いターン制RPG、なのだが色んな面でユーザビリティが良い
スキル使用履歴による簡単なスキルアクセス
戦うかどうかを完全に選べる微動だにしないシンボルエンカウント
どうせ攻略Wiki見るんだろと言わんばかりに戦闘画面でフルオープンされる敵耐性
時間がかかるだけのMP温存、ボス戦前に帰って回復等無いクールダウン性での常時全力バトル
これらは簡単になるという意味ではなく、それ前提の難易度なので高難易度ゲームの分類にはなると思う

作者は状態異常や属性攻撃で弱点を突き、属性防具で攻撃をいなす、いわゆる耐性パズルが好きなのだろう
そのやりたいゲームバランスへ導く為の導線が作り込まれている
敵耐性は常時確認可能
弱点を固めた敵配置
モンスター捕獲する際、状態異常の重要性が高いので捕獲していれば自然に覚える状態異常
これらで慣らしていき徐々に耐性パズルの依存度を高めていくそのバランス感覚が凄かった

最後に欠点があるとすればモンスター捕獲システムについて
いわゆるポケモンと同じ感じの瀕死にして状態異常漬けにすれば成功率が上がるタイプなのだが
ボスも捕獲できるという所に問題がある
つまりボス戦が全力バトルではなく殺さないように注意しながら捕獲を試みる戦いになるのが不完全燃焼だった

author: {'steamid': '76561198155081472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5134, 'last_played': 1610962999}
review:
Отличная игра с прекрасной музыкой, простая и увлекательная. 
Геймплей спокойный и не напрягающий. Русский перевод приятно удивил.
Диалоги и различные ситуации действительно забавные. Шутки отторжения не вызывают.
Хотя кажется, сюжет и атмосфера слабее, чем в предыдущей части.
Экипировки много, но большую часть особо нигде не применить.
Самый серьезный минус - игра любит подтормаживать во время боев.

author: {'steamid': '76561198854607699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2904, 'last_played': 1659618754}
review:
I found the game by accident and it's really amazing, probably the best RPG I've ever played. 
The game is a steal, with all of the optional content you'll probably be able to play for more than 60-70 hours in just a single playthrough. 
The characters are fun, the humor is top notch and the gameplay is really good. 
The artstyle fits really well with the music and the overall atmosphere. 
The only downside that I can think of is that it might not be as fun if you've never played something similar before, because you'll miss a few jokes.
Strongly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198236222182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1638146415}
review: So far it is very similar to fourth game and true to the series. There are some game-play changes that are quite different, but improve the game in my opinion. Mainly I am referring to the change from a mana system to a cool-down system on a per skill basis. Stronger moves have longer cool-downs, and some have no cool-down at all. This is much more sustainable in long, epic battles that this series is great at. And many of the moves are the same as before, with better animations, and plenty of new ones.

review: I thought I wouldn't be able to be more pleased than the 4th installment in the best RPG series I've played (and I include that list with well-known series such as Final Fantasy). The lovable characters have amazing dialogue that really cultivates each characters personally, I thought I would hate not having MP but oh boyo was I wrong, it's an amazing mechanic making strategy more important than spamming OP spells repeatedly. I've never been so satisfied before. All ten of my fingers just turned into thumbs up. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271149119', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 20889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12768, 'last_played': 1663262693}
review:
While I only now have this game for myself thanks to a lucky guess with a Steam Key giveaway, that doesn't mean I didn't play this game beforehand. 

My brother bought it first, and after first playing (the free version of) the game on ArcadePreHacks (yes, I played a hacked version because I'm a cheater addict), then playing the game on Steam...

...limiting myself to EBF4 was a big mistake. I was missing out on so much.

This game isn't PERFECT, no game is. 
But this game is INCREDIBLY CLOSE to it.

I've never been an RPG guy, the only "RPG-type game" I've played is Pokemon on my DS.

But the EBF series is more than just an "RPG". It's a game that defines "fanservice".

No matter how you get it, you're in for a hell of an experience if you get it, which I reccomend you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355143901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1624553547}
review:
The gameplay is superior to EBF 3 and 4.
The atmosphere is good, but EBF 4 did it better. Especcially the final boss fight, EBF 3 and 4 outclass the atmosphere of the final boss of EBF 5.
The story is about rocks and some alien. EBF4's story clearly outclasses EBF5's.

Overall, fantastic gameplay, which is the main aspect of a game, but the story and atmosphere lacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054162922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1640568985}
review:
Hello, I'm the designer for the Tanuki monster (since EBF4) and it's been a long while until I finally decided to pick this game up from a Halloween sale. I've known this series since its Newgrounds days and I can tell you that if you're new to this, I recommend starting from EBF3. I mean, why not? The game is FREE and the main reason is actually because of the gradual addition of game mechanics. Think about it. Imagine playing Skyrim and then you decide to play Morrowind, it's going to feel awkward. Ok, now to the review.

+ Graphics may be simple and mainly anime-based but it's fine with me
+ Animation is simple but it works
+ Effects make you feel proud for finally using your limit breaks
+ Puzzles are ok enough, unless you possess only a single brain cell...
+ Plenty of quests to keep you busy
+ Challenging foes to keep you on your toes
+ References!
+ Comedy is everywhere to keep you entertained
+ Fanservice!
+ No more MP based skills, now it's all cooldown and I quite like it as it adds to strategic combat
+ Monster catching is another fun strategic side
+ Fleeing is a tactical option, it will save your ass!
+ Phyrnna's music will put a smile on your face
+ The game acknowledges YOU and your efforts (Yes, yes it does)
+ I can't find any cons at the moment... (Unless you want to put in difficult enemies, then that's your problem...)

You will need...
= Plenty of strategy
= A keen eye for all the treasures and secrets
= Patience for grinding (Come on, if you can stand doing that in Final Fantasy, I don't see what the problem is...)
= Courage to experiment
= The urge to resist throwing your computer against some of the punishingly difficult parts of the game (No, I don't have that problem. I embrace the Cosmic Monolith coloured death with my face in Munch style...)

Overall, it's a damn good RPG. What else can I say?

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 3850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3850, 'last_played': 1609026727}
review:
As of writing this review, I have just now beaten this game...sort of. I guess there are multiple endings, and I got a 'good' one, but not the best one? Didn't vary my party combinations often enough it would seem, and I needed to do more quests - a non-spoiler tip for anyone who picks this up I guess!

Needless to say, 64 hours is a solid amount of playtime. I did not do everything the game had available, and I did do a lot. It has built in options for replaying, including higher difficulties, custom game startups and newgame+ if you beat the game. 

This game is a love letter to / parody of many nerdy things, with a focus on JRPGs of the (you guessed it) classic Final Fantasy format: turn-based combat with a three person 'active' party. 

That said, they do a damn good job within the genre from a mechanics perspective. They have clearly talked and thought A LOT about all the little things that could be tweaked in these type of games to make it less tedious, more transparent and more fun. The amount of customizations (both classified as options and 'cheats and challenges') that you can make to tailor your gameplay experience to your specific preferences is staggering. If you like this genre of games, and enjoy some very 4th wall breaking parody humor, this game is definitely worth looking at.

The only thing I will say is the graphics are a bit funny. They have one visual style (which is honestly kind of underwhelming) for walking around the world and all the out of combat interactions, one visual style for combat (which I really liked personally), and then one visual style for the cut scenes, which is this cute-sy kind of art style. It felt a bit indecisive in that respect, and I'd still say it was fine. I would've loved for the out of combat art to be more of the quality of the in combat art, and I think they did it the way the did as part of 'staying true' to their Newgrounds roots. Considering that this games roots were as a flash game, they have come a LONG way and I do not regret my purchase. 

8.5 / 10

review: Uno de los mejores rpg por turnos que puedes jugar. Contiene múltiples mecánicas interesantes como capturar enemigos (incluso jefes) como si fuesen pokemon, equipamiento y objetos que cambian radicalmente la forma de jugar para cada uno de los 5 personajes, objetos que ofrecen mejores permanentes y configuración de la partida para mayor o mejor dificultad en características específicas. Sin duda alguna, un juego infaltable en todo repertorio de steam. (Me tomó aproximadamente 100 horas terminarlo al 100%, un desafío muy gratificante)

author: {'steamid': '76561198935333611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3079, 'last_played': 1685699670}
review:
モンスターを食べるニートと破壊神を呼べる猫が魑魅魍魎をフルボッコする神ゲー

相手の弱点を探ったり、逆に敵の攻撃の属性に対処したり、ある時は道中で捕まえたモンスターの力を借りたり、
戦略性や駆け引きが楽しめる。
また、サブクエストやメダルや隠しダンジョンなどのやり込み要素が豊富で、プレイヤーを飽きさせない。

お値段以上に楽しいゲームなので強くオススメしたい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198303102584', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1698354339}
review:
Okay, I'm not very far into the game, but like, wth is wrong with the lore here? Why doesn't Matt recognize No legs? It can't be a prequel game if Anna's in it, because they'd never met Anna until EBF4, and why is he so seemingly naive? Bro, you've killed an ancient demon of destruction and slain literal god, why are you so concerned about a rock? Not gonna lie, this is the first one of your games I've played that I've only kinda liked instead of super loved, and I've played EBFs 1-4, Adventure Story, and both Bullet Heavens.

I really hope this game improves later, or I'm gonna be heartbroken...

review: I grew up on the EBF series back on Armor Games; you know before flash was killed, R.I.P. flash. EBF4 was a game I would replay and replay for years on end. I waited for a long time for this game and what can't I say? This game was well worth the wait, it's by far my favorite so far, sorry EBF4, the combat is great, the characters are as funny as ever! If you have played the others this is a MUST to play! If you haven't played any of them, EBF 3,4, & 5 are all here on steam and I recommend that you play them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083275451', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1695956935}
review:
The fifth (and final?) entry in a venerable series that began in the Newgrounds / flash games days. If you like the previous Epic Battle Fantasies, or turn-based combat RPGs in general, you'll like this one. The dev has shaken up the formula somewhat since EBF 4, though not too much to make it unrecognizeable to fans of the previous games. I actually do like a lot of the changes:

- Skills are now on cooldowns rather than an MP system (forces you to diversify and not rely on spamming the same skill plus a magic potion every few turns)
- Swapping party members is fast and effective (I ended up switching in and out most of my team in many fights; the system encourages its own use)
- Various QOL improvements including the ability to save equip loadouts
- A not-unreasonable story and some decent dialogue, especially if you go outside the main path, and reasonably challenging / strategic combat.

Overall, fans of the EBF series should love the improvements made here. Newcomers to the series should find it an accessible, in-depth turn-based RPG with a lot of strategic options. Main story probably 20-ish hours, sidequests probably another 20, 100% completion probably 20 more, though I'm not totally sure. Currently somewhere in the middle of the sidequests at review time.

Edit: Editing solely because I forgot to mention the foe-capture / summoning system, which is in-depth and provides a lot of tangible benefits. (Another strong improvement over the previous games in this series.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198170172841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12734, 'last_played': 1618248271}
review:
バトルがすごくこだわって作られててノーマル難易度でも歯ごたえがあります。
一戦一戦が長くなりがちなので時間に余裕があるときのプレイがいいかもしれません。
難しいなーと思ったらペナルティ無しで難易度を下げられるのでストーリーだけ追いたい人も安心。
モンスターを捕獲するシステムは一部除いてボスも捕まえられますがうっかり倒しちゃっても後々再戦可能。（かなり終盤ですが）
メタフィクションやパロディ要素が多いのでそういったものが苦手な人にはおすすめできないかな。
日本語ローカライズはしっかりできていて全く違和感なく遊べます。（作業してくれた方々に感謝）

author: {'steamid': '76561198027303746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4200, 'last_played': 1619694956}
review:
Been playing this series since ebf3 came out on Kongregate.
Gotta say it's gotten better and better with every single installment. it's got at least 50 hours of content if you wanna do all the optional stuff as well(and even more hours if you want to get all the medals).EBF5 has the most interesting mechanics  in the whole series imo and while I love 3 and 4 (have never played 1 and 2) I gotta say this is at least for me the best installment in the whole series. Would heartily recommend for everyone who's a fan of the series (obviously) but also for eveyone who's a fan of turn based rpgs (jrpgs basically).
This gets a 10/10 for me and I really hope the creator continues with this series (maybe by introducing more characters and even more cool mechanics)
So yeah, awesome game, would recommend, great fucking buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162832578', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 2354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1616682448}
review:
大致玩法上与前几作类似，体量更大，战斗更多，粗看下来可能会比较无聊，毕竟没有什么明显驱动你玩下去的内容，如果角色养成算的话hhh，再怎么说以往的rpg好歹有条主线吸引着你玩，EBF就没这么多包袱一如既往的flash风格，而且加入了许多人性化的设计，推荐最高难度玩，普通数值下没什么压力，而且实在打不过还可以刷，对比最终幻想这套玩法还是很合理的，比如团灭后其他队友会自动补上来，换人换顺序不消耗行动，我就一直想吐槽为什么ff替补的机制这么离谱，游戏里也充斥了各种梗和致敬，对我来讲算是一部不错的作品（可是我还是希望能换套玩法来表现这个系列啊）。
长时间玩下来感受，boring

author: {'steamid': '76561198031657795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3456, 'last_played': 1606830662}
review:
Probablement l'une des plus belles pépites de l'histoire du jeu vidéo.
Je ne ferai donc pas dans l'originalité en rajoutant une goutte d'eau à l'océan d'avis positifs qu'a ce jeu. Entre les personnages hauts en couleurs, les dialogues absolument golden, les combats tantôt loufoques, tantôt stratégiques, tantôt les deux et enfin la bande son de Phyrnna, juste exceptionnelle, c'est honnêtement difficile de ne pas user de superlatifs.

Vraiment rien à redire. Propre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106948868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1671042883}
review:
I've played over 70 hours of the fourth one. I'm nearly done my second run of it. That game was really great. Love the characters, the combat, the enemies, locations.
This one fixes what was not wrong but was a bit frustrating about the fourth. There isn't anything wrong with it, let me be clear on that. Mp or Mana or whatever you want to call it wasn't frustrating but when fighting enemies that would steal your mp or syphon you leaving you unable to use your mana-dependent skills (almost all of them). This was a bit frustrating. But not a completely bad one, Instead, this game takes out MP and replaces it with cooldowns. Which I like better. There are items which reduce your cooldowns. Also cooldowns are great because players could spam powerful moves in the previous game if they had enough Mp. This makes it harder to spam moves. Overall very awesome game. I have been playing Matt's game since I was young with Mecha Dress up, EBF1 &2&3 and even adventure story. Love his games, they are all worth getting.
EDIT: I am now 46 hours in, Everything I've said previously still applies. Also wanted to say the extra areas are fantastic, love these areas. The fourth had a few, but this one (the fifth) is full of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091660154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5442, 'last_played': 1607951623}
review:
RPG爱好者不容错过的小品级。。。
才怪，本以为50h就能通关的游戏花了快90h才一周目通关，然而要是愿意打打通头目车轮战不知道要何年何月。。。
内容之多，游戏性之深完全不逊色于任何一款大作rpg
喜欢回合制战斗的玩家绝对推荐

系统
最大的优点应该需要精心琢磨的每一场boss战了
十分标准的你动一下我动一下带些异常带些buff的回合制
但是就这么简单的机制却还能玩出那么多花样是令人比较惊讶的
尤其是各个街机boss，每一个都要专门对策细心研究打法
南瓜和凤凰初见真的能把人气死的感觉 （

如果全程史诗难度的花恐怕一路打小怪都要费不少精力
如果精力不够推荐一路最低难度boss最高难度，boss是一定要全程最高难度的！

画面
一开始那画面真亏我没被劝退。。。。地图画面可能是我见过的最糟糕的游戏
不过战斗画面做的十分出色
人物和怪物风格都很统一很可爱，技能的动画效果非常棒
并且角色，背景，在没有任何操作的情况下都会有各种预设动作，
让人感觉这个战场十分有活力

剧情
梗我给9分，日常我给6分，这个结局和某些支线我给-1分。
[strike] 因为某些面具男和乱码地区着实给我吓到了[/strike]
正经讲主线其实就是挺平淡的主角一行人拯救世界的故事

音乐 
满分

author: {'steamid': '76561198050336410', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 76, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1712438662}
review:
[h1] A Truly Epic RPG Adventure! [/h1]
[h2] Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5) [/h2] 



I have been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy series for a long time, and I couldn't be happier with their latest installment, Epic Battle Fantasy 5. This game is an absolute blast from start to finish, and I highly recommend it to all RPG lovers out there.

First and foremost, the visuals are stunning. The hand-drawn art style is incredibly detailed, and each area in the game feels unique and full of life. From lush forests to volcanic caves and even cybernetic space stations, the game's environments are a joy to explore.

The gameplay is where Epic Battle Fantasy 5 truly shines. The turn-based combat system is perfectly balanced, and there is a wide variety of strategies you can utilize to defeat your foes. With over 170 different enemies to face, each with its own strengths and weaknesses, battles are always challenging and engaging.

One of my favorite aspects of the game is the character customization. There are four main characters to choose from, each with their own unique abilities and play styles. Additionally, there is a vast array of equipment and skills to acquire, allowing you to tailor your party to your preferred playstyle. The level of customization and depth in this game is truly impressive.

The writing and humor in Epic Battle Fantasy 5 are also noteworthy. The game doesn't take itself too seriously and is filled with hilarious dialogue and clever references. It kept me entertained throughout the entire adventure.

Lastly, the soundtrack deserves a special mention. The music perfectly sets the mood for each area and battle, and I found myself humming along to the catchy tunes long after playing.

In conclusion, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is an incredible RPG experience that combines beautiful visuals, engaging gameplay, deep customization, and humorous writing. Whether you're a fan of the series or new to the franchise, this game is an absolute must-play. It offers hours of entertainment and will leave you craving for more.



[b] -Like Final Fantasy, but a Flash based game, a upgraded version of EBF 4. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097206846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2020, 'last_played': 1606576152}
review:
La suite d'une saga fait par un grand fan des jeux ayant marqué mon enfance (un mélange harmonieux et fun de Final Fantasy, Golden Sun et Pokémon).

 Avec de l'humour et des easter eggs à foison (de zelda a dbz ), des niveaux cachés, de l'exploration, de la tactique, de la difficulté (et la possibilité de la ruiner en cheatant, options également offerte pour les moins aguerris), de la chasse aux trésors, et une durée de vie aussi longue qu'un bon FF (j'estime n'en être qu'a la moitié du contenu au bout d'une trentaine d'heure au moment de cette évaluation).

Ce jeu est une vrai perle (et la Saga complète des Epic Battle Fantasy ^^).

La musique est entrainante et nous rappellera notre enfance.
Pleins de puzzles plus ou moins complexe à la golden sun ou parfois vous passez 20min à vous creuser les méninges.
Des invocations épiques qui ferais palir Bahamut et Orbital !!! (un peu moins Léviathan).
Des boss fumés qui pour certains vous demanderont de vous resaper entièrement haha.
Des items utiles du début à la fin.
Des tas d'upgrades et d'objets à collecter.
Des galeries d'artworks de fans disponible en jeu, un super clin d'oeil pour la communauté.

Matt à encore une fois marqué le coup avec un super projet, qui ferai palir nombreux gros jeux du genre tant il y a de choses à faire, un bon jeu pour les collectionneurs aigus XD.
Ca fait vraiment plaisir de voir un projet indépendant du genre qui à débuté à l'époque de Kongregate toujours en vie et aussi fun. 
(Quand on vois le nombre d'éléments, de monstres et d'animations/fx, c'est un sacré boulot à faire en solo, en plus de tout le gameplay, chapeau)

Si vous n'avez apprécié que l'une des trois oeuvres citée tout en haut ce jeu est un must-have pour vous, vous ne serez pas décut et passerez un super moment.
Baku'

author: {'steamid': '76561198211205089', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1698702398}
review:
Very good game. A lot of fun, it's so funny. A lot of details! For me Epic Battle Fantasy is a classic in the world of gaming. in my world lol. It's a must-have if u think that u are a real gamer. I was feeling depressed and all, and I wasn't sure to play cause I saw a let's play on it, but almost forgot a lot of it. But I tried to enjoy myself. I was surprised that even if I know some places and all, I was able to do my OWN thing, go where I want when I want. You are free in this game which is really cool. I'm playing it on Normal but I think I will switch it to Difficult lol. So if you are hesitating to buy it, actually don't! The EBF3 is free, u can try BUT it's far different from EBF5.
Maybe u will dislike EBF3, and love 5. In the old days when 3 came out, it was one of the best game I ever played! But I played it too much so now I'm sick of it lol. But still nostalgic. LOVE YOU MATT !
I... WE WANT A EBF6!
But take ur time, maybe in 10 years who knows. Maybe never, but we are proud of u, thank u so much for never give up and give us the best experience ever for a parodic rpg game!

And sorry for my english, it's not my first language lol.

review: Wow, una gran mejora de todo, en comparacion de las anteriores entregas. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198055516653', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4366, 'last_played': 1698610703}
review:
An amazing game that reinnovates a lot of mechanics from the previous games!
It has a memorable art style, getting a lot more pulished in this game.
The soundtrack is a wonderful work made by Phyrnna, impressing everyone as always!
The gameplay is easy to understand, and it gives a lot of space to think ahead battles and do some tactic, if you know how to prepare yourself, then you will get through without any problem.
The characters are a lot more developed, with so many interaction between themselves and memorable quotes :P
Totally recommended, Matthew does an amazing work with love and passion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056432552', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6174, 'last_played': 1607250603}
review:
In short, do you like classic final fantasy style gameplay with some silly humor and rediculous animations? Well than this game is the one for you.

The story is silly but fun.
The gameplay feels nice with constantly changing enviroments to fight under with different mobs requiring to switch up the gear all the time. The insnae amount of additional content really drives the strategy part further. Taking it to a next step with epic difficulty for all the achievements, and voila you got yourself at least 80 hours of gameplay to go through.

One thing i didn't really like is the captures. In the sense that you need some for crafting and quests and have to get them all again. 
Oh thinking of it, the newgame+ was kinda unnanounced so while i wanted to go further for the other content i had to redo the whole storyline again

author: {'steamid': '76561198065424111', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 11156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6331, 'last_played': 1705333047}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 è un gioco RPG con diverse cose, ed è un prodotto di cui vale veramente la pena provare.
Ma prima, i motivi per cui v'incito a provare il gioco:

[h1]La trama:[/h1]
Sarà paradossale, ma in questo gioco, la trama è abbastanza interessante. In pratica, a causa di un mancamento di corrente, Matt si avvia all'avventura per cercare la causa di ciò, e da lì la trama inizia ad evolversi, fino al punto in cui si scopre che [spoiler] un'entità malevole, Il Divoratore (o The Devourer), aveva modificato la memoria di tutti, perché nonostante avesse creato Godcat, così che creasse Akron, il team aveva comunque interferito con le sue simulazioni. [/spoiler]
Ci sono anche intermezzi divertenti, sia durante, che fuori il combattimento.

[h1]Il Gameplay e la difficoltà[/h1]
Il gameplay è interessante. Il gioco ti dà inizialmente il controllo di Matt, ma nel corso del gioco si uniranno anche Nolegs, Natalie, Anna e Lance (la cui loro battaglia boss ha una condizione speciale per farli abbandonare di loro spontanea volontà ed ottenere un'achievement). Giusto per dare qualche aiuto:
- Matt, uno dei membri iconici del franchise, è il guerriero del gruppo, le sue abilità infliggono danni fisici a colpo singolo, può migliorare l'attacco di un membro, e può equipaggiare armi nella categoria "Spade";
- Natalie, l'altro membro dai tempi del primo EBF, è la maga del gruppo, le sue abilità infliggono danni speciali, può migliorare l'attacco magico di un membro, e le sue armi sono nella categoria "Staffe/Staves";
- Lance, prima antagonista di EBF2 e membro da EBF3, è il pistolero del gruppo, molte delle sue abilità sono più magiche che fisiche, e possono essere focalizzate su un bersaglio singolo per colpire anche gli altri nemici, e sono anche potenti. Tuttavia, maggior parte delle sue abilità hanno un tempo di recupero, il che richiede un'incentivo sul sceglierle e/o conservarle. Le sue armi sono composte da un revolver ed un cannone;
- Anna, che ritorna da Epic Battle Fantasy 4, è l'arciere del gruppo, molte delle sue abilità sono più fisiche che magiche, ed alcune di esse possono colpire uno o più bersagli a caso (nel caso sia stata potenziata l'abilità). Le armi che possiede sono archi.
- Nolegs, il nuovo membro del gruppo, svolge più il ruolo del ladro. Alcune delle sue abilità sono peculiari: Se Nolegs sconfigge un nemico con un'abilità che infligge tre colpi in sequenza, passerà ad attaccare un altro nemico ancora. Le armi che possiede sono "Giocattoli da gatto", ossia composte da una spada ed uno scudo.

La particolarità di Epic Battle Fantasy 5, è il fatto che il giocatore può equipaggiare i membri con diverse armi ed armature, che incidono sul tipo di resistenza che avranno. Inoltre, è possibile migliorare tali armature ed armi, in modo da fornire nuove abilità, assieme a quelle presenti di default. Inoltre il giocatore può ottenere abilità tramite quest secondarie, che possono essere equipaggiate su membri specifici. In battaglia, il giocatore può scegliere di scegliere un membro in panchina e fargli cambiare posto da un membro in prima linea, ed ha la capacità di usare le Ultimate, abilità che si caricano quando un personaggio viene colpito, e che fanno un danno pazzesco. Tuttavia, la novità del gioco è la possibilità di catturare i nemici.
Per quanto in EBF3 ed EBF4 ci fosse la capacità di evocare, in EBF5 il giocatore può catturare quasi qualsiasi tipo di nemici, inclusi i boss, per utilizzarli in battaglie successive al costo di un certo numero di punti evocazione (ottenuti eliminando nemici).
Il gioco ha cinque diverse modalità di gioco: Zero, Facile, Normale, Difficile ed Epico. Quello che cambia nella difficoltà, è il fatto che gli effetti di status diventano più frequenti, i nemici hanno statistiche più alte ed ottengono nuovi attacchi, e si potrà avere achievement per essi. Il gioco inoltre ha trucchi e sfide, che rendono il gioco più facile o difficile a seconda del tipo di sfida/trucco scelto.

[h1]l'Esplorazione, le quest secondarie e gli achievement[/h1]
In questo gioco, l'esplorazione è un fattore importante. Si possono trovare diversi tesori nascosti fra certi punti, e sta al giocatore trovarle. Inoltre, sono presenti diversi puzzle, le quali richiedono certi oggetti da posizionare un certo numero/in un certo ordine, tirare leve in un'ordine specifico, o esplorando. Questo vale anche per le aree nascoste, le quali richiedono di fare determinate cose, in modo da poter entrare.
Un'area del gioco inoltre, possiede zone di cui richiedono un certo punto. Ed è lì che gli Achievement entrano in gioco.
Il gioco ha ben 133 achievement, e variano dal subire un certo effetto, fino al sconfiggere un boss a difficoltà Epico. Tuttavia, non sono soltanto per semplice esposizione: raccogliere un certo numero di achievement permette di aprire una zona dell'area, dove si trovano non solo nemici ed oggetti, ma anche fanart inerenti ad Epic Battle Fantasy.
Riguardo le quest secondarie, il giocatore deve dare ad un certo NPC un numero specifico di oggetti, o un certo tipo nemico, ma l'incentivo di fare esse, è la possibilità di ottenere nuove abilità, ultimate ed armi/armature.

[h1] Conclusione[/h1]
Dopo averci speso 106 ore, il mio verdetto al gioco, a mio parere, è un 10/10. Consiglio a chi legge la recensione di provare il gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279011246', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1686457288}
review: This game is fantastic. I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy series for a long time now, but this tops all the other games. I played the free version and it was so good that I just had to get the real thing. Instead of random encounters like ordinary games, you can see the enemies on the screen and choose to fight them or not. I also loved the addition of being able to capture foes. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 also includes an element system which I found really cool. Using specific skills or spells will effect enemies different ways depending on their weaknesses. This encourages players to think about their next action and not just spam random attacks. Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148507748', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1618377621}
review:
30시간의 턴제rpg 에픽배틀판타지5
난이도 보통 노치트 23.3시간에 최종보스를 클리어햇습니다.
(퀘스트/던전은 반정도 깻는데 왜이렇게 많이 놓쳣지..)
저는 턴제게임을 매우 좋아하는데 하면서 이것보다 잘 만든 게임을 본적이 없습니다.
전 작품을 햇던 유저라면 좀 더 감명깊게 플레이할수 있습니다.
3은 무료니까 3을 한다음 5를 해도 충분히 떡밥을 회수하실 수 있습니다.
대사를 스킵하는건 비추합니다.
중간중간 골때리는 번역들과 동료들끼리 태클거는모습
엔피시들의 패러디, 한국에서통하는 드립들, 미국식개그도 볼만합니다.

p.s 퍼즐을 싫어하시는 분이라면 조금 짜증날수도 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198886556710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5590, 'last_played': 1612009531}
review: 终于全成就了，从三代到现在，这个游戏几乎从来没有给过我负面的体验，打怪升级收集装备，遇到强力的敌人时思考一番装备与技能的组合，没有什么多余的东西，只有源源不断的玩RPG时你所需要的最基本的快乐。在现在很多游戏都在拼命地加入不同的元素，其实却只是给玩家他们根本不需要的东西，而这个系列一直告诉我一个最纯真的游戏已经可以做到一段难忘的有趣体验，对我而言，这就是游戏的真谛之一。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042183304', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 19074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15617, 'last_played': 1669623334}
review:
I thought I'd update this review 'cause my last one was stupidly long and somewhat drifted away from talking about the game.

This game is the flagship finale of 2000s to 2010s culture, game design and passion. It's Flash's last stand. It's the last stop for the scrimblo RPG that's both geeky and naive but also cool and wise.

This is a gameplay-centric RPG. It has a story, it has characters, they banter and are cool, but it's more about the vibes. The culture. The scene. Playin' this game gives you shivers. It lets you hear the whispers of the internet.

Pretty weird, right? I mean, a gameplay and culture-centered RPG? What's the hubbub?

Beyond just being a reflection of our culture (or maybe the past, at this point) Epic Battle Fantasy dares to create an RPG system that reinforces the player's decisions in the same way many action games' systems reinforce the player.

It accomplishes this by having the player organize massive Rube Goldberg-esque payoffs which stretch between their gear they enter the battle with, the effects of their skills, and buff/debuff techniques. Lots and lots and [i]lots[/i] of debuff techniques. Epic Battle Fantasy has one of the most modular and sophisticated status accounting systems I've ever seen.

And that's basically what you do for the vast majority of the game: status accounting. You need it to keep the party alive. You need it to keep the enemies from being alive. You'll bookkeep like the wind. And if you turn the difficulty lower than Epic, you'll be baffled to find that encounters quickly cease to have depth beyond designing twenty step programs to success every other fight.

That said, every other turn-based RPG I play that doesn't expect me to design a business strategy every time I so much as encounter a new variety of fluff-nugget on the side of a highway now quickly bores me to tears, so obviously something was going right here.

But I do actually have a criticism: I wish the enemies could suffer more. I am not joking. I've played some other games where you can tangibly do things that would be annoying if they happened to you to the enemy, and the enemy visibly suffers for it. Dismantling enemy ships in [i]FTL: Faster Than Light[/i] had a sadistic pleasure to it. What can I say? I love to bully my enemies.

In this game, enemies can surrender and have varied behaviors sometimes, and use better moves under certain conditions, and this is a start. But when all that my Rube Goldberg machines do is make bigger numbers to make the spooky Pokemon go away faster, sometimes it gets hard to feel the impact. Which is impressive, because this game is the best in the series when it comes to sounds, attack impacts, and the sheer joy of seeing a number ten times as large as your other attacks pop up while the enemy makes googly eyes. But even then, reflecting on my memories of the feedback, I'm just like "chunky hits on big dudes are nice, but I wish casting fire on a crowd of small things would cause a more dynamic shift in behavior."

Provided, most things you fight are not remotely human. Animals, spirits, old gods, dragons, rocks, these things care very little about their own wellbeing.

Lastly: this game takes so much freaking time to play. Designing load-outs does not feel worth the time investment when, especially on Epic, every single enemy is a puzzle boss, and there's often little mechanical difference between strategies, making it seem a little lame to vary things up for spontaneity's sake. Bringing earth, tired and poison to gas out a monster isn't anymore cruel and unusual than bringing the ice and wind magic to freeze them so that the rainy gales can cut them to ice shavings. Every element has a status or two associated with it that's usually some variant of stun, damage-over-time or a cumulative draining debuff, meaning that even if you had more freedom, you'd quickly realize that despite how cool and different your guys become with different outfits, they aren't doing anything different. 

The stat-draining debuffs are much more loved by the developer than the others because stun and poison-likes are very easy answers that let you play defensively. By "lauded" I mean you can't stun bosses and most can't be poisoned in a way that matters. Like this, you have to at least be a little offensive to stack up the number-stat debuffs. No laming out the boss that way.

Still, having mechanics that just cease to exist when the going gets rough will always be something I have to belabor a game for. It'd be more excusable if they instead did something different but still substantial to a boss. What if stun took away their second turn or restricted some actions or otherwise produced an effect that seemingly pissed them off? Or something? I don't know exactly, but statuses like freeze, stun and instant death really feel like they should do something. And ideally you'd want to keep applying it much like curse, weaken and tired so that there's an encouragement to be aggressive even when you're getting wailed on.

Oh, and the music's amazing. This composer has stuck with the developer throughout the ages and has always produced awesome tracks. One of many artists I grew up on.

Still, for all the mixed opinions I've had of this game over the years, it's probably the best turn-based RPG I've ever played. Truly one of the games of all time. I didn't realize what I had with this until I had to play Yakuza 7.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121531413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6697, 'last_played': 1621592260}
review:
打开游戏，开始游戏，Zero通关，坏结局。
？？？.jpg
“Epic难度过Devourer可以触发好结局的”
30h，SL，死死死死死死死死。
40h，思考，配装，死死死死死。
50h，开始查wiki，写代码让电脑帮我配装，死死死。
60h，我打到10%血了，打爆了眼睛。
断触手开始传播病毒，9层毒之后开始疯狂回血。
眼睛复活了。两只。
啊啊啊啊啊啊。垃圾游戏我WNM啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊。
70h，过了。
10/10愿意心态再爆炸一次。

review: É um jogo incrível! author: {'steamid': '76561198244382448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1605560429}
review:
PS : A l'heure où j'écris cette évaluation, je n'ai pas encore fini le jeu. J'estime parler en connaissance de cause, vu que je suis la série depuis le premier épisode, paru à l'époque perdue des jeux en Flash.

Commençons par le commencement : l'univers de EBF est barré à mort. En en ce sens, il faut savoir que soit on adore, soit on déteste ! D'abord, le jeu est une version améliorée de EBF4, qui, lui-même, est une version améliorée de EBF3. Je vous rassure sur un point : il n'est pas nécessaire d'avoir joué aux jeux précédents pour comprendre l'intrigue. Cela est toutefois recommandé vu les multiples clin d'oeil et références disséminées ça et là. Par clin d'oeil, je parle des épisodes précédents mais aussi de la culture Jeu Vidéo en général - sans trop en dire : de Tetris à Golden Sun en passant par Final Fantasy et Mario, tout le monde en prend pour son grade.

En parlant d'Intrigue, pensez au Donjon de Naheulbeuk. C'est à peu près le même délire : une équipe épique de bras cassés qui passent leur temps à envoyer des grosses punchlines bien grasses aux ennemis, quand c'est pas à eux-même, vont devoir se réunir pour sauver le monde. Certes, les remarques comme "C'est puéril' sont justifiées, oui mais voilà : EBF s'assume et surtout l'objectif premier de la manoeuvre n'est pas de faire de l'humour mais bien de jouer avec l'interminable liste de clichés des JRPG.

Une équipe donc de cinq personnages, parmi lesquels un gamer, une bombe sexuelle, un nazi, une écolo et un chat. Vous arrivez dans un village ? Jouez-là comme Link et pillez tout ce qui n'est pas sous verrou, après tout vous devez sauver le monde.

Mais ceci dit, un détail : derrière l'aspect immature de EBF se cache en réalité un énorme travail de développement et de game design dont beaucoup feraient mieux de s'inspirer. Le game feeling est intense, la difficulté est au rendez-vous, la stratégie est de mise, je veux dire par là que rentrer dans le tas ne suffit pas. Il va falloir faire preuve d'anticipation et, pour le coup, de stratégie.

Pour ceux qui ont joué aux épisodes précédents, vous ne serez pas non plus dépaysés car certains ennemis, notamment les fameux monolithes, sont de retour. En vrac, il me reste à signaler que le jeu propose également un système de quêtes, de forge, d'améliorations. Bref, tout ce qui fait "le petit truc" de EBF. A cela s'ajoute le système de capture qui vous rappellera un célébrissime jeu paru sur Game Boy. Ce système divise la critique, vu qu'il est fortement basé sur le facteur chance et qu'une créature devra parfois être capturé plusieurs fois pour des raisons que je ne détaillerai pas ici pour vous laisser le soin de découvrir par vous-même. Ce sera le seul point négatif pour moi, mais rien de bien méchant.

Il me restera donc à parler de la SoundTrack du jeu qui non seulement est très bien composée, mais qui, de plus, se fond parfaitement dans l'atmosphère et l'ambiance du jeu. Là aussi, les références aux épisodes précédents est de mise (We Dream of Booty !).

Tout bonnement excellent.

PS : Si l'aspect puéril des dialogues vous agace, sachez qu'il y a une option pour rendre le jeu visible par tous. Certains diront que ce n'est pas comme ça que le jeu doit être joué, mais il faut saluer le travail du développeur qui pour le coup a du passer quelques moments à réécrire les dialogues au lieu de chercher une excuse façon David Goodenough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972791237', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 103917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94746, 'last_played': 1643183691}
review:
A worthy successor to a fantastic series, even when putting aside nostalgia.

I was going to go into a long-ass retelling of my introduction into the series, but got bored halfway through, and realized that if I couldn't entertain myself, then others probably wouldn't be entertained either.

Honestly feels like a strict upgrade from EBF4 to me. Although I haven't played in a while due to college, my little sister absolutely loves this game, and I'm glad that she enjoys the series. Thanks Matt and Phyrnna, for making my childhood fun, and for making hers enjoyable during this time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149739384', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 13202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8280, 'last_played': 1708715343}
review: It's a fun game. Main content is fine, the final boss was a bit out of the blue and a fair challenge, otherwise most other bosses are easy. Side content turns into a slog of boss after boss each with their own single gimmick that you have to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116307907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1649551962}
review: I played flash games a lot as a kid. The names Kongregate and Armor Games bring a fluttering sense of nostalgia that makes me wish I could return to more simple times. This game aids in that endeavor quite a bit. I remember being young and finding the original Epic Battle Fantasy game and loving it. Its the game that kickstarted my love for turn based rpg games. This game does what all the other games have done, but improves on it in so many ways that I would be here for a very long time writing this review before I would be done. The art is fantastic, the gameplay is fun and nostalgic, and I love the lore that has been built up over the course of 4 damn games. I recommend this game with all my being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071135261', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3097, 'last_played': 1604511107}
review:
Oh Maaaann!

The amount of content packed in this one game is just impressive.
Game progression is interesting and doesn't bore you, it grasps you inside until you beat it.
The first time I saw the last boss, I knew it was getting real and he gave a good challenge.

Look man, the game costs 16 euros and it takes roughly 50 hours possibly even more to 100% the game.
But is a satisfying 100%, none of those grindy overlong tasks or completely unfair achievements.

And yeah, I liked the game so much I got 100%.

But even if you not into the achievements, is still a genuine fun experience.

Definitely recommend this.

The Dev put love and effort into this franchise thought the years, and it shows.
This series truly has come a long way.

review: If you played the epic battle fantasy games on a flash web browser when you were younger, you'll love this game. It is a natural upgrade and progression from the other games in the series, adding a few new mechanics combined with loads of new abilities and a good new story line. The game only really becomes challenging on brutal once you figure out what is going on. I'd recommend the game to anyone that likes RPG games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314843034', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 14105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12872, 'last_played': 1672061848}
review:
玩过的最天马行空的rpg系列，从第一部就被惊艳到，一直追到第五部，第三四五部出的时候每一次我都有种升天的错觉。
无论是怪物设计还是招式设计都是目前我玩过所有游戏里最富有想象力的，不管什么时候玩都能找到童年的那种快乐，这么好的游戏没有续作了实在心痛，但是EBF5的全开发日志我几乎是一路追过来的，这几年的开发确实历经坎坷，再开发对制作组的负担的确太大了，至于游戏本身，吹爆，无条件吹爆。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044557973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5542, 'last_played': 1610860317}
review:
Fond memories of playing the original series on Newgrounds, and then Mad Man Matt went and topped it all with this gem and still has the stones to put 90% of it online for free. 

Well worth the purchase for that last 10% of optional dungeons and challenges if only to support the guy who has been making stellar content mostly solo since around 2008. This games got a fair sized overworld packed with secrets and treasure, the series trademark combat reimagined to be more sleek, efficient, and complex then ever, and the same lovable cast of roving goons in their biggest adventure yet. Played through it twice on the hardest difficulty and still havnt seen everything it has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125868835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1608544822}
review:
Nerdy turn based combat and puzzle combo fun for people that enjoy game nostalgia and culture. It also features multiple languages! It's one of those games that makes fun of itself and other gaming mechanics but isn't over the top. It knows what it is and is proud of itself and it's supportive and loving fans of the series. I got it as a gift from a friend and I'm amazed as to how much I enjoyed it's efforts and well thought out formulas. A lighthearted time killer with tons of surprises and Easter eggs. Even if you don't quite get all the references, it's good roundabout fun. If you're looking for a good time with little stress, I highly recommend this one.

ADHD Gamer Approved: Mostly yes. Easy to control your pace, difficulty, settings and how much dialogue you choose to read.
