author: {'steamid': '76561198258589512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5398, 'last_played': 1694569889}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is by far the best in the series. It gives the lovable game style of the previous EBFs while creating a whole new story to implement each character together. The game can be your choice of easy peasy or ungodly difficult depending on how brave you feel, and even gives you the option to change it on a whim. While the graphics may not be super high def, they are still pleasing to the eye and charming in their cartoony way.

Honestly, give EBF3 a try first (since its free) if you wanna get involved in this series, but each of these games deserves a lot of love and attention for how hard the man who made them worked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062438506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 4600, 'last_played': 1712426880}
review: If you want a reasonably light, funny, well-designed, decently lengthy, enjoyable romp through a brilliant example of a single player RPG made by someone who clearly loves RPGs, this is 100% the game for you. I've followed Matt Roszak since he was still kupo707, and the man just doesn't make bad games or even mediocre ones. Every game is a 9/10 or 10/10 and frankly, I'm always happy to send him more money for them. Music is stellar, combat is deep enough to be fun on multiple playthroughs without being overwhelming, areas are visually distinct and vibrant, writing is consistently just meta enough to be hilarious. Difficulty ranges the full spectrum, from so hard it makes you decry it as impossible to so easy you can make it beat itself, all in full control of the player. UI isn't super crowded and bloated, equips and builds offer a decent range of customizations, and once you are done there are scores of postgame options from battle arenas to boss rushes, and a VERY impressive New Game+ with a host of customizations that affect the whole game. If you aren't sold yet you probably aren't the kind of person who should be reading a review for an RPG in the first place. Play it, love, and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122509872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 2952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2921, 'last_played': 1601010986}
review:
Après presque 50 heures de jeu dont environ 40 effectives, j'ai battu le boss final.

Que dire si ce n'est que Epic Battle Fantasy 5 promet de très longues heures de farm et de fun; on voit qu'il a été fait par un développeur-joueur passionné qui n'hésite pas à proposer tout un tas d'options pour rallonger la durée du titre et qui place un grand nombre d'easter eggs pour notre plus grand plaisir.

Il y a encore des petites choses qui pourraient améliorer la saga comme par exemple la prise en charge d'une manette ou encore l'ajout d'un manuel de jeu pour tout ce qui est notions spécifiques comme l'effets de chaque statut etc
Juste pour le plaisir, ça aurait été un bon plus si on pouvait choisir le physique de ses personnages quitte à avoir un choix de skins existants puisqu'il y a des micro images-cinématiques à certains moments de l'aventure.

Seul petit bémol selon moi, c'est que la fin est assez abrupte (avec le lancement de la newgame+)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037626790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1691672253}
review:
This and its previous game EBF4 are shockingly fun little RPGs. As far as its parody humor goes it can be hit or miss, but i find it falls on the charming side more often then not. Honestly though the most impressive part is how fun and tactical the combat can be, while not super difficult it does make you think (it helps that some over powered skills from EBF4 have been tweeked) and is always pretty fun.

I give it a solid 8/10. It's worth your time if you enjoy turn-based RPGs even a little bit

author: {'steamid': '76561199013744453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7206, 'last_played': 1710881351}
review:
Great game. Buy it right now.

Need more convincing? OK.

First, I will list everything bad about this game.

A boss named Neon Valhalla.

...

That's everything.

Now, here is everything good about the game.

1: A deep combat system with room for experimentation and depth. 

The combat in this game is deeper than an ocean trench. There are countless pieces of gear which can drastically change the roles of your party members and many skills that can be swapped between characters whenever you wish. None of this is locked in so you can experiment to your heart's content. One example is the Love Sword used by the warrior character Matt, which turns him from a heavy physical damage dealer to a tanky healer, or the riot shield for Nolegs, whom has high evasion. The riot shield trades that for immense defense and health boosts. These are just two examples. There are flairs which modify stats further, offering special effects such as stat boosts on revival. Gear also can summon enemies, give buffs, or counter enemy attacks after being upgraded. And speaking of summons...

2: You can collect every enemy in this game as a summon with very few exceptions. Each summon is unique and useful in its own way. The variety can not be overstated in addition to the increased depth this adds to the ocean of depth the combat already has. 120 hours in and I am still learning new tactics by the way, You can even capture most bosses, whom are often well worth the effort. There are 190 (192 in new game +) enemies to capture and summon in the game, if you want to catch them all for completion. (Like me.)

3: "But what do I do after beating the game?" OH then do it again! This game has replayablity out the ass. You know those randomizers for Dark Souls and stuff? A gear randomizer is built in! Plus there are options to limit party members in fights, change enemy encounters, weather, etc. You can even mix and match these along with 5 difficulty settings! There are so many ways to play the game, and I myself have only scratched teh surface of this with 120 hours in the game! I haven't even messed with these options I am still doing a playthrough on the max difficulty!

4: 120 hours for two playthroughs may sound like a lot but there is more than enough content to keep you busy with bosses form the first 4 games, countless extra dungeons, quests, puzzles, and a fun story. The humor can get a bit raunchy but you can disable this in the options if you have a younger sibling or child that wants to play the game for even more options to customize your playthrough.

Overall this is one of the best RPGs I have ever seen and I recommend it to any RPG player.

But if you go for 100% and intend to fight Neon Valhalla on EPic Mode (the highest difficulty)...

God have mercy on your soul...

Or I'm dumb with so much depth you can probably figure out some tactic I never even thought of, which just goes to show how deep the combat can be. 

Buy it if you want a fantastic RPG, if you read this far it must interest you and it is worth every cent and more. The price for this is a steal compared to the quality and quantity of the content. 

If you're on the fence, you could always play Epic Battle Fantasy 3, which is free on Steam. Now 3 is not near as good as 5 but still great, and if this is 10x better than 3 and 3 is already great, imagine how good this game is. It is a must play for any RPG fan, and I cannot stress that enough. Purchase it, you will not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087823124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1599688490}
review: The title uses the best adjective for this game; EPIC! This is a must-have for all RPG-lovers which uses classic turn-based battle system. There's no annoying random encounters as you traverse the expansive world map, you are in complete control of encounters as to initiate a battle you talk to the enemies on the map. I've been playing since EBF3 and continue to be astounded with how each proceeding game was far exceeded my expectations. Each game since EBF3 I've sworn there's no way the next game can possibly be any better yet I'm proven wrong each time. The story is comical and the banter between characters is downright hilarious! Characters also have unique dialogues while wearing most equipment for the first time and this game definitely has replayability time and time again. Well worth at least 5x the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045733466', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2954, 'last_played': 1693727764}
review:
My childhood was spent on EBF4 and I daresay this game is a perfect continuation of it.

Well done to Matt.



For people who aren't fans of the previous games, EBF5 (Epic Battle Fantasy 5) is a wonderful RPG with colourful characters and hilarious interactions. The story is simple, but good. It leaves enough not known to draw you in, but gives enough to keep trailing the player on. The flash graphics are probably a bit of a turn off for some of you, but I mean, I dunno, I love the art style myself.

You can play this game for free, but I'd highly reccommend buying this steam edition for the extra content. Im struggling with it myself, but honestly the extra content dungeons are challenging and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199086441997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1599092767}
review: Amazing old-school RPG turn-based game with a hilarious story-line. It's great for the perfectionist as there's well over 100 achievements to strive for, so many equips to collect and level-up. Characters also react differently to situations while in various equips so there's always a reason to swap out equips. What's great is that stats grow exponentially and stat-boosting items are farmable. I rate this game 100/10. Each game in the series somehow greatly surpasses its predecessor; I didn't think a game in this series would be better than EBF4 but I was wrong. Hopefully I'll be wrong again if the amazing creator is willing to make an EBF6. This game is well worth 5x what he's charging and has 100s of hours of playability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198853774631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3720, 'last_played': 1611279854}
review:
若干年前的一个暑假，我通过东方认识到了《弹幕天堂2》这款游戏，接触到了EBF系列。然后在某小游戏网站上玩到了EBF4。现在两作都已经补票。这个暑假偶然看到EBF5，立即买了下来，果然还是熟悉的味道，还是熟悉的感觉：
       太开心啦，这才是我想要的rpg游戏！
       说一下为什么喜欢本作。首先，氛围很欢乐。主角团不是那种苦大仇深的人，一路冒险上总是伴随着各种玩笑，轻松愉快的感觉。作者Matt是真的懂rpg，不仅知道怎么设计关卡，而且该吐的槽作者还都帮你吐了。
       再说一下解谜要素。经典的推箱子，滑冰面，一笔画，本作一样不落。而且其中有一部分颇有难度。至少我玩起来是很开心的。难的解谜也都不是必做内容，不用担心因为卡在解谜而卡关。隐藏宝箱也为旅行增添了趣味。
       然后是rpg使人沉浸的一大经典要素——成长。肝度不高，我玩的普通难度基本不需要练级。但是我还是能感觉到自己操控主角们成长的喜悦。拿攻击力来说，刚开始只能打50不到伤害，在冒险的路上主角们一点点变强，最后分分钟超过10万，那叫一个爽啊，玩过一些经典rpg的都懂。
       我对ebf5的游玩不深，所以关于战斗系统不敢说太多。就我现在的了解而言，ebf的战斗可以变出各种花样，但是也都
好懂。目前正在争取攻克史诗难度。

review:
Worth the price. The only shortcoming of this game is the Early Game, it's painfully slow and i honestly recommend playing it on easy until the first Boss. (which stomped me a bit on EPIC difficulty)
The Otional areas are filled with goodies and very fun Super Bosses, Neon Vallhala gave me more trouble than most SMT Bosses for crying out loud. I'm still halfway trough the game but i've 100%'ed the fourth game beforehand. And without a shadow of a doubt this one is the best yet.
9.3/10 (i wish you had speed up on battles)

author: {'steamid': '76561198327808643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1699542914}
review: This game is the best in the series to date. The quality is very high and the additions provided by free patched makes the game i thought was fun and had potential to grow to be a bigger game that adds more to the already astounding gameplay and characters that have evolved over the years. As a fan of this series since its early years, it is great to see it punching hard with so much variety and strategy to play around with. This game is a must play for fans of the RPG genre as a whole. With a free version available on Kongregate put up by the creator with less content and a full version here on steam with added content post launch, it's great and fun. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198861584935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9517, 'last_played': 1624453328}
review:
O jogo tem inspirações em final fantasy, pokemon, animes, e muito mais.
mas ainda assim o jogo consegue se destacar pelo modo que ele utiliza suas mecânicas
o sistema de combate é de longe o melhor da franquia, e o nível de customização e estrategias que fosse pode usar são vastos, principalmente se você estiver jogando uma gameplay personalizada.
a dificuldade do jogo é muito bem balanceada, e até mesmo as batalhas mais difíceis podem ser vencidas com todos os desafios extras ativados,(se você já tiver dominado o sistema de combate), você pode sempre voltar atras e mudar a dificuldade a qualquer momento fora de combate.
Se você gosta de RPG em turnos e de alguma das inspirações acima, o jogo vai ser uma experiência incrível.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874395164', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1603316828}
review:
El EBF3 me encantó, me lo terminé 3 veces en dificultad épica en su tiempo.
Sin embargo, este juego tiene muchas cosas innecesarias que sobrecargan la experiencia de juego, y hace que pierda más tiempo escogiendo los items adecuados para cada batalla, en vez de realmente batallar, esto se debe a la enorme cantidad de personajes jugables (5) y a los muchos efectos de estado. Se me hizo tedioso el juego y al final solo quería terminarlo, nada que ver con el EBF3.
Esto es un juego indie, y los indies no los juegas por su completitud, si no por su pura jugabilidad.
Matt, si haces un EBF6, por favor, hazlo con solo 3 personajes y saca efectos de estados inútiles como condena y virus, diséñalo lo más eficiente posible, como en el EBF3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316170817', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2900, 'last_played': 1624162826}
review:
童年回忆，已二周目，属实好玩。
数值平衡上佳的JRPG，全程只有最终BOSS前需要刷一会儿等级，有难度适当的探索和解密，游戏全程都乐趣满满。
游戏内置引导友善，目标设置明晰，虽然游戏容量很小但很成熟，玩着舒服和快乐的，才是一个好游戏，EBF系列做到了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199065131266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1600620169}
review:
I played EBF5 on Kongregate and I really enjoyed the impression immersion and fantastic game elements behind it all and now that I replayed it here on Steam just to experience more additional content just like I did on its previous predecessor, except it did not require Steam but was remastered on all platforms, I loved it even more and I am currently playing on Epic difficulty.

However, one complaint I have is that, since my party is lvl. 37 and I am playing with New Game+, the enemies I faced -- especially the ones at the earlier levels -- are still the same level as I first faced them when I started the game on Kongregate, even on harder modes and not even the challenge options helped remedy this, so it would help if these foes were a few levels stronger -- like the Hope Harbour & Wild Tropics mooks on Hard and Epic should be 20 levels more and so on. Because fighting the same foes with lower levels just feels empty for me as a player who deserves a better challenge in RPGs. I hope this makes sense to Matt Roszak and those susceptible to comment.

author: {'steamid': '76561199005029939', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2696, 'last_played': 1624818117}
review:
[h1]Una épica reseña a Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/h1]

EBF es una saga que (junto a otros clásicos de newgrounds como Alien hominid, castle crashers, madness combat, etc) formó parte de mi infancia e incluso definió varios de mis estándares para videojuegos,  humor y [strike]waifus[/strike] música.


Me es casi imposible encontrarle una falla o aspecto negativo a este juego (y a la saga en general realmente), pero si tuviera que "quejarme" de algo, sería de lo [b]HORRIBLES[/b] que son algunos puzzles de bloques (aaaaa matenme), pero eso no es culpa del juego, simplemente soy idi0ta xD

Ahora vamos a hablar de lo bueno... [spoiler]Osea, todo el juego jsjjajsjaj[/spoiler]

Si vienes de los 2 juegos anteriores, deberías saber algo de antemano: Este juego tiene una cantidad [b]ENORME Y COLOSAL[/b] de contenido y misiones totalmente desligadas de la historia principal.

Si juegas ignorando misiones secundarias y en dificultad normal (Pro tip: Jugar en la máxima dificultad no es divertido, es horrible, y jugar en "muy fácil" no tiene gracia) el juego ya es bastante largo (7w7), pero, si eres un completista, tendrás ante ti una labor titanica.

A quien le interese jugar un juego con humor absurdo, fanservice y una cantidad muy grande de [strike]tetas[/strike] contenido muy entretenido, le recomiendo este juego al 100%. Vale bastante mas de lo que cuesta de base, y un descuento ya debería ser razón de sobra para comprar este juego (ademas de que la música esta increíble)

(Por cierto, amé ver a Lance como villano una vez mas <3)

author: {'steamid': '76561198278697717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3817, 'last_played': 1710130843}
review: Always enjoy a good RPG game, and this one takes the childhood for me. Grew up playing EBF3 and 4 in class, and now get to play a new release, which shows even more promise than the last two games. Not to mention, I loved the new mechanics they added in this one. Of course, you can play it for free, or basically get all DLC for a good price on Steam. But their deluxe, if you love a challenge, is very much worth it. I find myself reusing different strategies for different areas, trying to get through what I call 'Lose Limbo', where many parallel universes of losing eventually lead me to the right one. If you didn't win, that means it's not your levels that need a check, but rather your equipment, as statuses and elemental defense is highly important. And that's why I love it. I don't grind out levels like a 9-to-5 job looking for chump change, I go into a world and gather an arsenal, where it can be used at any time. That's why this game is highly recommended for RPG lovers and newcomers alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118950984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 12221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11813, 'last_played': 1703916906}
review:
It is crazy to watch the gradual transformation of a childhood flash game into a full-scale, legitimate game with the same charming detail.  While it is a bit melancholic to realize the series will probably not continue, this was quite the send-off.

To start, the turn-based gameplay is classic; the addition of cooldowns to the skills over the skill point system in the previous games forced more careful consideration to how skills were used in a battle.  The sheer amount of content as well — overwhelming, but in a good way.  Each area seemed unique and it rarely became tedious to solve the puzzles or battle the enemies that blocked paths.  The major feature of captures made the gameplay even more interesting with hundreds of unique abilities to incorporate into battle, but it also gave completionist players a challenge capturing all the possible foes.  Coming back to the game with new updates adding even more content was a blast and kept me invested from the release date.

The care taken with the story was impressive as well.  Breaking apart from the integral copyright jokes and innuendos that have stuck with the series forever, everything just seemed like it fit.  It is weird to compliment the writing, but playing other fantasy RPGs, the dialogue can be cringe-inducing at times.  The self-aware humor about the fantastical elements combined with endearing charm of the characters made everything outside the gameplay palatable and fun to follow along with.

This game is definitely worth whatever price you see; your money (well, most of it) is going to a humble and dedicated team of people that seem to love the game as much as we do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131342684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5289, 'last_played': 1686102450}
review:
It's colorful, it's witty, it's hella fun (seriously, NOTHING is more satisfying than setting up a killer combo). But mostly, it's a journey. Plus oh my GOD buy the soundtrack

review: Потрясающая игра, однозначно покупайте, тут уйма контента, и он не наскучивает. Из минусов можно отметить техническую составляющюю: из-за движка флеш сложные анимации тормозят. Также достижения Стим засчитывает с задержкой, некоторые и вовсе не засчитывает, плюс сохранения иногда лагают (возможно это только мои проблемы)

author: {'steamid': '76561198327258989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1618257225}
review:
Прошел эту игру еще на флэше в бесплатной версии, сейчас решил перепройти стимовскую. Что ж - если вы все еще думаете, играть в нее или нет, то моя рекомендация однозначная. Играть обязательно, поверьте старому любителю классических ролевых игр! Итак, что же здесь есть:
1. Юмор. Игра постоянно обыгрывает ролевые и анимешные штампы, персонажи постоянно шутят над происходящим. 
2. Полет фантазии. Ну где еще вы можете сразиться с нарисованными врагами на листке бумаги, например?
3. Чувство вкуса и меры. Игра не скатывается ни в пошлую клоунаду, ни в откровенный наркоманский бред. 
4. Хардкор и разнообразие. Несерьезность у игры - кажущаяся. В ней огромное разнообразие тактических приемов, невероятное количество навыков, вооружения и монстров-саммонов, а еще огромный мир с кучей секретов (даже не пытайтесь открыть их все при первом прохождении).
5. Персонажи. Они живые, веселые и невероятно крутые. Задрот-клептоман Мэтт, фансервисная волшебница Натали, гринписовец Анна, безумный диктатор-милитарист Ланс и, конечно, неповторимый кот БезЛап останутся с вами надолго!
Итого оценка 9\10. Немного портят картину плохая оптимизация (у меня ноут не самый мощный, но RTW: Attila или там Witcher 3 работают нормально, а здесь приходится скручивать настройки на минимум... просто мде), местами неочевидные способы прохождения и резкий скачок сложности ближе к концу - третья встреча с Чиби-Рыцарем и особенно финальный босс в обоих прохождениях порядком вымотали мне нервы, хотя до этого я спокойно зачистил бонусные подземелья. Все остальное - шикарно, и я обязательно перепройду эту игру в третий раз. Но сначала ознакомлюсь с предыдущими частями)

author: {'steamid': '76561198108737418', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4278, 'last_played': 1645359173}

review:
我没玩过前面几代，5代也是因为看到语言支持有中文才试探性地买来玩玩，谁知道玩了几个通宵根本停不下来。里面各种玩梗吐槽真的太有意思了，而且它也不只是玩梗，游戏内容十分充足，游戏性也是极佳的。相比之下，其他一些玩梗游戏真就只剩下玩梗了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198076260298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1688755276}
review:
This game is a masterpiece. 

Better than all games of the Ubisoft and EA combined. 

I initially downloaded a pirated version just to give it a try, but I was hooked from the first minutes even before the first battle has begun. I rushed to buy it on steam, and after playing for a couple hours now I know that I'd pay anything for this piece of art. I haven't played any games of this kind previously, and I'm not sure I will find anything even comparable, but I couldn't recommend more this specific one. 

I rarely write reviews on steam. Just give this game a try and see for yourself, that's all I can tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171099675', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1684027662}
review: this is probably my second favorite of the EBF series.  beaten out by 4 just because (no spoilers) the final boss of 4 required me to swap out my party regularly throughout just to have a chance of victory, while this game made some setups much more powerful than ever before.  including, but not limited to gear seupts that practically make a male character immortal, and a female character (natale) a resurrection based immortal.  (basicly, one block gives 80% def buff, 30% dodge buff, 20% more health, over time heal, and the normal defence buff for the male character, and 100% heal on revive, +50% health on revive, and ocasional auto res on the natale)  while there where no OP setups i could really find in EBF4.  it's still a great game, and the fact that you can have such powerful setups makes you feel really powerful.  but sometimes, more of a chalange is a bit more fun.  still though, strong 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155366981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4036, 'last_played': 1590316531}
review:
首先，这款游戏的剧情是无厘头搞笑风伴随跨次元壁对话的，所以这游戏不是讲故事的，剧情党就不要入手了，其次是画面，这游戏的画面是祖传的，基本上没什么变化，所以画面党也不要入手了。
但是，如果你是一名喜欢回合制游戏，并且不纠结剧情，喜欢搞笑风格的玩家，那么你值得尝试，这个游戏简而言之：很捞，但该死的好玩，最开始从4399上的4代入坑，现在刚发现它出了5代，而且这中文翻译，我只能说：“真讷道，无情哈拉少儿。”游戏的战斗机制、系统，都很正常，正常的有点捞，但是就是这平平淡淡的东西被以一种搞怪的方式组合在一起的时候，你会发现你根本停不下来，技能的特效、攻击的打击感、角色的造型，很捞，但很合适，恰到好处的表现了出来，不会让你觉得有软绵绵或者驴唇不对马嘴的感觉，然后就是对话，这没有任何zzzq，又带有那么点微讽刺的台词才是游戏应该有的台词，有的时候，不要讳莫如深、不要引人深思、不要某某正确，痛痛快快的不带脑子玩个游戏也挺好（我指的是别想那么多，这个游戏的许多战斗不降难度的话其实还是要动动脑子讲策略的）。
游戏的许多探索区域和怪物的设置很有新意，许多的设计有点“十大未解之谜”、“缸中之脑”等等科幻风阴谋论那味儿了。
评分（10分满）：7.5分
rpg类游戏难以避免的硬伤，后期无趣，无敌的寂寞，扣0.5分。
怪的模型、种类还是太单一，很多换皮，但毕竟是个小游戏，只扣1分。
设计了许多额外探索区，但整个流程太长，超过了小游戏类型承受的限度，以至于推完主线已经把兴趣耗光了，再无心打其他探索区域了，扣1分。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998961605', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5506, 'last_played': 1636964434}
review:
This game is honestly a *gem*. It's easy to tell how much Matt cares about his games by the sheer effort put into each and every one of them, and they're only getting better and better as time goes on.

Even upon release, Epic Battle Fantasy *3* was one of my favorite JRPGs for a number of reasons; the complexity of the gameplay, the enjoyable story/characters, the world design, etc. EBF4 improved on this formula in a number of ways, introducing another character (and therefore swappable party members) as well as generally improving the gameplay loop.

EBF5? Blows them out of the water IMO. The gameplay is *crazy good* by JRPG standards and the customization is insane. While each character has a bias towards one playstyle or another, there are plenty of ways to influence what skills they learn, what skills they have, and what equipment they're using (and equipment is crazy impactful in these games, not just simple stat boosts). And surprisingly enough, it's pretty hard to "cheese" the game; with all of the customization you have, you'd think you can break the game, and you *can't*. Sure, some combos are more powerful than others, but even the "best" gear and skill layouts will require some thought to operate them without dying to the game's more powerful enemies. But the joy here is that the "best" gear/skills is impossible to objectively figure out. Oftentimes you might be slightly sacrificing one character's power for a significant boost in another's, or focusing entirely on one attribute in some cases and swapping in others. There is no "best" setup because the enemies mandate careful choices if you want to play optimally. This sounds super tedious, but isn't actually necessary unless you're playing on Epic mode with some of the challenges enabled. And either way, careful thinking that's *worth* doing isn't incredibly common in this type of game unfortunately; oftentimes a bit of grinding can easily overcome any hurdle that thinking would.

But besides the gameplay, even the rest of the game is fantastic IMO. When the biggest problem I have with the game is its engine (Flash, which *is* a problem due to its performance, not its functionality), you know you've got something worthwhile. I'd describe the out-of-combat systems as a parody RPG of sorts; lots of 4th wall breaking, lots of tropes (that are called out), strangely arbitrary location design, etc. This parody aspect doesn't detract from making the world fun and interesting to explore though; sure, most things are trope-y, but they aren't designed in such a way that they're *annoyingly* trope-y, and there are plenty of ways to accelerate the less exciting aspects of the game if you know what you're doing. Also, on top of the parody roots, the game *does* have an actually interesting story to boot; a fairly typical or overly crazy one, but one you totally get into towards the end (or at least I did).

And the developer. Don't even get me started on him (in a good way). This dev as previously mentioned puts *SO MUCH LOVE* into his games that's it's crazy; the art, the character design, the gameplay mechanics, the world design, the story, the music (oh god the music is wonderful), etc. Everything gets refined with each installment, and if that's not enough, patches (and occasionally *huge* ones like 2.0) come out to fix problems with the game or add extra content to make a great game even better. If you have a problem, just let him know and he'll talk about it! He's a genuinely good guy and a great dev, so don't be afraid to speak up. He's even helping someone's mod project out by doing some of the art, and no one is paying him for this.

So yeah, this (and the other EBF games) are incredible, and deserve your money. And even if you don't have it, Good Guy Matt still uploads them to the flash game sites they originated from, albeit slightly stripped down in terms of side content (hey, you have to have a reason to pay for a game, and devs need money right?). But the entire base game and its mechanics are intact, so if you're not sure, go check the game out on one of those sites first! 

Yes, there's a 135 MB version of a 400 MB flash game (mostly) freely available online. DAS A BIG BOI

author: {'steamid': '76561198006553071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2541, 'last_played': 1595663737}
review:
This is easily one of the best games I've bought and played as of date. Whereas Final Fantasy keep getting worse, this game series just gets better and better. I love the graphics, the sound, the story and the characters. Easily worth full price and if you find it on sale, grab an extra copy for your best friend so he/she can enjoy it as well!

If you enjoy the following then this game is definitely for you!
+ Fun and charming characters
+ Kickass music
+ Lots of loot
+ A ton of pop culture references
+ Plenty of humor
+ Loads of secrets
+ Bonus dungeons
+ Bonus side quests
+ A horde of different, weird and quirky enemies

5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198300113849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4047, 'last_played': 1668497036}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127931675', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4514, 'last_played': 1623634025}
review:
100% done, this is probably the best RPG experience one person can get off of playing an ENTIRE series of it (that or Rance no clue). It's for the best that a NEW player does not play EBF5 first, instead, start off with 3, then climb your way to 4 and then come back here for 5! While the story is not a direct lead off of the previous, you will enjoy the experience of seeing how much things change and gets better over time.

But what else is good? The gameplay mechanics, the design of characters and enemies, the adventure overall, this game is the definition of an Epic Battle Fantasy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164146498', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1552207619}
review:
I have played the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series. 1 and 2 are just a series of random meaningless fights. The big breakthrough happened at EBF3, which was also what made the series stand out. It turned into an adventure RPG game where the player characters level up, learn skills, and collect equipment while going around fighting monsters. I had a lot of fun with that game when it came out. However, since then, the series has started to stagnate. EBF4 is more or less the same thing. Sure, there's one more character, more skills, more equips, more monsters, ... but they end up being too insignificant to affect the gameplay experience. When the core gameplay remains the same, those minor cosmetic changes just end up being superficial. EBF5 did little to address this issue, so at this point, the series has overstayed its welcome. (Sure, it tried to change things up with the cooldown system replacing mana and the new buff system, but the gameplay still remained very similar despite that.) In addition, EBF5 introduced a new mechanic that ended up being more tedious than interesting, and ended up really souring my experience with the game. In fact, if there's one word to describe EBF5, it's "tedious". How so?

- There's very little strategy in most fights. Hitting the enemy with the element it's weakest to, or just using your strongest attack, is enough to win most fights. For longer or harder fights, just buff up in the beginning and heal as necessary. You just end up repeating the same moves ad nauseum. 
- Hidden treasures sound like a nice concept in theory, but all it does is make you carefully scrutinize every tile with a fine-tooth comb every time you enter a new screen. Gets very tiring very quickly. 
- The new mechanic of capturing monsters, inspired by Pokemon, is very annoying, mainly because of the sheer number of monsters there are. Every time you meet a new monster (including rare monsters, minibosses, and bosses), you need to weaken it and inflict a ton of debuffs and status effects to capture it. What's worse, some equipment requires you sacrifice a captured monster to upgrade it, and you can't capture two copies of a monster, so you need to find the monster again after doing the upgrade. And sometimes, that monster doesn't exist anymore, or is too weak that it ends up dying in one hit to anything, making a weak monster surprisingly difficult to capture. All in all, probably the worst mechanic in this game. 
- Occasionally, you come across treasure that is not accessible without a key item that's obtained later in the story. So you either need to make a note of every such instance, or periodically backtrack to all the places you've already visited. As if this game isn't long enough as is. 
- Puzzles are nice if done sparingly, but the number of them present in this game is truly excessive. Especially because a lot of these puzzles have no strategy other than brute-force trial and error. In fact, I ended up ragequitting this game after being subjected to a series of puzzles in rapid succession, and one complex puzzle I couldn't solve after numerous tries ended up stonewalling my progress. That might actually be a blessing in disguise, because even with 20 hours of playtime, I'm probably only 1/3 of the way through the game, so I spared myself even more agonizing torment. 

EBF5 not only failed to deliver a truly new experience, it ended up being an exercise in raw tedium instead. I don't think I've seen a game anywhere near as annoying before. 

1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198195595913', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1663803934}
review:
An absolute gem of a game!  With over 35 hours of it, outside of Steam, I HAD to buy it. Why? Well, it wasn't just to support the creator, but because of how heavenly this game was (But also to receive the additional content in order to achieve 100% lol). It's rather impressive that it ran on flash; which was how I discovered this game. Shoutout to "Shyguymask" on YouTube whose video, that was about the best flash games, somehow landed into my recommendations.

It's been ages since I've played flash games, I've had special memories playing a crap ton when I was young. Unfortunately, there were a load of others that I knew I should have played, this one was one of them. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a JRPG style game that is undoubtedly inspired by games like the older Final Fantasy games and so on (At this point it’s already an established series). You're introduced to Matt who was about to finish a video game until the power suddenly went out. Matt leaves his house to investigate, which then further escalates to saving the world with 4 others: NoLegs, Natalie, Anna, and Lance. Throughout my playthrough, I absolutely enjoyed the characters and the party altogether interacting and getting along overtime. It’s ultimately satisfying to watch until the end, where you wish you could be included. The battles are always a joy as you use many skills, plus equipment to strategize against any enemy. Easy to learn, too! You are able to catch almost any monster that you encounter and finally, a lot of treasure hunting is involved in this game, so keep your eyes peeled! Aside from these, you have the soundtrack made by Phyrnna, that I already was jamming like Shaq in a DJ booth; a tremendous amount of artwork put into this game and a shit ton of content. If I had to pick a favorite in this game, it would definitely be the Grand Gallery. Looking at concept artwork, but also artwork they embraced from the community, which is awesome. The cherry on top is that they include the characters’ comments about it on most. B)

Overall, I recommend it, everyone at Kupo Games, Matt Roszak and anyone else involved did a spectacular job on this game. I’m not sure what else to say if you’re not convinced yet. It’s worth the twenty, especially for them. You could, I guess give it a try online before flash dies, keep it mind there’s none of that juicy content that is already served here. You do not need to play the previous titles as they’re not connected and tell a different story. I, for example, haven’t played them yet, which I already promised myself that I must play them someday. I haven't even finished this game yet as there is so much left, but I had to tell everyone how much this game meant to me. Much love to the devs and community!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999828031', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1634247456}
review:
Весёлая пародийная JRPG с отличными анимациями, кучей гэгов и отсылок, и не самым глупы сюжетом (правда, до конца я его ещё не прошёл).
Обладает всеми традиционными атрибутами жанра в духе убербоссов, опциональных данжей, растущего по ходу сюжета уровня пафоса и больших мечей.
Боёвка местами затянута, но это в целом свойство жанра, так что ругать за это глупо. 

Ещё жаль, что композитора поменяли — музыка в прошлых частях мне нравилась больше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003969210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4661, 'last_played': 1593664982}
review:
This game is a nostalgia trip for me. I've played all of them on Newgrounds. My brother knew this and bought this copy for me.
What a trip. This game really sucked me in. I remember getting stuck on a few puzzles and looking up on the wiki page how to solve them.
Tons of things to do -- Puzzles to complete. Chests to find. Quests to fulfill. Enemies/bosses to capture. Weapons and armor to test out. "Steroids" to consume. Formulating strategies for each enemy and boss (especially on Epic). I haven't seen all of the summons either. 
The references, gameplay and art has an astounding amount of love and effort by the artist, Matt.
Highly recommend if you love RPG's. And if you don't, give this one a try. It'll probably change your mind.

review:
This game has been a part of my childhood from when I was 9, The first time I found EBF was at Kongregate.
It's been a wild ride from the first game to now, I didn't expect for the 5th Game to have more "something".
Matt Roszak has done a great job making EBF, Not only the story is great, Also the art style, The music, everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277300017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4087, 'last_played': 1592841089}
review:
断断续续打了60多个小时完成了一周目，大多数时间都花在找装备（技能）以及升级装备（技能）的过程中：
为了获取强力装备和技能，你需要：解推箱子迷题，走格子迷题，摆石头，插花迷题；在每一张图都点一遍找宝箱，直到头上不再有问号为止；打相应的精英怪，然而后期精英怪大多是血量100万起的血牛，没有相应的技能及装备搭配会让你打的很痛苦，但要是有相应的装备则可事半功倍。
为了升级装备，要刷钱买材料，
刷钱要用马克装备盗贼三件套，用偷窃技能偷画廊的天空龙，最多一次能偷四个星星。然后用星星换钱
某些装备还要用小怪作为材料，所以平时走路的时候最好不要漏抓小怪
大部分的怪包括boss都可以抓为己用，不过大部分怪抓回来后不会有出场机会，一来SP少，二来有用的怪就那么几个。部分boss怪的捕捉几率太低，我是10次以内抓不到的通通打死球。不然时间还得花更多
另外整个游戏过程中还穿插了很多游戏的梗，还挺有意思的。
最后，最终boss前记得存盘，打完boss是直接开始二周目的。
最后还是给推荐吧，游戏是好游戏，但感到自己真是人老了，这种老式rpg真没那么多精力打下去。

author: {'steamid': '76561198806537107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3071, 'last_played': 1609949801}
review:
N年前4399的盗版ebf寻梦过来，听到熟悉的音乐猛虎落泪才发现这么多年过去了。感谢steam让我体验到了为爱好氪金的快感！菜鸡选手零蛋难度50小时终于刷完主线意犹未尽~欢迎来氪!!
评价就是传统rpg的王者级别，5代的天气系统召唤系统可玩度非常高。音乐依然爆哭好听（还是偷偷想念4代一些bgm）
人物性格鲜明，丰富的对话让回合制不再枯燥，非常非常非常好笑！！连带着简陋的技能都变得高能起来；解谜游戏稍微花点时间就能解决；游戏自带作弊器，可随时修改难度，不耽误菜鸡们刷剧情（史实难度全挑战是想都不要想了）难受的是，支线太丰富宝箱太多拿不完啊；后期的怪物好nb换装换技能好麻烦啊~另外求娜姐的全福利图片啊，谁能告诉我在哪里找得到啊？
ebf6又要等下去了，不知道会不会有一天不用flash了改3d建模。希望可以看娜姐更性感的body！

author: {'steamid': '76561198127501284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5880, 'last_played': 1594325058}
review:
Очень хорошая игра, но берите с осторожностью. 
У меня к ней сложные чувства, любовь пополам с лютой ненавистью. 
Сложность просто зашкаливает. Эта игра выбесит, вывернет и высушит. Эти ваши дарксолсы от нее недалеко ушли. 

Бесит просто запредельно эта манера: 
Победил всех боссов? Победи всех супербоссов (усиленная версия обычных)! 
А теперь злые двойники персонажей! 
А теперь задораздирающий кошак!
А теперь марафон боссов!
А теперь марафон супербоссов! Што значит с первого раза психика еще не оклемалась? Иди бейся!!!

А есть еще аррена, игровые автоматы и ретро-игрушки, без прохода которых вам не собрать ни шмот, ни карточки. 

Кто вообще придумал подгонять монстряков на особых зонах под уровень игрока и за такие сложные бои не давать ни опыта ни золота? Я задолбался терзать несчастную огненную гидру, чтобы нацарапать монет, купить стероидов за полляма и сделать себе жисть хоть немного проще. 

А там еще марафоны аркады и боссов ретро-игр... 
Нет, завтра попытаюсь завалить это кошмарное крючило, финального босса, может получится, после чего с чистой совестью можно будет удалить игру и забыть о ней как о страшном сне. 

По кой ляд я вообще купил этот геморой?! 
Знал бы что здесь твориться, обошел бы десятой дорогой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423945317', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1702086147}
review:
Avery nice RPG for any age (if some things in the options menu are changed) 10/10.
My experience:
The game is very well designed. The enemies are very good looking and same for the party members. The achievement names are sometimes hilarious and the game-play itself is very neat.
(I saw no one talk about limit breaks in reviews, so...)
The limit breaks are amazing by design and by power. It makes the game more fair and fun to play.
The puzzles on the map are also nice and challenging for some hardcore players.
Overall, this game is amazing and I think everyone that at least knows what an RPG is should play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168682811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1654938956}
review:
A JRPG style game with a lot of inspiration from anime. As always, with JRPG, character interaction is important, and EBF5 did not disappoint. Gorgeous art style, and incredible music. Fun battles with a variety of skills and effects. Tons of improvement from previous games (though I would still recommend to try those too), including new enemies, new skills, new effects, new buff and debuff system, no more mana instead managing cooldowns, no leg as a party member, monster catching, and a lot more secrets to find. 
Side note: you don't need to play the previous game to understand this game. This game has a completely different story from the previous game, even though the character is the same.

Let me tell you this: for this price, this game is REALLY CHEAP, it's basically a steal. If you're still not convinced, there is the free version on the official website and other websites like kongregate, though the paid version has a lot more extra contents so I would still recommend buying the game.

I really like the cooldowns mechanic, instead of relying on mana. It makes EBF5 feels unique and different from other JRPGs. Though if there's one thing I missed it would be spamming the "unload" skill (Lance's skill) with Matt's atk buff, one shot any and everything, though I do understand why that is removed.

author: {'steamid': '76561199020776535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1625742786}
review:
网页玩过四代的汉化版，但是后面听完作者因为四代被盗版的厉害导致什么问题来着（没去细细关注）后面来了steam居然又五代了，角色比上一作多了一只猫，打法也由此变了不少，多了很多非剧情副本地图，难度也蛮高的。
就我个人来说还是很喜欢这种回合制，看似画风有些简陋但玩法十足的游戏，有啥同类型的游戏希望看到这条评论的大佬也可以给我推荐几款，感激不尽！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198317149222', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1650147605}
review:
Great game to play when you want to chill or to play something more casual. The story is beautifully written, the mechanics received a more "turn based" approach than EBF 4 where you could spam 2 or 3 abilities over and over and just win with simple abusing of the OP spells.

In this sequel, abilities are either spammable or have a cooldown of set number of turns, so on that note, the mana bars have been removed in comparison with having to eat to replinish your mana after a set number of turns which you did in EBF4.
The music is fantastic and sets a mood for every situation even if you are exploring an ice biome or a tropical rainforest.
The optional features on this "deluxe" edition are worth in my opinion and add tens of hours to this game to complete which include dungeons and new items to collect.

Overall, the series Epic Battle Fanstasy is my childhood because i started playing Epic Battle Fanatsy 2 on the browser and the sequels always added new features, new music, new mechanics and great story to unfold. I'll never forget the days in the summer when i completed EBF3 on browser hundreds of times and I'm happy to see this great franchise grow with me in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834197376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4474, 'last_played': 1596773011}
review:
You know how when you play a game and keep coming up with ways the game should be improved? ... This ain't that type of game. [b]It ticks all my turn combat RPG boxes, even those I didn't know I had.[/b] And as I can't think of a more reasonable explanation for a dev to be in synch with what I like: The dev is possibly a psychic... or is very likely my best friend... or is absolutely personally stalking me. 

10/10... Would put out a restraining order again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193792039', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2611, 'last_played': 1593048594}
review:
epic battle fanstasy 5 é o melhor jogo na franquia até agora.
as batalhas são divertidas, os puzzles são bons, a exploração é muito bacana e os personagens são carismáticos. é LOTADO de referências, tem momentos engraçados e você realmente sente que está ficando melhor com seus avanços. ele valoriza estratégia e, para pessoas que preferem jogar pelo humor e história, a dificuldade pode ser ajustada, regulando a força de seus inimigos. a trilha sonora do jogo dispensa comentários, já que é muito boa de início ao fim, não enjoa em momento algum, até mesmo depois de horas de jogo.
vale comentar que as 30 horas prometidas no trailer são apenas caso você jogue sem completar nada além dos objetivos principais (o que é um desperdício, já que o jogo brilha mesmo com as interações com NPCs e o conteúdo extra). eu finalizei o jogo com 40 horas, isso depois de completar parcialmente os objetivos secundários. ainda há muito conteúdo que ainda tenho que descobrir. vale cada centavo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300368222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1592360541}
review:
It's just like a FF clone, but with lots of humor and references, think south park the stick of truth but more of what you would expect from an anime parody. 

Like most good FF clones, it's simple but has lots of hidden depth. This game also many optional content for those looking for a more challenging experience. 

I strongly recommend it if you like turn based RPG and/or anime/games parody/references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075819469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1592443558}
review:
Alrighty, this game is awesome. 

To be completely honest, i had initially downloaded it pirated. Played it for about half an hour, realized the big smile on my face and how excited i was with the game, and just came here to buy it on steam to support the dev.

This game is full of collectibles, easter eggs, very good humour that isn't cringe, and generally cool stuff all around.

You can expect easily 40 hours of gameplay, unless you're rushing it. I'm already 25 hours in and i haven't even started to explore the final area, optional dungeons that are pretty long, finishing the missing side quests, hall of achievements, etc... I'm probably going to take ~50 hours to finish the game. Might be because i'm playing on hard, so the battles take longer in general.

That being said, there's only one thing that could be a bit better in this game, but it's the most important one: Combat.

I guess i'm a bit spoiled by having played octopath traveler recently, wich has the best combat i've ever seen out of a JRPG. Things i don't like about the combat in this game:

-There are some very basic combos, but they aren't very strong/rewarding/varied. Sure, you can make a nice combo by spending the turns of your 3 characters that will instakill the first wave. But that just brings the next waves in and then you're just left there with your best skills on cooldown. That leads me to the second point;

-The multiple waves system is annoying and unfun. I suppose it was implemented to prevent the players from just using the same skills/combos over and over again. But there are better ways of doing that. Things like vulnerabilities to certain damage types, and a well designed skill system should be enough to make you have to choose your skills more carefully and with variety. Again, octopath traveller does that wonderfully with it's vulnerability, boost and break systems.

-Talking about skills, they are generally unappealing unbalanced (not in terms of being op, but most are useless). I often find myself just basic attacking quite often instead of using most skills (especially with matt), and even if they have elemental advantage, they just deal so little damage that you're better of using a strong high level skill with no elemental advantage, wich makes combat stale. The big ammount of overlap between the characters elemental abilities also contributes to making most skills redundant.
  
-Lastly, having 3 active characters instead of 4 limits the ammount of cool plays and interesting combat experiences. Sure, having backline allies somewhat solves that, but it's not the same, especially with the overlap wich makes it so that characters aren't very distinct. I would 10000% prefer having 4 highly specialized characters active at all times, than having 5 somewhat similar characters that can only be played 3 turns at a time. And again, this is something octopath does wonderfully. It has 12 characters, and yet they all play very very differently from eachother, with very little overlap. 

-The ultimates system is quite meh. They take very long to recharge, just to be used on a random 1/3 wave. In octopath you can actually use your ultimates/specials every battle, but you have to charge them during combat. I think this thing where you can actually carry your special bar from one fight to the other in this game limits how strong and cool they can be, as well as the multiple waves per battle system, wich just makes any super skill only 1/3 as satisfying as they could be. I'd much rather be facing stronger/healthier enemies than facing 3 waves, i think that's the biggest downside of this game's combat, having multiple waves per fight.

I guess having said all of that makes it seem like i didn't like the combat in this game, wich isn't true, otherwise i wouldn't have spent 25 hours in it already. But it starts getting stale after some time, i'm already starting to not enjoy the battles so much, they feel very draggy. I might just start playing on normal instead of hard, but then the challenge of the game would be gone...

But alas, lemme say some other nice things about this game before i leave:

-No annoying random battles
-fun and charismatic characters
-cool art
-boob giggles

Overall great experience, pretty solid 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198880435744', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15003, 'last_played': 1641609119}
review: This is honestly one of my favorite games. The soundtrack is absolutely incredible, thanks to the talent of Phynna. This game was a little hard to get into at first, with the new combat mechanics, but I have realized that this actually fits the game perfectly, and the series as a whole. The story in funny and engaging, the characters are well written, although Lance is obviously the best. Replayability is also here, with the many challenges you can add to your game. Also the art was great. Overall 9.5 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344451016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 546, 'playtime_at_review': 6718, 'last_played': 1712452022}
review:
An amazing conclusion to a classic flash series that started all the way back during the golden age of  Newgrounds. The characters are all lovable, more fleshed out and interesting than ever before. Gameplay has been massively improved with the new unique cooldown system replacing the classic Mana Pool of the original 4. Secrets can be found around every corner, with hundreds of cute easter eggs referencing everything from Minecraft to Saladfingers. The music is outstanding, Phyrnna truly outdid herself, with every single track being memorable, capturing every emotion from nostalgia to fear to sadness to peace.

I cannot stress enough, this game is top of the line. It's an amazing indie JRPG made by talented and passionate developers that deserve your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195413443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2322, 'last_played': 1669596230}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is about a group with a wide variety of characters that go on a quest to stop alien monoliths from causing terror in their lives. Your party is filled with a pirate who loves to steal, a wizard princess, a nature girl, a fascist, and a cat companion. This wide range of characters all have their own flaws that they must find solutions to over the game. While there are 5 character, you can only have 3 in the battle at one given time. Those 3 that are in battle will learn more about one another and start to bond via battle.

Although the game describes itself as having, "30 hours of gameplay" you can easily lose yourself in the game with fun challenges and optional dungeons which can end up doubling this playtime!

EBF5 has many unique gameplay elements that can enhance your experience, one of which is the fact that you can capture almost every monster that you encounter (including bosses).

My favorite part in EBF5 is in the optional dungeon of the underground labyrinth and how Natalie suggests to the player of making a map and making a map for the labyrinth is such a fun experience, especially for those who like classic jrps/rpgs.

There are many MANY other things in EBF5 but as this is a review I want to leave this somewhat short and inform the reader that there are so many amazing things in EBF5 and I could not recommend this game enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093616042', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3354, 'last_played': 1710299762}
review: I've played this game's series as a child back when Epic Battle Fantasy 3 was on the Kongregate website for free. I absolutely enjoyed playing Part 3 which made me fell in love with the whole series. Part 4 was a really good continuation of Part 3. Now after playing Part 5, it has really made this one of the best game series I have enjoyed overall. This game gives so much nostalgic feel to the previous games. I would definately recommend this to people who enjoy adventure and rpg games. You don't have to play the previous games before this one but it's recommended if you want to get the feel of the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271151780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 4791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4791, 'last_played': 1575701661}
review: A hilarious game with fun characters, great battles and a lot of strategy. With the difficulty being ajustable, it is possible to grind up experience for the difficult battles and then change the difficulty back, or just play the entire game on whatever difficulty you pick. The boss battles are all very unique and require a different strategy for every one. My favorite part is the equipment collection and the interactions between them, taking your resistances to over 100% and actually healing off of enemy attacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198975495021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4381, 'last_played': 1710884551}
review: Probably one of the best games I had the pleasure to play in a long while. Both the game mechanics and the funny stories of every character is just great, one thing that kinda got me disappointed is the process of autobalancing level with certain foes but I suppose you can't have a "EPIC" kind experience without it so I just set my mind at peace, plus the nostalgia train hit me real hard this time around not gonna lie. Thank you very much for this masterpiece of a game (in my nerdish opinion), really hope to see another epic sequel in the future. (And probably another big thank you for all the fans for all their dedication, really hope to make a decent fan art sometime in my life as well).

author: {'steamid': '76561198842278451', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 5510, 'last_played': 1712308717}
review:
已经全成就了。
说实话这个年头还在做flash游戏的实在不多见了。
但是Matt依然在用flash挖掘传统回合制战斗的精髓，尝试用最简单的操作构造无穷的游戏性。
无论从谜题的设计，还是地图的设计，还是从装备、技能的设计，都可以体会Matt对于游戏性极致的追求。
同时战斗中的骚话，NPC简单但是很有味道的对话和奇妙的场景演出都给人很强的沉浸感
本来去年玩完了原版，没想到V2还能挖掘出这个游戏这么多的潜力。
P姐的BGM依然那么棒，比起前作，这次的BGM感觉更加注重场景性和战斗的节奏感了
最后想说的是，即使被埋在红松镇的墓碑里，我也要用腐朽的声音喊出：
“快出EBF6！”

author: {'steamid': '76561198011425371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2826, 'last_played': 1682668851}
review: This is a really fun point and click rpg with gamers in mind. Countless fun references to movies and other game titles and none of it really feels forced. The characters are meant to be generic in terms of what they do (Matt is a guy who likes swords and is a big meat shield , Natalie is a busty sorceress , anna is the nature girl and lance is wearing the wrong uniform xD )  but its the interaction between one another that sets them apart from other rpg characters. Plenty of things to work towards and many many .... many secrets to find. If you like rpgs give this entire series a look at its worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120259544', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 8054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3408, 'last_played': 1645911991}
review:
good game. alhough you most likely will play on easy and all cheats enable because why waste time with "random fights" on epic difficulty that won´t give you more exp or anything. just time waisting. That leads to only play on epic mode when you get a medal for it. 
UPDATE: I used cheats but therefore only EPIC difficulty. Best gameplay experience so far.
Apart from that the game is really huge. A lot to do and a bunch of extra features which is really nice. I would rate it a 10/10 if different difficulties would lead to a bonus and that you can only lower the difficulty in each playthrough but not raise it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198970690747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1685196652}
review:
回想起来，当年还是小学时候的我在4399乱晃随手点进去玩了盗版的4代ebf，我还记得那天基本上一整天都沉迷在这小游戏上，虽然那时的我就是嫌麻烦想快速通关而直接无视不塞路的怪和宝箱，结果导致了我打尽管是普通难度的最终boss猫神的时候溃不成军赶紧逃跑，觉得打不过就不想玩这游戏了。但在一年前为了回忆童年我再次玩了一次，结果发现这游戏虽小，但许多彩蛋都能让你会心一笑，，难度其实也不算大，搭配好装备再高出boss一两级还是能过史诗难度的。（。。。。写完才发现上面这段不是应该写在4代的评测吗）现在知道了5代出了体验了一下赶紧入正，还是一样的回合制，还是那4人1猫，熟悉的吐槽制作者的风格和时不时玩梗让我非常乐在其中，回过头来我已经4周目了。与前代不同，此作取消了mp制取而代之的是某些强力的技能有冷却时间，最令我惊讶的是此作的自由度，基本上任何的敌人都能捕捉，甚至包括boss！！！！！（其他中boss都能在一周目捕捉，last boss在二周目能够捕捉）游戏还拥有非常丰富的支线，许多有趣的挑战都蕴含在此，你甚至要和电脑漏洞对战！
平时不怎么写评测的我还是第一次写的这么长，但我还是难以表达我对这小游戏的热爱。
最后最重要的：即使被埋在了坟墓，我也要用腐朽的声音喊出：ebf快出6！！！！！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198256168050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7158, 'last_played': 1627048334}
review: 就快到最终决战了，说一下，游戏本身很好玩，还有不少的策略性，尤其是喜欢动动脑子的，应该会很喜欢。史诗难度略高，需要思考，配装需要对游戏有一定了解，需要s/l，但是这个游戏已经考虑到这一点。。随时可撤退，没有任何损失，你可以尽情思考尝试。。。这也是我喜欢这个游戏的地方。另外，我有一点小的期望，也可能是我没有玩过以前几代，从后缀5我猜前面应该还有几代，人物不够鲜明，马特我至今不知道是啥性格，有点热血蠢笨？反倒是兰斯印象很深也可能是我认为他比较强的原因。。。。。。

review: La secuela de un juego que marco mi infancia como lo fue su precuela, tenia altas expectativas para este juego y cumplio todas, me termine el juego en flash y procedi a comprar el juego para apoyar al creador, y juro que no me arrepiendo, este juego puede jugarse sin haber jugado sus precuelas, aunque es recomendable jugarlas para meterte de lleno en la historia, merece el comprarlo por precio completo

author: {'steamid': '76561198289164872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20029, 'last_played': 1693539548}
review:
I personally enjoy a good RPG. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is no exception to that, as it's provided me with hundreds of hours of play time and 100+ achievements to unlock. While its predecessor, Epic Battle Fantasy 4, had a quirk in the algorithm that would multiply the difficulty twice after a certain level (for Hard and Epic difficulties), this game does not, yet it still provides quite a challenge. 

Version 2 of the game has allowed me to test my knowledge of utilizing each character to their fullest extent, adapting to various foes with updated stats, or even test myself against bosses with every single challenge activated (which I can proudly claim to have done on Epic difficulty). The ability to fight several old foes/bosses from the previous games has greatly increased the playability of this game, and I certainly look forward to more games by Matt Roszak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257691881', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3262, 'last_played': 1647275605}
review:
This series carried me through middle school. I remember playing the first two games on separate tabs during my tech ed classes on flash game sites. If I hadn't found this series as a kid, i don't think i would be the same person i am now.

I love the personalities and tropes of all the characters that have developed as the series has grown, the unique visual style that i haven't seen much of outside the series as well as the original music that started being made for the series after the first game (the soundtrack of 3 is probably still my favorite overall)

There's so much packed into 5 i can't believe it started from something so much simpler. the enemies are diverse, the environments almost as much, battle strategy is complex and flexible and the dialogue is engrossing. 

I honestly think this series deserves better than the attention it has.


Thank you so much Matt and everyone who has worked with and helped him in the making of all these. You guys helped make my early teen years bearable.

Y'all are awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561199047469208', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1596524336}
review:
YES.  SO MUCH YES!

My favorite feature and new addition is that you can still play on Newgrounds for FREE, but that as an ADDED bonus, there are extra levels here on Steam that you don't have access to otherwise.  The plus to that, as if there needed to be more, is that you can totally save out your progress and upload it between Newgrounds and Steam, and the medals are all transferable, so you don't have to play the game twice if you don't want to!

Great game, great developers... excellent backstory to the content and it's origin... Just, so much yes.  You DESERVE this game.

Have fun!

review: Always been a fan of Matt's stuff, so happy that he put so much love into making a proper send-off for the series. A proper challenge, lots of secrets and a rollicking good story, with tons of skills, enemies, and glorious hardware. Whatever you do next, Matt, godspeed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198248467608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7614, 'last_played': 1708989162}
review: this game is very good and has a surprisingly deep combat/item system. i've played through this game more than a few times and i never get tired of it just because it's so fun to mix and match setups for each character. when you get to higher levels, the overpowered setups you can do with characters is awesome. there was a recent update that now allows you to customize your playthroughs in a number of ways (only a certain number of characters can be out at once, enemies scale to your level, no items, etc.). this gives the game a lot of replay value and makes it very satisfying each time you play through it. recommend it to anyone who likes RPGs.

review: Great and fun game

author: {'steamid': '76561198249855752', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7186, 'last_played': 1655352727}
review:
Amazing game. Incredibly fun and interesting, various systems to develop and a lot of different skills and equipment. The combat is fantastic and it's able to remain interesting after a long while. 
The difficulty is on point and scalable to your liking. Its even better now that it has more options to customize the experience. 
Not the most amazing story but it does the trick, and the replayability of the game is INSANE. Love it! 
If you liked the previous entries in the series you're going to love this one, or if you're interested in a great, long, not-super-serious, turn-based rpg I can't recommend this game enough! Its REALLY good.

Also, the music is awesome! 12/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198256947285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3840, 'last_played': 1663271475}
review: This Game is Amazing! It's a great RPG with funny characters, a great story, and a in depth combat system that even someone of questionable intelligence like me can understand. This was a Major step up from EBF4, and the fact that this Series when from a simple little flash game on the internet (sorry if I got that part wrong), to a incredibly well made RPG, that everyone can enjoy! And the game was made even better with the Version 2 update that was released this year, adding Cards that add passive bonuses, new areas and enemies, re-balanced equipment, new medals (Though that makes getting into the final room of the Grand Gallery harder since you need every medal to get in there), and brand new shiny custom game option that you can do anytime, even if you haven't beaten the game, and a cheats and challenges menu in the options that can make your experience harder or easier that you can switch however you please for shits and giggles. I got this, EBF4, and Bullet Heaven 2 in a bundle, which I highly recommend because you get two well made RPG's, and a Bullet Hell game that I have no idea how to play because I suck. I love this game, and I'm pretty sure that you will as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418176746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3933, 'last_played': 1664556044}
review:
The game pays omage to popculture, movies, games, anime, comics, if you like references and meta humor, then the series wont let you down. 
My opinion might be a little biased, as I was following Matt Roszak's games' development for years now, ever since he started working on ebf4, but it doesnt change the fact, that EBF5 is really well made and still getting updates.
If you've played older jRPG series, then you will find many familiar mechanics reminiscent of other games.
A lot of effort and love seems to have been put into the characters and maps, the dialogues are not boring and the entiriety is a fun experience. The battles get a bit stale towards the end, which the developer tried to balance out by using multiple enemies with unique mechanics, but that just wasn't enough for me to not feel tired after a slow, methodical fight through the waves. This, however, doesnt matter, as the characters can swap their builds on command, allowing you to, for example, just equip bio-resistant equipment and start a virus outbreak on the battlefield, where stacked infection heals the Players and decimates Foes. This is possible thanks to steroid foods being exclusive to each character, so that you wont be tempted to, for example, just feed Natalie magic attack steroids while Lance gets literally nothing in that field, like in the previous game. This gives every Player character an opportunity to shine.
The fanbase is really nice and supporting, the developer constantly posts fan-made art on their blog.
And finally, the music is amazing, I love to listen to the game ost outside of playing, Phyrnna really did a great job here.

So, if that still doesnt convince you to buy EBF5, then just know, that there is an achievement for molesting seagulls and you can just pick bricks from the ground into your inventory and carry them around. Also, anime tiddies. Or, rather, anime-esque, which is not a bad thing, because imitation is the best form of flattery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193685719', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3829, 'last_played': 1681397777}
review:
太好玩了，作为一个回合制游戏 超级丰富的装备和超级不同的搭配以及超级多的boss设定 光打一个史诗难度boss的装备调整我就能研究上半小时还不觉得腻 太棒了 游戏内人物各种吐槽 各种梗 特别特别游戏。但是毕竟是回合制游戏 如果追求成就这些确实杀时间，但是每天打一个史诗难度boss就像每天的一个惊喜一样 十分有成就感（除了神以外 特别特别容易灭队这个史诗难度打得我怀疑人生)
所以如果是喜欢回合制和rpg类的游戏这个你绝对喜欢的！如果追求快节奏这些的话这个游戏还是不太适合

author: {'steamid': '76561198099689321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5372, 'last_played': 1677083611}
review:
休闲RPG的巅峰之作,FLASH游戏的绝唱。
几百MB的大小里，你能找到几乎所有的RPG所有拥有的特色，元素及装备系统、宝箱、谜题、隐藏内容、成就。让人大呼过瘾，虽然几乎没什么剧情，但是不会让人感到无趣，几乎每次游玩都有新的惊喜。丰富而全面的成就系统更是大大增加了游戏时长（笑），不可多得的好游戏，竟然能用几十块钱买到，超值。

author: {'steamid': '76561198297486233', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1588923415}
review:
萌，可爱，奇妙，有趣

很传统的回合制游戏，但是做的实在香。角色和敌人AWSL不说，战斗系统优化地很舒服，玩起来没有其他回合制游戏那种别扭的感觉，感觉被作者特意照顾到了。地图足够大，径路、解密和隐藏相当丰富，有许多让人会心一笑的设计（比如绕出屏幕偷拿商店老板的宝箱）。目前推了一半不到，还有许多探索要素，30h不知道能不能打完。

（作者深谙回合制rpg的精髓，然而在游戏里却通过角色疯狂吐槽，挺喜感的）

author: {'steamid': '76561198033293455', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1709669193}
review:
good old JRPG goodness, huge amount of game references, awesome graphics and soundtrack, and so much to do, from finding chests, to fighting hidden bosses, to 130 achievements to collect!
also, cheats built in to game, or challenges if you prefer a harder game, and custom game with random equipment in chests and limited party size.

review:
NB！

author: {'steamid': '76561198073982904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3976, 'last_played': 1660364707}
review:
A hidden gem with enough content to justify twice its price tag and a battle system deep enough to keep you engaged the whole way through. This is a beautiful example of RPG progression done right - there are no superfluous items, skills, or abilities to be found. Each piece of gear is unique, and the combinations practically infinite. Messing around with different combos and strategies was - for me - where most of the fun was found, and although I personally don't consider myself part of the 'all hail turn-based combat' niche, the sheer amount of quality-of-life features meant that I could focus on the fun of the game without feeling bogged down by many of the common pitfalls other turn-based RPGs fall into. 

The sheer amount of care put into this game, and the care Matt shows for the fans, leaves me with a warm fuzzy feeling whenever I see his telltale art style or hear Phyrnna's beats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843287287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5871, 'last_played': 1682825246}
review:
全成就达成
是我玩过最有意思，最入迷的回合制RPG游戏
内容玩法丰富，数不尽的解密，各种支线区域，搞笑的剧情对话，乐趣多多。
战斗系统与四代相比，继承了上一代的元素，状态，和属性强弱化等优点，把技能要法力值消耗改为了冷却时间，避免了4代的无脑重复甩技能和后期的法力值形同虚设的问题，战斗需要频繁的切换队友，更加灵活。此外状态更加多样，敌人拥有各种属性弱化和施加负面状态的攻击，极具挑战性。不动动脑子可打不过史诗boss。

review: The sequel to probably the best RPG I have ever laid my hands onto.  It has an amazing storyline, cute graphics, amazing combat system, and truly epic boss battles. (Can't forget coughcleavagecough.)  The game lives up to its title, and probably the most well spent 15 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287194682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 4181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1611011985}
review:
A good and entertaining RPG with tons of content and a pretty comedic journey.

More seriously, the element and status effect systems in this game are so good that it makes about 80% of other turn based RPGs feel like boring repetitive bullshit. this is a massive positive. you have to basically reinvent every character's kit for every area and bossfight, and if you turn the difficulty up you'll still get crushed like a pancake several times. Despite this, the battles rarely feel high stress, which i appreciate (it's the comedic style).

author: {'steamid': '76561199031536124', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1704621626}
review:
评测98%的好评我就不说啦吧。我就想问两个问题：
1.为什么我抗住啦剧情杀（墨镜+军帽，运气好就扛下拉，然后复活队友砸坦克，兰斯不用管）娜塔莉还是被抓走啦？？？
2.为什么宇宙巨石碑和吞噬者能抓？？！（疲劳+虚弱+诅咒，抓啦不推荐使用吞噬者，这货全屏秒杀还带自动退出，只能打成就或发泄用）

author: {'steamid': '76561198878464552', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3542, 'last_played': 1645966652}
review:
Эта игра просто супер, практический похож на Final Fantasy. Игра примерно длится 50 ч.. Отличная рисовка, музыка и бои (если на эпическом сложности), но минус в том, что макс 30 фпс и нельзя на 60 фпс сделать. 
Но все равно игра хорошая, я вам советую сыграть в  это

author: {'steamid': '76561199026158806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1695730622}
review: 非常精美的游戏，第四面墙被反复蹂躏让人很爽，究极难度受苦的难度也绝对不是一般人玩的下去的，收集要素很多，还很贴心的设计了节日礼物（春节给礼物真的很令人惊喜而且鞭炮确实很好用）这游戏从2就开始接触，一直追到5部，不会催第六部的，5够我玩很长时间了。诚意满满，同时富有趣味性和挑战性，上乘制作！

review: obviously one of the best games ever. Like legit, it's just a fantastic game, love the art, love the enemies, love the different kind of weapons and challenges. I have gotten 114 achievements (the newer ones i haven't much of) just so nice to see Matt still adding content. I hope for a ebf6 perhaps with new chars? Feel like these guys' story is finished.
