author: {'steamid': '76561198093347752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3870, 'last_played': 1692301403}
review:
An excellent, fun. quirky. and hilarious RPG that both stays true to its roots, and improves upon them! I've been playing the EBF series for years, since well before they were available on steam, and any fans of the series, the creator, or classic RPGs will almost certainly enjoy this game! And the best part is that you don't even have to have any background knowledge of the previous games to jump right in! Play the game and become the greediest, most unapologetic, monster-enslaving adventure team of them all as you quest to save the world!

The art style is anime-esque, with tons of armors and weapons with awesome and/or ridiculous designs. The music (by Phyrnna) is catchy, and you'll probably find yourself humming or whistling along as you smash monsters and steal loots. In a slight change of pace. The writing, as always, is very funny, and this time you can build the team members relationships, to say nothing of the dialogues you can trigger in-combat if you meet the right conditions. The many maps (both those that will be available for free online, and those that require purchasing the game), are filled with tons of Easter eggs and hidden goodies that will net you hours of playtime finding/collecting them all.

My only issues are that the many bonus dungeon monsters do not give you any experience upon defeat, and there are quite a few of those, and I wish the Newgame+ scaled the monsters to your level.

All in all, I still give this game a 15/10, would adventure again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198818523863', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6311, 'last_played': 1667469142}
review:
It’s hard to review this game, for me personally, because I’ve been playing the series for so long; this a game steeped in nostalgia, with a history spanning a decade and two spin-offs. This is Matt’s magnum opus—I don’t think he will ever make a game that’s bigger than this one.

Before I carry on, if you’re considering buying this game: do it. The executive summary is that Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a great RPG—one of the best, even. And I’ve played a lot of RPGs, let me tell you.

The remainder of what I’m going to write is intended for other players and Matt himself, and won't appear in the Steam review; it’s my experience playing this game after having played EBF3 and EBF4. I’m not a hardcore gamer in the sense that real hardcore players would consider, but with 72 achievements under my belt (and a similar number for EBF4) I’m definitely not your average casual.


In conclusion, despite all the negative feedback, I still loved playing Epic Battle Fantasy 5. This is still an awesome game. There’s a gravestone, actually, near the masoleum, which says: “Here lies Epic Battle Fantasy 6, along with all those who ask about it.” But I think Matt is wrong. We do need EBF6. It certainly shouldn’t be as long as this game, but I think the series deserves one more shot. At the very least, I would like to see some of the game mechanics be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050746120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6555, 'last_played': 1585157727}
review:
I am a casual gamer and finished this game 99% on the highest difficulty.

The bosses were adequatly challenging, but I beat most of them without grinding or anything, just a little bit of tactic and its all good.

You may have noticed 99% and most. The final boss (not the optional and therefore hardest boss, just the final boss) was immune to my cheesing strategies though.
Immune to CHEESE.
Not any cheese, the cheese I was using to get through 60% and even the optional boss of the game.

I am mad as heck, but also props to Matt, the guy who had me have my fun and candies through most of the game and who got me to take the final boss of a game seriously after I obliterated the optional boss on highest difficulty down to a state where he could not even try to harm my Squad. Enjoyed it a ton, banter is spot on.

review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Follow our curator page:[b] OCG-Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

	[td]8.2/10[/td]

👍 [u]Pros:[/u] 👍
Pokemon-style monster capturing mechanic
Solid RPG mechanics
Customizable skill system


[u]Pro or Con:[/u]
Story with Juvenile Humour

👎 [u]Cons:[/u] 👎
Block pushing puzzles aren’t especially engaging

[h1]Overview[/h1] 
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is an excellent sequel in the Epic Battle Fantasy series. The RPG mechanics are solid and remind me quite a bit of early Final Fantasy games. The overworld is set up in a grid just like those older RPGs mentioned, and the easiest puzzle to make for this kind of overworld is block pushing. There is a decent amount of block pushing puzzles and they do get tiring after a while. The combat is good though and relies heavily on countering element weaknesses found in enemies. This is made easier with the scan feature which allows a player to see the stats of an enemy. Another optional feature that can be quite fun is the Pokemon style monster catching mechanic. Even bosses can be caught which can make some boss fights even harder as the player wants to get them low and debuff them heavily instead of straightforwardly murdering them. 

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]

🎮 [u]Gameplay:[/u] 🎮

Overworld
 The overworld is set on square grid that allows the player to only move in the cardinal directions. This is quite similar to SNES era RPGs early Final Fantasy or Pokémon games. Similar to these games, the player is able to use a control scheme that allows the player to move around in the classic way, the arrow keys. The way that I preferred to play is with the mouse. Being able to just click on interesting objects is nice because the pointer changes based upon what the player is hovering over, allowing them to know which objects can be clicked, and which are useless. The mouse can be a bit like cheating, and the game knows it. This is because the player is able to automatically move to partially hidden chests that would normally require a movement puzzle. I found that it was much easier to use the mouse, but if a player wants the developer’s intended experience then they should stick with arrow keys. The places where arrow keys can really help are blocking pushing puzzles. 

Puzzles 
The puzzles in this game are a bit disappointing. This is because they mainly consist of simple block pushing challenges that are difficult to complete with the mouse and aren’t especially challenging. The rewards for completing them are handy, but aren’t required. This means that players can at least skip them, but if you want to be more powerful, then they definitely help to increase the speed at which a player is able scale in power. I do wish that the game used the movement puzzle more found in the labyrinth mine dungeon as that requires a lot of strategy and thought. 

Combat
Combat focuses on dealing bonus damage by exploiting enemy elemental weaknesses. Each enemy generally has at least one elemental weakness and one elemental resistance. Resistances are often very high. So high that they will heal an enemy if they are exposed to that element somehow. Weakness allow an attack to deal about two times as much damage to an enemy that has a weakness to it. Elements also have status effects tied to them. For example, bio damage often has a chance to poison an enemy if hit by it. Every character has a basic attack that does damage based upon their equipment, but many times a player will want to simply use skills that have a particular element. 

Skills & Sidequests
Skills are not gained in typical RPG fashion where they are gained automatically gained upon level-up. Instead, at the end of every battle, the player’s characters gain ability points which may be spent to level up the skills that a player wants. This allows for a lot of minute customization and some characters can be specialized into either a damage dealer or a healer. There are also limit break skills. Every time a character is damaged or deals damage, they gain limit break points. Limit breaks are extremely powerful abilities can provide lots of damage or can even heal the team for a lot of HP. They can be a good choice to invest in, but they are often expensive. 

Equipment
Equipment, besides leveling up, is the main way to increase the character’s power. Item must be spent though, so it is often best to complete puzzles and optional areas when possible. Equipment not only increases specific stats, they also come with special effects and elements. The element effects what kind of element the normal attack has. The special effects that occur are usually on attack effects or spells that will randomly attack enemies. Besides equipment, another source of damage that a player can harness is monster catching.

Monster catching
Similar to the ever popular series of Pokemon games, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 has a monster catching mechanic that is quite fun. Nearly every encountered monster in the game is able to be captured, this includes quite a few bosses. During the battle, if the player wants to, they may try to capture a monster by using the capture command. If a monster has low health and has debuffs, there is a good chance that it will be captured. Otherwise, it may break out of confinement. Once a monster is captured, it can be used by spending the summoning point gained at the end of every battle. These abilities can be devastating, and monster catching can make the game a lot harder at times as a player will often not want to kill something they are trying to catch. 


⚙ [b]Overall:[/b]⚙
A comedic and fun RPG that scratches that old SNES era itch. Worth a look for every RPG fan.

📚 [u]Story:[/u] 📚
The story is a complete parody of JRPGs and it knows it. The story follows the same JRPG introductory style. A plucky young adventurer’s home is under attack by an evil force and must defend themselves before it is too late. Along the way, he gains new party members that will help him defeat the evil. The story constantly makes fun of this trope though. For example, the reason that the young hero wants to destroy the evil is because it would mess with the video gaming he was doing. While the story is comedic, it can also have elements of what some would call “juvenile humor.” This game is not above joke about bodily functions and can sometimes turn quite dark for a moment. If a player is able to handle a ridiculous story that can quickly change themes, then they will enjoy the story of this game.

🎧 [u]Sound:[/u]🎧
The sound effects fit their respective skills well. Ice has a scraping and cracking sound that reminds me so much of ice. The main aspect of sound that really stands out is the music. The soundtrack is mainly comprised of pumping EDM music. The only downside is that it can be a little distracting to a player who is thinking about their latest strategic options.

📺 [u]Graphics:[/u] 📺 
The graphics have a clean, digital art style to them. Enemies area all visually distinct, though there is often a base class of monster type that changes its abilities and looks based upon its main element. The standout graphical portion of this game is during the “cutscenes.” These cutscences are comprised of chibi versions of the character that are made out of fabric. These short, animated sections are a delight to watch.


This product was reviewed with a key provided by the developer for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172286955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3000, 'last_played': 1553986932}
review:
Though the music is not quite as good as EBF-4, the game is immense.  When you're 7/8ths of the way through the main quest, there's still 80% of the game remaining through backtracking and additional side-quests you couldn't complete before.  I had thought I had completed at least 95% after dozens of hours later and went to the final boss fight only to discover I had only completed 58%!  The game has TONS of additional content to discover!

Some negatives are that most monsters level-up with you equally (though not on primary quest paths).  Some of the puzzles are VERY difficult by my standard, and I've been playing RPGs since 1978 to include all the Wizardrys, Ultimas, and Might and Magics and may take hours to solve (or, heck, I could be getting senile, dunno..)  ;p  I played it through on HARD mode until the final boss and had to back it off to NORMAL.  I'm not sure if it can be won on EPIC but there are a few out there that have accomplished this I think.  Pretty brutal, seriously.  Almost X-Com 2 humbling at-times on EPIC.  Not impossible but darn close.

I wish some of the puzzles were a bit easier and grinding was rewarding (bosses just get tougher like later Wizardry games.)  You're punished for not incorporating ALL the characters evenly for a "best" ending.  Why not allow 5 characters to fight simultaneously or have two separate parties that switch back and forth with two story-arcs, then can fight together for the last 1/4th as 5 at-once, meeting up at the end and teaming-up?  I mean, we all have our favorites, you know?

Still, overall, this is an amazing and unassuming game.  Seems basic but is actually high in depth and content.  Creepy-pasta basements, etc.  Some Morse-code translations there.  Lots of tongue-in-cheek comments.  A few in-jokes.  Some psychological drama.  Looks kiddie but it's quite deep at times.  A few glitches had me lose some of my summons (such as pink-slime) after reaching Pixel-world and capturing a few.

Score:  A-

author: {'steamid': '76561198025265663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3589, 'last_played': 1663282448}
review:
Some things just get better with age, and this series is definitely one of them.  I've been a fan of this series since as far back as the very first one, and each time, the developer manages to stay true to the game's roots (creatively-animated, complex-yet-enjoyable battles) while adding on heaps of new stuff to improve the overall formula.  I'll admit, I was skeptical about trading MP for cooldowns, but overall it was a great change.

I mean, really the only thing I feel like I can criticize this game about is the amount of obnoxious block puzzles.  I'm on Matt's (the character's) side when ever these show up, every time!  It's also annoying how upgrading gear sometimes costs captured foes, which requires you to backtrack and catch another of that foe since they don't stack.  But overall, I'd say those are very minor complaints about an otherwise great game.

Definitely looking forward to the expanded content Matt (the developer) has planned in the future.

I'm also quite pleased that the game has managed to retain its crass humor via an options setting, rather than selling out and watering everything down like so many others seem to do over time.

PS:  The lack of controller support is worth noting, as it's easier for a long-time fan of the game to forgive this than someone who might be new to the series.  I'm really hoping EBF6 (if it happens!) takes controller support into consideration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026689773', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5675, 'last_played': 1648545304}
review:
So, I've been with this series from the start. 
Ever since I discovered Epic Battle Fantasy on Kongregate, I loved every second of it.
And what this game is, it's a culmination of all the hard work that Matt went through to make the best EBF game yet.
It definitely shows how much has improved. All the quality of life changes, and the actual quality of the visuals and the [b]music[/b]. Oh my god, the music... Phyrnna keeps delivering, as she always has. 
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 just hits all the right spots.

 I've gotten all the achievements of all the 3 games on Steam, they're just too good.
This series was the only one that has gotten me to actually 100% a game before. Because I wanted to show my support and dedication to the series. I wanted to be proud of perfecting glorious games like this.

So, from the bottom of my heart, I can safely say that if you're looking for a turn based RPG, Epic Battle Fantasy will definitely satisfy your needs. I cannot express enough how much I recommend this game.

review: 大画廊里居然有我的渣图！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198287743167', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 5038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3612, 'last_played': 1621582474}
review:
怎么会有这么牛逼的游戏！！！
刷了3天把全成就刷出来了，毒性太强了。
不落俗套的故事，出色的音乐（尤其是Title和某个boss打时候的那首），腻的要命但是一定要解开的谜题，简单但有趣的游戏系统，大量的隐藏要素和梗，一切都做到了几近完美，才能造就这么优秀的作品。
我甚至感觉自己回到了小时候，拿着psp玩rpg的那种感觉。
11/10已经无法表达我的心情了（尤其是在和如今大厂的rpg对比之下）100/10好吧？

什么时候会有EBF6呢(

author: {'steamid': '76561198324031032', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1708613884}
review:
喜爱之情无以言表！仅仅购入了两个星期就玩上五十个小时，真的上瘾了。没有任何别的游戏能让我这么如痴如醉！而且，从头到尾都那么有趣！
前期你会惊叹flash也能有如此精美的美术动画和音乐。
中期你会痴迷于搜查每一处微小的地方。
后期你会自豪于你的猫万军丛中纵横四方！
把各类boss神仙抓入囊中真的很有成就感！
与黑暗队友战斗的特殊规则也十分酷炫！

author: {'steamid': '76561198055994365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2203, 'last_played': 1585411248}
review:
Great turn based RPG that doesnt take itself too serious. If u liked EBF 3 or 4 or old school Final Fantasy games u will surely enjoy this one as well.

The fights get very drawn out and grindy at the end but the first 30 h i had a blast playing it.

review: 游戏是绝对值得的 看你喜欢不喜欢这种类型了 玩了十几个小时了 相反有些大作我是玩不了几个小时的 说回合制但也看属性相克 也可以肝 收集装备 召唤兽 各种要素也多 缺点是可能有时候会卡 flash的缘故好像 希望能继续更新或有续作吧 名气不怎么响可能卖得不多 勉励吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198025286003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 8849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4236, 'last_played': 1664389020}
review: I’ve played all the other entries in the series and have to say it’s just getting better. This game ads some new features the biggest being the collectable monsters, similar to Pokémon.  I’ve liked the game overall and thought the art direction was fun and cute. It very much feels like a Newgrounds passion project fleshed out. The battle mechnics are very much the standard turn based rpg, but that’s sort of the point.  It’s got so many quality of life features, selectable difficulty, annotated map, bestiary, etc…

author: {'steamid': '76561198347478989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1888, 'last_played': 1642251187}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997860863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3958, 'last_played': 1553346822}
review:
65 = nombre d'heures passé dessus
2 = nombre d'épic battle fantasy terminé (le 4 & le 5)
4 = nombre de vomi suite à une gastro
17 = note sur 20 que je lui accorde
Fidèle aux précédent épisode, la quête à l'upgrade et l'accessibilité du jeu le rende vraiment abordable pour une majorité de joueurs tout âge confondus.
Il n'y a rien a redire, l'humour potache et les multiples références en fond un jeu de geek à l'ancienne sans réelle prise de tête.
Tout les personnages sont bien construit avec leurs propres histoires.
Les graphismes sont jolis et les animations des limit break dantesqes.
Je n'en demande pas plus d'un jeu que de passer autant de bon temps et Epic battle Fantasy 5 réussi haut la main, pourtant j'avais peur au début de la redondance avec le précédent opus mais en fait non, tout coule tout seul.

Je recommande vivement

review:
30H c'est l'histoire sa et encore pas complétement, 60h plus et je n'ai toujours pas fini le jeu , et de loin d'ailleurs :D 
Franchement pour un jeu qui se veut marrant a 12 balles ... ben j'aurai pas pu demandé mieux . Le prix est Ridicule pour la qualité . Rien que l'humour de l'auteur et le fait de jouer un putain de chat vaut 12 euros , alors le reste c'est du pur bonus :)
N'hésitez pas ! 
Une pépite comme on en voit trop peu .

author: {'steamid': '76561198005290267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2524, 'last_played': 1581871578}
review: Zagrałem tylko przez przypadek i gra znajduje się na mojej osobistej liście najlepszych gier w jakie grałem. Mechanika jest prosta do zrozumienia a jednak aby w pełni wykorzystać trzeba trochę pokombinować. Działa świetnie, gra się świetnie i po prostu jest to gra która jest grą. Dla mnie to tytuł wręcz rewelacyjny, szczególnie, że od dawna nie grałem w aż tak dobrą grę. Poważnie, inne "ambitne" i bardzie poważne gry przy tym wyglądają średnio. Mam 60 osiągnięć i może postaram się zdobyć wszystkie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105831614', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 3189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2432, 'last_played': 1604573874}
review: 表示是在逛商城的时候无意发现的,也没有玩过前作.画风一开始觉得挺有特色的...然后发现这游戏出乎意料的有趣,游戏性不一定很棒,但趣味性十足,很少有RPG类游戏能给我带来这种感动了,游戏里不仅有超多搞笑的吐槽,有意思的对话,还有很多玩梗要素,哈哈(比如黄金太阳的墓碑)细节十分出色,在完了很多小时回合制砍怪后仍然不觉得无聊..........有很多支线任务,解谜要素和隐藏要素,玩起来十分有趣,爽快的无耗蓝技能砸脸,带各种被动的装备,流畅的战斗动画,战斗过程轻松惬意(当然是在普通难度下),出了某个支线BOSS让我重新挑战,其他的都是渣渣(普通难度)......剧情上没玩过前作的的基本没影响.......打通了之后也有各种成就,隐藏要素,收集要素,还有挑战等着玩家去玩,实在是一款非常出色的游戏.....以后能给朋友安利的游戏又多了一个.....忘了说了,这游戏音乐很棒,特地买了DLC来听,爽!

author: {'steamid': '76561198182883002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1653827208}
review:
玩过最好玩JRPG类游戏，内容丰富，游戏内细节满满，中文翻译的质量：100/100
唯三愿意原价买的游戏之一，另外两个是巫师3和GTAV。
唯一可能的缺点是：都9102年还在用flash引擎，游戏偶尔会掉帧。

The best JRPG I have ever played,with abundant context and details and the quality of Chinese translation is 100/100
I am happy to buy it with full price, just like bought the witch 3 and GTAV
only disadvantage is the engine is flash, sometimes drop with low FPS

author: {'steamid': '76561198401088419', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1712412614}
review:
真的太好玩啦！！！！我之后买的鬼泣5都没怎么玩  熬夜玩这款游戏 
一开始担心50买这个游戏可能有点小贵 
但是！！！真的值得！！
这款RPG游戏绝对适合喜欢回合制的你！
而且彩蛋非常多
我还没有通关  也就看得出来有jojo梗和undertale还有纪念碑谷
和npc对话也非常有意思 任务奖励也很吸引人
刷怪没有必要 只需要拿一下宝箱即可 不需要很高的肝度
天气和属性状态叠加的设定也非常有意思
总之！
非常好玩！非常好玩！非常好玩！

author: {'steamid': '76561198402257193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1680797281}
review: Ever since they released Epic Battle Fantasy 1, I have been obsessed over this series. Please understand what you are about to maybe buy is a game for certain types of people. So before you buy it look at gameplay/trailers online. For those interested or fans of the series then this game is 100% worth it. New heroes and a story all for a fair price(you get a discount if you buy epic battle fantasy 4). So in the end this game should probably take no longer than a 100 hours. It also has secrets, treasures and a whole lot of achievements that will make you keep at it. I would rate this game 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141592553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1617365112}
review:
I played part 3 and 4 a lot when I was younger. Relly enjoyed the battle system, but the story was kind of lacking. 
This part has made battles even more complex, thats a plus for me. Also the story feels alot more involving (only got past the castle so far)
Some things annoy me however: Nolegs dies too fast, there's no fast travel besides Slimes and Buffs and Debuffs don't stack, but replace the last one (I guess it's supposed to balance the game, but it feels very wrong...)

review: 尽管还没通关，但是我已经忍不住要推了，你问我为什么，因为我终于回想起这份熟悉的感动来自何处。那就是20年前，阿猫阿狗1带给我的感动。ebf5将木桶镇的优点全面放大、进化了。多的无法言表，玩过并喜欢阿猫阿狗1的都懂。

author: {'steamid': '76561198254909930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4648, 'last_played': 1697599446}
review: Super fun game! I really liked Epic Battle Fantasy 4, and this one has a lot of fun new changes. In particular, this new release makes character building more intuitive. This game is super fun. It's easy to learn, and playing on "hard" mode keeps it a good challenge level for me. I was delighted to learn that the maker of this game Matt Roszak was involved with childhood favorite games on sites like Kongregate, Armor Games, and Newgrounds. No wonder I love this game. It's funny, smart, and you'll get a lot of hours out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016001880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 7660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7327, 'last_played': 1551754365}
review:
You'll probably like this gameplay if you enjoyed Darkest Dungeon.  (though the game theme is completely opposite)

There is an epic mode, that provides a challenge.  On epic, you will actually have to put good thought into your strategy (gear and skills used) in order to beat certain enemies.  On normal mode, you'll probably only ever lose a couple hard boss fights in the entire game which may take around 40 hours to play through.

There's a few important gear items and summons that if you overlook, will make the game a lot lot harder.  Angry Faic item is  basically the only way in the game to turn someone into a tank otherwise enemies are just randomly attacking your more squishy characters.  And Ancient Monoliath summon becomes a critical summon to get survive huge attacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326345086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1666883252}
review:
超级好玩！
不过这游戏流程细节流派好多，原本打算正常难度到底的我依旧屈服了。变成零蛋+boss史诗。小怪好多。
boss基本上都是这样：极限技加buff，套复活，换人，咖啡咖啡换人咖啡复活咖啡咖啡换人咖啡极限技。
捕捉？那是什么啊我才不知道。
谜题都挺好玩的！有几个卡了我几个小时。解出来的时候很开心。
然后玩了30个小时左右的我还没通关，甚至略过了很多个支线。我原本还打算补完所有游戏的...Orz
以及恐怖的时候太恐怖啦！在地下室之类的地方心理压力超大的！
（换，换装也挺好玩的......娜塔莉太漂亮了。衣服穿着普遍比另一个好看）
（但另一个比较强）
（等等你们听我解释sdsdewfrvf

author: {'steamid': '76561198090119641', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1545549794}
review:
I am writing this review where I just beat Poseidon boss and reached the next area.

As an old fan of EBF, this game has really been a very anticipated one.
Ever since I saw the EBF series (1-3) on Kongregate, I immediately got hooked. 
EBF 1-2 was very fun because of all the parodies but 3 really took a different turn when it really beacame an RPG. Then after a few years, I saw Kupo released EBF 4. It was an improvement and a welcome one at that. Then after that, it got a steam version which I bought not long after to support Matt. I haven't played the steam version of EBF 4 much though. When I learned Matt was starting to make EBF 5, my excitement skyrocketed. 

Now that I am able to play EBF 5 on steam (SWF version), I can say that the exclusive content you put into it is LARGE. THe bonus dungeons, bosses, equipments, and of course puzzles makes the game a whole lot more fun. I really RECOMMEND to buy the paid version. The hall where you show the artwork of the fans is a big PLUS for me. It shows how much you care about your fans even adding dialogue to some of them. 

Of course the music and sound effects, are always as great as they always have been with a few additional new ones. 

Currently trying to get all badges to enter the last room in the Hall. Great job on the glitch areas and secret areas. And let's not forget the *cough*conspiracy*cough* in the basement.

Gameplay 8/10
Characters 7/10
Music 10/10
Story 7/10
Art 8/10
Overall enjoyment 9/10

No regrets buying this game. The 20% dicsount helped too =)

review: I remember finding these games online, not knowing how to equip against enemies and giving matt some donuts to boost his magic damage, playing this feels like nostalgia. This is your typical turn based rpg, but it's done so differently and it feels new and fresh. EBF 5 feels a lot smoother and cleaner unlike the last game, the annoying mana system being removed and the replacing it with cd is such a good change. The writing and the characters is good and keeps the game moving and entertaining. I could go on about how good this game is, just buy it! worth your money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198224536684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3795, 'last_played': 1551178896}
review:
史诗战斗幻想5真的是太好玩了！

无论是人物技能还是怪物的攻击都十分有趣，战斗策略的思考也十分多样化，游戏中充满了探索要素、打破常规的思考以及老套却有趣的解密，炫酷的极限技让我想起了当年萨菲罗斯毁天灭地的超新星，在游戏性上而言已经完全满足了我的个人需求。

BGM绝对是一大亮点！太棒了！我的腿抖个不停！

美术可爱而细腻，不同地区有着不同的战斗背景，而且角色对话中还有许许多多的neta和meta元素:-D。

主线剧情上没什么亮点，可爱的中庸，然而却无法遮盖主角们鲜明的角色魅力。

总之，我想说:
我  们  要  六  代！！！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198338936689', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1702292782}
review:
I NEED HELP 
我需要帮助，我遇到了黑屏的情况，就算卸载游戏重新安装还是黑屏，但是我换一台电脑就完全没问题，我玩了几十个小时准备对付最终BOSS，但是因为有事情我退出了一次游戏，重新开始游戏就发现黑屏了，一直没有办法解决。

所谓的黑屏是不能显示画面，比如进刚游戏有一个点击人偶的小游戏，我可以听到我点击人偶的声音，但是我却看不到画面，我可以凭记忆选择语言进入游戏，可以听到菜单界面的优美bgm，但是还是没有画面。
使用flash版本可以进入游戏正常玩，但是没有存档，让我难以接受。
我的系统是Windows10，也尝试过使用兼容模式运行、nVidia显卡运行，等等方法都不能正常使用。
此外我已经秃顶了所以不希望重新再打一遍 ORZ

不知道有没有人和我有一样的经历，希望能够得到解决吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198060519525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1616501278}
review:
A very good game and doesn't cost much, definitely worth your money and time... in fact, I think I enjoy this game a lot more than some triple A games I paid for 60 dollars

I remember I first played the series when I was younger at New Grou... wait, did I play them on New Ground, or Armour Games? Maybe Kongregate?
Crap, I can't remember, all I know is the series is getting better and better, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 probably is the best of the series. The already amazing Gameplay is polished even more, and more contents is added since previous entry.
The battle system is a little different than your typical RPG, equipment management is super crucial. All equipment can be leveled up to fit the current level of your progress.
Early game equipment still has usage depending on your build and the enemy you are fighting, their stats aren't inferior than the weapons you pick up later, they all have different usage and suit different situations. This force you to change equipment to fight different enemies (so you can't mindless power through foes), but also left enough freedom for players to test out different builds.
Last, Art is good, music is good, it's a fantastic game

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 11563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3086, 'last_played': 1604119172}
review:
You could argue either way whether this is "better" than EBF4, and it's certainly not as much of a step up from the previous games as 3 and 4 were. But it's certainly a strong RPG in its own right.

Most of the obvious changes are improvements and fix some of the flaws in the previous games, and I like the new character and the slightly-condensed skill selection. However, most bosses feel much weaker than I remember their equivalents being in the previous games, and regular enemies don't fare much better. The capture system is a mixed bag; capturing foes adds a bit of excitement and tension whenever you find a new baddie, and particularly in boss battles; but the summons themselves are slightly overpowered and way too numerous. Plus it feels like the bosses may have been watered down a little to accomodate it.

The content that's only available in the paid version is more spread out than in the previous game, which feels more organic than putting it all in one area. I think there's a bit more of it overall and it's a LOT more varied; it has some of the best dungeons in the game and the only boss I've seen so far which was actually challenging.

Overall, would recommend to fans of the previous games, or fans of turn based RPGs in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048154092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2047, 'last_played': 1573994086}
review:
[h1]Un grand OUI ![/h1]

Bonjour à tous et me revoilà pour une nouvelle recommandation ;)

Pour ce jeu c'est un grand OUI.

Voici un résumé pour ceux qui auraient la flemme de lire et je détaillerais plus loin pour ceux qui veulent réellement s'investir dans ce jeu et cet univers déjanté.

[u]Points positifs:[/u]
- Jeu RPG aux graphismes rétro/récent. Un mélange qui peut repousser certains mais que j'apprécie.
- Il y a une histoire, certes déjà vue pour beaucoup mais au moins il y en a une.
- Niveaux de difficulté intelligemment codés.
- Diversité des équipements.
- Présence de petites quêtes annexes (objets spécifiques à rapporter aux PNJ contre de l'équipement)
- Donjons Optionnels et donc Boss optionnels
- Univers loufoque ainsi que les personnages et leurs manière de communiquer entre eux et pendant les combats.
- Bande son vraiment sympa (j'aurais apprécié plus de musiques métal comme dans le 4. Cependant la musique électro/techno de cet opus est plaisant à entendre)
- Les références subtiles aux autres jeux vidéos bien connus.

[u]Points négatifs:[/u]
- Dans l'immédiat je n'en vois pas...



[b]Partie détaillée ;)[/b]

J'ai déjà joué a Epic Battle Fantasy (EBF) 3 et 4 sur "ArmorGame" et j'avais déjà accroché à cette période là.
Lorsque j'ai vu qu'il y avait eu un 5 j'ai naturellement sauté dessus. Je vais donc diviser mon "test" en différentes catégories afin que vous alliez chercher les infos qui vous intéressent directement dans la rubrique souhaitée ;)

[u]Les Personnages:[/u]

Les personnages s'élèvent au nombre total de 5. Ils sont tous différents, ils ont tous un équipement plus ou moins différents (valable pour les armes uniquement. Au niveau des armures, il y a la catégorie armure homme et armure femme).
Leur personnalité est différente, leur but est différent et leur motivation également. Bref, ils ont strictement rien à faire ensemble et pourtant ils combattent tous pour la même chose. A vous de découvrir pour quoi ;).
Pendant les combats, ces mêmes personnages vont interagir entre eux, répondre aux attaques des montres, se moquer des flops des autres, etc... Ca donne un coté vraiment vivant au jeu et montre surtout que le développeur du jeu n'a laissé passer aucun détails au hasard. 

[u]Les combats:[/u]

Les combats sont vraiment porté sur la stratégie. Après tout dépend de votre niveau de difficulté. Plus le niveau de difficulté sera faible, plus vous pourrez bourriner. Cependant, arrivé en mode normal, le bourrinage sera de moins en moins efficace et vous demandera de faire preuve de plus de réflexion. Equiper des armures et des armes en fonctions des ennemis pour avoir de l'immunité à tel élement ou au moins de la résistance. Equiper telle arme pour faire plus de dégât, etc... Le piège dans ce jeu, ce sont les effets bonus accordés par les équipements. Il serait tentant d'utiliser des équipement qui fournissent exclusivement des attaques passives pendant les combats, mais en faisant cela, vous vous mettrez en danger au niveau survie. En effet, les attaques passives (qui consistent à l'invocation gratuite d'un monstre ou à une contre-attaque) est trop aléatoire pour en profiter pleinement. De plus, l'utilisation de sorts bonus peu rapidement faire basculer le cours du combat. Augmenter votre esquive, diminuer celle de l'ennemi, lui faire porter la poisse ou augmenter votre chance, tout est bon pour remporter le combat, même si vous perdez un tour pour vous buffer et débuffer l'ennemi.
De plus, un système de capture à la "Pokémon" est de rigueur dans ce jeu. Chaque ennemi capturé pour être utilisé en tant qu'invocation payante via un jauge spéciale se remplissant au fur et à mesure que vous mettrez KO les monstres. Comme pour "Pokémon", vos chances d'enrôler un ennemi sera d'autant plus grande s'il a très peu de points de vie et en fonction de ses malus. (ASTUCES: combo idéal: Baisse d'esquive et malheur pour l'ennemi, augmentation de la précision et bonheur pour votre personnage en plus d'un équipement exclusivement composé de bonus capture).
En parlant de jauge, vous n'en n'aurez que 3 au total: votre santé, votre limite qui se remplie pendant que vous prenez des coups afin de libérer des attaques surpuissantes et votre jauge d'invocation ==> Pas de jauge de MP, en effet, tous les sorts et attaques spéciales sont illimitées !!! Mais vous devrez attendre X tours avant de les réutiliser x) Il y a une limite à la puissance quand même ;)
Pour aller plus loin dans les techniques de combat, je vous ai parlé d'utiliser un équipement adapté en fonction de l'ennemi, mais nos développeurs ont été suffisamment fourbes pour faire des combats avec double éléments: 3 ennemis d'eau sensible à la foudre avec 2 ennemis de foudre sensible à l'eau, sachant que ce qui va blesser l'un va régénérer l'autre. Et il y en a plein de combat comme ceux-là x)
Bref, voilà pour les combats, en gros, si vous voulez juste jouer et découvrir l'histoire, jouez dans une difficulté inférieur à "Normale". Si vous voulez faire parler votre coté stratège, jouez à partir de "Normal".

[u]Autres:[/u]

J'ai parlé des différentes références aux jeux vidéos que je vous laisse découvrir afin que vous ayez le même sentiment de nostalgie remonter en vous ^.^
Mais il y a aussi quelques références à des faits historiques assez osés: ne prenez pas la mouche, le jeu est avant tout un univers loufoque je vous le rappel.
De plus, les développeurs ont eu la belle idée de mettre une option dénommée "Contenu Adulte". Une fois coché, vous aurez affaire à un langage très familier, avec quelques insultes bien de chez nous et j'en passe. Décochez-le et... Je ne sais pas ce qu'il va se passer je n'ai pas testé ><

Ensuite que dire, le jeu se déroule un peu comme un métroïdvania, vous allez visiter beaucoup de zones différentes avec pas mal d'endroit que vous n'allez pas pouvoir visiter par manque d'un objets spécial vous permettant de vous déplacer plus loin. Cependant, ces mêmes objets spéciaux peuvent également être utilisés pour atteindre des zones cachés, arpenter des donjons optionnels renfermant pas mal d'équipement au détriment d'ennemis plus durs et de boss plus impitoyables ><



[u]Conclusion:[/u]

Il y a vraiment beaucoup à dire sur ce jeu. Mais franchement je vous le dis... Pour 12 € 49... Prenez-le aveuglément si vous êtes fan ou nostalgique de ce genre de jeu ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198286724664', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 375, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1711768889}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023474251', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4730, 'last_played': 1583217199}
review:
A well-polished sequel (gameplay-wise) to EBF4 that still is missing a few QoL features, but is otherwise an excellent turn-based JRPG. This entry into the Epic Battle Fantasy series is a soft reboot of the main games, where our four heroes - Matt, Natalie, Lance, Anna - and their [strike]lord and savior[/strike] pet cat NoLegs re-meet each other and [strike]l00t everything[/strike] save Earth from the invading cosmic monoliths.

So... story. I am horrible at saying if a story is objectively good or bad, but I will say it was a very entertaining narrative for my first playthrough, even taking itself seriously for at least a few hours. It took me 50 hours (somehow this game was supposed to be 30 hours according to the promo video on the store page...) to do most of the content in the game aside from a few chests I was missing and end-/post-game bosses. As is usual for this series at this point, expect many parodies of and references to games (not just JRPGs) and other forms of entertainment (anime being a rather obvious one).

The status effect combos (Chill+Wet = Freeze, [strike]Dry+Burn = Scorch[/strike] (I thought this was the case but as it turns out it is inflicted separately from Dry/Burn), Bad Luck+Doom = Instant Death, Good Luck+Death = Damage infliction + Stagger) and elemental damage increases from certain status effects are excellent ideas -- even if it's not unique (it probably isn't), it's the first time I've personally engaged heavily in something like it. I also really enjoyed stacking up buffs on the players and debuffs on the enemies (except against Flybots, f*ck those inverting b*stards). The game does allow for some build diversity with different equips, which I also invested a bit of time into (I dabbled in a physical-damage Anna with the Sharanga, Royal Crown, default Ranger Skirt, and War Paint accessory; a status-inflicting NoLegs with the Riot Shield Toy and Pirate Hat; and a defender Matt with Genji Armor (or Spartan Cuirass), Agnry Faic (later Target Badge), Lucky Clover, and Lightning Shard/Heaven's Gate during my first playthrough. Currently I am trying out a support Matt for the beginning of my Epic difficulty playthrough)

Graphically, the game is not breaking visual standards, though should it really at the expense of a good story and gameplay? The paper construction motif for the cutscenes was pretty nice though, and they make for some good wallpapers. (psst... if you buy the game check the install folder) In terms of music, Phyrnna returns to score EBF5 and she ended up with an absolutely stunning original soundtrack* to accompany the tides of turn-based battles.

*You can buy the soundtrack here on Steam as DLC for $5, but as I found out it is missing 1 track: Lacrimis ex Anima. (the optional dungeon theme, which is quite good imo) [url=https://music.phyrnna.com/album/the-music-of-epic-battle-fantasy-v-composers-cut]Her Bandcamp[/url] has the track though (#27), and you [i]could[/i] buy it for $1.

If there was something to criticiz(s)e, they are mostly UI issues. Things such as:
-SPOILER but also annoying once you realize it's happened to you: [spoiler]When Lance kidnaps Natalie from your party at No Man's Land, her extra Skills are returned to the shared pool, but her armor and flairs are not. In other words, Matt and NoLegs cannot equip the flairs she had on when you get ambushed by Lance's tank. Once Anna joins your party, she does not have access to whatever female armor Natz was wearing at the time. (until Natalie rejoins the party before fighting Lance) This could be fixed by addressing the next point...[/spoiler]
-You can't quick-switch/remove equipment. (...i know this can be misconstrued so pls i only mean in terms of gameplay) To switch equipment from person A to person B, you have to get person A to switch to a third equip, person B to switch to person A's old equip, then person A switches to person B's old equip. It takes more clicks than necessary, in other words. This minor complaint also extends to extra Skills and Limit Breaks.
-You can't have more than one copy of any individual Summon at once, even though some of them are used as crafting material for forging equipment. This one is actually kind of annoying if you don't remember where to find more of the material monster, and would be a way worse blight on the game if you were playing the free version, which does not have access to the Grand Gallery and Temple of Trials.
-You can't remove all Summons at once, nor switch an "in-use" Summon with a backup Summon. (only when moving from in-use to backup, not from backup to in-use) This is in the Summon main menu, not the Summon sub-menu in battle.
-There is no "Auto-Use" or "Use All" function for stat steroids. Especially since the game touts that there is "no need to save them for later", I'm surprised there was no "Use All" function. (Maybe if this was implemented replace the inventory with amount of steroids used)

All in all, though, EBF5 is a really great game and worth $15. Great story with a lot of self-/meta-aware humor from the characters, some build diversity, intricate turn-based JRPG gameplay, and marvelous music. Score spoiler: [spoiler]9/10[/spoiler]

Estimated time to finish first run: 45 hours (with side content done)
100% Achievement Completion time: possible in 60~70 hours if you play on Epic from the start, otherwise if you're like me and played on Normal the entire way through it would take a second playthrough, meaning an additional 60~70 hours.

EDIT: How could I forget the performance disaster of EBF4 and not consider it when playing this? Well, I did tweak something at the beginning of my playthrough: I bumped the process's priority in Task Manager to above normal (dunno if that did anything though, lol). The performance of EBF5 is leagues better than 4 for me, even when running on [strike]"Ultra" Anti-Aliasing[/strike] (I guess it's just "high" AA now) @ 800p window size (whatever the hell this resolution actually is...), rarely dipping into "running noticeably slow" territory.

EDIT 2: As I'm going through another playthrough to get the Epic difficulty medals, I realized that I really under-appreciated out-of-battle HP regen. It's a subtle, yet very effective way of cutting out menuing between fights to heal and cure statuses (although cooldowns still take a while to recover if they're >5 turns). I also under-appreciated the fact that there's no "random" encounters, only ones that you're supposed to fight because they block your path and they provide much-needed EXP. (I did most if not all the side-encounters anyway, which is worth it since the loot from the side paths are valuable enough to partake in another battle)

review: I really love the humor and style of this game, and the characters are appealing and funny. I have always been a fan of turn based RPGs, and this one is no different. It has collectibles, unlocks, and I am going to try and "100%" it. This game can be a casual game to just have fun with for casual players, or a game for advanced strategies for those who wish to play it with a challenge. The difficulties are fair, and the puzzles are challenging, and overall, I love the games. It was fun playing EBF1 and EBF2, but I loved the style of EBF3 and was worried it was the last game. Then I found EBF4 and was excited for 5, and it delivered. Keep it up Kupo Games, and keep making awesome games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080264555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3070, 'last_played': 1680810108}
review:
Whew, and i thought that EBF4 was a massive leap forward. Turns out, there was so much more to explore in the series, and here it is.

EBF5 takes what was great in EBF4 and amplified it. Fighting along with the elemental debuffs became satisfying. Combat system was reworked from mana to cooldowns, making choices much more meaningful especially if you're doing an epic difficulty run. Summons became an entire bestiary of things to choose from rather than spamming Ancient Monolyth to get out of basically anything. Characters now have clear strengths and weaknesses and switching to backup doesn't feel pointless or forced anymore. The silly nature of storyline and character interactions got turned up to 11.

There's a few flaws there as well. Luckily, they don't damage the overall experience with the game at all.

As i'm writing this review, i am sitting at 53 hours of gameplay (more like 50 because i AFK'd a bit), and i'm still not finished.

If you liked the previous games, you will like this one as well.

If you didn't play them, you can begin there and you will not feel lost because of not knowing what happened in other games.

tl;dr

+ good money spent to hours of gameplay ratio
+ great soundtrack; also there's some of the tracks from previous games if you feel nostalgic
+ meaningful choices, actual strategy and many builds to try
+ if you love the art style of this game you will feel satisfied as you explore new areas, find new stuff and foes
+ the usual silly plot of EBF but even better and more overboard, and you can tone it down in settings if you don't like the "naughty" stuff

- gameplay gets too slow and repetitive at some points
- sometimes the pop culture references can be too much
- random FPS drops, but that might be my PC's fault

author: {'steamid': '76561198083880494', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1550022028}
review:
Wow, I was expecting a cute little RPG and I was surprised by its depth. Skill trees, combo's (Turn based combat), studying your enemy with scan to see its weakness before going in guns blazing. Costume and weapon changes reflected on the screen and all up-gradable. The writing is amusing, lots of digs at video games of the past, the mobs themselves are varied enough and do not pop up at random like those RPGmaker games you see everywhere. They are often there to block access to chests or paths.
Three hours went by super fast I hardly noticed but I stopped there to sleep and make a review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998777939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1574893900}
review: While most of EBF 5 is a long-awaited continuation for long-time fans of the franchise, I wish I could track down whoever recorded that voice saying "Fail" whenever my party gets wiped out & stick my thumbs in his eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812731470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1690997456}
review:
I never actually review any game ever in my life, so watch me completely fail to persuade people here:

The gameplay is really classic as I can tell. You can move around with WASD or arrow keys, and interact with stuff using spacebar. Alternatively, use mouse to move around and interact. Easy to learn 5/5 stars!

The battle mechanics can be quite a hassle if you are not used with RPG and stuff, though. Not to mention, EBF5 is kinda unique itself, where it has it's own unique status problems, resistance, level-based stats, equipments, skills cooldown, tactics (e.g. backups, capture, scan) etc. Luckily, the game did a decent job on explaining it through the hint pop-ups, the characters and NPCs dialogue. I also noticed that the game gave you an option where you can turn off the hints and such, to let you explore by yourself. For your information, I'm an old player of this series, so it's not a big problem for me to learn some of the new mechanics. But for those new players, I think this is still a little-very-tiny-bit overwhelming. Loved the new battle mechanics, though 4/5 stars!

Soundtracks is perfect, I mean REALLY perfect. The soundtrack fits really well with the battle and the biome. Also loved the fact where Phyrnna aka. Halcyonic Falcon X used some of the old song as a sample (or totally remix it) in newer tracks. As usual, the final boss always has it's own theme and it's always perfect. I can't commentate enough about the soundtracks, since I don't think I have the rights to judge such angelic beats, 5/5 stars!

Spoilers: I really loved the new storyline in which we [spoiler] play in the same universe, same character, yet with completely erased memory, despite the fact that they already know each other well in the previous game. Turns out, something is bugging out with the game, and trying to recreate the game completely by "deleting" the party as the first step. As the plan fail, the "thing" escapes the game to the higher dimension aka. real world [/spoiler]. It kinda breaks the 4th wall though, so it might be a little bit creepy for some people, including me. Also, worth the notice for some people that it explains some of the party backstories here, some of them are quite sad while the others are very happy. Nonetheless, it's pretty dark and lighthearted at the same time, 4/5 stars!

Artstyle is not something I should complain, but it looks comparably a lot better than EBF4 where the color pick is quite rigid, resulting in a not lively-looking game. But this time, it looks so much better! 5/5 stars.

Miscellaneous stuff: There is a total of 102 achievement which you can hunt down (some are really easy, while the other might be really hard), 164 different foes which you can scan and/or capture, 15 challenging and puzzling bosses (if I counted correctly), +200 gears which can be used stylishly or tactically, 35 NPC's sidequests, and more! Took me 60 hours to completely finish the game (all achievements, finished story, all foes and bosses scanned and/or captured, all equipments, etc.), with bossfights took the longest (strategizing equipment and skills, battle formation, trial and errors). Ended up looking at walkthrough once at optional extra boss aka. [spoiler] the Neon Valhalla [/spoiler].


1 gues5 tha@t's a(error:#0201)?l I can s!7, 65^/5 star-(NOT FOUND #12)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054350862', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1550373004}
review:
So here we are, with the Fifth Installment of the EBF series and I have to say...

-Grows beard- I'm starting to feel reeeeaaaaaaaally old, right about now. Has it really been this long? It feels like just the other day when I first saw mats EBF animations, and to know that we've come this far is nothing short of amazing. Good work bro, I've always enjoyed your games and art, and I hope you give yourself the well-deserved rest you earned after this game. 

EBF is something that I grew up with, to be honest. Back in the day when Matt was just making flash animations or even his odd flash games (anyone remember the spacebar challenge?) I'd always find his art style ridiculously cool, and he even inspired me to try and take up my hand at drawing for awhile. Too bad I didn't have much talent, but hey -- It was inspiration nontheless.

This game is basically a love-letter to RPG's (Especially FF) practically everywhere, and is chuck full of references to modern culture, and other video games. It's a game that doesn't take itself seriously, and that lends well to the atmosphere it tries to promote. Skills are over-the-top anime-style, or just creatively hilarious (like Matt using his sword as a boomerang) that makes you grin from ear to ear as they spout out their cheesy lines. 

Anyways, onto the actual review.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Matt's brought the formula we love, and has improved upon it even further with some interesting new mechanics that will keep you on your toes. One thing to majorly talk about is the addition of the capture system, which is an incredibly fun mini-game that has actual battle benefits. Being able to capture bosses and minions as summons? Absolute genius. It's funny, and hilarious. 

The addition of No-Legs as a playable character was interesting, and to be honest, I didn't know what he could possibly offer to the party that the other four didn't already, but Matt has shown a layer of creativity with No-Legs that I find pretty astonishing. He's basically a wild-card fighter, and can be seen as a jack-of-all-trades to really round out any party, as well as being a formidable fighter.  

The battle system has also went an overhaul. Instead of actions costing MP, we now have cooldowns, and at first I didn't think i'd like it due to not being able to buff-stack anymore, but it kind of helps promote a more active gameplay style that I've slowly come around to enjoy. Being able to dump big-skills is great, but you also have to think about the cooldowns now. It's an interesting consideration, and only ups the strategy layer. 

[h1]Music[/h1]

HalcyonicFalconX AKA Phyrnna has done it again. Honestly, she brings a touch of magic to Matt's games that I could go volumes about. I was sort of antsy about the new battle theme, but with time I came around to it. While admittedly this game's music feels a *little* odd, in the sense that it's 'lighter' than the other games, it's not a bad change, it's just different. We've come a long way from songs like twins of duality, or chase theme which are tracks I still listen to even this day. 

Keep up the good work, you two. You've done an absolutely fantastic job so far.

[h1]Closing Thoughts[/h1]

It's great fun. Not going to lie, I'll admit that i'm somewhat saddened by the length of the game. For what's supposed to be a 30-hour's worth of content RPG, it feels like it took a very long time to surface. I remember when EB5's development started. I remember thinking that this was going to be the literal magnum opus of Matt's games, and while I still think it is, I can't help but sort of be sad. 

Knowing that i'll have to wait a long time for more fun adventures from Matt and Crew (if I get to see any more atl all) kind of breaks my heart. I really wish the Author would consider making a web-comic or something, because there's some major chemistry here about these loveable characters that I'm sure would spread like wildfire over the internet if given a proper chance.

Anyways, I appreciate Matt's time and dedication to bringing us another excellent installment, and I look forward to any other plans he might have in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364917388', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5693, 'last_played': 1639150689}
review:
[h1] 别翻评论排雷了——买就完事了！ [/h1]
你说你是EBF的老粉丝？ 主角团一如既往的吐槽役绝对让你梦回青春重返18岁，地图界面的简介以及标记系统的优化绝对让你能更轻松地探索秘密，战斗系统的进一步完善绝对能让你更酣畅淋漓地刷怪，新增的各具特色的Boss绝对能让你内心的挑战欲望欲火重燃，新增的探索要素绝对能让你的旅途更增趣味
你说你是刚接触EBF系列的新玩家？ 性格鲜明，人设饱满的主角团让你告别粗制滥造的RPG中的三无主人公，战斗系统的丰富能让经历无数钟回合制游戏的你眼前一亮，史诗成就带来的挑战令你对RPG游戏策略的思考更加活跃，[strike] 大量的解密元素让你直接气到退款[/strike]
总之，如果你喜欢回合制的策略游戏，还不希望像隔壁工具人地牢那样硬核，那么剧情轻松[spoiler] 邪教元素 [/spoiler]，战斗简单[spoiler] 石化！断奶！禁械！七重地狱！ [/spoiler]，画风萌系[spoiler] ４０４ [/spoiler]的EBF系列绝对是你的不二之选！
最后，能有EBF６的话。。。。。。那我再来吹爆一波！

author: {'steamid': '76561198028725379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1629051696}
review:
Been a fan since the flash games on Newgrounds/Kongregate! If you don't know, this series of games is a love letter to older turn based RPGs. Fight things, level up, find new gear with different effects and mix and match to make your ideal party build. 

A very solid upgrade from EBF 4 in pretty much every respect and it truly is the small details that make all the difference. 

- There's more shades of color in the art that gives everything a smoother, vibrant look.
- Bosses get visibly more beat up the less HP they (no other game I know of aside from Final Fantasy Mystic Quest did this!)
- Cool down system in place of MP takes a little getting used to but works very well and gives each character a more unique feel 
- New buffs/debuffs and combos are very rewarding 
- There were one or two music tracks I didn't like in 4, but I like them all in 5 including a remix of one I didn't like in 4 
- Catching summons system didn't feel tacked on like I first thought it would, challenging but fair and I've tried to catch EVERYTHING. Great range of abilities to mess with.
- Story pacing is better. In 4, I started to get "rpg fatigue" just before Godcat, haven't hit that wall here yet!
- Battle system quality of life improvements: As long as you haven't gone yet, you can switch a party member out with one in the back and not use up a turn. Party members in back heal slowly. Party buff spells apply to everyone, even members in back.
- Of course, all the easter eggs (the gravestones are always fun to read, RIP Golden Sun)

Excellent job Matt. Very worthy sequel in every respect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066554218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2341, 'last_played': 1699684013}
review:
Like Epic Battle Fantasy 4, but with more content and a better fighting system. Obviously a love letter to earlier Final Fantasy games, it does its job increbibly well. It has one of the best turn based battle systems that i've played in a while, and I play a lot of turn based battle systems.

Story leaves a fair bit to be desired, Wasn't particularly happy that one of the Party members is a literal fascist.

review: Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a freaking amazing sequel to one of my favourite video game series. I discovered ebf3 when I was bored and needed flash games to play and the series has come so far. The cooldowns system is executed very well, and I much prefer it over the old SP system. Trying to catch the bosses can be very hard sometimes but not impossible and the captures system is very well done, and I love being able to use almost any enemy you can encounter against the other enemies. 10/10 gr8 game would playthrough 7 times again

author: {'steamid': '76561198110278688', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 9295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9152, 'last_played': 1693365204}
review:
ถ้าคุณชอบการผจญภัยแบบสหายร่วมผจญภัยแบบเฮฮา สบายๆ ซีเรียสบ้าง
หรืออยากเล่นเกม turn-based-RPG ที่เข้าใจง่าย แต่มีระบบที่แปลกใหม่ 
ไม่ควรพลาดเกมนี้ครับ
[u]จุดเด่น[/u]
-เนื้อเรื่องเป็นมิตรกับคนเล่นใหม่(ไม่ต้องเล่นภาคเก่ามาก่อน เพราะภาคนี้รีบูตเนื้อเรื่องใหม่)
-เนื้อเรื่องการผจญภัยจะมีสีสันตลอดทาง เฮฮาบ้าง ซีเรียสบ้าง
-ระบบต่อสู้ turn-based มีความสร้างสรรค์ โดยมีระบบ กริยาธาตุ สถานะทางกาย สถานะพิเศษ(สถานะบางอย่างไม่คิดว่าจะมีในเกมนี้ด้วย) สภาพอากาศ แต่สามารถเข้าใจได้ง่าย คนไม่เก่งเกมแนว turn-based (อย่างผม) ยังเล่นได้
- เราสามารถจับมอนเตอร์ที่กำลังเราสู้ได้ (จับได้แม้กระทั่งบอส) และสามารถอัญเชิญมาช่วยเราสู้ได้
- ฉากจะมีการออกแบบให้ย้อนกลับไปได้ หรือย้อนกลับมาสำรวจเมื่อพร้อม และถ้าช่างสังเกต หรือขยันแวะฟาร์มก็ยิ่งได้ของดี 
- เพลงประกอบทำได้ดี

[u]จุดด้อย[/u](จริงๆมีเยอะกว่านี้แต่ผู้พัฒนาแก้ใน Update V2.0 แล้วจนหาข้อด้อยให้แทบไม่ได้เลย)
- มอนเตอร์บางตัวอาจจะเป็นตัวเดิมแต่เปลี่ยนดีไซน์เล็กน้อยๆและธาตุเฉยๆ
- สำหรับสายเก็บ Achievement (มีสปอยเล็กน้อย) [spoiler] ถ้าเล่นเกมจบแล้วจะเก็บ Achievement ต้อง New games ใหม่อย่างเดียว เพราะว่าถ้าเล่นจบแล้วตัวเกมจะตัดจบแล้วเริ่ม Newgame+ เลย ซึ่งโหมด New game+ จะทำ Achievement ไม่ได้ [/spoiler]

[u]ควรชื้อช่วงไหนดี[/u]
ถ้าสนใจจริงๆ ผมแนะนำให้จัดราคาเต็มไปเลย คุ้มแน่นอน
หรือถ้าไม่แน่ใจก็รอลดราคา (น่าจะเหลือ 200 กว่าๆ )

author: {'steamid': '76561198125391725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4156, 'last_played': 1550544557}
review:
伝統的な、いわゆるRPG
成長システム、戦闘システム、スキルの構成が秀逸で、戦闘が延々ずっと面白い。

属性相性、バフ・デバフ、ステータス異常の重要性の高いゲームで、一度スキャンした敵の情報は常時見れるので、耐性とにらめっこしながら数ターン分の戦略を立てるのが楽しい。控えのキャラとターン消費無しで交代できるので、全員を使った戦略の組み立てが容易で、プレイしているうちに自然と「こいつは何属性担当、あいつはバッステ撒き、とどめはこいつにバフをかけて…」と分担が出来てくる。そうなると今度は、持っている装備を全部ひっくり返して、新たな戦略の可能性を模索したくなる。あんまり注目してなかった固有スキルが強いような気がしてくる。そういう全てが延々ずっと楽しい。

ストーリーと世界観はというと、基本的にブラックジョークとゲームオタクあるあるネタとパロディとメタネタで出来ていて、人を選ぶっちゃ選ぶんだけど、逆にストーリーもクソも無いだけ人を選ばないような気もする。メタネタも安易な寒いやつじゃなくて、一貫して作り込まれてて面白い。

キャラクターやアートワークは緩いので、最初ちょっと「えっ、雑…」と思ったけれど、プレイしているうちに、決してクオリティが低いわけではなく、むしろ雑っぽいテイストで統一された良デザインだと気付く。キャラクターに関しては細かい差分やアニメーションまで良く作り込まれていて、そいつらがいちいち軽口を叩くのが楽しくて見飽きない。

あと個人的な趣味だけど、主人公がメチャクチャかわいい。それはもう、かわいい。


ともかく王道RPGなので、RPGが好きな人は是非ともお薦めしたい。
ストーリーやキャラは邪道だけど、システムやバランスは高水準な王道と言って間違いない。
強いて言えば、RPGを散々プレイしてきたRPG好き以外には多少とっついにくいかも知れないけれども。

author: {'steamid': '76561198128759859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1638300350}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966565361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5009, 'last_played': 1574038953}
review: This is just a wonderful game. Lighthearted and fun with challenging battles and a very nice progression system. I think what I like the most is seeing your characters improve. You'll get your butt kicked by a criiter and then go grind for a bit, upgrade your skills and equipment go back and be pleasently surprised at how easy the same critter has become. The grind amount is well balanced with the reward amount. That's some good Skinner Effect right there Mr. Roszak  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041862889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1681, 'last_played': 1710122097}
review:
I'd found out about this series at Epic Battle Fantasy 4. Having played its earlier series, I can say that this game shows a great deal of learned polish. And it's a shiny polish.

There's actually a story. It's full of jokes and potshots at other popular game styles, but there really is a story and it's connected to prior games. You don't have to have played the prior titles to enjoy this, but it will add to the experience.

Balance is great - allowing multiple difficulty selections. I've been playing on the hardest difficulty from the start - it's a real struggle to beat some of the stronger enemies. It encourages you to play smart, to use tactics instead of using every character to "this hits the hardest". The author has also taken steps to lessen the 'cheap tricks' used to cheese the game - such as some stuff I used in the last game (stat growth abuses).

Phyrnna makes another return creating music in this game. I've found songs by this artist very enjoyable, they add a unique charm that helps add presence to each game's area. There are other enhancements in this game that makes this music be more enjoyable over the previous titles, such as more reliably continuing from the last position of the previously active song. It's a small thing, but keeps you from hearing the same start-sequences over and over again.

This is worth the playthrough for a breath of fresh air. It's also a pleasure to see the progress this indie developer has made.

review: 我是一个从3代开始追过来的玩家，当初玩3代的时候一上手就被这款游戏深深吸引了，有趣的对话，印象深刻的怪物，萌萌的史莱姆，还有技能、换装、解谜、小游戏。当初3代为了刷全成就小游戏玩到吐血。。。等到4代出了以后一通宵推完主线，然后慢慢刷全成就，虽然正版现在还没刷满。。。5代的剧情我就不剧透了，喜欢RPG的玩家我希望你们可以试试，前面打的几个BOSS都没开史诗难度，为了成就我打算重开一轮全史诗难度挑战一番。感谢作者Matt，如果出6代的话我会继续支持的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119642552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 49297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1711998465}
review:
Review of Epic Battle Fantasy 5
Overall- After waiting for a few years for the much anticipated sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy 4, we finally have it and admittedly while it has many good traits, it lacks in some small areas that make it feel less then perfect.

Characters- While the main protagonist isn't the most relateable guy ever, he's still one that we may know someone like him from time to time. Matt started off on an adventure to go see what made him lose his electricity, which spirals into meeting new people and fighting monsters. He is great at using single target attacks, thankfully he covers most elements in the game.
	Like every feline that man knows up to now, NoLegs is a capable cat warrior to an extent, while having twice the evasion, his lower health pool puts a slight damper on him being reliable when survival comes into play. However his status effects and group revival comes in handy in desperate times.
	Natalie and her beautiful........stature, her ability to cast magic spells and heal her fellow teammates is very useful throughout the entire adventure. It was interesting to actually see her get temporarily kidnapped by Lance in the story, it made me realize how useful she was, plus it gave us a reason to invade Lance's fortress to begin with.
	Anna, for a young archer she's surprisingly strong and covers many of the water, ice and thunder elements, while she did lack fire I easily made up for it. Its nice to have another female in the group, and since she comes in when Natalie is kidnapped it helps make up for the loss of dps output.
	Lance, running with the theme he had when we first meet him in Adventure Story where he kidnaps Natalie there which leads to him joining in Epic Battle Fantasy 3. Its nice he's still the same pervert we'll know to watch out for. Also if you need bombs he's your go to guy plus the Aid Kit was  useful when Natalie's healing was on cool down.

Level Design
	The one thing the EBF series, at least 3, 4, and 5 have is great level design and puzzles that sometimes even left me in a tizzy and having to look up the answers. Chests hidden in every nook and cranny, it was definitely fun to keep your eyes peeled especially for the "sparkles" where extra items could be found.
	I always hated the ice and how slippery it could be but when you get the ice boots it becomes so much easier so I thank you for that.

Enemies
	There are many varieties of enemies in the game, from slimes to dragons, though admittedly there's more variety of just one kind of enemy instead of new enemies so I'm on the fence about this one. For example there were at least five different kinds of the new enemy Chompers, which was fine but kinda became boring after awhile.
	There was a special reacurring enemy, Chibi Knight, who comes out of left field around the Mystic Woods, however I wish there was more reason to fight her to begin with then what the enemy info gave explanation to.

Bosses
	Decent bosses this time around from Jotun the cyclops at the beginning to the Devourer in the end. Though one thing the fans were kinda hoping (or at least I was) to see older bosses come back and revamped, like Akron at the very least. I feel like he got the short end of the straw in his game, cause even on Epic difficulty he was easier then the three headed Pyrohydra you fight just an hour before.
	I may be biased here since I liked EBF 3 the most, for how adorable the game was, even when it wasn't the best or polished it was since it was the first game to actually have an actual story.

Building Relations between the Characters
	While the characters in the game do talk to each other it feels kinda empty, the main building of the group was put at the end in the credits when you defeat the final boss which is fine but we wanted more during the actual game. No one is perfect I suppose.

Weapons
	I feel like certain weapons I didn't bother using at all due to them not fitting any situation that I was in, I barely used the Chopper sword for Matt, Alchemy Set/ the Knife for Natalie, Green Goliath for Lance, Eagle Eye/Fenrir's Jaw/Alchemy Bow for Anna, and the Buster Sword for NoLegs to name a few throughout my entire playthrough. 

Medals = Rewards
	The one thing EBF 3 had was the extra areas that were available once you collected enough medals or achievements in the game, EBF 5 has done it as well but in the form of the Grand Gallery where not only treasure but all the enemies in the game can be found and captured if you missed them anywhere else. Definitely useful if you want to collect them all. The last room which you have to have ALL 102 medals (edit: 133 now) wasn't as satisfying to see as I thought it would be, the guard before you have all the medals even says there's not much, which sucks since Matt could've easily put a revamped version of the final boss fights in there as a treat to older players, it would've been interesting to fight Akron and Godcat on Epic mode just to test out mettle. Hopefully he might reconsider this as an idea for a potential update since he recently gave EBF4 an update. Fingers crossed.

Music
	Ah the music, Phyrnna has always made good music in these games, from Akron's final battle to the humble music you listen to during almost every fight in EBF 5. Hell there was even some creepy moments in the game that made my skin crawl. I hope she gets as much support as possible.

Final Words
	In the end EBF 5 was a great game to play and record for my youtube channel, there won't be a sixth game since Matt put a tombstone in the game that says " Here lies Epic Battle Fantasy 6 and all those who ask about it."

	What Matt Rozsak will do now with his time since EBF has come to a close is up to him but we hope he will be successful with whatever he comes up with.

I give EBF 5 a 8 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828223073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1581864382}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy - это серия JRPG, которая выпускается одним человеком - Мэттом Росзаком. И эта серия с каждой частью становится всё лучше и лучше. 5-ая часть вышла для меня неожиданно, но от этого только приятнее, ведь игра бомбезная.
30+ часов простенького но не скучного сюжета, шуточек да отсылочек, головоломок, и что самое главное - боёв.
Бои здесь невероятно увлекательные и заставляют подумать, т.к.  тупо рашить и по кд юзать самый крутой скилл тут не выйдет, к середине игры нужно учитывать кучу факторов, чтобы эффективно сражаться.
Музыка, несмотря на свой оригинальный стиль, мне особо не зашла, ну т.е она хороша, но я бы не стал слушать её отдельно от игры.
Также очень приятно, что в 5-ой части наконец вышла русская локализация, причём нормальная, которую реально приятно читать.
В общем, если вы любитель бодрых JRPG, эта игра просто создана для вас, если же нет, то всё равно дайте этой игре шанс, т.к благодаря этой игре я полюбил этот жанр.
9 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129123979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 4651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1684827318}
review:
ВоВ-ан скатился а Свитор кроме сюжетки ничем не вставляет? Тимейты в Дноте 2 хуже чем пауки под кофеином? Но при всём этом ты любитель J-RPG?
Тогда ты по адресу братан/сеструха.
В те бородатые времена, когда в бывших странах Союза Игростанция 1 была столь же редкой как скажем Ламборджини, некие представители из страны не любящей гайдзинов, одной трудолюбивой конторке удалось склепать 7 по счёту Последнюю Фантазию. Почему 7? Да я то откуда блин знаю, не ниппонец же. Вот с ёё выходом и можно сказать пошла нехилая волна популяризации таких игрулек. 
Довольно истории, перейдем к разбору полётов:
-Геймплей. Приятный, удобный, понятный. Рубай мышкой или клавишами. Если так получилось что игрулю хочется но закос по Финалку тебя смущает то спешу обрадовать. Таких злодерючих заданий/врагов/загадок и т.д и т.п не встретяться, всё мило, весело и чутка отбито на кукуху.
-Персонажи. Ну в принципе даже в рамках сетинга калоритные. Главный герой а по совместительству пират-ниндзя лутер-клептоман Мэтт. Владеет хокейной клюшкой (коей умеет пользоваться), пиратским прикидом и неуемным аппетитом(серьезно, хотел сожрать следующего компаньона). Самовлюблен, крут, но при всём этом обладает мозгом хлебушка. Котик БезЛап(не обманывайтесь, лапками орудует быстро и наверняка). Котэ в рыцарских доспехах, любитель рыбки, халявы, ударов в спину и хтоничных лемитов(серьёзно, лемиты кота самые криповые). Натали - рыжий маг(отсылка к красным магам в той же Финалке). Колдует огонь, лёд, молнии, при должной сноровке вдаряет стихийными эффектами своего посоха(что может быть крайне полезно, если при этом удасться обвешать цель дебафами).Если очень попросить согласна похилять ваших попаданцев совершив выход в  эротическом белье(к своему явному неудовольствию и под дружное одобрение остальных, включая следующую мадам). Анна - друид но не эльф(что не мешает  призывать огромного энта который начинает дико нагибать брёвнами вражин). Умеет стрелять из лука разными стрелами, травить врагов, любить природу и всяких кавайных зверушек. Ну и последний но не по значимости Лэнс. Нацист, характер стойкий, нордический. Вероятно в детстве бывал бит отцом откуда впрочем дальше только дедушке Фрейду больше известно Похищал женщин ради своих низменных потребностей, строил империю. Но как всегда, не получилось не фартануло. Имеет в арсенале кучу средств массвого поражения включая убойнейший танк(первая втреча с которым чуть не становиться последней).
-Бой. Ну что говорить про бой? Пошаговый, без всяких инициатив и прочих половых извращений. Есть стихии, есть резисты к ним. Сканируйте, думайте, бейте, качайте умения и станьте папкой/мамкой. А да, чуть не забыл. Некоторых врагов(особенно изрядно потрёпанных) можно поймать в клетки, и запускать в следующих битвах аки покемонов. На это расходуется Очки Призыва. Честно говоря пару таких покемонов лихо меняют бой в вашу пользу. Например волшебное зеркало которое при должной сноровке станет для вас Сайтамой, или же кавайный слайм-кролик накинет регенерацию хп в начале каждого хода.
-Снаряжение. У-у этого добра тут как и положено: МНОГА! Просто Д-О-Х-Р-Е-Н-А! Так же как и абилки прокачивается за лут который вы набили с монстров. Если лута не хватило всегда можно завернуть в ближайший магазин и отовариться нужным. Некоторые материалы редкие, потому прийдеться побегать. Так же хочется отметить систему хавчика, тут тебе и постоянные бафы(стероиды) на всякие характеристики, и подхил с ресом аки Phoenix Down. 
-Мир. Довольно не маленький. Есть телепорты, обходные пути в старые локации. Есть даже свой дворец достижений(посетите когда соберете всех 5 приключенцев). 
-Итог. Что можно сказать в конце? Игра хорошая, весёлая, мальца пошловатая но ничего сверх меры. Нет скучных персонажей или неинтересных мест. Любой поворот может подвалить приключений. Из минусов то что в так называемых подземельях не дают очков опыта, золота или ресурсов, что я вообще не понимаю каким местом логично ибо в конце после лютых махачей залутаный шмот нуждается в последующей прокачке. Отличнейший саундтрек не даст заскучать. 
10 позирующих Натали в нижнем белье "только ради бафов" из 10.

review:
As an avid player of EBF3, EBF4, Adventure Story, and the Bullet Heaven games, this game by Matt takes the cake. No unnecessary grinding is needed but the game doesn't feel like a cake walk. Loving the more mature themes as well!

Only complaint: [spoiler] Anna is a lot more childish in this game verses EBF4, which (to me) is a total switch up of her personality, and I really liked mature Anna. But considering this is my only complaint, I'm more than happy to deal with it! :D [/spoiler]
