author: {'steamid': '76561198447301976', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 25268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3701, 'last_played': 1707579110}
review:
que decir de este game despues de 68 horas , una de las sagas rpg que mas me han gustado, a pesar de que las habilidades no cuestan mana (que fue una opcion muy buena) , y  algunas de las habilidades no se pueden usar por varios turnos  no significa que sea un juego facil, se pone bastante complicado, 20 de las horas jugadas fueron para intentar la medalla de 10M de daño que esta bien complicada de conseguir, me gusto mucho el metodo de captura de criaturas y bosses al mejor estilo Pokemon, y sus millones de chistes, a veces malos y sus referencias como la del goku  que gasto su maldito deseo en puro oro  o donde dice que "aqui yacen los sueños de un epic battle fantasy 6" o algo asi que ya no recuerdo, conoci esta saga de juegos desde el ebf3 en el navegador hace unos cuantos años, algunos dirian que al ser  una saga bastante larga termina por aburrir pero con esta  no fue asi, plantearon una especie de "Reboot" al hacer que los personajes no se conocieran entre si  para luego revelar al final que el pulpo rojo volador gigante  les habia hecho perder la memoria , 
tiene una historia muy buena, con muy divertidas referencias, y en dificultades altas se vuelve muy complicado, 
uno de los mejores de mi biblioteca, super recomendado y mas aun si les gustan los juegos tipo rpg  XD

(edit: no son 68 horas sino  66.2 xD)
(Edit 2: creo que es de las reseñas mas largas que he escrito )
(edit 3: ahora son 390 horas :0

author: {'steamid': '76561198881816010', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1548098691}
review:
If you've played the previous ones, this one is every bit as good. Go ahead and grab it.

If you haven't, and like mid-2000s style internet humor/references and refined menu based combat, you should give it a go. 

It's a very lovingly crafted game. The art and animations are fun. The humor will probably make you roll your eyes at times, but, if you're anything like me, you'll be grinning while you do. The music consistently adds to the atmosphere, switching between generic JRPG songs, some techno beats, and even just atmospheric sounds in a couple of parts. The maps are drawn with a ton of detail and treasure lurking in every nook and cranny. The story is mostly there to parody, but it did what it set out to do quite well.

The combat is the best incarnation of simple menu-based JRPG that I've played. Buffs, debuffs, statuses, etc. all matter and the game is well balanced. I'd generally prefer some sort of action or addintional tactical elements (SRPG style) thrown in, though. I played the game on Hard difficulty, which managed to provide consistent challenge and require attention to detail, without feeling unfair. 

It took me a little over 40 hours to beat the game, with a significant amount spent on exploration and a decent bit on optional puzzles. I ended up leaving portions of one side dungeon and several quests unfinished. In retrospect, I would have enjoyed the last act more if I'd spent less time on optional content, but I think that's more down to my preferences than anything else.

That said,  it's an unequivocal recommendation if you're at all interested in this style of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049644259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1548018141}
review:
EBF is a long-loved series of mine, every time a new EBF's out, I have had the habit of starting the game and get ready for a good time. EBF5 was not much difference, it was a pretty decent game. Not as much as I hoped, but it stick to the franchise's theme and has some of its own charm.

That said, 1 thing ruined the entire experience for me, that's the capture system. Basically it go against everything that made the franchise good. It's so bad even the characters complain about it!

To me EBF was a feel-good, curiousity-inducing game where you would spend some dozen hours in and you could 100% it. It brings great satisfaction to see you've "completed" these little gems. Not so with EBF5. I couldn't finish it.

The capturing system started ridiculously difficult at the start of the game. Without much explanation, you're faced with capturable, missable bosses. Then as you gain knowledge and - more importantly - capture equipments it get stupidly easy and turn into a chore. And then at the end of game it turn into RNG-based burden resulting in lots of save/load.

Got a huge limit break ready that can easily wipe the group? Nope gotta hit them with a branch to capture.

Tutorial mention stacking effect for exponential damage? Lul I'm having trouble *reducing* my damage here.

Finally stack enough debuff on the boss for capture? "Hi it's me the randomly-appearing lil'bear! Watch me slap the heck out of this feeble boss!"

In the end I got frustrated and quit the game, couldn't finish it.

Aside from the capturing, EBF5 started having a lot of meta, franchise-based dialogues. I don't really like it since it shows that EBF has started becoming a "franchise". Meaning EBF6 will be less a game by itself and more "A EBF". And probably by 7 or 8 we'll get another game that just suck off its ancestors' glory with 1% content and 99% reminiscence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042576627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8179, 'last_played': 1619115650}
review:
A very splendid sequel to a great series.
 
Great story, fun gameplay mechanics & battles, immersive soundtrack, cool references to pop culture and Grade A acting for the characters.

I have to say that the game is pretty worth the time and effort to 100%, worth the wait when I heard of its development early 2016 and worth every penny just like EB4 (Sorry Matt, You gave me a coupon so I had to use it. :D ). Kudos to Matt and everyone who helped him make yet another great game.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000797183', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1607285356}
review:
Another great installment in the Epic Battle Fantasy series by Matt Roszak. If you are not familiar with the series they are side scrolling turn based JRPGs with plenty of pop culture humor, Easter eggs, and cats. 

EBF5 takes it up a notch being able to capture foes and then summon them in battle. It makes for fun trying to "catch them all". 

I also like that MP for some of the more powerful skills was replaced with cooldowns. Fun swapping characters in and out of the front line to maximize their attacks and limit breaks, and it keeps the dialogue between them from getting stale. 

First play through was just over 30 hours but it could have been more if I took my time. Huge map with caves to explore and puzzles galore. Story was a change of pace from the typical good vs evil thing. Plenty of achievements to be had as well (over 100!) so I will probably do another play through and take the difficulty up a notch.

My favorite EBF game so far and I can't wait for the next one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134255276', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8144, 'last_played': 1590320256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198282335679', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 878, 'playtime_forever': 3915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3248, 'last_played': 1561873422}
review:
沒有令老玩家失望的遊戲, 幾乎所有地方都比預想中更好。
今次的故事起點是由大家不認識開始, 所以新玩家也能放心地玩。

偷東西可以由頭偷到尾, 連法師都可以做小偷, 要儲材料比以前易得多。(但也變得很浪費時間。)
敵人全都可以抓起來當召喚獸, 包括王。(不小心殺掉王, 讀檔重打, 又浪費時間。)

最不好的地方是, 有些技能要冷卻時間, 補血不能連續補, 遇到殺傷力高的敵人時, 變得很危險。貓咪的復活技能冷卻要等10回合, 10回合夠你死10次...

現在最令我搞不清楚的地方是, 有些成就要求用史詩難度打死各Boss, 如果在主線故事時用其它難度殺掉了, 以後還能解嗎? 我查過討論區, New Game+時殺他們, 是不計數的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198252959565', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1621773182}
review:
未クリア（ファイル選択画面でのプレイ時間16時間11分、
[spoiler]いかだを入手して神殿の裏口を見つけたところまで[/spoiler]ですが）

[h1]どんなゲーム？[/h1]
カナダ出身イギリス在住のMatt Roszak氏が制作したRPGシリーズの5作目。
製作者のホームページ上でパブリックベータ版がプレイ可能。

[h1]このゲームの良い所[/h1]
[list]
[*]装備品が豊富な上に、万能な装備が殆どない。
[*]キャラクターや背景が細かいところまで描き込まれている。
[*]戦闘が単調じゃない。（属性をしっかり考えないとザコ相手でもあっさり負ける）
[*]救出されたはずのNPCが何故かずっと牢屋の中にいる事がない。
（一部のNPCはダンジョンクリア後などに移動する。）
[*]UIが親切。戦闘中に最近使ったスキルの使用やキャラクターの順番切り替えがワンクリックで出来る。
[*]音楽の出来が非常に良い。
（しかも3の神曲であるEstaviusがエリア限定だが2バージョン聞ける。
[spoiler] オルゴールアレンジバージョンはワープゾーンで、
オリジナルバージョンはアンナの家の前にあるラジカセをいじると聞ける。[/spoiler]）
[*]シリーズ作品で初めて日本語に対応していて、翻訳の質が非常に良い。
（16時間やっても誤訳が見つからなかった。）
[/list]

[h1]このゲームの気になった所[/h1]
[b]特になし。[/b]

[h1]自分の評価[/h1]
10点満点で15点ぐらいあげたいけど
[b]10/10(絶対やるべき)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198140571756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 11688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5635, 'last_played': 1641947866}
review:
This game is a lot of fun!  It's a bit like the older turn-based RPGs: there are a ton of secrets and puzzles to solve, and there a lot of different equips that actually affect gameplay a lot.  In fact, you'll need to master understanding your equipment, because you ARE overpowered, you just need to figure out HOW.  I love the visuals.  Heroes and baddies alike are charming and fun.  I especially like the different weapon and armor designs, and how certain combinations will change to create unique aesthetics.  There are lots of jokes too.

Compared to previous EBF games, this one has much more content.  The v2 update has a lot of new areas, enemies, flairs and achievements.  It also introduces monster cards which influence gold drops, chance to capture monsters, summoning points and damage dealt by summons.  Overall, highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141267933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2755, 'last_played': 1691446324}
review:
Been waiting for this game for years, and i can say it was well worth it. I thought 4 was an amazing game (replayed it and 3 quite a few times) and had high expectations for 5, but this game exceeded them greatly.
a large map dense with secrets, interesting new mechanics, and challenging puzzles.
having no legs as a playable character seemed a bit odd to me before 5 came out, but after playing a run- he's probably one of the best teammembers in the game. not overpowered, but very flexible build-wise.
If an EBF 6 where to never happen, i feel like this game would make an honourable closer to a series ive (and many others) enjoyed playing for the last 10 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132557605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 9249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2121, 'last_played': 1656455620}
review:
Roszak hasn't skimped on content or style. Really gets my dopamine cooking.

Improved in every way from predecessors.Tactics deeper (more statuses), writing funny, puzzles harder (moving blocks), battles tougher (especially in optional areas). Those who enjoy EBF4 will surely enjoy this. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198377504480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5547, 'last_played': 1548778568}
review:
Проходил 3 и 4 часть игры. И вот 5 вышла. 
Впечатления по порядку: 
1) Ура! Русский язык! 
2) Ура! Не маны! 
3) Ура! Они трясутся! (только сегодня узнал что на заставке тоже) 
Теперь касательно отрицательных: 
Захотелось собрать все медали в игре, вот что получилось (дабы перейти к обоснованной критике читайте с "Короче впечатление такое"): 
Прокачал персонажей до 40 уровня, собрал самую оптимальную экипировку, напокупал и использовал усилители (которые с каждой покупкой возрастают в цене вдвое), пошёл к финальному боссу, с горем пополам сломал монолит... и ВСЯ моя команда была разнесенна ПЕРВЫМ ходом противника! 
Попробовал другие варианты, пошёл сражатся для получения других медалей на эпической сложности. Итог почти тот же. Мне даже возможности не дают построить стратегию разнося персонажей так словно я не качал им всё что можно и не лез в каждый квадратик в игре. 
Короче впечатление такое: 
Хотите получить все достижения в игре? Получите все простые медали, дойдите до конца, начинайте ОЧЕНЬ долго и нудно гриндить самого злачного моба в игре чтоб набить пёс знает какой высокий уровень и накопить ОГРОМНЫЕ деньги на усиления дабы получить вообще неизвестно что. Поначалу я тянул на любопытстве, но оно бытро сменилось скукой. 
Я придираюсь? Да! Если бы в игре был хоть намёк на баланс. 
Знаете какая разница между минимальной сложностью и максимальной? Её нет! Совсем нет! Медали единственное ради чего стоит играть на эпической сложности. А пока ваше прохождение их не затрагивает можно на минималках играть. Если бы за повышение сложности давали соответственно увеличенную награду. 
Что ещё? На NewGame+ вам не дадут медали за эпическую сложность. 
Я уже молчу про то что в игре есть испытания и очень сильные противники за победу над которыми вам дадут (один раз) только скудный лут и никакого опыта или хотя бы денег. 
Обращаюсь к разработчикам. Если вы это читаете (хотя я сильно сомневаюсь) сделайте хоть что нибудь. Из-за таких проблем интерес к игре быстро гаснет к концу. 
Дайте игрокам возможность развивать персонажей дальше а не ставьте в тупик в конце игры. NewGame+ это хорошая функция но из-за ограничений нет смысла даже начинать заново. Игрок ничего не получит за это. Надеюсь ко мне прислушаются.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009830872', 'num_games_owned': 2282, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3333, 'last_played': 1574836783}
review:
Пройдя вдоль, поперек, слегка по диагонали, собрав все очивки, убив всех подряд, можно и ревьюху. Если кратко - отличная.
Великолепный пример инкрементированного развития толковых задумок в нужном направлении, досыпания того, что стоит насыпать, и постоянной работы над ошибками. То, что в 2008 (не помню уж точно, старый стал) выглядело как откровенный рипофф фекалочки, на что слаборазвитым школьникам может намекнуть даже название, выросло в полне самобытную серию со своими фичами.
Незаменимая формула про тех же щей и пожоще влей отбивает автору зарплату год уже, наверное, третий. По прежнему радует глаз Наташка, переодевая которую в разные шмотки, кормя ее перцами и кастуя 7th Heaven, можно снимать ацки сочные скриншоты для обоин на десктоп. Мэтт все также тупит и лупит всех клюшкой и отпускает шутеечки. Ланс, несмотря на обшую правую направленность, остается правильным пацаном. Анна стреляет из лука в разные стороны и лелеет зверюшек.
Все те же узнаваемые вражины, жесткие боссы, секретики, обшаривание мышой экрана в посках сныканных сундуков - все на месте. Квесты, труселя, стероиды - тоже. Добавили кота и ,возможно, саммонов, которых я не помню в 4й части эпопеи. Отлично нарисованные вставочки в духе "Аппликация в детском саду" радуют глаз и умиляют суровых ветеранов. Музычка, в целом есть, и местами даже не надоедает, а наоборот - заставляет купить себе OST. Багов не встретил, разве что при переносе сейва с компа на комп, медальки ухитряются потеряться, поэтому не будьте как я - жмите бэкап сэйв и будет вам щастье.
Если предыдущие игоря (которые можно бесплатно погонять на флеш помойках) понравились - срочно покупать и гонять. Если нет, то с сайтика автора можно стянуть фриварную версию без допольнительных абоссов, данженов и очивок совершенно бесплатно.
P.S. Замечательный пример того, как хобби, начавшееся на флеше и, ЕМНИП, ньюграундсе, при приложении времени, сил и упорства, превращается в постоянный, и судя по патреону автора, неплохой заработок. Он там на сайтике еще описывает довольно длинную историю о том, как он выкладывал 4ю или 3ю часть в стим и жутко боялся что всем будет как всегда. Радует, что вышло наоборот. Жду 6ю часть изо всех сил, чего и вам желаю.

review: I've played just about every game in the series, and personally to me this one is the best. The combat system is fantastic, the graphics are a huge improvement even though they retain their origonal style and uniqueness, the dialogue is funny beyond belief, and all the referneces are just "perfect" - Cell      with so many acheivements to get, including many which force you to challenge your skills and smarts at this game, there is a lot of play time to be had. The customization is crazy good. Good luck hunting for all the chests and hidden loot. That alone could take days of playtime. This little game has so much packed into it. Worth buying and supporting for sure!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055425148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3462, 'last_played': 1635078674}
review:
EBF5 offers a deep and polished turn-based RPG experience that rivals the classics of the genre in terms of sheer moment-to-moment fun. It's an easy recommend both to players new to the series and RPGs in general, who will appreciate its accessibility and wonderfully designed world, and to hardcore strategists that like complex battle systems. The only real disclaimer is that players looking for a final fantasy style epic story won't find it here - the story is silly and often hilarious but mainly functions to give your team an excuse to traverse the world beating up everything that moves.

To fans of the series, the formula is familiar: you journey around a tiled world map tackling one themed region after another in linear order, fighting battles in between. The design on the world zones is as great as ever, with each screen being densely packed with battles, treasures, and secret areas and paths with secret treasures. You can just run through the critical path if you like and still see the whole world, but it's most rewarding to search around everywhere you go for hidden interactables. As the open world slowly unravels on the map screen, you can see how it all fits together and there's a huge incentive to investigate every new area.

The biggest changes from EBF4 come in the battle system, and they're mostly ones for the better. MP is scrapped for skill cooldown times, allowing you to always use the most appropriate skill for the occasion. I found the best change to be to the characters - all 5 characters are balanced really well and gain exp whether they're used in battle or not, encouraging you to actually use all of them when they best fit the particular battle you're in. This system makes battles so much more varied and dynamic that most RPGs, where you stick with one team and neglect the others.

Battles themselves start simple in the beginning of the game, but new skills, weapons and armours are fed to the player throughout the journey and by midgame you can experiement with buffs, debuffs, statuses, elements, limit breaks, counterattacks etc. Those looking for a challenge (and I mean a real challenge) and fighting bosses on Epic will need to precisely juggle all of these. For the rest, normal difficulty is surmountable but rewarding; however, I did find by the very endgame even normal was frustrating on some battles. I ended up fighting the final boss and some of the optinal bosses on easy, since spending upwards of 30 minutes on a boss with the risk of failing and having to restart felt unfair.

Another small problem I had was the level-scaling. Only enemies in some (mostly optional) areas scale to your level, and considering that the way stats scale up makes enemies even a few levels below you a pushover, I can see why they were designed this way. But it still feels like being punished for levelling up when you know the enemies have gotten a lot stronger too. Speaking of enemies though, the design in terms of both graphics and AI of nearly every enemy in the game is pretty immaculate. Learning every opponent's carefully designed attacks and weaknesses, and using the knowledge to plan how each battle goes, is almost puzzle-like, and one of the best parts of the game.

Overall, there's a truckload of content here, occasionally to the point where it's overwhelming (eg. the sheer number of equips). A quickish playthrough might be 30 hours and a complete one 50, or even much more if you want every single achievement. The extra dungeons available on the Steam version are a lot of fun, especially for EBF veterans, but aren't 100% essential. The Kongregate version will come out when Matt feels like it (maybe mid/late 2019??) so for now this is the place to play. I didn't even mention the writing but there's jokes and memes galore. Highly recommend to anyone interested in this kind of game.

To the devs if they're reading this: really enjoyed following the development of this for like 2 years (!). Thanks for another great entry in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271377713', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5203, 'last_played': 1681245932}
review:
[i]Bom, quando eu estava fazendo a analise deste jogo, aconteceu um problema e eu perdi todo o texto que eu escrevi, então eu vou resumir....[/i]

Com pelo menos 80 horas de jogo e todas as conquistas, posso dizer que é um jogo excepcional.
[list] 
[*]Poder capturar inimigos e aniquilar chefes poderosos na dificuldade Épica é um grande desafio que se torna bem recompensador;

[*]Jogo lindo com ótimos gráficos e segredos espalhados por todo o jogo;

[*]Várias referências espalhadas ente equipamentos medalhas e principalmente pelas falas dos personagens;

[*]Diálogos engraçados e às vezes meio inúteis, mas que sempre te animam a jogar mais;

[*]As músicas são as melhores da série Epic Battle Fantasy;

[*]Chefes opcionais extremamente difíceis!

[spoiler]\\\\ Vencer Deus é uma tarefa quase impossível...
E capturar é ainda pior... ////[/spoiler]
[/list]

O único problema do jogo é a repetição, principalmente quando aparece um inimigo obrigatório 3 passos depois de outro inimigo obrigatório num corredor estreito...

Porém ter zerado este jogo foi uma grande conquista que valeu cada momento! [strike](Esse jogo trava até em um PC relativamente bom.)[/strike]

Então, eu só posso dizer....

[b]COMPRA LOGO O JOGO, POIS VALE CADA MOMENTO!!![/b]

[h1]Nota Final: 9000+ / 10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198133722665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4559, 'last_played': 1702834668}
review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy series has been a childhood pastime of mine ever since I discovered EBF 3 on Kongregate. From the humorous dialogue, to the many hidden secrets, to the intense strategy required for epic mode, this game was a heck of a ride and probably Roszak's best game yet.

The story was definitely a step up from previous EBF games. The dialogue and flavor text was as hilarious as ever, with my favorite line being from a report in den of a conspiracy theorists referencing Alex Jones's "turning the frogs gay" comment. I really enjoyed the arc with [spoiler] Lance as the main villain, since his regime [/spoiler] provided an urgent threat and a mini-climax of the story earlier on in the game rather than only building up to the climax at the very end. I also enjoyed Matt's occasional fourth-wall breaking since it fleshed out his character in comparison to his dumb muscle portrayal in previous games. I also found that part near the end where the people you did quests for come to help and encourage the party very heartwarming, The last phase of the final boss fight [spoiler] where the Devourer deletes the world, becomes an epic race against time that [/spoiler] was really enjoyable.

The side areas were also really well done. The areas with the [spoiler] cultists who speak in Morse Code and jewels from EBF 4 [/spoiler] were creepy as all hell, and that little sidequest unlocked a nice homage to Toby Fox's Undertale, another great indie game. The [spoiler] glitched areas [/spoiler] likewise unlocked a beefed up and more epic version of a secret bonus boss from EBF 4, [spoiler] the glitch boss. [/spoiler] The bonus dungeons were a difficult and enjoyable challenge, (especially the bosses, fuck Neon Valhalla though), and the puzzles were also a lot more complex than before. (If you find them too complex and don't want to miss any loot, look online for the solution.) The Grand Gallery also has a bunch of fanart, which really demonstrates Roszak's regard for his fans,

Gameplay-wise, I found most of the changes from EBF 4 to be an improvement. I really enjoyed capturing almost every foe in the game, since it gave more options to the player. The new steroid system encourages usage of all 5 team members, a solid improvement over EBF 4, in which most people would dump all their attack steroids to Matt and all their magic boosting steroids to Natalie. I felt that mana became mostly pointless in the lategame in EBF 4 (unless fighting clay idols or mage birds) and that their EBF 5 replacement, cooldowns, were much more strategic. I was more on the fence about the buff system, since buffs didn't stack, making debuffing enemies a pain. I can, however, see why it was implemented, since it encourages switching out players. Difficulty ranges from super casual (Zero) to pretty freaking hard (Epic). I also love that for even long-time veterans of the series such as myself who are at home on Epic mode, there are still bosses that will wreck you on the first attempt, such as Neon Valhalla, [spoiler] God, and the Devourer. [/spoiler] The weather system also added an interesting, though somewhat trivial, aspect to gameplay.

The music was better than EBF 4, though I am not sure if it beats EBF 3. Some of my favorites include "Those of Us Who Blossom," "Never Falter," "Snowdrift on the Cloud Edge," "Fight the Movement," and "dU5k M3Igb VkgN Wsxbg" (yes that is a song title). Even if you don't particularly like the OST, chances are that you won't dislike it either; it will just be there in the background. I also loved all of the radios that you could interact with for throwback songs; it produces feelings of nostalgia for previous games.

Not everything came out exactly perfect; there were a few slight mishaps as well as issues I would like to see addressed in a future update. The call to adventure for Matt came off as somewhat awkward. A gameplay complaint I have seen people voice is that enemy stats outpace the growth of the party's stats. Although that is true, equipment forging, skill upgrading, and steroid usage will more than counterbalance that for MOST of the game. However, for level 37+ or so, I would like to see equal stat growth. [spoiler] The final boss's visual design looked somewhat similar in appearance to an enemy from previous installments in the series (The Beholder);  it was still a fun fight regardless. [/spoiler]  Also, in a future update, I would love to see maybe a second floor in the grand gallery with rooms for 70, 75, 80, 90, and 100 medals, since going from a 60 medal room to a 102 medal room is a bit awkward. Finally, I would love to see an Evil Player boss rush. 

For long-time fans of the EBF series, this is a must buy. For newcomers to the series, I invite you to check this game out. If you're on the fence, play EBF 3, it's free on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154246772', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 8529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3986, 'last_played': 1602200350}
review:
Ok, so after 50 hours of my life wasted on this game I think I'm ready to make a review on it. I'm gonna list the good and bad things I think about this game.

Lets start with the bad things:

The Skills; I don't think the skills are bad, I mean the way you can get better skills. In EBF4 you get to keep your weaker skills but in EBF5 those weaker skills evolve into the full version of the skill, so you lose the original skill.

The New 7th Heaven; I'm just not a fan of the new art for it. It's creative but I just like the original better.

Art Changes; Just like 7th Heaven, some art got changed. Again, I like the original over the new art.

The Story; I'm really not a fan of the story. The fact that all the characters don't know each other when they meetup isn't what I was expecting from the story.

Now lets move on to the good things;

New Content; Anything new that got added can be a major key to help you in the story. Some might clothes or weapons might look useless but could actually end up helping you.

Steam Only Areas; These areas are really well made and I just wish there was more. I know that there was some DLC stuff for EBF4 but it wasn't much, (If I remember correctly) but in this game there are areas and tons of new clothes, flairs, and bosses.

Holiday Events; During 4 holidays there will be events and you can get limited time only items. (ofc you can hack these in, but it will ruin the fun)

Capturing Enemies; You can capture enemies in this game, including some bosses. This will help you MAJORLY depending on how you use the enemies you've captured. (I just caught any I could.)

Surrender; Instead of forcing to kill your enemy, they can surrender and flee when low enough

Even with all the things I don't like, I still love this game. I've been waiting for this to come out for a pretty long time now and it was definitely worth $15. Any fans of the EBF series will love this game and I would recommend the full version over the free version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083679405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6101, 'last_played': 1645739420}
review:
I've been a fan of the EBF series since 2011, back on Kongregate, and I believe EBF5 is the perfect continuation to the series. In essence, it's still the same two-dimensional turn-based RPG as EBF4 and all it's predecessors, including flash game nostalgia, but with a long list of quality of life improvements. This includes the ability to skip just about any menu or cutscene interation, although it's not like you'd want to miss the unique and beautiful artstyle of the world and characters.
Gameplay has been optimized in such a way that you can have your kids breeze through the game in under ten hours on the lowest difficulty, with adult content like blood censored of course, or spend 70 or more hours completing every achievement and medal on Epic difficulty and abusing the combat system to ludicrous effect. Collecting each of the summonable foes is practically a game unto itself.
One of the key features of the game is the newly fleshed out characters and story, which helps connect the player to the struggles of the five playable characters. Also adding to the wider appeal of the game is the expanded languages available, which is no small task for smaller indie games to accomplish. Speaking of things that Indie games rarely do, the soundtrack is an incredible work by Phyrnna, and deserves praise for how it remains catchy and fun to listen to even after hearing it for a hundred hours, to say nothing of the emotion it can bring out when it wants to.

Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is an aproachable game for any age and skill level, and is full of secrets and easter eggs. I strongly recommend it to anyone that has enjoyed the 2D Final Fantasy games, Earthbound, Undertale or Pokemon.

review: Humor,Epickie wymagające walki,Przyjemna fabuła,Bardzo grywalna to słowa jakie śmiało określają  najnowsze EBF. Serdecznie polecam fanom rpgów turowych :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119744524', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 5473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2477, 'last_played': 1636574765}
review:
Asi es como todos los juegos triple A deberian ser: Entretenido, desafiante, interesante, lleno de secretos y easter eggs, un juego dinamico, con muchisimos cambios respecto a la anterior entrega, un juego que se puede jugar sin haber jugado los anteriores, con una trama simple pero entretenida y graciosa, personajes originales y muchas risas a los cliches de los juegos, honestamente no tiene desperdicio, es bueno para jugarlo de manera casual o si buscas un desafio siempre podes probar en la dificultad epica.

El contenido de fin de juego es basto, con diferentes desafios respecto a los jefes y determinados enemigos, zonas ocultas y diferentes logros que requieren jugar de determinada manera o incluso re-jugar la partida (ya sea desde un NG o un NG+)

La musica es buenisima, el soundtrack de los jefes si da gusto, variedad de equipos, mecanicas y momentos graciosos.

Un "must buy" si te interesan los rpg por turno similares a final fantasy o a darkest dungeon (mas a este ultimo que al primero)

author: {'steamid': '76561198088598365', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3730, 'last_played': 1653441135}
review:
Very passionate, witty developer with a knack for realising what he's good at and consistently outputting more and more of that. And unlike buckets and buckets of skittles, you never find yourself saying "well, that's too much of the same stuff". You'd think after the fifth installation of the (mostly) same characters, the (mostly) same enemy types, the (mostly) same elemental-based RPG system, it'd get old. It really doesn't.

I enjoyed EBF1 and 2 as turn-based RPG games originally on Newgrounds. It was a cool duo of flash games to play when you're bored. When EBF3 came out, and I realised I had a world map to explore, characters to level up and gear to get instead of an already-maxed-out RPG fight-engine experience, I became hooked. But I never enjoyed playing those games on browsers....

So the decision to boot the games over to Steam was phenomenal. I don't know what's wrong with me, but booting games up on Steam and earning Steam achievements is my motivation to play a lot of my games.

Matt Roszak has branded his own image, based on typical JRPG tropes and characteristics. You can see a lot of the characters in this game in other genres if you go play his flash games, including a bullet-hell game and a QTE game. 

Enough of the context. Here's the summary:

It's a turn based fantasy adventure, as you'd expect. You may think "wow, that's totally original, never seen that one before" and I'd be on your side. But the charm and care, the humour and references combine into an homage that singles itself as something new, something familiar and something reliable. 
It plays out like a normal JRPG. You fight monsters (not randomly, thank Godcat), you level up - you get stronger. You venture weird and wonderful realms, you slave away for NPCs who stand in one spot and command you to get stuff.

If you're a fan of JRPGs and turn-based combat, you may look at the art-style and go "wow, this looks so trash" and as a result denote it as drab, boring, or potentially easy. But there's a lot of depth in this game. And each instalment adds in new mechanics that change up the game DRASTICALLY. In EBF3, it was pretty basic, but the whole appeal was (aside from being able to use Lance) acting like a standard RPG as I mentioned before. EBF4 added in a prime new character, a deeper story, the backup system, end-end-game content and NG+, more status effects and elements, and this one adds in summons, weather which affects statuses between turns, and removes a chore: mana, instead implementing more cooldowns for more moves, which previously, the 'good' moves would just give a negative debuff to the user.
You'll warm up to it, even if from the get-go it looks lacklustre. I personally enjoy the art style and the humour, and there's a huge difficulty curve on bosses if you play on epic.

One thing I didn't like about this game were amount of shared skills there were, it's a cool feature but it was annoying to be able to dedicate a true 'healer'. The equips, especially the flairs in this game are amazing, though, so it offsets nicely. I wish you didn't have to use captured monsters as materials for upgrading, and I wish you couldn't catch bosses. It made me painstakingly have to re-fight each boss on both Zero and Epic, for the capture and achievement respectively, and it burns my completionist complex where I've been collecting one of each monster, just to have that monster now be a gap in my Bestiary in terms of capture, then I have to go back and catch an extra.

The haste mechanic is nice, but it feels like the Viking Monolith ends up being an end-all solution to summoning. I'd rarely.. just rarely... find myself using any 50 SP+ Summons because I may not have SP for Viking Monolith, or I need SP for Stumpy Gloop or Slime Bunny.
I think the summon system needs work, a good idea would you'd be able to have two non-backup monster slots and you could summon specific monsters to help fight in some way.

A solid experience. I'm 50 hours in, and I still need to do the [spoiler]Dark version fights and God fight[/spoiler] on Epic. I've gotten close... but I wish there were more strategies to those fights other than set guides I've seen online. It feels like on Epic the fights just overwhelm you with constant nukes and AoE, and you can't cover all the elements through resistances.

The 'equip' function during battle [i]would[/i] come in handy here if it didn't consume a turn. I get it'd be really unbalanced to be able to change equipment on a whim - maybe you can only change one equip per turn, and any more than that consumes your turn? According to the devlog Matt wanted to take this feature out completely but it was contested highly, I'm not sure why though.

Overall, a charming, funny, solid experience. It's not game of the year, and it's not the best story-wise, but it doesn't try to be. It offers a nice amount of content, surprising depth, and differs enough from other instalments to warrant its pricetag. 

I'd recommend it to anyone who has time to spend on turn-based RPGs, and I love the developer to bits, so please check out Kupo Games and Matt's humble beginnings.

Looking forward to future releases.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009136493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6515, 'last_played': 1663121329}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is great.  If you're on the fence about buying, go try Epic Battle Fantasy 3, which is free.  EBF5 is just like number 3, only longer, cleaner, and better.

EBF3 is a microcosm of RPGs.  It has all the grinding, questing, leveling, and boss fighting, condensed down into a 5-10 hour experience.  EBF4 built on those concepts, and EBF5 is a full 40 title in its own right, retaining the charm and appeal of the original without ever feeling bloated or excessive.

EBF5 is light on story compared to a 'traditional' RPG.  That's not to say the story is bad, but rather it's simple with archetypical characters and tried-and-true save the world plotline.  The story serves the function it needs to, being well executed without ever getting in the way.  There is a lot of jokey/humorous dialogue which, along with the art style, helps set the tone of the game as light hearted and fun.

The reletive de-emphasis on story allows for the game to focus more heavily on, well, gameplay.  The combat is turn based tactical perfection, being widely diverse in both player options and enemy abilities without ever feeling excessive or confusing.  A variable difficulty setting allows the player to adjust challenge at any time, ranging from very simple to maximum abuse.  Getting the medals on Epic difficulty is fun, and a worthy challenge that never feels like it's deliberately wasting the player's time.  There are a lot of strategic options to explore and play around with, and often a switch in approach is what it takes to make a seemingly impossible challenge beatable.

I had a lot of fun with EBF5, and if you're still reading this, I think you will too.  Give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140310054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2228, 'last_played': 1654576046}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a drawn, turn based, RPG featuring many easter eggs, puzzles, a long list of different enemies and bosses, and your typical armor/weapon/consumables scattered throughout the map. This game allows you to play casually at lower difficulty settings while the higher difficulty settings require more strategy and thought to how you approach an encounter. I highly reccomend anyone looking to play a new RPG to consider buying EBF5 or any previous installment of the game

PS: I easily played this game for over 40 hours without exhuasting all the content that the game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057784485', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2923, 'last_played': 1589124495}
review:
Maravilloso RPG, el mejor de su saga, desde mi opinión y hasta que no saquen el 6, si has jugado a los anteriores, esto muy probablemente te encantará.

La nueva dinámica de capturar monstruos, está muy bien introducida, esto te permiten expandir tu arsenal hasta confines inimaginables. Y los locos efectos climáticos provocan giros inesperados, tanto para bien como para mal, en los combates, que ofrecen una experiencia bastante desafiante, obligándote, siempre ha explotar las debilidades enemigas y encontrar la manera de sobrevivir a las embestidas enemigas.

Los puzles, en su mayoría optativos, pero con grandes recompensas, son desafiantes, pero no amargantes, al principio costaría, pero al cabo de unos minutos empezarás ver la solución.

La historia, engancha desde el principio, y es muy fácil empatizar con los personajes. No hay conversación que no te saque alguna risa, sobretodo, para aquellos que llevamos desde los 90 con los videojuegos.

La banda sonora, esta al mismo nivel que el juego, hermosa y muy inspiradora, perfecta para combates de proporciones épicas.

En general, un juego perfecto, donde emoción, desafío y epicidad están en armonía creando una experiencia de juego única.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000781856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1582055054}
review:
I'll have to admit: I am awfully biased. I've played this series ever since the first version showed up on newgrounds and I've loved it ever since. 

With that out of the way: This game is a beautiful combination of the gameplay of those old JRPG games (The name's similarity to Final Fantasy is not a coincidence) and a whimsical art style that shows you what to expect of the series. It's self-aware enough to realize the ridiculous nature of the adventure itself, yet it has a sense of excitement and wonder that is lost on a lot of the new games. There's pop-culture references and easter eggs all throughout the series taken to silly proportions. This instalment even extended its summon system to become a Pokemon-style capture system, meaning you can capture most enemies and use them in battle. 

This game rewards you for nearly everything. When you search every nook and cranny you'll find a tremendous amount of materials, weapons, outfits, and in some cases even extreme easter eggs. There is not one but multiple "glitch" areas hidden for those who seek it. There's a mansion that offers additional rewards based on the amount of achievements you've obtained. There's hidden chests with just the tiniest outline of their shape peeking out from the trees for the keen-eyed gamers looking for extra loot. 

This game is perfect for people who love the old turn-based RPG games. It has this almost childish sense of fun sprinkled all over. It is silly to the point where you can click certain squishy things to make them wobble. You can walk through walls in some areas just to get to a secret chest. You can put on a fake mustache that allows you to steal materials from monsters in battle by just attacking. And somehow, despite all its silly gimmicks, it is still an epic adventure with tons of amazingly awesome monsters and a wonderful combat system. 

If you're familiar with the series and want to know how it measures up to the previous one: You can now capture foes which scans them and also makes them available as summons, which has a huge variety of possible effects available to the whole team. No-legs is also a playable character now filling the Rogue-type of character, and his main gimmick is being able to finish off enemies who have low hp and moving on to a new target on the same turn. As for story and gear and such... It's a lot of what you're used to. Weird effects all over the place, tons of old favorites are back as usual. Doesn't seem like there's a tremendous amount of new stuff on that front, but it's still as fun as the last one. 

It's not crazy long unless you're a completionist, but it's definitely worth every penny of its current pricetag. You don't need to wait for a sale for this one, but if you catch it on sale it's really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076859069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 10308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3742, 'last_played': 1588005959}
review:
Great game! The characters, gameplay, music, and art are all awesome!

My favourite thing is the combat system - it's very complex and gives you tons of things to consider for every boss. Figuring out a strategy and equipment loadout before every hard fight is one of the most fun things in the game for me. It's super rewarding whenever you use status effects (of which there are a lot) well and turn a very hard fight int a relatively easy one - it's happened a few times that I had trouble with a boss but then changed my strategy and won immediately. The game feels a lot like XCOM or similar games when thinking about equipment or what to do during your turn. Overall, the combat in EBF is probably my favourite among all JRPG's I've played.

Note that I've been playing on Epic. If you're playing on one of the lower difficulties, you don't necessarily need to spend loads of time on figuring out your strategy and loadout, so don't be worried if the above paragraph sounded scary to you.

Matt Roszak - great job! I've been a fan of your games for a while now. I hope you keep making awesome stuff!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088384258', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2921, 'last_played': 1650618855}
review:
J'ai reçu le jeu gratuitement car j'ai participé à la traduction en Français (je rappelle qu'il s'agit d'une version "premium" et qu'une version gratuite existe sur les sites de jeux flash).
J'ai toujours été fan de cette série, mais comme cet opus est (en gros) un reboot, ça ne devrait pas géner de commencer par celui-ci. Il apporte d'ailleurs de nouvelles mécaniques (cooldown de certains sorts plutot qu'une barre de magie, des tas de nouveaux effets de statut...), et la diversité de composition des vagues ennemies rend les combats bien moins lassant que dans un JRPG classique.
L'histoire et les dialogues ont quelques moments de sérieux qui justifient le "Epic" dans le titre, mais on est plus souvent sur un ton très léger, drôle et pas prise de tête.

En gros,
Les + : Pour un "petit jeu" et un JRPG, il est ultra propre: plein de contenu (j'insiste sur la diversité qu'on peut avoir en combat), des musiques géniales, des animations bien travaillées, des dialogues bien écrits (et normalement bien traduits, on a eu des retours positifs)
Les - : Ca reste un JRPG: Malgré la diversité, si ça vous saoule de taper des trucs en boucle, c'est probablement pas pour vous.

Conclusion: Si la version Premium était un DLC d'un jeu déjà payant, je râlerai sur les 13€. Mais là je trouve que le jeu les vaut largement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009324832', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5324, 'last_played': 1546502324}
review:
Great continuation of the series. Tons of content, and gameplay is as good as ever. New mechanics fit quite nicely, MP removal turned out to be less impactful than I expected: playing overly defensively certainly became easier without the necessity of spending turns on consumables or using non-optimized gear solely for that mana syphon, which helps on rush and endless challenges, but most bosses and quite a bunch of high-end enemies can't be outturtled, which starts the arms race. And on Epic winning that requires careful gear and strategy preparation, and that is as it should be. 

RIP gunswords, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260508414', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3299, 'last_played': 1601475593}
review:
A very good RPG game:
Funny storyline and dialogue
Entertaining Battle system
LOTS of secrets
Favorite part of the game for me is the fact that you can catch bosses and use them. I also enjoyed the difficulty of trying to capture a boss instead of killing them, a good challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090196894', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3010, 'last_played': 1627967504}
review:
总体来说非常喜欢，作为一个第一次接触EPBF系列的玩家，当然是选择了史诗难度，顺利的通了关。超级好玩的JRPG，我特别喜欢里面的音乐，感觉听一天都听不腻[spoiler] 除了打神的时候打了快一个小时打得头晕受不了关掉了	[/spoiler]。还有各种不同的谜题，难度刚刚好，都能自己解出来。而且有非常非常多的隐藏宝箱！！！不过大部分宝箱都只是一些能买到的材料，关键装备都在解密里面。很久没有玩过这种吸引我钻研一个BOSS长达2-3小时的游戏了[strike] 兰斯出来挨打  [/strike]。还有值得称赞的是EPBF5的中文翻译接地气，丝毫没有在玩国外游戏的感觉，能看见很多来自不同ACG的梗与出人意料的剧情。最后值得一提是里面有个技能会让屏幕出现一张脸和女鬼的尖叫声，一开始把我吓尿了，后来知道那张脸是作者之后每次看到那个脸都有点想笑。总而言之，我非常推荐喜欢搞笑风的JRPG和解密玩家玩这个游戏

thank you for provide chinese version!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198331667554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4891, 'last_played': 1697847254}
review:
Feine Fortsetzung der Reihe.
Abgesehen von der Fähigkeit Gegner zu fangen u dass es keine MP mehr gibt, hat sich zu den Vorgängern am Gameplay nicht wirklich was geändert.
Netter Humor, liebenswertes Design sowie ein vielseitiges Kampfsystem 
(Elemtschaden, Statuseffekte etc lassen die Kämpfe nicht eintönig oder monoton erscheinen)
machen EBF5 zu einen gelungen RPG.
Trotz seiner kleinen Weltkarte gibts viel zu entdecken und erforschen.

13 Euro sind als Preis durchaus OK, wobei die Vorgänger (bei EBF5 nicht sicher) online gratis zu spielen sind (auf newgrounds zB). Hab mir damals trotzdem den 4er Teil gekauft da ich das Projekt durchaus unterstützenswert finde. 
EBF3 ist auf Steam gratis zu spielen, bei Kaufunentschlossenheit einfach mal da reinspielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 12057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6940, 'last_played': 1631415892}
review: Absolutely fantastic game with an amazing soundtrack created by Phyrnna. I would've written this review sooner, but I was busy playing it. The developer keeps outdoing himself with every new game, and it's the only series I can think of that consistently improves and doesn't take any steps backwards when it comes to sequels. Easily worth the $15 asking price with the amount of content that you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997819311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 20474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3268, 'last_played': 1652228034}
review:
Yep, it's great. I know it looks like it isn't, how could a game called "epic battle fantasy 5 be good?". Well, it is.

Go play Epic Battle Fantasy 4 on Kongregate if you're unsure, it's free and also great. But EBF5 is even better. It's also a reboot of the series, making it the best starting point. It's also, bafflingly, one of the best modern games utilizing classic RPG mechanics. Even better than Octopath Traveler. 

My only complaints are that it goes by too fast. Not so much that it's too short, but that I always want more. :P

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198254595136', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4543, 'last_played': 1679678610}
review:
“打怪、升级、解密、开宝箱，最后拯救世界。”
看上去是很老套的JRPG套路，但bf5在细节的完成度和新颖度上做得非常出色：

主动遇敌，在大地图上有各种各样的怪物，点击怪物才会会进入战斗

玩家逃跑率100%，非战斗时间角色会自动回复HP和技能cd

宠物系统：怪物能被捉住奴役，消耗相应BP值就能被召唤宠物使用对应的技能，BOSS也能抓

技能系统：本作把魔法和战技统合为“技能”，取消mp，改用cd冷却；这让玩家对技能有搭配需求的同时，也能随心所欲的释放技能

属性克制系统：bf系列和一般的JRPG不同，属性抗性到100%时，受到的伤害就是0，如果超过100%，伤害就会按百分比翻转为回复（例如毒抗100%，收到伤害为0，如果毒抗110%、中了毒或者病毒buff，就会变为回复效果）

装备系统：bf系列的装备系统非常实用，武器和防具上限只有5级，饰品3级，不论是前期还是后期拿到的装备升到5级的强度都是一样的，区别只在于加成的属性和装备的附加技能、抗性而已。玩家不需要考虑装备的替换，只需要考虑装备的搭配，非常赞

优点：
探索、收集和战斗方面 8/10 
bf5的完成度完全不亚于传统的JRPG，用两个字来说就是‘好玩’

BGM 8/10
虽然没有大厂的那种史诗感，但bf5的音乐做到了切题、好听、也很有特色

缺点：
画面 6/10
bf5的画面就好比皮蛋，看上去不好，吃起来真香！虽然玩久会习惯这个画风，但不可否认的是，这是导致大部分玩家没有选择接触这款佳作重要因素

游戏引擎 5/10
由于游戏采用的flash引擎，引擎运算能力较差，而开发者给游戏加入的素材过多；这就导致很多时候游戏会出现掉帧的情况，只能调低画质和动态功能缓解，希望开发者能着重优化一下。。。

综合 7/10，这是一款在steam上为数不多的优秀JRPG游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198263998872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1576900762}
review:
No se como describir exactamente lo mucho que disfrute este juego pero aquí vamos. Esta franquicia es de las pocas que he podido decir que es una parte importante de mi vida, como lo lleva en el título simplemente es épica.

Este juego me cautivo desde el primer momento con tan solo la pantalla de inicio [strike] bueno, si no contamos la clásica pantalla de las babas [/strike] realmente me salieron lagrimas de la emoción cuando la vi porque esta franquicia la conocí cuando eran solo flash games de internet y apenas era un puberto, pero justo el día que cumpleaños 18 salé la quinta parte, aunque me enteré gracias a los cupones que repartió porque no uso Discord y tampoco revisaba las noticias, solo decía que sucedera cuando tenga que pasar, y vaya sorpresa que me dió cuando lo vi [strike] auque al principió me saque de onda porque leí Final Fantasy V y solo he jugado al XV, luego revise bien y di un grito de la emoción [/strike] pero me estoy saliendo del tema, ¿Recomiendo este juego? POR SUPUESTO QUE SI, aunque sería mejor que jugarás los anteriores para que les vayas cogiendo cariños a los personajes.

Prácticamente todo de este juego me gusto así que solo puedo separar las cosas que me gustaron mucho de las que no tanto.

Entre lo que mas me gusto de este juego fueron las interacciones de los personajes, si bien solo recuerdo la historia del 4 y vagamente la del 3 [strike] porque en ese entonces mi ingles era muy básico así que no entendía mucho de los 3 primeros y no los he rejugado, a diferencia del 4, el Adventure Story y los 2 Bullet Heaven no se porque [/strike] en este sentí mas conección ellos, adémas que era interesante que se dierán mas detalles de si vida pasada, otra cosa que me gusto fue el diseño del mundo y de los enemigos menores que me gustan mucho, también el sistema de clima fue una grata sorpresa, al principió pensaba que iba a sobrar porque iban a ser igual de simples que los de Pokémon pero me alegro de haberme equivocado porque fue bastante mas profundo, y bueno el humor claramente es otra importante de esta franquicia pero no se me ocurre otra cosa que decir que ya hayan dicho otros.

Lo que me gusto un poco menos fueron los diseños esteticos de los jefes se me hicieron un poco simples para lo geniales que eran los de los enemigos comunes nuevos [spoiler] salvo el Valkyria de Neón y el jefe final que si me gustarón [/spoiler] y músicalmente no se como describirlo con pocas palabras pero diré que el primer tema de batalla se tornaba un poco repetitivo a partir de cierto punto, por mas que sea bueno, y el tema de la mayoría de los jefes igual [spoiler] si bien el del Valkyria de Neón era distinto tampoco me gusto mucho como Rage of The Abadoned del 4, sobretodo porque esperaba un remix épico de Organ Jaws [/spoiler] pero fuera de eso me gusto bastante la música, sobretodo las de las zonas finales [spoiler] en especial la del jefe final que justo el fue quien tuvo el remix épico de Organ Jaws que quería... aunque yo de pendejo consumido por la emoción lo confundí con el tema de Akron [/spoiler] por último la disposición de los gatos baba era un poco incomoda.

Bueno eso es todo lo que tengo que decir por el momento sin que me invadan mas lo sentimientos, quizá solo he acabao el juego una vez [spoiler] y sinceramente no se si hay más finales, lo digo por lo que te dicen en el final [/spoiler] poco menos de media hora antes de que acabará el año 2018 en mí país, quizá edite esta reseña en el futuro con mas detalles, pero lo que puedo decir sin dugas ahora es que pocas veces he sentido la diversión y emoción que esperimente con este juego, es uno de mis juegos favoritos, no solo de este año sino de toda mi vida. Muchas gracias por todo, me gustaría poder ecónomicamente por esto mismo pero no estoy en una situación ecónomica que lo permita pero cuando lo haga sin duda apoyaré.

P.D: Se me bugeo la medalla Second Chance/Segunda Oportunidad , dentro del juego lo tengo pero en Steam no me aprece como obtenido.
developer_response: If any medals have failed to unlock on Steam, you can click on them in the in-game medals menu to re-send them to Steam, and that should fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055435879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4657, 'last_played': 1693046454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061040259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3744, 'last_played': 1550998584}
review:
La ultima entrega de esta saga y en mi opinion es la mejor de todas.
Yo jugué todos los EBF pero el primero fue el 4 y me encantó.
Este ultimo añade muchas cosas nuevas como capturar enemigos (Para nada como Pok*mon), esteroides definidos para cada personaje, el 5to personaje (SinPatas), muchos enemigos nuevos y las mazmorras opcionales.
Este juego es bastante completo para el fan clasico de los RPG y lo complacerá con facilidad.
No es perfecto, pero es excelente 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028354069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3384, 'last_played': 1546633982}
review:
I like to imagine the creators having as much fun creating this game as I am having playing it -- that is to say, a lot!  😃

Epic Fantasy Battle 5 has something for everyone, and has enough lite fare to serve as a casual game but with a deep enough system to give the achievers something to master.  Combat is fun and fast-paced, exploring is rewarding due to tons of secrets to discover, and the new capture system adds another fun thing to do while you're playing (giving you monsters to use as summons). 

The story and game itself is goofy, and doesn't take itself too seriously... don't let it put you off if you're normally not into that sort of thing, I recommend just going with it and you might start to actually enjoy it. Eventually, it wore me down, and now I laugh out loud sometimes. :p

The game is a joy to play has more staying power than I expected (I'm still going!). Try it out for a casual RPG with plenty of wit and plenty to do -- or play it on Epic difficulty and try to master all the systems and collect all the gear.   Either way (and all the way in between) I recommend this game. 👍

I also want to thank Matt for making this game, and hope he keeps the series alive for many years to come. ⭐🏆⭐

author: {'steamid': '76561198162368960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 3422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2468, 'last_played': 1627535637}
review:
Esta saga siempre ha ido de menos a más. 

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 llevaba el gameplay al terreno de la perfección: una dificultad sumamente adecuada, enemigos variados, combates muy dinámicos y llenos de opciones, estrategia, y una trama divertida, loca, sin sentido, pero muy humorística. Esta nueva entrega, en mi opinión, termina por potenciar todo lo anterior. 
No se olvida de los viejos enemigos, y añade un montón de nuevas criaturas. Hay más medallas, más poderes, más habilidades y la opción de "capturar" a tus enemigos para hacerlos tus esclavos (aunque no es un gran feature en la práctica, pero es una novedad al fin y al cabo). Sigue habiendo superbosses.

El humor también ha ido mejorando. Continúan los chistes absurdos, de esos tan malos que son buenos, y el juego saca buenas risas. Le han bajado un poquito a los chistes sexistas, lo cual me agrada, aunque continúa teniendo la esencia pícara de un EBF (de todos modos, existe la opción para desactivar el humor negro). Los personajes también son menos desesperantes, y más entrañables, lamentablemente este juego no aporta ninguno nuevo (se puede jugar con SinPatas, pero él es un viejo conocido ya).
La pelea con el final boss te quita el aliento.

Si no has jugado absolutamente nada de esta saga, no te confundas: EMPIEZA POR ÉSTE. Aunque hay constantemente referencias a los juegos pasados, no es necesario conocerlos, y EBF5 implementa todas las cosas buenas del anterior y un montón de mejoras. 

Este juego es para ti si te gusta: a) el RPG puro y duro, b) lo poco convencional, c) literalmente, batallas épicas, d) humor absurdo a montones, e) aguantas el humor negro, f) no te molesta jugar una parodia de los RPG, g) si te gustan las batallas harto estratégicas, por turnos, con type match-up, habilidades, magia, forja de equipamiento y armas, niveles, rage y ese tipo de cosas.
NO subestimes EBF, aunque parezca un burdo juego flashero es uno de los RPGs más sólidos que conozco, con un extraordinario balance y no todo es risas y tontería, tiene una historia congruente, momentos serios, y mucho, mucho entretenimiento asegurado.

En fin, no tiene pierde, es un juego muy divertido en todo sentido, tanto en lo humorístico como en lo entretenido. Hay que tenerlo, si lo que se busca es un RPG con buen nivel de reto, y si tenemos ganas de algo que parodie a los juegos de rol convencionales.

PD: Si algún día llega Epic Battle Fantasy 6, que estoy seguro que ocurrirá, con todo lo que ha construido la saga tendrá todo en sus manos para ser un auténtico hit a nivel global. Esperemos que Kupo Games tenga esa fortuna, se lo merece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434762639', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 74, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1711275441}
review:
I have finished all of the EBF games and I can say this one also was awesome. The only problem I can see is the epic difficulty being a little easier than the other 4 games because of the game mechanics like stealing and capturing. I am sure many people would like something like an impossible difficulty as 250%. Other than the game being amazing, it doesn't go far off the EBF series and their storyline, but it still introduces a great story (However EBF4 still has the best story overall). The game is cheap and I would recommend you get it if you like (especially) RPGs. And in EBF5 now medals are not just something you accidentally get and be like "Oh, cool I guess". Now they are something you work for and get rewarded.

Edit: This was written before the content update and I have to replay it but it's still easily one of the best Turn Based RPG out there

author: {'steamid': '76561198308918624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1709393082}
review: Before buying this, I was doubtful that it would be as good as EBF4, because EBF4 was a near perfect game that I spent hundreds of hours playing on Armor Games.  After beating the whole game, I can safely say that not only was this well worth the time i've spent on it, but I will be playing it again on epic difficulty.  This is the only steam game that I have ever written a review for, and it's just that good that I think it deserves my only review.  I'd give it a 9.5-10/10.  Matt, if you're reading this, thank you so much for this game, and Pyrnnha, if you're reading this, then thank you for the most amazing soundtrack i've heard in a game series ever.  Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134705018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4530, 'last_played': 1585158294}
review:
全成就撒花留念!能从2代一路玩过来见证这个游戏的成长真的是太好了!

按照自己一如既往的习惯,这次也是从一开始就直接全程史诗难度硬推,真的是每代都要感叹一次这个游戏在战斗数值的设计上真的十分完美,这里作为测评其实游戏的各种优点早在4代的评测里该写的就都写过了,5战新增的各种东西我就也不坠余再感慨一次了,我只想说感觉这作最感动的设定就是增加能力的补品食物变成了每个人固定使用,虽然可能会有人觉得这样会在角色培养上少了一定的自由度,但是正因此才能让大家基础能力上持平,从而真正做到让特色鲜明的大家都有上场的机会,比起前作集中培养而从头到尾只让三个人站前排就好,这作在各种危机情况下大家依次上场战斗补位应对各种情况真真正正有了这是一个五人冒险团队的感觉,看着大家关系一点点变好互相感慨彼此的能力和穿着,真的是很羡慕他们彼此有这样的同伴了

然后不知道是不是缺点的一点,或者是我自己觉得不适的一点是,buff和debuff的数值变动,从前作的增减变为了直接覆盖,不说这项改动本身对游戏难度的影响,只是觉得因为这个设定让防御类技能变得十分微妙...好不容易开个盾结果对面直接一个debuff盖过来,就只能看着5回合CD傻眼干等,而史诗难度下每个回合的行动都至关重要,面对怪物各种随机的debuff,到后期基本就变成了指望防御指令加防类的装备和标靶苟命,盾技能上了也是浪费人生.....啊,顺便给逆转能力可以强破祝福一个好评(((

总之6代啥时候出---6代是不是该到蓝毛妹子了----我还没玩够我还要玩(大喊

author: {'steamid': '76561198858398064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3217, 'last_played': 1690007390}
review:
Jogo excelente!!! O que parecia ser ótimo antes o criador conseguiu deixar ainda melhor! Entre as melhorias que vi comparado com o jogo anterior estão:

- Gráficos melhores ainda nos mapas e menos "quadrados" nos terrenos
- Evolução de poderes que aproveitam melhor o espaço na lista de skills e melhoram a utilidade de cada um
- Em alguns poderes você pode usar 2 tipos de mira diferentes e assim reaproveitar o dano conforme a quantidade de inimigos
- A barra de MP (que era quase só um enfeite no jogo anterior) foi substituída pelo cooldown que além de equilibrar as "apelações" dá uma noção muito melhor de quais poderes são realmente fortes
- Ao invés de um simples "chance de infligir veneno" agora é possível saber as chances exatas baseadas em porcentagens e número de turnos do status
- Agora a combinação de diferentes status pode gerar outros status (frio + molhado = congelamento)
- As histórias que você ouve da sua família aqui contam como estratégia de batalha, por exemplo: quando você quebra um inimigo espelho você recebe má sorte, se o inimigo for um voodo o original vai receber dano também, etc
- Quando você usa um equipamento pela primeira vez o personagem pode comentar sobre ele no campo de batalha (Lance reclama da sujeira se você equipa-lo com a Roupa de Mendigo)
- SemPés é um personagem jogável que usa brinquedos como armas

Ainda tem várias outras melhorias que reparei mas essas são o suficiente pra mostrar que vale muito a pena comprar esse jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051585731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1546099878}
review:
[quote]
[th]关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39039781]斗鱼游戏社区[/url]，随时了解主播推荐的好游戏。[/th]
[tr][th]访问[b]斗鱼鱼吧社区[/b]参与互动，活动好礼送不停！[/th][/tr]
[/quote]


[h1]前言[/h1]
​​一开始有朋友安利我玩《史诗战幻想》系列我是拒绝的。都什么年代了来还玩Flash游戏，并且还是非常老式的回合制游戏。然而朋友却再三安利道“试一试吧，你绝对不好后悔的”，自己实在遭不住朋友的热情，极不情愿点开来这款游戏...
然后，自己不由发自真心感慨到“真香...” 


[h1]游戏体验[/h1]
首先比较惊喜的地方在于这次的游戏是直接自带中文的，英文不好的小伙伴终于不用抱着大段大段的英文生啃或者苦等民间汉化了。游戏的画风属于那种初看之下很一般，却越看越耐看的那一种。游戏的全名叫做《Epic Battle Fantasy5》。从标题上便致敬里日式RPG里大名鼎鼎的最终幻想系列。游戏实际内容致敬要素其实也不少。当然游戏除了《最终幻想》系列外，玩家还会在游戏中发现很多其他可以让人会心一笑的梗和NETA。游玩本作前我一直担心，在目前这个大多RPG类游戏都想方设法加入动作要素来提升游戏体验的时代，本作老式的回合制战斗方式会不会过于拖沓，导致玩家在游玩过程中觉得枯燥之类的。然而本作的作者绝非等闲之辈，他对传统JRPG的玩法取其精华去其糟粕，再结合作者自身的游戏宅属性，可谓是将他能想到的所有有趣的东西都有条不紊地结合到了一起。
​​
非战斗状态下玩家可以操作主角Matt与地图上的人或物进行互动接受各种任务。游戏虽然有主线剧情却对玩家的行动不做强求。玩家如果主线打乏了，可以直接脱离主线先去其他图探索去了。游戏地图上中还存在着非常丰富的解谜要素，例如通过推石板或通过各种机关来说抵达宝箱位置等，谜题解法在设计上也是比较有趣味性的。


[h1]优秀战斗系统[/h1]
​​史诗战幻想1问世时，日式回合制RPG就已经逐渐走向衰亡，开始逐步向着APGR或者半即时式RPG转型，而本作却反其道而行之，将回合制RP深度挖掘下去，将老式JRPG的优点发挥到了极致。
地图上的敌人只会一动不动的站在原等待玩家自己通过对其点击后进入战斗，而不是RPG经常遭人诟病的踩地雷式遇怪。这也就意味着玩家对是否要战斗掌握着十足的主动权，不至于出现一不小心碰上各个高级怪，被团灭后只能“大侠重新来过”的尴尬局面。而在“普通”难度下玩家每打完一场仗后，体力值会随着时间慢慢回复。一场激战过后，玩家检查检查装备，技能点分配啥的稍微休息片刻，立马又成了一条龙精虎猛的汉子。本作中还取消了MP值的设定，魔法特殊技改为了CD制，某个技能使用后，隔上几个回合就可以再次施展，省去了频繁喝药的麻烦。
​​
​​进入战斗前后玩家可以使用“扫描”敌人收集情报，然后利用属性克制的技能来对症下药。战场上还存在着天气系统，例如下雨天气，会导致场地上的角色变潮，害怕雷属性攻击；刮风天气，会导致场地上的角色变轻，而畏惧风属性的攻击。游戏的战斗也不是那么苦大仇深或你死我活，角色时不时会打打嘴炮对战斗的吐槽几乎没停歇过，各种脑残或恶搞的吐槽实在让人忍俊不禁。角色们还有着怒气槽的设计，当怒气槽攒满后就可以发动各种赏心悦目的华丽必杀技了。
​​
​​战斗系统还很友好地提供了记忆热键功能，玩家可以通过点击直接执行之前使用过的战斗指令。
战斗中抓怪物要素的存在让这部作品甚至可以当做宝可梦来玩，游戏中的怪物大部分都可以进行捕获，在敌人的血量越低捕获的成功率越高。当怪物所剩血量不多时就考虑尽快下手吧，否则不小心中了某个角色的被动攻击，或者怪物主动举白旗逃逸就得不偿失了。捕获后的怪物可以在后面在战斗中通过花费SP数值进行召唤，是其对战斗进行各种辅助。


[h1]装备升级系统[/h1]
​​主角在开宝箱时经常会收集到土块，臭袜子，铁丝或其他瓶瓶罐罐之列的东西。这些看上去不起眼的物件在装备升级时可以有着大作用，升级后的装备不仅仅会有着跟高的属性数值，甚至会带上一些攻击对手后可以顺手牵羊偷走敌人身上道具之类的增益buff。


[h1]布娃娃系统[/h1]
​​角色的装备分为武器，服装，头饰三部分，更改这些部位的装备后，角色的外观会随之进行改变。


[h1]其他丰富而贴心的要素[/h1]
​​1.玩家接受过的NPC任务会直接以图表的形式呈现，已完成的任务的npc人物会暗掉，未完成的鼠标经过则会显示对应的npc地点。
​​
2.地图各大区域存在着相当于传送门的史莱姆猫，触碰后可以快速对地图位置进行切换。
​​
3.游戏大地图会以星标提示玩家已经完成的主线任务。


[h1]超多的梗与彩蛋[/h1]
​​1.战斗胜后的BGM其实是最终幻想胜利BGM的变奏。
​​
2.游戏的开始菜单里的史莱姆是可以戳泡泡一样有鼠标点爆掉的，右上角还会对玩家点掉爆的史莱姆进行记数字。
​​
3.XBOX？！
​​
4.塞尔达三角圣力
​​
5.宝可梦，以及小刚和精灵护士的梗。
​​
6..装备页面的女主娜塔莉的“欧派”是可以点击的，而且不同角度点击会产生不同的晃动效果可谓是“恶趣味满满”


[h1]缺点[/h1]
​​整部作品的素质实在太优秀了，很难找到硬性的缺陷。如果实在要找鸡蛋里面挑骨头的话，那就是steam成就暂时还不是中文吧，期待以后的更新可以带来汉化过的steam成就了。


[h1]总结[/h1]
本作是一款基调轻松，笑点满满，并且比较懒人化的优秀JRPG游戏。游戏的恶搞功力不浅，还经常或出现一些像《死侍》那样打破第四面墙的吐槽。玩家在游玩体验中舒适度非常高，也因此导致本作的毒性较强，一旦上手会让人根本停不下来（捂脸）。

友情提示：在打开本作前一定要确保好自己有着充足的游戏时间，否则你会惊奇地发现“咦，怎么天亮了？”


[h1]史诗战幻想5-做到极致的JRPG[/h1]
	[i]* 感谢SteamCN鉴赏家提供游戏评测机会
* 本评测在SteamCN社区：https://steamcn.com/t453679-1-1	[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151252211', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4526, 'last_played': 1646471491}
review:
A long time ago I discovered this little flash game called Epic Battle Fantasy 3 and had an absolute blast, I've since then been following the works of Matt Roszak, this game's dev.

This gameplay is phenomenal, moving to a cooldown system instead of a mana system makes the combat far more strategically rewarding than other turn-based RPGs. 
The capture system is well-made and doesn't rely on heavy RNG, an amazing feature compared to similar games with capture mechanics. 
Realistically though, the change that takes the cake is the clarity in status effect chances and damage amounts in ability tooltips, meaning that more strategic play doesn't mean looking up wikis.

Having the ability to save everywhere and regenerating outside of combat fixes a lot of the tedium that exists in many turn-based RPGs, and rewards playing how you want to play.
If you're forgetful it does mean that you won't get reminding to check equipment stores and quest npcs so bear that in mind. 
The puzzles are personally at a good level of difficulty, while the game being on Steam allows for people to make guides for those who have trouble, it can be frustrating to need to resort to a guide for more casual players.

The graphics and art-style are to die for on high, however due to flash being.. to be frank, terrible, I was forced to play through the game on medium and eventually low settings which did detract pretty heavily. 
I find the tone of the game to be pretty light so don't expect an in-depth or heavy story. 
(I would however be very interested in seeing Matt create a more story oriented game or franchise)

The music is top-notch and in many ways makes the game as amazing as it is, Phyrnna has always been one of my top artists, not much else to say, except..
For one thing, the song "A Breeze from Home" while not being my favourite track, has to be one of the best moments in this.
Kudos again to Phyrnna.

As much as I would like to, I cannot give this a perfect score, the engine choice really does heavily detract from the experience.
[b] 4/5 [/b] — Please learn a new game engine, flash was amazing, but now it's run it's course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114563643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 7315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2666, 'last_played': 1709355737}
review:
Guess it's time to write a review of this. I technically got this for free, although I really didn't, because crowdfunding exists.

[b]Things I liked about this game, in no particular order[/b]

[list]
[*] most new mechanics, namely the weather and status effects and some other things, were quite a lot of fun. I'm pretty sure you could beat the game without taking advantage of any of them (dry + thunder, Haste, etc) but if you did, there are a LOT of fun things you can do in battle, plus some achievements for seeing how far you can push the damage total

[*] humor is top tier, as we've come to expect in these EBF games

[*] Lance's introduction was a nice twist ("nice"), as was the entire game's place in the canon, not that EBF has ever been too terribly concerned with its own canon

[*] I guess this is technically a spoiler, but you can catch almost all of the monsters you can encounter. Most of them are quite good, even the ones that you wouldn't expect to be good, although there are so many of them it's easy to be overwhelmed by your number of choices and just use the same ones over and over . . . which I ended up doing more than I really wanted to. It's actually kind of hard to catch monsters early on, but at some point you'll probably discover one or more valid tactics that makes it RIDICULOUSLY easy. And fun

[*] NoLegs is the best party member and you're not allowed to disagree

[*] the fact that there's a strategy guide built into the game in the form of an actual library is kind of neat, although I'm pretty sure that (almost) all of the information in it can be obtained by talking to NPCs if you don't feel like sitting down and reading the whole thing.

[*] the amount of content in the game is nothing short of mind-blowing. It took me 40-ish hours to finish the final boss and most of the side stuff, but I'm pretty sure there's still some amount of stuff that I just completely missed. With games like Fallout and Skyrim you expect to have an almost infinite supply of things to do, but this game was made entirely by [i]one guy[/i] (two if you count the composer, and a few more if you count the translators)

[*] Puzzles are, for the most part, adequately challenging without being completely obtuse, although the solutions for some may be found in unexpected places, so pay attention to the stuff around you. None of the (harder ones) are mandatory though, so if you can't figure something out, it's probably not the end of the world

[*] the game is only as spine-crushingly difficult as you want it to be. The difficulty is pretty reasonable on Normal mode (except for a handful of fights, most of which are completely optional), but if you're a sucker for punishment, Hard and Epic modes exist. If you just want to play the game for the humor and don't want to be bogged down by the fights, Easy mode exists, and I'm pretty sure you're not penalized for playing on it, except for the achievements that require you beat someone or something on Epic. If all you do to some of the bosses is whack them with your sword you're going to have a pretty difficult time, but once you start playing around with the secondary mechanics everything gets considerably easier

[*] the developer ("Kupo Matt") is one of the most talented people in indie games, and cares a lot about making a game that's, well, like this. Considering how often the rest of the industry seems to shoot itself in the foot, this is something I'd be thrilled to encourage.

[*] the Pervert achievement is still there, you weirdos
[/list]

[b]Things I didn't like about this game, in no particular order[/b]

[list]
[*] I'm actually really sad now, because (1) I'm pretty much done with the game and there's nothing (major) left to discover, and (2) I honestly don't know how Kupo Matt can top this for EBF6, which I assume will happen at some point

[*] not enough dinosaurs

[*] the Pervert achievement is still there, you weirdos
[/list]

As you can see, I had to stretch my mind a little to populate that list.

[b]Steam is bothering me about updating a review for a badge or something, and this game has a more content coming Soon™[/b]

There's an update to the game due out in December that contains a few more dungeons, secret areas, weapons, foes, etc, as well as a few gameplay-altering things like challenge modes. I've gotten to play a bit of the beta version and it's every bit as good as the base game, so look forward to that.

[b]Verdict[/b]

BUY IT NOW BUY IT NOW BUY IT NOW.

If you want to hear me drone on for 20+ hours about this game, here's a fancy [url="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_hT--4HOvreeGb1Kbcyh0Pxf97Zh3tuf"]Let's Play[/url] of it.

As of my writing this, the free web version has actually yet to be published, but when that happens, I'll have to remember to add a link to that in here. Saves are supposed to be transferrable between versions, and the web version is supposed to contain just about everything that the Steam one does, minus some of the optional content.
