author: {'steamid': '76561198047197349', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1546706369}
review:
Главный герой — почтенный РНН-господин, клептоман, полубомж и дебил. Его напарник-кот занимется разбойным грабежом без зазрения совести. Есть сисястая туповатая волшебница, которая затесалась в эту компанию. Есть национал-социалисты, кошмарящие мирняк и давящие деревни на большом танке ради великой цели. Думаю, дальше будет ещё интересней, но за двенадцать часов я наиграл достаточно, чтобы сказать: десять из десяти, игра года, ибо закладывает самые лучшие и правильные качества в игроков. 

Давно не было игры, которая бы так спасала меня от игровой импотенции.

[spoiler]Играть нужно на эпической сложности.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197965229974', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2196, 'last_played': 1546041428}
review:
Too many damned sliding puzzles, completely ruined the game for me and I finally had to just throw in the towel and give up. I was already suffering *extreme* battle fatigue after fighting *literal* thousands of enemies, constantly being thrown into 2-5 waves of combat with each encounter, but the absolute torrential abuse from overabundance of pushing blocks and sliding blocks and sliding across ice just ended up crushing all the enjoyment out of the game.

The very same thing happened with CrossCode, another fantastic game utterly ruined by the constant Sokoban puzzles. Every single puzzle in both these games involved pushing a block, or arranging blocks.

If you enjoy Sokoban and tedious grinding combat, you'll love this. I didn't.

... though the sad fact is; the game *was* immensely enjoyable for about 2/3 of playtime. The humour is genuinely amusing, the characters are fun, artwork is cute and charming, and I loved the sheer staggering amount of gear and items. I just wish there wasn't such a reliance on block puzzles and, towards the end, the ramping up of slow slog fights against dozens of enemies per battle. Fighting is further compounded by the fact that enemies not only level with you, but their stat curve is skewed WAY ahead of yours, and by the time you're levelling up a lot; they get exponentially more powerful than you are. Not fun.
developer_response:
I'm just gonna pop in here to mention that 90% of the puzzles are totally optional.

What difficulty were you playing on where you felt battles were too long? There's no shame in turning it down for regular encounters and putting it up just for bosses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012996837', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2443, 'last_played': 1546033390}
review:
Really great game. Fun story, good characters, interesting turn-based mechanics, and a ton of hidden treasures to find. Played EBF4 years ago and thoroughly enjoyed it, and EBF5 didn't disappoint. The only critique I would have is that it got a bit tedious to explore every nook and cranny by the end especially when all your good skills were maxed out, as mob encounters stopped being rewarding and started feeling like a chore. But that's probably just me trying to be a completionist without having the patience.
Anyway, I highly recommend this gem of a game to anybody (I'd also recommend to play EBF4 first, as there are some references to it throughout the game)

author: {'steamid': '76561197961489779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 4552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1666061407}
review:
If you want to play a game that's cute, self-aware, Fun, and well-tuned, this is one of the gems of 2018.  

Featuring a cute cast of well-developed characters, adorable cut-scenes and lucious animations, this is a great little JRPG-esque experience, with lots of tongue-in-cheek laughs, puzzles and a difficulty curve that's extremely easy to get into.  I started playing, and promptly lost hours of my life to this game.

It's worth full price, unlike most of the AAA games I've reviewed this year.

review:
게임하다가 로컬 저장소 허용 팝업뜨면서 클릭이 안될때가 있는데 그럴때는 스팀로컬파일 보기 들어가면 "Flashplayer Windows" 란 파일이 있을겁니다.

요걸 실행하면 이게임에 맞는 버전인 플래시가 실행되는데 여기서 아무데나 한번 저장하면 로컬 저장허용 팝업이 뜹니다
번전이 맞기때문에 클릭이 잘되니 허용 눌러주고 다시 실행해보면 아주 잘 됩니다.

그럼 모두 즐겜하시길
developer_response:
This should be fixed in the latest version, which is 1.4.
You can opt-into it by going to Steam Client > Epic Battle Fantasy 5 > Right Click > Properties > Beta > Select the other version.

Sorry for the late reply! This update will be live for everyone soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025727074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4362, 'last_played': 1662804202}
review:
Believe it or not, but of all the games released in 2018, EBF5 is by far the one I anticipated the most, I have waited this game like crazy. I've always loved the series since the first one on Newgrounds, how nostalgic. This game surpass its predecessors on many aspects (it's the longest, the one with the largest number of enemies, etc...) and it adds numerous changes like the enemies capture feature for using them as summons, the cooldown system instead of MPs, etc... At first I was kinda frustrated by all those changes, but they work really well and add a change.

It's the fifth episode of a Flash RPG turn-based battles with exploration (since the 3, which is free on Steam, try it, but keep in mind it's not as good as the 4 and the 5. Also all the games have free versions with less content on Newgrounds or Kongregate, the free version of EBF5 will arrive early 2019). You can talk with NPCs, do quests and try to finish the game with waves of enemies and bosses. Some people consider EBF to be "easy" once you buff yourself and debuff the enemies, I strongly disagree, it's not as simple as that. Those games are hard and can be frustrating, but when you succeed, you are proud of yourself I suppose. There are some humor in the dialogs (EBF diserve its own Hollywood movie with real actors and things like manga-style # veins in the forehead kept, it would be great) and for the first time : the world is kinda changing from time to time, it's not huge but for example it's a PNJ that change place or change appearance when you return to see him after a certain event. There are also seasonal events that occurs only in Halloween or Christmas for exemple (you CAN change the date of your computer, the dev said the contrary but he is a deceitful dastard, I believed him lol. And actually, it's better, I don't want to wait a whole year just to pick a few items). There are also puzzles with blocks to push or something like that, there are hard yet doables. There is also a Metroidvania (I hate this word, why not using the term "Metroid-like" instead ?) aspect with areas blocked at first and you have to come back later once you have the item (I wonder if there will be a DLC with new zones for using the Acid Boots, which are useless for now).

The music is great and has its own feeling, its own personality. Really catchy and sometimes emotional I suppose. Although there are some remixs, not too many I guess but watch out for that (am I the only one who noticed that the menu/main theme of EBF5 is a remix of the first level of the game Adventure Story (EBF spin-off) ? Don't know if this is intentional but you can't fool me Phyrnna xD).

Things I can reproach are : if you didn't capture a boss, you have to wait a veryyyyyyyyy long time to be able to re-fight him, at least you can. The new character, NoLegs, is not really different/particular compared to Matt, but I guess a true tank will be too game-breaking and a black mage will take a lot of Natalie's spell on her to give them to the black mage (but why not ? She can still do a lot of damage with her white magic's Judgement). You can't zoom on the map (plan), it's kinda too small, you can't speed up the battles AND the movement of the character in the map, I don't know if this is doable. I suppose many of the bad things are just QoL (quality of life) aspects, not the gameplay itself.

I don't know if EBF5 is the best episode in the series (it's the longest that's for sure, lots of things to do), but it's definitely a great game, very enjoyable, it was worth the wait, and yes : I'm waiting for EBF6 and I hope there will be a EBF6.

==========================================================================

French version / Commentaire en français :

Croyez-le ou non, mais de tous les jeux sortis en 2018, c'est celui-là que j'ai le plus attendu. Je suis un énorme fan de la série depuis le 1er épisode sorti sur Newgrounds, ça rappele des souvenirs. Ce jeu surpasse ces prédecesseurs sur pas mal d'aspects (durée de vie, nombre d'ennemis, etc...)  et il ajoute pas mal de changements comme la capture d'ennemis pour s'en servir comme d'invocations, le système de temps de recharge pour les compétences à la place des MP, etc... Au début, j'ai été un peu frustré par ces bouleverments dans le gameplay mais ça fonctionne plutôt bien et ça ajoute du changement.

C'est le 5ème épisode d'une série de RPG en tour-par-tour en Flash avec de l'exploration (à partir du 3, qui est gratuit sur Steam, essayez-le, mais gardez à l'esprit que c'est le moins bon parmi le 3, 4 et 5. Sinon tous les épisodes possèdent une version gratuite sur Newgrounds ou Kongregate, celle du 5 arrivera début 2019). Vous pouvez parler aux PNJs, faire des quêtes pour essayer de terminer le jeu en traversant des vagues d'ennemis standards et des boss. Certaines personnes disent que le jeu est facile car il suffit d'appliquer des buffs sur vos persos et de debuff les ennemis, je ne suis pas d'accord, c'est pas aussi simple que ça. Ces jeux sont durs et peuvent occasionner de la frustration, mais une fois que vous réussissez, vous êtes fier de vous je suppose. Il y'a de l'humour dans les dialogues (EBF mérite d'avoir son film Hollywoodien avec des vrais acteurs mais en gardant des trucs mangas genre la veine en forme de # sur le front, ce serait énorme), et pour la première fois : le monde change plus ou moins. C'est pas grand chose, un PNJ qui change de place ou d'apparence quand vous revenez plus tard, etc...il y'a aussi des évènements en fonction de la saison, qui n'arrivent qu'à Noël ou à Halloween par exemple (vous POUVEZ changer la date sur votre PC et ça fera pop les évènements en question même si vous êtes en avril par exemple. Le développeur disait le contraire mais c'était pour vous tromper je suppose, je l'ai crû cet espèce de... xD et franchement heureusement que ça marche en faisant comme ça, ça aurait été clairement chiant de devoir attendre presque 1 an juste pour chopper quelques objets). Il y'a aussi des énigmes à résoudre genre des blocs à pousser ou des trucs comme ça. Ils sont casse-têtes comme leur noms l'indique mais c'est faisable. Le jeu propose aussi un côté Metroidvania (j'aime pas ce nom, ça veut rien dire, Castlevania SotN était lui-même un Metroid-like), c'est-à-dire que la première fois que vous allez arriver dans une zone, vous ne pourrez pas accéder à certains coffres, faudra revenir plus tard quand vous aurez l'objet qui vous permettra de couper un buisson par exemple (d'ailleurs, je me demande s'il y'aura un DLC avec de nouvelles zones à explorer avec les Bottes Acides qui servent à traverser les flaques d'acides d'après la description du jeu mais qui ne servent à rien pour l'instant).

Les musiques sont excellentes et possèdent leur propre personnalité, rythmées pour les combats et avec de l'émotion parfois je suppose. Même si y'a quelques remixs, c'est pas un défaut si y'en a 1 ou 2 mais attention de pas en faire trop (suis-je le seul à avoir remarqué que le thème du menu/thème principal de EBF5 est un remix du 1er niveau du jeu Adventure Story ? (spin-off de EBF) Je sais pas si c'est voulu de la part de la compositrice mais tu ne peux pas me tromper Phyrnna xD).

Les choses que je peux reprocher c'est que si vous n'avez pas capturé un boss lors de votre premier combat contre lui, vous devez attendre assez longtemps avant de pouvoir le re-affronter. Le nouveau perso jouable, PadPat (NoLegs), n'est pas vraiment si différent ou particulier par rapport à Matt, mais un vrai tank ce serait trop cheaté par rapport aux mécaniques de jeu faut croire. Impossibilité de zoomer sur la map, d'accélerer la vitesse du jeu, etc...la plupart des points négatifs c'est du QoL (Quality of Life) je suppose.

Au final, je ne sais pas si EBF5 est le meilleur (c'est le + long c'est sûr), mais c'est clairement un jeu excellent. Et oui, j'espère qu'il y'aura un sixième épisode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078835002', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 12079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3288, 'last_played': 1593328321}
review:
Hands down the best indie JRPG I've played. Hell, in combat alone it might be the best I've played, and that's coming from a JRPG veteran. Far too many JRPGs are "hit the enemy with your strongest attack"; EBF5 has status effects that manipulate damage, equipment that can make you cast spells between rounds or inflict status effects with your attacks, and even when it comes to defeating an enemy, you can either kill them outright, capture them and turn them into a summon, or sometimes you can weaken them and they'll simply surrender on their own.
But even then, better than the combat is the writing. The jokes all land (Lance is funny as hell, by far my favorite party member), the party dynamic works really well and has some refreshing changes from the past (the characters feel much more alive and dynamic than they used to), and the story, while simple, makes sense and even has some fun turns.
The game can really be as long as you want, I'd say roughly 20-30 hours depending on skill level at the medium difficulties, and closer to 40 or 50 if you're going for the highest. But you can easily layer 10 or 20 extra hours with optional content, if you want.
Highly recommend to anyone and everyone who likes JRPGs, and if you get it on sale or have money to burn, I'd recommend giving it a shot even if you don't typically like JRPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038869781', 'num_games_owned': 1112, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3274, 'last_played': 1658103160}
review:
I am a fan of the series and have played all the previous entries. This one, once again keeps that nostalgia feel while innovating into trying to stop you from spamming the same skill over and over by giving you hundreds more. 

Pros 

Insane amount of skills (character, quests, capture based)  200+
Hilarious story who is abordable to new players but old ones will get some hints to the older games
Flawless intuitive gameplay 
Difficulty modes who make challenging for hardcore players 
If you want to 100% on EPIC this is at least 100+h 
FUN!

Con 

Tutorial is lacking for newcomers 
Missable achievements 4 to be specific who might require you to do a second game to get but are early on so turn on easy should take 1h tops (achievements carry across all saves so no need to restart the game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052781517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3444, 'last_played': 1669474572}

author: {'steamid': '76561198250742816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1694825020}
review:
Гуляли с ребятами по лесу, сундуки с лутом собирали, но вдруг на нас напал медведь и покакал на нашего кота О_о

11 котеек из 10 (10 обычных и один БезЛап)

Единственный минус - игра на флеш, потому больше 30fps не выдаёт и при анимациях атак временами нехило падает фреймрейт ещё сильнее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059286918', 'num_games_owned': 1004, 'num_reviews': 992, 'playtime_forever': 3631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3617, 'last_played': 1545711081}
review:
Мемная рпг с пошаговыми боями получила 5 часть.Кто играл в прошлые части будут чуствовать себя как дома,потому сейчас напишу для новичков что такое вообще ебф а в конце допишу что добавили нового в этйо части.
ЕБФ - это рпг с пошаговыми боями - мы собираем по ходу игры протагонистов пати и исследуем мир выполняя главную цель путешествия и попутно выполняя квесты нпс,ищем сокровища,ищем лут,поднимаем свои характеристики,апаем характеристики шмота и наблюдаем тонну отсылок ко всему.
Что нового-теперь 99% противников (нельзя некоторых боссов) можно захватить и использовать в бою (как питомцев только если в прошлой части нам их выдавали как награду то тут мы ловим их сами-да боссов тоже можно ловить-сложно но можно),у нас так же есть полноценный 5 участник пати (безлап).Пока вроде все.
Так что всем любителям легких не задротских рпг советую.

review: One of my favorite games of this year, the lighthearted humor and well thought out battle system makes its return in this 5th installment! If your friends don't have it yet, send it to them as a gift for either the holidays or their birthday! Hell, send it to them even if it isn't a special occasion!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061448686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1637421273}
review:
Dieses Spiel erinnert mich an die gute alte J-RPG Zeit.
Es macht mir unheimlich viel Spaß wie damals "Secret of Mana","Breath of Fire" oder "Final Fanatsy III".
Dieses Spielgefühl rufen die neuen "Grafikmonster" ab Final Fanatsy 10 schon lange nicht mehr hervor.
Witzige Dialoge und dazu passende Animationen und Bilder.
Der Soundtrack ist super und nervt nicht.
Einzig eine Vollbildeinstellung für 4K fehlt mir.
Wer die rundenbasierten J-RPG Spiele mochte, dem kann ich dieses Spiel nur wärmstens empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030827042', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3093, 'last_played': 1545493819}
review:
The great sequel to an excellent game. Everything that made Epic Battle Fantasy 4 to click with me is there, with just enough improvements and novelties to make the experience fresh again.

The Epic Battle Fantasy serie focuses on what made the turn-based RPG genre, notably JRPGs, great "GAMES" instead of the excuse for overstretched storytelling that it became. Explore, collect, battle, loot, level-up at their best. The battle being the highlight of course: the "just. one. more. battle ..." feeling is in full force here.

Aside from the gameplay, I also appreciate the multiple options to disable either the "blood", "sexyness" or "cursed language" in addition of on the fly difficulty change. Always happy to see developpers willing to put the effort of making their game accessible to the many instead of force-feeding their "grand vision" or submitting to a sensibility or another.

A small damper : the game uses old "Flash" technology and can become very slow when too much animation occurs on screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1546003438}
review:
[h1]無視世俗套路，不走尋常路的角色扮演遊戲[/h1]

《Epic Battle Fantasy 5》（以下統稱《史詩戰鬥幻想5》）是款由加拿大獨立遊戲團隊 KupoGames  研發製成的回合制角色扮演遊戲，本作核心玩法是大家熟悉到不行的傳統回合制玩法，內容大致可以分為地圖探索和回合制戰鬥兩大類型，每次觸發主線任務時，開啟地圖都會看到一個箭頭提示玩家需要在哪個地方接續之後的劇情，當開啟的地圖越多，我們也能暫時忽略主線任務，四處自由走動探索，跟著一團小夥伴到處觸發支線任務，完成支線任務獲得獎品和新技能的同時，順便強化裝備和等級，進而挑戰更困難的隱藏地城。

筆者在這裡提及一下個人在本作最喜歡的遊戲設計，那就是遇敵機制不是那種會花費玩家大量時間的踩地雷遇敵機制，敵人會在地圖上顯示並且一動也不動，玩家可以【自由選擇】要不要去挑戰它們，除了某些必經路程和大多數寶箱面前會有無法避免的遭遇戰之外，幾乎所有在地圖探索不必要的戰鬥都可以直接忽略，這大大減少了休閒玩家不喜歡的練等玩法，這時候就有人問啦！沒練等怎麼打得贏守關Boss呢？貼心的遊戲製作者早就想到這點，玩家可以隨時隨地切換遊戲難度，最簡單難度的敵人整體強度是普通難度的四分之一，如果頭目都比平常弱了四倍你還打不贏，那麼就代表你真的需要練一些等級了。


[h1]告別灑狗血的公式劇情，來場輕鬆的冒險旅程[/h1]

千萬不要對《史詩戰鬥幻想5》的主線劇情認真，因為本作跳脫了公式化俗套的角色扮演遊戲劇情，主角沒有遠大抱負跟使命去拯救世界，也沒有謎樣的神祕勢力想要統治世界（好吧，其實有），更沒有【你愛我我也愛你可是我們不能相愛】的苦逼狗血劇情。進入遊戲，你看到的是主人公一行人到處私闖民宅和打劫財物，拯救平民百姓完全就是看心情，心情好或是對方給的獎勵佳才會有那麼一丁點的救世情懷，其他大多數時間，我們都在屠殺擋我財路的怪物，最後誤打誤撞殺到幕後黑手眼前，這才順手拯救了全世界。

對角色扮演遊戲的劇情很講究的玩家或許不會喜歡這款遊戲，因為本作的主要文本內容大多都是主人公一行人針對當前的人事物進行吐槽，從談論路人角色的外觀到遇見長相奇異的敵人都要說幾句幹話嘲諷一下。最令筆者感到驚喜的是主人公 Matt （既是遊戲製作者的化身）會突破第四道牆，動不動就跟螢幕前的我們哈拉幾句，文本內容包含製作遊戲時的各項考量跟困難之處，偶爾還會給予玩家一些有用的小技巧，讓我們能更快進入狀況，順利突破難關。順帶一提，遊戲中有一座大型畫廊，完成成就可以累積星數，當星數累計到一定程度後就會開啟獎勵房間，獎勵房間內不僅有粉絲繪製的圖片外，還有很多珍稀素材和強力裝備，所以在冒險途中不要忘了多傳送回畫廊瞧瞧，或許會有意想不到的驚喜喔！


[h1]線下抓寶不再是夢，百隻怪物等你捕捉[/h1]

遊玩角色扮演遊戲時，玩家總是會在冒險途中碰到千奇百怪的敵人，如果筆者跟你說，在這款《史詩戰鬥幻想5》中登場的所有敵人幾乎都可以捕捉，是不是有燃起你的抓寶之魂呢？要說本作最具特色的系統，那肯定就是本作的敵對生物設計，包含少數不可捕捉的敵人在內，遊戲中共登場超過 170 種以上的敵人，其中這些敵人都有各自獨特的屬性、害怕的弱點、以及不同的召喚技能。筆者以無腿貓派系的貓咪怪為例，從最基本的戰士貓、魔法師貓，到裝備現代科技武器的自爆炸彈貓和狙擊槍貓，每一種派系的敵人都如以上所示，這樣的設計讓玩家在碰到相同派系的敵人不會感到厭倦，反而會好奇對方會出甚麼招式，害怕的屬性是甚麼，抓到之後又能為主角團隊奉獻怎樣的能力。

想要召喚出怪物幫你戰鬥，那就要消耗【召喚點數SP】，SP的獲取方式非常簡單，每場戰鬥不管是擊殺、捕獲、饒過敵人都會獲得數量不一的SP，當SP達到召喚怪物的需求，就能使出威力強大的召喚獸技能，其中召喚獸的技能又可以分為攻擊、輔助、狀態異常、其他等多種類型。舉例來說，帶有閃電屬性的烏賊會施展出全力的群體攻擊，並且附加一定確立的麻痺狀態，無屬性的長毛象會對單體敵人造成超級強力的傷害，並分配此傷害的三分之一到對象兩旁的目標身上，雖然一場戰鬥最多往往只能開啟到兩至三次召喚獸技能，但對上Boss敵人時，召喚獸技能可能會決定勝敗，所以千萬不要錯過每一次捕捉怪物的機會。


[h1]Flash圖像程式已然過時，造成不完善的遊戲體驗[/h1]

《史詩戰鬥幻想5》是款使用 Flash 製作的角色扮演遊戲，不知道大家小時候有沒有在學校電腦課玩過一些網頁小遊戲，那些小遊戲通常都是以 Flash 研發而成的獨立遊戲，這裡筆者趁機科學普及一下， Flash 本身並不是一個適合用於研發遊戲的多媒體創作程式，從運作效率到與硬體機制、瀏覽器的相容性，都必定發生系統不穩定、資訊不安全、成品高耗能等嚴重問題，就連 Flash 的生父 Adobe 公司也聲稱會在 2020 年前完全淘汰掉它，可見 Flash 有多麼的顧人怨了。筆者自己在遊玩本作時，可以看到遊戲製作者 Matt Roszak 對 Flash 的熱愛，雖然遊玩時間過長會影響遊戲運行速度並使其急遽下滑，但精緻的人物動作和技能法術特效還是成為令人津津樂道的娛樂要素，正因為圖像程式的優化缺陷是不可避因素，如果把圖像程式優化過插的鍋讓無辜的遊戲製作人獨自承擔，那麼做似乎有失公正。


[h1]除去不可避的圖像程式，這是款令人意猶未盡的佳作[/h1]

《史詩戰鬥幻想5》主線劇情長度約三十個小時左右，破完主線劇情之後，還有許多支線任務和地下城可供探索，若要達到全成就並完成百分百遊戲內容，則需要超過五十小時遊戲時數，對於一款售價不到兩百七十台幣的作品來說，本作可說是誠意十足，大家不用擔心購買到半成品遊戲，因為這次的五代是由製作人 Matt Roszak 斷斷續續花了六年才研發完成的集大成之作，完善保留前幾代的玩法，並在基礎玩法加以強化，成為一款不管是新手老手都會得到樂趣的優質佳作。這裡提供給大家一些小建議，如果要長時間遊玩本作的話，建議把所有網頁瀏覽器關掉，再將遊戲畫質調至中等，不然不管是再好的電腦硬體設備，應該都撐不過 Flash 那恐怖的糟糕優化，沒過多久就會把你的電腦效能全部吃光光。


[h1]優缺點總整理[/h1]

優點：
+遊戲總時數超過三十小時，若要挑戰全成就達成，則需要超過五十小時。
+官方中文化無機翻，玩家可以直接又明確的了解到劇中角色的對話內容。
+超過 170 種以上的敵人可供捕捉，抓寶玩法讓戰鬥系統更具深度且有趣。
+登場人物性格飽滿，女性角色惹人憐愛，男性角色個性十足，還能吸貓。
+系列集大成之作，改善前作缺點，更加精緻的玩法內容，令人十分滿意。


缺點：
-Flash 造成的問題無解，建議玩家在遊玩前降低畫質或關閉不必要的程式。


結論：不可多得的獨立角色扮演遊戲作品，就算原價購買也不會感到吃虧。


網誌圖文好讀版：
https://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2018/12/epic-battle-fantasy-5.html

review: EPB5 is a must have for anyone who is a fan of turn based RPGs. The world building is amazing, with so many easter eggs, secrets, and equipment to find and upgrade. It has an amazing soundtrack as all EBF games do, and great entertaining characters. For what it's worth, it offers an insane amount of content. Overall, 10/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198197054298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2093, 'last_played': 1650118473}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a turn-based strategic RPG with a lot of collectible items, references to some companies, anime, religion, real life and many more things. The content is incredible for such a small game, you won't have to uninstall it after finishing it.
It is player friendly, not too hard or too easy, no grinding, even the main character tells others ,,not to sneak tutorials into casual conversations. He is going to beat the game without learning any skills". It makes you feel like a part of the game when Matt talks with you, and the game gets really wholesome.
The combat basics are simple, you just need to attack your enemies with the elements they are weak to, and its good to have clothes that resist the elements of the biome you are in. Sadly sometimes you will look like a clown while trying to sacrifice looks for stats (It really needs a vanity slot and the option to hide accessories), but it isn't that bad... its worse in other games. It doesn't get repetitive, the characters are talking wich each other (and every time it's something new, they don't recycle quotes). They say something about a new equiped armor set or weapon and other stuff that will make you laugh. This humour is pretty good, it is natural and not forced or exagerated.
It got a lot of items that you randomly get and don't have to farm for to upgrade your gear. Even if you don't have one item you can always buy it at a store in the game with the money you got by killing the enemies that stay in your way. The money can help you get items that easily increases your stats and they are not that important. 
The game is really catchy, i hit 25 hours in the first 2 days without idling and that doesn't happen often, the last time it happened it was with Skyrim. I didn't play many RPGs, but this one is the best one i have played.
It got a detailed map and there is an island in space with many cats that teleport you in specific parts of the map so you could get there faster.
You can capture the monsters you are fighting and summon them to do something for you in your next battles, it's really useful when it comes to healing, buffs and debuffs. 
It has some adult content but it can be filtered.
The graphics are really good, they are cartoonish but feel premium and are fit for an indie game. I personally like the soundtrack, but you can also mute it and listen to your favorite music. There are a lot of animations in this game, unlike in many other RPGs.
The settings menu has just one tab so it is easy to find what you need in it like sound, graphics, windows size, filters, difficulty, menu colors or the language you want to play in (there are 12 languages available).

Conclusion: EBF5 is a truly a great game and it's worth the full price. I enjoyed it a lot and i feel like i underrated it. It has everything i can expect from a game.
Strong 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198069806710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7089, 'last_played': 1545517517}
review:
The fragility of debuffs/buffs & the introduction of cooldowns make this iteration more strategic and rewarding than the previous games, but sometimes I feel trapped in a loop of revival and instant death that's more frustrating than challenging. 

The the complexity of the puzzles, the depth of the mysteries, and minor details like equipment changing color to fit the environement/other equipment are additional selling points for me. Also, [spoiler] the fact the the Earth is missing from Ion Cannon limit break (and probably others) when the Devourer 404s it [/spoiler] is fantastic, I love it.

F**k Neon Valhalla though. A [spoiler] constantly regenerating, AOE-Backrow attacking, count-down bomb spawning, buff-inverting tank that hits you for half health before the first turn [/spoiler] ? Seriously?

author: {'steamid': '76561198827278964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1545401579}
review:
其实本来我是想给一个好评的
但是为什么不推荐呢，首先是因为汉化的质量，其次是一个汉化组的侵权擦边球。
作为一个老玩家我13岁开始接触这游戏，从1一直打到4每一个成就都拿过知道每一个宝箱的地点。我们期待5期待了6年。虽然游戏本身做得不错，看得出来Matt还是用心做了的。然而主要问题是汉化。我们贴吧的朋友用了两个月的时间自己翻译了一个版本，大概是后来matt选了某个加拿大华裔去做官方汉化，可能是在国外呆久了中文有所下降吧，有一些语法错误之类。然而汉化组是承认，借鉴了一部分我们吧友的翻译的。然而汉化组名单当时出来的时候我们并没有看见这位朋友的名字。按理说引用是应该注明原作者的，大学论文都该懂的规矩。后来把那个汉化组组长拉进来才知道是疏忽，我要求他加上借鉴翻译的名字并向我们的朋友道了歉。本来我们那位朋友心理就有些压力，后来发生了这种事确实是做了一些我们不愿看见的事情，这里不便多谈。只是希望汉化组以后能多注意版权相关的东西，事情也就此结束吧。
最后还是感谢Matt认真做的作品。
developer_response:
Hey, I'm sorry about all that.
I'm very interested in improving the translations, please get in touch with me with any suggestions or advice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179002314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 973, 'playtime_at_review': 6828, 'last_played': 1712379219}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 a turn based RPG with a lot of charm, and a true gem. Let me start off by saying I'm no stranger to this series, having played it growing up, especially when I didn't have an ideal gaming PC, coming across it on browser on Newgrounds and loving the little jokes thrown here and there and the little details you'll see and appreciate. If you enjoy RPG's or are new to them, this is definitely something to consider picking up, if you're already familiar with this series and already know how great it is, you know what to do! I've already beaten the game not long ago, with all achievemnts included and while this game was gifted to me, I'll probably be buying it for a friend and have them experience the joy that is this amazing game.

If you need more reasons to buy the game, there are plenty, aside from the jokes of course, there are game refrences you may enjoy, if you like the prospect of seeking treasure, lots of that too! You enjoy challenges? The game has that as well, and man, are they really a challenge, (some made me feel like crying in the corner, you've been warned) but you don't have to take my word for it, buy the game and see for yourself! Do you enjoy capturing foes, and collecting them? You can capture foes, as well, quite fun to do, and use in later battles. 
Do you like really good music in your games?  The composer for this game who has also composed for a few other games in the series including the spin-offs, honestly knows how to make every area have the feel it should have, and the battles feel like... Epic battles, especially the boss fights, at one point I legitimately teared up with how awesome the boss fights were with how well music and the butt clenching fights mixed so well together. You should throw some money at them too if you end up buying the game and enjoy the music! 

And so, with all that said, I hope that's enough convincing the reader how truly amazing the game is and why you should buy it, if you're still unsure, go check out the other games in the series, Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is free on Steam, Epic battle fantasy 1, and 2 are both on browser, and 4 is here on Steam and on sale (if you're reading this during the Winter 2018 Steam sale) and you can also go look up the spin-offs as well if you'd be interested in those. There isn't much else to say now, other than a huge thank you to the developer, and the composer for delivering a wonderful experience, and I will be looking forward to future projects! And to the reader, what are you waiting for?! Go buy and give the game a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198241986368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3175, 'last_played': 1546184951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144266936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2493, 'last_played': 1709464784}
review:
Huge fan of the series. I've missed turn-based combat since the olden days of Final Fantasy 6 and earlier, and these games really really stick to that aesthetic. Aside from the nostalgia goggles, like previous entries this game comes packed with all manner of little references, jokes, gags, and just a silly carefree air.
But don't let that fool you into thinking this game is as easy as it is easy going. In the hardest difficulty ("Epic"), this game gets really rough, especially if you start the game on it. The mechanics of swapping characters, gear, using items and buffs (while on cooldowns) really forces you to think about the evolution of the battle and your characters builds. You can flee at any time so you can always retreat and start the battle from a different angle.

Good game mechanics, 5 characters, tons of abilities and equipment to find and power up, and (potentially) a certain amount of RNG on when you get what should give this game tons of replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014498406', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1556196980}
review:
跳出flash設定沒辦法按允許永久解決方式
1.到遊戲資料夾找到Flashplayer Windows.exe雙擊開啟
2.在Adobe Flash Player 31選單>檔案>開啟>瀏覽>選擇Epic Battle Fantasy 5\Epic Battle Fantasy 5.swf
3.進入遊戲後隨便存一個檔案，跳出flash設定，這時候就可以按允許了
4.關掉Adobe Flash Player 31，用正常方式開遊戲，這時發現存檔時再也不會跳出煩人的通知

author: {'steamid': '76561198240894454', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1647611548}
review:
Вообще, больше половины игры я прошёл на пиратке (отсюда и такое мелкое время игры и кол-во ачивок). Но ближе к концу образумился и такой: "А может поддержать создателя этого шедевра?" Вот и купил. 4-5-ую часть, ибо 4-ая, я знаю, тоже хороша (раньше почти прошёл её в браузере). Так вот... По впечатлениям: 5-ая Epic Battle Fantasy – лучшая игра в мире. А теперь по полочкам.

Плюсы: 
1. Юмор. В EBF 5 с ним всё чуть хуже, чем в прошлых частях, но он всё равно на высоте. Отсылки, мемы, а главное – появился перевод на русский язык!
2. РПГ-составляющая. Единственное, что отличает EBF 5 от типичной пошаговой РПГ – отсутствие дерва прокачаки (любое умение в EBF можно качать когда угодно, если хватает Очков Умений). То есть это добротная пошаговая РПГ. Сложные бои, особенно финальный босс... и [spoiler] чёртовы гидры, как же я их ненавижу [/spoiler] !
3. Отсутствие 4-ой стены. Это для кого как. Лично для меня (и других фанатов серии EBF) это весомый плюс. Тем более [spoiler] в этой части разрушение 4-ой стены важно для самого сюжета [/spoiler] .

Минусы: 
Оптимизация. Уже 5-ая часть игры, а создатель до сих пор не научился оптимизировать игру. На низких всё идёт идеально, да и на средних в общем как-то идёт... Но всё же. Жаль, что движок не изменился.

В общем, игру советую всем и надеюсь, что Мэтт Росзак (надеюсь, правильно написал) продолжит радовать нас новыми частями этой серии!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138647317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3128, 'last_played': 1624174405}
review:
The Epic Battles get even better. 

As a whole, the EBF series has always had some of the best designed turn-based combat out there. And on that angle EBF5 keeps things strong and keeps things fresh. Changes such as removing MP and giving stronger skills Cooldowns do wonders for keeping things interesting, and the newly revamped summon system gives the game a minor taste of pokemon that's completely optional (Catch a goddamn viking monolith though, it will do wonders.) 

I am also happy to say that some of the other areas of the game are a step up from previous games. The storytelling in this one is the best it's ever been in the EBF series. As a warning though, that doesn't mean it's perfect or great, since the EBF series is not a story-centric series, instead being incredibly focused on turn-based combat above everything else, but it's certainly an improvement of previous entries. 

As for the general satire and humor? Well, all that stuff's subjective. I was amused, but I'm not about to claim that you will be to, since everyone has different tastes. Speaking of tastes, the game still has a huge amount of different costumes and weapons with unique aesthetical appearences, and there's a deep variety of strategies and plans you can employ, with no real direct answer for any situation. The soundtrack's pretty damn good too, as it always is in this series. 

If Turn Based Combat and Party Management is your thing, you shouldn't be dissapointed here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104699599', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2992, 'last_played': 1582573741}
review: 一如前作好玩，操作上更简洁，美术风格继承前作且有所突破

author: {'steamid': '76561198826008024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1703, 'last_played': 1640080171}
review: 很好玩的游戏，内容很丰富，没有MP设定就不用考虑耗蓝这些琐事了，技能只是需要回合数的冷却。战斗系统非常丰富，有良性状态和buff，有恶性状态和debuff，还有一些中性状态，而且利用好状态组合有奇效，比如潮湿+寒冷=冰冻，利用好属性相克和状态可以良性循环，游戏有很多宝*梦的内容，几乎所有怪物都可以抓来当宝宝，包括boss也不能幸免。捕获宝宝很简单，把敌人打到半血以下，再叠个debuff就能轻松抓到了，需要叠加减防御、魔防、闪避的debuff，尤其是减闪避，所以绿毛虫和没退巫毒是抓宠神宠。敌人冰冻状态和投降状态基本百分百捕获。道具和装备的效果也是简单明了，玩一段时间就有了自己的搭配方案，不像哪些辣鸡网游效果繁杂的很，战斗时每个队友都有用武之地，因为这一代换队友不消耗回合数，游戏流程东拉拉西扯扯慢慢进入主线，一点都不会觉得赶工或拖剧情的意思。还有简介说的流程大约30小时……，我反正打了40小时还没通关主线，支线就更不用说了。不可多得的好游戏啊

review:
This game is exactly as I expected it to be. This is how you make a good series. Consistency in design quality, art quality, and gameplay. Good story, good comedy. I love the puzzles when I start them, hate them when I get them wrong, and love them as soon as I figure it out.

This is the best entry yet in a fantastic series, and I've loved every minute I've played, and it was worth every cent I payed. Great work as always, Matt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967713473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1545434629}
review:
Another excellent entry in the EBF series. There are a couple annoyances, mostly around the extreme difficulty in capturing some foes, and that you'll have to scour the map to recapture others since some are used in trades or in crafting.

But if you want a good RPG to play through, which still allows you to dive in deeper if you choose, EBF5 is the game for you. I don't want to sit with spreadsheets minmaxing damage boosts. But I also enjoy finding secrets and exploring the world. EBF5 lets you breeze through the game to explore its world and story, or you can turn up the difficulty to Epic and get a real challenge. Bosses on Hard and Epic are puzzles in themselves, requiring knowledge and planning.

Gameplay-wise, difficulty (and any settings) can be changed any time with no penalty. You recover quickly after battles except for some cooldowns and SP. There is also no penalty for running away, which encourages furious all-out battles, and scouting and experimentation. SP balances how often you can use (often extremely powerful) summons and essentially is the new mana system. Replenishing it is usually easy enough, but becomes an annoying grind especially when preparing for a boss. Hint: you'll want lots of SP if you plan to catch bosses.

It lags a little even on my monster of a machine, usually during complex fight scenes- a result of its heritage as a Flash game. That's the only technical issue I've had. I think it's time for an engine update for this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171718019', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 12867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5885, 'last_played': 1576457291}
review:
[h1]Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/h1]


De todos los EBF, este es el mejor de la saga. A diferencia de los demas, este EBF tiene algunos que otros cambios, pero los mas importantes son, el sistema de mana, ya no esta, ahora esta el sistema de turnos de las habilidades (que para mi asi es mucho mas complicado el juego), tiene el sistema de clima que dependiendo en que zona estes cambiara para beneficiarte o perjudicarte, tambien tiene el sistema de capturar enemigos/bosses y que puedes usarlos en los combates (pero claro esto te costara Sp, para aquellos que sepan del EBF4 ya sabran que es).

Aun no he completado el juego y eso que me queda zonas opcionales sin explorar, es un juego muy completo y que estaba esperando desde que me complete el cuarto juego. Lo recomiendo mucho, sinceramente nunca me habia viciado a un juego.

PD: No se si este es el ultimo juego de la saga, o si Matt hara otro juego de otra serie, pero espero que Matt pueda hacer un remake del primer EBF y del segundo, con gusto lo jugaria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105223884', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1990, 'last_played': 1546084961}
review:
For those who are wondering if this is just another JRPG that showed up on the steam store, Epic Battle Fantasy is a long running series since the days of Flash games. With excellent mechanics and a cast of delightable, fourth-wall breaking characters, Matt has once again shown why he is the master of creating both challenging and funny RPGs.

The new version of the game basically features the same cast of characters, this time with an additional mechanic in "Summons" - these are basically spells/skills that are used by the past monsters you have caught, and lend an unbelivable amount of depth to the game. Even knowing monster weaknesses you are required to play your cards correctly, as each turn you have to weigh between casting a heal, going for further damage or analysing/capturing your opponents.

While I have no doubt the steam store won't give this game the attention it deserves, hopefully more people reviewing will really push this game into the front page. Flash games may be 'dead',  but it lives on in Matt's amazing games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393970191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 2660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1549401567}
review: It is a very beautiful game, well done and wonderful. I think it's much better than the previous versions and I hope Epic Battle Fantasy 6 has both Epic Battle Fantasy5 and Bullet Heaven 2. We understand the idea of "gameplay +" after the game, but it's a little disappointing because all you can do is medals you did not do the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121237218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1582190705}
review:
There really is no need for many words here: EBF 5 is a perfectly executed continuation of the series. Every aspect of the game really is polished. 

The game provides a classic turn-based RPG experience - and does damn well in doing so. This great gaming experience is wrapped in a lighthearted, funny story and offers lots of optional stuff (hidden chests, medals, quests, etc) to explore. Difficulty can be adjusted freely - so the game caters to casual players as well as hardcore players (trying to) comple every boss on epic difficulty.

One additional aspect that is worth mentioning in my opinion is the fact that I cannot find a single annoying aspect in this game: There is no need for grinding, there is no need to spend a lot of game time walking from A to B (there are convenient means of teleportation), the UI is very intuitive.

Especially for this price, I'd recommand anyone to buy this gem and have a great time with it. 12/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000438477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1624197136}
review:
Pierwsza i najważniejsza informacja: gra wciąga niesamowicie :). Genialne połączenie RPGa, walki turowej i... łapania pokemonów. Kreskówkowa, bardzo przyjemna dla oka grafika i bardzo fajna oprawa dźwiękowa sprawiają, że samo przebywanie w tym magicznym świecie jest czystą przyjemnością. Cóż tu dużo mówić, na rzecz EBF5 odstawiłem RDR2 :). I to chyba najlepsza rekomendacja tej przeuroczej gierki. Kolejny raz potwierdza się, że nie ogromny zespół ludzi i góra pieniędzy zawsze musi stać za grywalnymi tytułami (Fallout76, hehe). Grę oczywiście jak najbardziej polecam. Good job, Matt!
A tutaj mój gameplay. Zapraszam: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=edXUxH-4SXI

author: {'steamid': '76561198255355414', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2591, 'last_played': 1558440027}
review:
先程、クリアしました。実は自分は何の前情報もなく、ただ「RPGがやりたいかな･･･」という感じで安く提供されてて、絵が個人的に好きなので本作を遊ばせて頂きましたが･･････これがメチャクチャ面白い！　バトルは大味なようで地味に気をつけてやらないとあっさりやられてしまう敵がいたり、スキルをレベルアップしていく楽しみ、装備の強化で得られる効果などなど、全てが面白い！　もちろん捕獲もほとんどの敵が捕獲できて効果も色々なので蒐集心をくすぐられます。
正直に言わせて頂くと、1520円以上の価値があります。それはゲーム容量以上の楽しみがあるということです。ストーリーも楽しかったですし、ブラックユーモアなどがありますが、このゲームが持っている雰囲気が鼻をつかさなくしていると思います。翻訳もとても丁寧で仲間キャラクターである「アンナ」の翻訳どうやったんやろ･･････とか思いました（笑）
わたしは今から二週目をプレイしますが、まだまだ全然飽きが来ていないので楽しめるだろうと思います。安いし面白いから買って損はないですよ！（宣伝）　では、失礼しました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971124645', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2383, 'last_played': 1546326740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198273778897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1704221269}
review: This is an awesome culmination of just how far this series has come over the years. Easily one of the best games I've played this year (though A Hat in Time gives this a run for its money). Absolutely worth checking out and playing through to the end. Great work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041382232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3103, 'last_played': 1587247531}
review:
Absolutely brilliant. 
Not only did Matt meet my expectations for this game, he managed to greatly surpass them.
It's obvious, that Matt put a TREMENDOUS amount of work into the game, and each bit of it was very much worth it.
Gameplay mechanics got another huge level up, story is amazing, the world is incredibly well thought through and dynamic, music is of course as amazing as ever, 
The whole world is innovative, the optional dungeons worthwhile and fun, and puzzles are actually really challenging this time (that's a good thing).

Only bad thing about the game is the performance. My computer is very strong, but the game lags when on max graphics. (Time to switch Flash for something better, I guess.)

Apart from the performance issues, the game is the best in the whole series, and I can't wait for the next one.

Please, keep up the great work, and never stop making games, Matt and Phyrnna.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171706581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3051, 'last_played': 1610933805}
review:
***CONTAINS MAJOR SPOILERS***

Just as a preface, I've spent an obscene amount of hours playing the first three games on various flash sites as wee lad. Point being, I deeply enjoy this series, although I never fully played the fourth due to various circumstances. 

As always, the combat system is fun and grabbing and the puzzles are tough but rewarding. A few tweaks to the overall experience such as the monster capturing system are very satisfying. The game does an excellent job at making the player feel rewarded with new gear and skills, and the while the forging system of this game remains relatively unchanged, I still contest it's one of the best examples of gear management I can think of. They don't try to reinvent the wheel in any aspect, but for what it's worth, I got my fair share of kicks out of it.

The game is ripe with nostalgia. Take that evaluation as a double-edged sword. While it does fill me with warm fuzzies, it's humor has remained stagnant and rooted firmly in that mid 2000s, I.E. 'ZOMG! Le vidya game reference! Isn't that funny?!' ala early gamer webcomics. I mean for the love of god, they make an over 9000 joke here. Even if that was done 'ironically', its still made me 'unironically' roll my eyes.

I see many defend this as, 'Oh, but the other games had the same caliber of humor'. To that I say yes, it does, and thats exactly the problem. Video game humor is almost entirely topical, so a game like this that feels like it was written during Newground's heyday is extremely jarring. Don't believe me? Go back and look at old strips of gamer webcomics. Even the ones considered good or even halfway competent are guilty of making those terrible obvious joke about Mario being addicted to shrooms or Link invading people's homes to destroy their pottery.  Of course, the stale humor is nothing deal-breaking. I even got a chuckle out of a joke or two, even though most decent bits are buried in a sea of corn.   

The main problem I had with this game is the same thing plaguing many indi-games nowadays - trying to be deep and meta. Good Lord, I hope this trend dies soon. It starts as just casual shots at the forth wall, such as the protagonists mentioning they feel like someones watching and controlling them, or the hero raging about how he hates block puzzles or directly referring to NPCs as NPCs. A bit off-putting, but stomachable.

Then you get to the late game and extra content.

Oh, where do I begin? A big sidequest includes having to collect three hidden crystals from creepy hidden cult dungeons in each town, which I will readily admit were surprisingly eerie and well done. Then you have to take them to a divine mountain where a god is rumored to live. And whats the grand payoff to this entire subplot? 

An optional boss which is essentially an Undertale reference. Yes, I wish I was joking.

And not just any Undertale reference, an Undertale reference that shames the player for killing a collection of pixels for the sake of exp and equipment. Yeah, how dare you like playing video games, person whos playing my video game that I filled with other video game references?! 

I legitimately burst out laughing as said boss began to cry blood. When you finally bring it down and the area turns into a black void filled with red eyes looming in said darkness, I was tempted to turn off the game then and there. I mean really? I think I've read creepy pastas more in touch than this.

But even that pales into comparison to the second hidden boss. Oh my goodness, the second hidden boss. I immediately felt sorry for trashing the first one after the second. It all revolves around what I believe is the same cult, only this time the whole indie meta idea horror concepts of vidya characters realizing they're inside of vidya and purposefully making textures and coding glitch out. Yes, just like in DDLC, expect somehow even more hamfistedly meta and awful.

Groaning, I forced myself through the unfun boss fight with a glitched menu only to have a... fake system crash! Wow, totally didn't see that one coming. It's not like theres been five-hundred others games that try to be deep and meta that have done the exact same thing.  

And then your characters directly call you a monster for forcing them to battle such an eldritch horror and how they'll be scarred for life. This all occurs during a cutscene where your characters all drawn like hyper realistic dolls with bloodshot eyes. This is all played without a hint of irony.

If I was tasked with giving this game a numbered review out of ten, that alone would've knocked off three points.

I tried to give the dev the benefit of the doubt and forged ahead to the final boss, trying to rationalize it as he was just using the optional areas as an excuse to be experimental. Ho boy, did he make me eat my words fast.

Not only do the characters again directly address you as if you're some sort of guardian deity, this time it being played complexly straight-faced, the final boss rants on how the world is just some sort of simulation he's already ran five times and how he's going to keep killing the heroes until you're bored of trying to beat him.

Again, just like in DDLC and Undertale. And again, a lazy and awful simile of trying to build tension, because the writer  isn't talented enough to actually invest you in the world and characters they've built and thinks somehow directly addressing you is clever and will totally not make you want to beat said boss by just uninstalling and playing a better game.

As much as I spit on the game for it's meta content, and as negative as this review sounded, I did have an overall positive experience playing it just for the combat and crafting. I'm only this hard on it because I know the story could've been so much better. I love all the games the dev makes, and its very clear he puts passion into his work in turn. The entire area devoted to framing his game's fanart is a joy to explore and absolutely heart-warming.

 I'd recommend  it if you enjoy'd the past games, but if you're averse to lazy video game references, stale memes and faux-deep meta-commentary, I'd regretfully have to recommend giving it a pass.
developer_response: I don't regret any of the writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035904401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 9754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3128, 'last_played': 1655488984}
review:
Не люблю и не умею писать обзоры. Но тут решил, что нужно написать хоть пару строк, игра того заслуживает.
В стиме уже есть множество подробных обзоров, так что буду краток.
Итак, перед нами классическая инди JRPG. Впрочем, это и так можно узнать по описанию и скриншотам, а вот то, что по ним узнать нельзя, это с какой любовью и старанием она сделана.
Море кавая и позитива, она словно создана, чтобы дарить вам хорошее настроение. Все в ней сделано для удобства игрока и его комфортной игры. Да перед нами очередное инди и это порой чувствуется, но данный продукт сильно отличается от убогого трэша заполонившего стим. Поэтому даже если вы терпеть не можете инди игры дайте шанс этому чуду.
Из минусов можно отметить: довольно слабый сюжет и посредственное техническое исполнение. Впрочем, никаких серьезных багов я не обнаружил, игра вышла не так давно и постоянно патчится.
А в остальном, для меня, это практически шедевр, глоток свежего воздуха, очень сложно оторваться.

Отдельное спасибо за перевод на русский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151381170', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 7079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1667964719}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039549756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2426, 'last_played': 1632971531}

author: {'steamid': '76561198228104384', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 7720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5227, 'last_played': 1637061165}
review:
First things first, if you love the Pokemon games you should definetly get this, even though I have yet to write a review for the previous game in this series, I was recommending Epic Battle Fantasy 4 to many Pokemon fans just because of the battle system(which is far better than the standard pokemon formula because it is a cross between Fantasy's and Pokemon's best mechanics) and that game didn't have an in depth monster catching system, which EBF5 has and it is great, if you played the pokemon games you'll know the advanced catching tips already since it follows a similar formula, but if you didn't, once you get to the library you will get all of the advanced catching mechanics and tips you ever could use.

The game itself is very much like the previous entry, but much better, with a stadalone story with a few nods to the other games, so you can jump in right ahead to 5 if you want, it is much more completionist friendly than 4 was too, even though getting all achievements in this game took about 4 hours longer than in EBF4, it actually was more enjoyable since this game ditches completely annoying and boring achievements like grind to a certain level, beat both NG+ and NG++, heck even the max damage achievement got cut down to size meaning you can actually get it without grinding.
You can get all achievements without getting into NG+, just save before getting each party member and leave those saves for later, you may miss a few achievements you can't get later, thank me later for saving you having to do a new game just to get them.

Other great improvements in 5 compared to 4. (Some mechnical spoilers ahead):
-Auto targetting (Berserk/Confuse/Some equipment related effects/Switch target after kill attacks) seem to have an improved AI system, so the player characters do follow what could be decribed as their personal combat style instead of being totally random if forced to take a turn without player input, like NoLegs targetting the weakest enemy when berserked or changing targets after a kill. Also beneficial equipment effects like occasionally sending in a medpack at random actually properly prioritze sending it to who needs it instead of choosing a random player even if they have full HP.
-MP system swapped out for cooldowns for the powerful abilities as well as rebalancing to make the very rare and powerful food items have some drawbacks, which is nice.
-Map mode shows completed quest locations, main story destinations as well as letting you mark each map tile with a large amount of icons so you can mark all the yet inaccesible chests, key item requiring paths, points of interest, etc.
-Each area has an alternate music track you can enable if you find the radio in the area(most alternate tracks seem to be from the older titles)
-Overall UI improvements

I got it close to launch as a gift from a friend, so it's the first time I was experiencing something before the patches settled in, there was an annoying flash player saving permissions bug, which is resolved in patch 1.4.

The 2.0. update added more content as well as made changes to the balance of the early-mid game like not have some of the less useful gear be obtained from endgame areas.
Anyone starting a new game for the first time after 2.0. will have a more complete blind experience than anyone prior.

Oh yeah, 2.0. adds various cheats and challenge modifiers. meaning you can have your item randomizer, super hard mode, weather randomizer, 1 character only run if you wish. There's no need for mods to do that since it is now supported natively.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037919624', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1584182034}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is an absolute joy to play. I was in the mood for a easy to pick up and put down RPG and this game always scratches that itch. The combat loop is very simple to learn, difficult to master. The complexity of all of its stats/buffs/resistences/debuffs/combos will keep me coming back to play day after day.

Exploration is top notch too, all of the hidden chests are visible if you're paying attention, or if you can logically work out how to get to them, they contain useful items such as weapons/armor/permenant stat buffs/crafting components. All of which I'm happy to get more of.

The story is silly, remenicent of Newgrounds Flash Era stick fighter videos, but its genuinely good humor to go along with it too. I find myself clicking on every NPC just to hear what they have to say.

At its current price its an absolute bargan for what you get. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198337920047', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 14946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1686758401}
review:
I've been a fan of the EBF games for a while, ever since I played EBF3 online with a really bad PC. I've liked the games and loved 4. There has always been an issue in all of them, not a fault of the game itself. It's usually a small issue, like 1's difficult ending, 2's linear path, 3's irritating scanning and item progression and 4's repetitive-ness and lack of use for a "4th" character, as you can just ignore one for the entire game. I like these games, and before, I would replay the hell out of them.

Now i'm never going back.

Holy shit is this game a hoot. It's very similar to 4 but there are so many little to huge changes that make it overwelmingly fun. NoLegs is a great new addition that allows for better team comp, the combat is more fluid and fast, the weather system (while a little small) adds an extra bit of strategy, the story is as insane as before and i like how it's basically a soft reboot.
The characters and comedy is really great, and the interactions in battle add a bit to a character's personality. New items add interesting attacks and strategys to this game.
The game is still, a little repetitive, but then again, isn't most RPGs. And, that might be the only issue i have. Any offensive material can be turned off, the jokes are funny, the combat is solid.

Matt Roszak, good job mate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182683146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1576105252}
review:
Note: This review is meant for players who have played the game themselves. Not that it has huge spoilers, but that it makes better sense for those who have experienced the game themselves.

As one of the many passionate translators for the game, I am honored to be part of this wonderful indie game, developed by the one and only Matt Roszak. The humour is back, with more witty dialogue, 4th wall breaks (more on that later), and snarky banter between the characters, making the translation process highly enjoyable.

Pros:
That aside, NoLegs is an awesome addition to the cast this time as a playable character. Skills designs have been totally revamped for the better, with the Cooldown system replacing the old MP system, making battles more intuitive and strategic based. It is also cool to see the weak skills upgrade into better skills, which makes sense considering the removal of MP. The over-the-top animations for the exaggerated Limit Breaks are highly entertaining as well. Battles flow better in this game than in previous iterations, allowing you swap between attacking players and backup players without any hassle. Foe catching system is also a welcome addition to the game, allowing you to actively hunt for the best summons to assist your journey. Unfortunately, catching the foes may sometimes be tedious, and coupled with the fact that some equipments amalgamates summons, you have to repeat the catching process again. Steroids have also changed so that each character is more balanced out. Puzzles are greatly designed and its difficulty gets exponentially more challenging as the game goes on, providing a huge burst of relief upon figuring out the harder puzzles. NPCs also give out hints in clever dialogues, or critique about political stuff happening in the real world, or even discussing heavy philosophy subjects. Some of them even got to move around the map! (which I found a nice touch to the standard NPCs in most games)

Cons:
Map design and the story.
The map design seems more messy and convoluted compared to previous games. There is a difference between good hiding spots for chest and map layout. In EBF5, there are too many view-blocking structures in the middle of the map for no apparent reason other than making the chests more hidden (the boxes, not the flashing secrets). The hidden chests in EBF4 are intuitive, they make sense and their locations are hinted at. In EBF5, you sometimes have to move your cursor around randomly to try and spot the exclamation mark, just to find the corner of the yellow box peskily sneaking out at random locations. The Mystic Woods (including the treetop walkway) is one of the messiest locations in the game. The one good thing about the map design is that it does attempt to give a theme regarding the overall game, which juxtaposes EBF4's map design perfectly. In EBF4, the players slowly rise upwards to the top of the grid to spar with the Gods of the world. In EBF5, the players gradually descend to the bottom of the screen to face off the [spoiler] destroyer of worlds [/spoiler]. This adds a nice touch to it.
Next the story. Although I liked the dialogue, the story of the game is rather plain mostly throughout the game. You get no new characterization and motivations for the characters are weak. These two can be explained by the fact that this game introduces a soft reboot of the series in a world where the character's memory are wiped out, so that they exhibit the exact same characteristics from previous games. However, the story suddenly turns a steep turn and becomes staggeringly awesome... only at the very end of the game - Rapture. It is where the NPCs we have communicated with returning to cheer the players, along with Natalie breaking the 4th wall with Matt, delivering a wholesome speech to the players; and don't forget the [spoiler] deletion of the Earth [/spoiler] providing that intense heart-pounding tension. These moments alone almost makes up the blandness of the entire story.

Overall, it is a wonderfully crafted game and I would highly recommend it to other people. And once again, thank you Matt for allowing me to assist with the translations!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973845109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2420, 'last_played': 1572932426}
review:
Okay, I just had to come on here and review and I never, ever review. 

This game is amazingly fun and well worth the price. This is a special present and you won't be let down. Matt delivers. Anyone, at any age, can play this game and love it. 

There is no stereotyping who plays this game though. I will shatter that stereotype. I am a tall, muscular, white, tatted up male who is
extremely toxic and alpha and I love this game. What is lying under all of the nice visuals, perfect anime if you're into that but don't need to be, is a game that hits my heart with the exact right love. 

The dialogue is amazing. I can't express how much the dialogue is golden here. I don't want to spoil anything but the dialogue will make you happy. Matt, I would totally be your friend in real life. Totally down to earth, common sense dude! 

The characters and world is amazing. I get so much nostaliga from the 80s gaming era from this game. I don't just say that to say it, it is truly meant for almost anyone and it will hit everyone's heart in some way that will make you love this game. 

If you we're a kid growing up in the 80s/90s with nes, snes, sega and all that followed than you were gaming in the peak of civilization. This brings me back to a kid. The escapism is real. 

The mechanics is pretty much perfected. It is way more complicated than you may first glance and especially so at epic level where the percent difficulty is at 200% instead of 100%. 

Anyway, this game is epic and matt you are a great man.

review: It's basically EFB 4 with some extra bells & whistles.  EFB 5 is a bit longer, has some quality of life improvements and has monster capturing which is an extra little thing you can play with.  If you liked EFB 4 and want more of the same then buy the game.  If you never played EFB 4 then pick this game up because its a fun and casual RPG.  If you didn't like any of the past EFB games then I'd give this one a pass since it plays almost exactly like EFB 1-4.  Still I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088358584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1709957536}
review:
The formula always seems so familiar. An rpg where you gather party members, go dungeon crawling, fight bosses, and save the world. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 does this, and then blows it out of the water to reinvent it a bit, then blows that out of the water to start from scratch. Really it's mostly the explosions that count...

EBF5 is a joy of a story, and it's writer has outdone himself greatly. You play the role of local hobo Matt who is whirlwinded onto a journey with a strange no-limbed cat, a mage with interesting assets, a young huntress seeking balance, and guy with questionable morals. But it all seems familiar to you, and you probably know that you've played this before... Or didn't you?

EBF5's improvments on it's previous games are vast. The capture/summon system is a joy, the general changes to the buff/debuff system and various weather effects make the game challenging, and there's enough customization in here to make your party shine. The world even feels bigger than ever. And that doesn't even begin to include the new and improved Epic difficulty. The music and sound effects are the best they've ever been, and the animations are clearly done with care. And the humor from the previous games has returned, perhaps the best part of it all.

That's not to say there aren't any cons. The game feels a bit long in some cases, and it's easy to feel lost at times. The new 5-party system is a welcome change, but I find myself sticking with the same members more often than not. (This might feel different in Epic difficulty?) And while I understand the reasons behind it, the fact that I can't change equipment and still have a turn on the same go is more of a personal nag than a real one.

Do I recommend EBF5? Yes and No. No, I don't recommend it because I feel like a person should play some of the previous games first (Especially EBF3, since it is free.). But on it's own, EBF5 shines and is something I wish everyone who enjoys RPGs could pick up and dive into. 10/10, Matt. You've surpassed expectations, and it was well worth the wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042876171', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2447, 'last_played': 1578120901}
review:
Do you enjoy RPG's of old? Love to slay monsters and collect a bunch of stuff that may or may not be important? Enjoy a good dose of whimsical humor and with a story and characters that are both serious yet don't take themselves seriously at times? If so, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is right up your alley!

Much like it's predecing games, this lovely RPG designed completely in Flash is one that will give you plenty of laughs, chuckles, and gasps as you play through defeating monsters and collecting treasure. You needn't have played the prior games to enjoy this one, though some story elements will point to the previous games, so it's recommended at least.

One new aspect of this game is that instead of finding particular monsters to summon by your side in battle, you actually have to catch them a la Pokemon-style, and mostly every monster has different effects varying from giving your party useful buffs to slamming foes into the ground. And yes, you CAN capture bosses too! All of this adds in an extra layer of collection for the ones who need to satisfy that itch~

Though you can play this game for free on popular Flash game sites, buying this version will give you access to a good bunch of additional content, including bonus dungeons, bosses, and a lot of endgame challenges. Plus it helps support the creator, Matt Rozak. Seriously, this man is quite attuned to his craft, and it shows~

The only major critisism I'll give to this game is that while it's very meaty in it's content for it's price (about 25-ish hours for the base game, though with bonus content it can stretch upwards to almost 40, and that's not including New Game+), during your first playthough it could be a bit of a slog in the later areas, so I highly recommend playing this game in small 'doses' at a time to get the most fulfillment out of it. All that said, if you're a big fan of his work or just really love a good-crafted Flash game, consider picking this one up. You shan't regret it~

author: {'steamid': '76561198050248192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2312, 'last_played': 1545580789}
review:
If you have played any of the earlier installments you know what you are getting. And like usual this installment is a refined and improved from the last. Of course if you played the others you likely aren't checking reviews before picking this one up.

For those of you who haven't played EBF before. It is a typical turn based combat J style RPG. That mocks and pokes fun at its conventions and just doesn't take itself very seriously. For example? After helping someone collect planks to build a house they tell you that if you leave and come back they will be done and when you visit them they thank you and invite you to rob them blind. Because we all know we were going to go through their belongings anyways, right?

Honestly I would probably pay more than the asking price for this. The game almost seems like a steel at this price given how many hours I know I can put into EBF.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059730333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1560806490}
review:
Поначалу очень увлекательно и необычно. Находишь новые шмотки, прокачиваешь умения, радуешься новым цифрам урона. Но со временем приходит понимание что большая часть одежды/оружия в игре скорее мусор, чем что то полезное, т.к в итоге бегать придётся с очень ограниченным арсеналом особо имбовой экипировки. Контента и кастомизации для инди игры тут реально много, но от неё нет никакого толка, ведь 80% всего этого вы никогда не будете пользоваться всерьёз.
Бесконечные закликивания монстров одним и теми же набором заклинаний постепенно навивают скуку и перестают радовать. Есть некоторые умения которые можно найти проходя игру, но принципиально ситуацию это не меняет.

Играть рекомендую небольшими наскоками, что бы немного отвлечься когда остальные игры поднадоели. После десятка часов в игре не остаётся и следа от того начального восторга. Ты просто уничтожаешь монстров сотнями как в каком то кликире (цифрами дамага под миллионы) и идёшь по сюжету который тут скорее для галочки.
developer_response:
I hope you try a higher difficulty if the game is not challenging enough.

The equipment is quite well balanced, and you'll have more reasons to experiment with it if you play on a harder difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089762156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1544374427}
review:
等了好久的作品。我本人本来是不很喜欢玩JRPG的，不过这作品算是个例外。一大原因就是因为战斗系统真的很cooooool，考验玩家策略的同时没有拖泥带水的感觉。
本作比起前几作来说战斗系统有进一步的提升，首先就是这作的换角色是真的不再鸡肋，后备角色不会长期坐冷板凳。再者就是宝O梦系统极大的丰富了战斗策略。在敌人方面，游戏前中期不会有过分多余的战斗（不点名批评某些2018年还在地雷遇怪的游戏...），但是每场战斗都会有一定的难度，尤其是复数大怪登场的时候是非常考验战略（和属性技能克制）的。另外，没有法力值，战斗结束后自动回复生命这点也能让玩家更专注于战斗本身，不用考虑那么多的资源调配。
剧情方面继承作者一贯的基调，东扯扯西扯扯之余顺便交代一下主线，总体是偏欢乐的（毕竟初代就是个单纯打怪的游戏...)
内容很丰富，即使不去打额外区域也有笔者这种游戏时长。并且前面也说过了，单纯想玩的话并不会玩的自己特别累。

review: If you liked the rest of the series, you'll love this. The new systems with monster catching, weather systems, and COOLDOWNS REPLACING MP are super fun. More of that ebf humor and charm, with some fun easter eggs. Really great, cant reccomend enough to fans of the series. It is welcoming to newcomers, but I'd personally reccomend playing the other games in the series to fully appreciate its growth as a series, especially since they're all free online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094613262', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2685, 'last_played': 1583373568}
review:
This game is Exactly what i wanted, and alot more.

Few games can do this, but i believe this game is near-perfect form of this game, it takes a real good understanding of the player and the game mechanics to achieve this, but the gameplay of this game is top tier, the battle mechanics are indepth, and dispite how clear weaknesses and resistances are, and what moves can easily take out foes, this game STILL has room to design stratagies and lineups to take on battles with.

Systems done right:
Gear, Skills (and extra skills) Limit breakers
Being able to capture 90% of the enemies, including alot of the bosses! then them all having a unquie power to use.
Optional areas to explore, dungeons and bosses!
The music fit really well, i enjoyed it a bunch (and will probably continue too, favorite track was 'Fight the Movement'
I understood everything the game threw at me (besides parts where i didn't, it was intentional though), simple achivement, but its still worth mentioning!
I enjoyed world exploration, dispite how linear the story is, i found myself still going back to old zones of my own free will, and finding alot of secrets, one in particular near the end made me real unsure of my actions... (which is good)

Though the gameplay itself is pretty flawless, there are a few things that still can be improved appon:
The Story and Diologue can be hit and miss, i enjoyed how clear the personallitys of each of the characters were, and how it affected the story entirely, but there was still something missing, im not sure what it was, but writing is pretty hard so...
During my playthough, the framerate wasn't the best, i fiddled with the options and it still wasn't running super well, it might just be my computer, but the last game ran pretty well! and on 1 particular session, this one ran well too! it was kinda confusing, but the next day it went back to bad framerate, this could be improved appon after launch im sure
Making original puzzles is hard, im not quite sure how this can be fixed...

I did beat the game yesterday, and did many (but not all) of the optional side dungeons, i think i'll come back to finish them later.

Final Thoughts: 
This is a Really good RPG, it does so many things well, the developer knows what they are doing!
Would reccomend this game, 9.5/10      (i'd round it up to 10 if you don't take halvsies)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021569873', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 4689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4689, 'last_played': 1545076862}
review:
Как-то много всего и сразу хочется рассказать о данной игре и серии в целом, но постараюсь быть краток.

С данной серией игр познакомился уже давно (на сайте Armor Games), ещё начиная с EBF1, правда тогда они были совсем примитивны - одни бои, до какой волны сможешь дойти (но выглядели круто, как для своего времени и Флеша). Серия эволюционировала и переросла в полноценную JRPG, очень качественную JRPG, надо сказать.

Данная серия игр отличается достаточно хорошим балансом, если не упарываться в детали, и объемом механик. Она какая-то... добрая и забавная? Хардкорная и веселая? В любом случае, ты не ожидаешь от неё многого, судя по тому, что это игры на Флеше и по скриншотам, но она гораздо глубже и интереснее, чем множество более "крутых" проектов.

Здесь 5 играбельных персонажей, куча экипировки, которая меняет твой стиль игры, можно менять скиллы персонажам (доп. умения  и доп. ультимейты), призывные мобы – это открывает просто офигенный простор для разного рода тактик. Кстати, под некоторых боссов следует их подбирать, нахрапом победить не выйдет. Играть стоит строго на Эпике! :)

Эта игра... ой, серия игр... игра... давайте будем брать всю вселенную EBF сразу, ок? Настоящая жемчужина в своем роде. Для сравнения ближе всего подойдет FF7, но EBF не такая пафосная, она простая и с юмором, часто стебет другие игры и саму себя :) 

В неё, просто приятно играть. Ценителям жанра - рекоммендую!
