author: {'steamid': '76561198140299409', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1629722132}
review:
This is a great game
If you have played ebf4 and 3, you know what to expcect in the combact. Each enemy have unique animations for different attacks, and each character having differnct skill and animations as well
In this version, there is no mp system, so certian moves (ie Powerful/super useful) are balancd with a turn waiting system, that works fine enough.
The difficutly settings are fine, and from wht i have heard, 5 bonus dungeons, that scale to your level, with bonus bosses, to do, if that scratches your itch. (only in the paid version might i add, over the free version)
Its a good place to start for newcomers as well, as the story has been soft rebooted, with the same characters, but with different ways of them meeting and story. there are some minor issuses, like hearing the point where music loops, and some minor grapical issues, but other than that this game is great
4/5
(p.s. the music is fantasic, and i would highly reccomend checking the artist out on soundcloud (Phyrnna)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127204008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4010, 'last_played': 1644567650}
review:
從三代，四代到現在，五代終於正式上市了
還記得小時候打最終王花了快兩個小時，真是緊張又刺激的回憶（
以下是我對這代的評論：

+優點（PRO）：
+流暢的戰鬥畫面，整體畫面也非常細緻
+從MP制修改為CD制，戰鬥需要更加仔細思考戰略，不在像以前一樣無腦疊招
+一如往常優秀的音樂表現
+新增抓寶機制，讓戰鬥變得更有趣，適當時機使用寶*夢甚至可以扭轉戰局
+大量遊戲動畫梗（以前就有，不過這代多更多）
+可以在地圖上隨時標記，日後拿到關鍵道具的時候可以立馬知道對應的位置
+奶子

-缺點（CON）：
-舊時代FLASH引擎，優化其實不是很好，過圖、放某些招式或極限技的時候會有明顯掉偵
-非常單一的劇情，一如往常
-擋寶箱的怪物"很多"，有時候打了老半天，換來的只是普通材料
 ＊其實以前就有，只是可能這代地圖比較大，所以特別有感觸
-不知道這個BUG有沒有被修正，當遊戲自動儲存的時候有機率觸發FLASH的設定提醒，你必須要按允許或不允許，
 然而問題就是按不到按鍵。目前解決方法是調整桌面解析度即可！
 千萬不要關掉視窗！！否則他不會給你存檔，我之前辛辛苦苦終於抓到黑化蘭斯，結果出現這個問題就沒了。

這真的是一款值得遊玩的遊戲，而且台灣售價非常便宜，三百有找
以這款遊戲的質量，甚至可以要求更高的價格（國外售價是15美金）
所以非常推薦購買！
developer_response: Sorry about the Flash pop ups, that should be fixed in version 1.3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054257218', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2170, 'last_played': 1561070764}
review:
Epic Battle fantasy 5 has resparked a love for video games that I thought I had lost.
This game is simultaiously easy and hard to describe. it's a top down rpg with turn based battles, but it's so much more than that. The protaganists are easily my favorite part of the game, and the overarching story really wasn't even important until i was almost 20 hours into the game. Where the game excells is not only the content, but the variety of loot and secrets in every tile of the map help to keep you engaged and looking for secrets. I personally plan on trying to get every achievment, and i'm not really an achivement hunter kind of guy.

whether you've played the previous games or not, EPF5 will delight you. for the best experience, avoid any guides or walkthroughs (even though some puzzles are tricky, they are optional so as to not be frustrating and stop your progress.)
I strongly reccomend this game if you've played any of the previous games, or are a fan of turn based RPG's in general. if you're hesitant about purchasing the game, try out EPF4 or EPF3, which can be found on most flash game websites. Epic Battle Fantasy are like those, but much more refined and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994118212', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1824, 'last_played': 1575789839}
review:
Абсолютно не ожидал такой увлекательной истории и геймплея от этой игры. Тут нет графона, но зато на месте юмор, красивый дизайн локаций и героев/монстров. Много отсылок к другим jrpg, но всего в меру. Крайне рекомендую, игра проработана до мелочей)

Единственная проблема бывает на финальном боссе в полноэкранном режиме. Внезапно пропадает изображение, потому стоит проходить его в окне.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009586252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 19766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3406, 'last_played': 1706992283}
review:
i lack the ability to put into words how much i adore this game
as someone who played the earlier iterations on the old flash sites, it's fantastic to see a new entry in the series that lives up to the rose-tinted glasses&nostalgia fueled version of the older games.

with a frankly absurd amount of customization for outfits and builds, a "reboot" of sorts for the story, and a reworked combat system(cooldowns instead of static MP cost, capturing foes to use in battle later) and an expanded roster of main characters this game is everything i didnt know i wanted in a sequel.

if you ever spent any time on newgrounds or armorgames, or enjoy JRPG's but wish they didnt seem hellbent on cramming angsty Emo bullshit down your throat/boring you to tears constantly, you owe it to yourself to get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057949660', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1581060373}
review:
太好玩了！给我的感受是我第一次玩口袋妖怪的体验，有种心金魂银的既视感。
谜题恰到好处，剧情对白打破第四面墙，设定疯狂玩梗，非常多的宝箱和收集物品
战斗系统像神界原罪一样要造特殊环境提高伤害，也很宝可梦，可以召唤小弟帮你打
这里面boss也是可以抓的，记得召唤毛毛虫和僵尸手，接着叠debuff
这是一款你打开就会想熬夜通关的优秀RPG
我要为了打出真结局再开一把（和探索程度 各角色上场率有关）
诶，一开始以为Matt是个萌妹子的...

author: {'steamid': '76561198243319050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4873, 'last_played': 1575211541}
review: 'God' made my day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054082356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8200, 'last_played': 1545215289}
review:
全実績解除した勢いでレビューします
PVからファイナルファンタジー的なRPGをイメージしてたのですが
戦闘システムはドラゴンクエストのような完全ターン制コマンドRPGでした
キャラ/エフェクト/背景の描き込み、パロディありメタあり笑いありシリアスありのストーリー
シーンにマッチした綺麗な音楽、マウスでの操作性の良さ
適切な戦闘バランスなど完成度が高いゲームです

雑魚はもちろん全ボスとも再戦できる施設があるので
アイテムや実績の取り逃しがないのも心配性な自分にはありがたかったです

5の目玉システムのモンスター捕獲ですが捕獲方法はポケモンですが
使用感はFF4や5の召喚獣をイメージしていただければ分かりやすいと思います
FFの召喚獣は高火力・範囲火力のイメージですがEBF5では火力の他にも
バフ/デバフ/回復に優れた召喚が非常に沢山あります

最高難易度エピックでの全ボス撃破実績解除にはPTと敵の耐性と睨めっこして
装備・スキル回し・召喚獣をセッティングしていく必要がありますが
ラスボスや隠しボス戦ですら先行して確実に逃げられるシステムの上に
敵リストで詳細データが見られるのでセッティングを考えて何度も挑み
敵の行動を把握して糸口を見つけて攻略していくがとても楽しかったです
耐性ゲーですが全味方キャラが豊富な属性攻撃や補助スキルを持っており
なおかつ戦闘中の控えキャラとの入れ替えがターン消費無しで出来るので
いらない子や死にスキルと言ったものが無いのも良かったです
むしろエピックモードでは全員をフル活用しないとボス撃破は難しいです
なお90年代JRPGにありがちだった万能で最強な各キャラ専用装備群や
レベルをあげて特定の強行動で殴れば余裕でクリアと言った大味さはなく
実績解除のためのエピックモードでの攻略は詰将棋のような緻密さがあります
気軽に攻略したい場合は難易度を下げれば実績が取れない以外のデメリットなしで
EDや隠し要素までまるっと楽しめます
もちろん低難易度で全クリ・隠しボス達成した後でも難易度をあげて再戦施設で
全実績解除に挑戦できるので様々なプレイスタイルに答えられると思います

第一印象ではふにゃふにゃしてるように思えたグラフィックも
プレイしてすぐに丁寧に描き込まれていることが分かったので
パット見で敬遠してる方にも是非ともプレイしてもらいたいです
攻略中もっとも使用したリミットブレイクの7thヘブンは本当にヘブン状態に誘われます

BGMに関してですがJRPGの音楽、特に戦闘音楽が大好物なのですが
このゲームは通常戦闘・ボス戦闘ともにMOTHERやポポロクロイス物語のように
数曲用意されておりどれもハイクオリティなのがこれまた良かったです
中でもNymphisFaeという曲は自分史上トップクラスのお気に入り戦闘曲になりました

最後に日本語訳もとても素晴らしかったので
EBF1～4や出るのか分からないEBF6での日本語ローカライズもお願いします！

author: {'steamid': '76561198263177330', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1833, 'last_played': 1548519841}
review:
游戏内容丰富，耐玩但节奏较慢，消磨时间的利器，但想玩好的话需要带脑子翻对话和记忆事件（解谜倒是简单）总体不是那么的吸引我
内容不够吸引我是差评原因之一，其余原因包括翻译问题（建议使用简体中文，而不是繁体）和较拖沓的游戏内容、遇到的丢档问题（不排除是steam的锅）
2019/1/27更新
On Translation：location:Leonidas(Wrong word错字)Aniki（Personal pronoun我/我们使用混乱）........A lot
关于翻译问题：在我的角度，完全不需要什么发现‘问题的对话位置在哪里’了，超过一半的繁体中文翻译质量都比简体中文要差，我觉得以及不需要作后续跟进了，坏一点还能修补，全是坏的怎么补救呢？
繁体中文给我的的“机翻”味道极其严重，明显只是略做改动的英文直译。随意找一个中文使用者，任意国籍任意地区，两种翻译只需各读给他听一遍，他也会和我一样告诉你，繁体中文的翻译没有用心，到处都是硬翻译导致的僵硬语序或者用词

除了上面的错误之外，有大量的NPC对话的语感对比都能明显反映出问题

另外发现的简体中文问题：Stephanie的简体中文翻译缺少关键“第五个”节日提示

12/17再更新@alvinau2000：It's worse than simplified Chinese. It's obvious that I made an absolute judgment when I checked the skill names of three NPC dialogues and two roles at random.
另外的发现：噢，我发现繁体中文把勋章馆里左下角“dao”老哥的话翻成粤语了（港式的），但好像跟原文有比较大的差异？这是翻译组搞的彩蛋呢？还是夹带的私货？好吧，我反正不喜欢，当然也可能是因为我是广州人，不是不是香港人不懂他们屈机或者这样的有趣是个有什么笑点的梗。
12/17更新：家里丢档了（应该是天才般的steam云系统问题），由于我的个人习惯不佳，只有存档1有保存存档，现在的档“回到过去”少了大约15幅图（昨天一个休息日的游戏时常）的探索进度，我好像需要找其他东西消磨时间了，心态有点炸
消磨时间还行，但不怎么好玩感觉（仅代表个人，至少在有这高比率的好评做前提时，至少不够好玩），游戏质量不错，有兴趣的也可以入，但这铺天盖地的好评我觉得不至于，如果我有其他事情，应该不会想打开这游戏吧，大概
玩了几个小时都不知道在干嘛，有什么就点什么，前期到处都是帮助教学说实话有点烦人，遍布全程的低难度解谜可玩性其实不错，但说实话做的不够好；组建队伍刷怪过图，来回找材料跑步解谜，有些什么左脚袜子找半天找不到就很烦人真的，还有各种后面拿到道具再回头回老远找东西的。。真的麻烦啊。大概我不适合这游戏吧

越留意文字越感觉不喜欢这风格。。还是只看大概吧，能感觉到各种奇怪的梗（但很多我并不喜欢或者不懂），稀奇古怪的逻辑跟语气，也不知道是翻译问题，还是原文就这个味道，也许其他人会觉得不错，但我说实话不太喜欢

To the production team: I don't need help in the game, but I don't think it's interesting enough to be praised by me.
developer_response:
Where are you lost? 
You can ask for help in the Steam forums or on Discord if you get stuck with something. I hope you give the game another try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025215186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4204, 'last_played': 1556359918}
review:
(Note: The following review is predicated on playing the game on Epic difficulty, the highest available.)

Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is one of the best RPGs I've ever played in my life. The most impressive thing about it, and what puts it a level above nearly any other RPG I've played, is how almost every battle is a meaningful challenge that's fun to complete. There are no random battles, just monsters on the world map you can interact with (they won't charge you down themselves). The majority of these fights after the tutorial will present a unique challenge to overcome and rarely, if ever, will simply smashing the default attack button see you through. You have a wide range of balanced skills to use and there's just tons of great mechanics helping things along.

 For instance, buffing works by giving say a 50% boost to attack damage. Next turn, it goes down to 45%, then to 40%, and so on. This turns the simple act of buffing into a mindgame where it's constantly weakening and you need to decide when to re-cast it. Things get even more complicated when enemies start reversing your buff, turning a 45% attack buff to a -45% attack debuff. Then there's the "Weakened" status ailment, which lowers your defense/attack buffs by 5% each turn, even going into the negatives. Status ailments are a magnificent can of worms as well, with there being a range of creative ailments that really keep you on your toes. Invisibility makes you immune to physical damage, but you take twice as much from magic, for instance. But the most common status ailments are the like of dry/wet/etc, that introduces vulnerability to certain elements AND resistance to certain elements.  The whole element system is executed really well too, you REALLY want to be exploiting elemental weaknesses and gearing up to resist elements when necessary, not to mention levelling up skills to open up and strengthen your attack options. 

Hopefully that paragraph got across how complex, yet well designed the gameplay is. You really have to play it to believe it, though, to really witness how all the systems work together to make some great RPG combat. Thankfully, the complexity is backed up by the game being just fun to play. Everything about EBF5's shows that the creators likes RPGs, plays RPGs, and knows how to make RPGs. You can scan enemies to get a detailed analysis of their stats, removing guesswork from the equation and allowing for precise strategizing. You're constantly levelling up and improving your abilities, which feels great, and the enemies (naturally) grow in difficulty as you progress further, so said improvements never end up with you steamrolling the game. There's a constant sense of progression that's very enticing and makes the game hard to put down. There's a crafting/upgrade system, but it involves little busywork and doesn't get in the way of just playing the game. Quests are admittedly pretty basic fetch quests, and while I'd criticize that in most games, you can clear most of them here by just paying attention and remembering when to backtrack. Basically, everything works well and either improves the fun or doesn't get in the way of it. I haven't even mentioned the plethoras of extras like the bestiary or the fanart mansion, or the monster capturing/summoning stuff, etc. There's a lot to this game and it all works together brilliantly.

But every RPG is built around a plot, and if EBF5 has a clear weakness, it's the plot. The writing isn't bad at all, and I found myself amused by a lot of the conversations, references, etc. But this is a game in a long, long, loooooong line of RPG parodies filled with self-referential, derogatory humor and not much of an actual solid plot. The dialogue scenes are short enough to never drag the experience down, and for a lot of people the writing won't even be an issue, but it is worth noting that the writing is not quite up to par with the game design.

To sum things up: Epic Battle Fantasy is a brilliantly fun and brilliantly well designed RPG, among the best I've ever played. Whether or not you enjoy the parody-focused writing, the gameplay is sure to deliver on great tactical fun - assuming you go to the options and set the difficulty to "epic", that is. This game gets my full recommendation for any fan of turn based RPGs.

Word of warning, though: This game requires mouse and makes heavy use of it. There's no way to play it keyboard only (or controller only), which I think is some pretty rough oversight.

review: Great game, pretty in-depth with a lot of exploration in fighting and the map. Casual game, unless playing on epic difficulty, makes it a lot harder and more fun. A lot of quality-of-life things and more are on the way. Price is very reasonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025319378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 5310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4182, 'last_played': 1589067787}
review:
A content-packed JRPG adventure that stays true to its Newgrounds-era roots. I highly suggest it to anyone that was a fan of EBF3 or EBF4, or is looking for a straightforward, fun tactical RPG to sink hours into.

With no random encounters or mandatory grinding, the game's 60+ hour runtime for an Epic difficulty playthrough is packed full of meaningful content and exploration. Numerous secret bosses, optional dungeons, and unlockables will have you scouring over the entire world and taking on a large variety of enemies in different environments, and systems like Scanning and Capturing every enemy in the game add even more for collectors and completionists.

If this is your kind of game, grab it the moment you have some cash to spare and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080267493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 6228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3647, 'last_played': 1626498022}
review:
EBF5 is another step forward in the right direction, which is great because it was already standing on a pretty good path. The new one made lots of improvements from the prior games, a few of which I originally questioned but soon came to appreciate.

You probably know the drill by now, but if you didn't, I'd describe EBF5 as "Classic Final Fantasy with all the bad bits taken out and a sense of humor". It's a well-made JRPG with a nice art style, and the system still holds up well (engine could use work, though, Flash). A few new additions made: to unlock your "summon" abilities (skills shared between all party members), you have to weaken enemies and capture them Pokemon style (the system is less frustrating than that though, thankfully). Skills no longer cost mana, and instead have cooldowns depending on their effectiveness (Was originally dubious about this, but it works amazingly well in game terms). Healing items have cooldowns, party members not in combat can be buffed and interracted with, and de/buffs no longer stack, as a few big examples. It's a very well refined system that seems to only be improving.

You aren't going to buy this game for the story, honestly (it's a prequel, strangely enough, and if you liked the characters, they each finally get concrete background in this one), but its script is excellent. Lots of excellent humor, and a few lines you might recognize from the older titles as well. The art style is charming and quite appealing (though I like 4's version better). The game has very fair challenge on the higher difficulties, and generally is streamlined further and further from its roots for the better. The only complaint I have at all is that this game sort of borrows a bit heavily from the prior entries at times, in terms of dialogue and some bosses.

EBF5 is an excellent RPG I'd recommend to anyone who's a fan of the genre, even if the normal turn-based JRPG is off-putting to them. This game is good enough and has refined the system so well, it's taken out almost every complaint I have about the system in other games. 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994896116', 'num_games_owned': 2350, 'num_reviews': 1483, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1544562142}

Приятная картинка и спокойная музыка подарят нам незабываемое прохождение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053162180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3782, 'last_played': 1637384762}
review:
This series is just like its creator intended to be. Matt Roszak has mentioned that he first created Epic Battle Fantasy to make a game that had everything he enjoyed in RPGs and this game is no exception. It has everything from loveable (and punchable) characters, epic battles against massive foes, oddly good dialogue and storywriting for a series that can be aptly described as one massive meme, and a rather unique artstyle that works very well for its intended purpose.

For as simple of a game as it is, it's also simply fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092312756', 'num_games_owned': 1201, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2536, 'last_played': 1544518186}
review: Played the free version of EBF4, liked it, so thought I'd buy EBF5. Didn't disappoint. A lot of references. A lot of humour. One particular moment I liked was the dialogue when I used a captured summon against his brother (shall not spoil). One thing I disliked was having too many fights. Yes. Each fight felt like minibosses near the end game. Exasperated, I turned down the difficulty from normal to the easiest one somewhere at the 75% main storyline mark. I guess I'm not patient enough for turn-based games, especially if there's no option to speed up the battle animations. But overall was worth the full price. (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198167016513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1591991236}
review:
EBF is a series that never stops improving, never stops impressing, and I keep enjoying every time I come back to it. It takes out a lot of the boring junk from a lot of JRPGs and still leaves the chill combat loop that you can lose hours to, and the pacing of the game lets you play in bite-sized chunks.

I kinda was concerned that coming back to the series after 5 years since the last entry would kind of scrub out a lot of the nostalgia, but Matt still keeps trying to improve and keeps suceeding. I felt skeptical about a few new additions like the monster-catching on limited bosses, but I've yet to be completely locked out because of how well the player can manage these things.

I guess the only thing is that the game is a bit all over the place with diffculty. On epic difficulty you can go from wiping out entire encounters with no problem to barely avoiding your entire party getting wiped in one enemy phase. The optional areas are particularly bad about this. Still, it's easy to find the loop you want in the game.

Thanks for the game, Matt, it was worth the wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063800293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 9910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2993, 'last_played': 1709945079}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 - Holy fucking shit. - 10/10

Okay, so i've been playing since EBF1. This one game series has brought me from my newgrounds era, to my discord era.
All the same, this series once started out as a 2vMany flash game. All this being said, I've had high hopes for EBF5.
If you want to know: This game is FUN AS HELL. Best part about it, is the story, the characters and the animations.
Everything from the first game has been improved, however the only real complaint is the cooldown mechanic. 
Asides from the cooldowns, The game only has glitches if you play in full screen. 

Therefore.

My own personal rating of Epic Battle Fantasy... is...
10 battle-ready cats... out of 10.
This game is one of those games where nothing really is flawed. It's a entertaining story, with  lots of character.

Thanks so much to the Developer. Y'all did good.
Music's awesome too. Can't wait to get the soundtrack.

review: First off, don't let the graphics fool you into thinking this is anything other than a really well made, deep, and funny game. You will start  playing thinking meh, it's a flash game, but it will pull you in with it's game mechanics and humor, and since you can just play with a mouse, it's super accesible on things like low power laptops. If you like Final Fantasy style games with a bit of Pokemon mixed in, you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142452530', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 10083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1698669813}
review:
[h1]Epic Battle Fantasy 5: ça se mange comme un petit pain, mais en plus longtemps et en plus delicieux[h1]

[table]
[tr]
[th]Graphisme: [/th] [th]Gameplay:[/th] [th]Bande Son:[/th] [th]Histoire:[/th] [/tr]
[tr]
[th]★ - 18/20 [/th] [th]★★ - 20/20[/th] [th]★ - 18/20[/th] [th]★ - 19/20[/th] [/tr]
 [/table]

Epic Battle Fantasy 5 a été fait par une petite entreprise du nom de Kupo Game, publié le 30 Novembre 2018.

Alors qu'on pourrait croire que les graphismes sont comme un jeu flash, cette merveille (voir chef-d'oeuvre) contient tout ce qu'il faut avoir pour faire d'un jrpg une sorte d'objet non identifié.



En un bref résumé: ses points positifs et négatifs.

Les +:

-L'humour, celui qui ris pas a pas d'âme
-Personnages tellement attachants qu'on ne s'en lasse pas
-Beaucoups d'objets. BEAUCOUP.
-Difficulté changeable à tout moment
-Pas d'écran de téléchargement
-Capturer les boss, du génie absolue
-Références sur quasi tout les jeux nintendo

Les -:

-Les graphismes, on s'y attache, mais il y a du temps avant pour s'y adapté...
-Rien d'autre.

Conclusion: ★★★★★★★★★☆: 9.5/10

Epic Battle Fantasy 5: un jeu où pratiquement les mêmes personnages que les opus précédents se rencontrent encore une fois pour tabasser du mob à gogo. Avec son humour poilant et ses réérences pittoresques, il mériterait d'être l'un des jeux indépendant de l'année!

Un jeu incontournable! Jouez y si vous voulez vous mettre dans les J-RPG!

(Je le mets entièrement en bleu car ce jeu en vaut vraiment le coup)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062231717', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 3690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3690, 'last_played': 1549664470}
review:
"Epic Battle Fantasy 5"


Wie seine Vorgänger auch ein sehr Gutes Spiel , neue und andere Mechaniken von Zaubern und Beschwörungen.

"Epic Battle Fantasy 5" ist anders als seine Vorgänger eine neue Geschichte mit den selben Charakteren , wo sie sich erst nach und nach alle kennen lernen , was auch in Ordnung ist , am ende des Spiels erfährt man noch einiges dazu.

---

Durch Geschafft auf Mittel ( vor der Version 2.0 die noch kommt ) , bei etwas über 61 Stunden , mit fast allen Erfolgen , so alles mögliche an Sachen gesammelt.

Um dann die restlichen Erfolge zu sammeln , müssen bestimmte Kämpfe auf Episch gemacht werden , da mir das Spiel gefällt und es gut gemacht ist , mache ich auch alles andere noch auf Episch , man sollte ohnehin besser erstmal auf Mittel bis Schwer vorher Spielen.

---

Eine Erklärung zur Nummer im Namen , sah das Spiel "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" in Steam gefiel mir gut aber ich Kaufe alles nur mit Rabatt nicht jeder ist reich und kann alles immer zu Vollpreis Kaufen , dann kam es irgend wann mal in einen Bundle wo dieses und auch andere Spiele noch waren , und Kaufte das Bundle , fing mit Spielen an , bevor ich am Ende ankam sah ich noch nach gibt es den noch einen Vorgänger da es immer wieder mal was so angedeutet wurde das da noch ein Teil davor geben könnte , und ja es gibt noch einen aber mit 3 im Namen , also und das Spiel gefällt mir auch , und wo ist 1 und 2 und dann fiel mir auf in 3 sind 3 Charakter und in 4 genau diese Zahl auch an Charakter , und jetzt wo es 5 im Namen gibt wo es 5 Charakter gibt ist es klar die Zahl bezieht sich rein auf die Charakter.

Also spart man sich Zeit um nach 1 und 2 zu suchen was es wohl nicht gibt , falls doch dann wohl nie erschienen.

"Epic Battle Fantasy 3" , "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" , "Epic Battle Fantasy 5"

---

Es ist bei diesen Spiel im Gegensatz zu anderen eher schwer zu Schreiben wie gut oder schlecht etwas ist , bisher viel mir so eigentlich nicht negatives auf , und es ist verständlicher für mich da es Deutsch gibt.

Aber man kann ja auch "Epic Battle Fantasy 3" mal Spielen , das auch Kostenlos ist , um zu sehen wie das einen gefällt , auch wenn es Englisch ist , wenn einen der Teil gefällt dann sollte einen "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" und "Epic Battle Fantasy 5" gefallen.

Also von mir her gefallen mir diese Spiele sehr Gut.

---

In dieser Gruppe https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu findest du mehr gute Reviews von mir, dort könnt ihr mir auch Folgen, (Kuratorseite).

review: Great game overall, there were a couple bugs here and there that honestly I don't specifically remember, HOWEVER that does not take away at all from this game at all. Great soundtrack, a wonderful classic turn-based fighting-style, great animations,  plenty of funny dialogue to give the characters some personality, and just a complete upgrade from the already great EPF4. If you're looking for a game to sit down and just binge on, I would highly suggest this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198331580698', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3573, 'last_played': 1667033570}
review:
All right so this is after the V2 update... lets just say
IS THIS ACTUALLY HOW A BALANCE IS DONE????????
To be serious, I can just appreciate since the 8bit guys and returns (especially the summoning) were good enough
The elder finals were not appearing but that`s yet to complain much, despite that I was looking for a 5-remade Akron battle for some reason
But really?? REALLY????
INVISIBLE AND ENCHANTED GOT TO BE CONSUMED????????
And the golly ice stone's cost was increased ONCE AGAIN even after the game has been on FOR SO LONG????????
okey, I could say they may be somehow imba, but this is never a reason that some would change it just for a BALANCE leading to a result of ruining countless solutions built to just clear or enjoy. This is a totally unreasonable doing since there can be much strengthening for the foe but never a fundamental and reiterated change to the players' attacks
That's a lot of good designs which is enough for me to ignore those somehow bad neta (←just enough for me though), but come on, this is how you update? You just... "balance" it in this way?
============================
Getting more check, here's the katana
What's the point of making an EXTREME gear NOT THAT EXTREME?????????
You are telling that you BALANCED a -90hp gear by turning to -50 with less damage, are you thinking that this could turn someone mind the hp to use this?? REALLY????
It's already a great special gear and you make it a dabbler to tell as a BALANCE???????

author: {'steamid': '76561198150827335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4612, 'last_played': 1695583730}
review:
Matt you bastard you've done it again.

In all seriousness, this game, along with the entire EBF series is criminally underated. If your new to the series, 5 is a great place to start. (though I highly recommend you play 3 and 4 as well) If you're returing, expect nothing less than what you've come to love, plus extra. The 15$ asking price is easily worth it in comparison to the amount of great content and raw amount of time you can sink in to this game. Matt, if you're listening to this, I think I speak for a lot of your fans when I say I would happily pay 5-10$ for bonus DLC dungeons roughly the size of the current bonus dungeons in game, maybe adding in some new bosses and equipment along with the new area. EBF Forever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000942568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1544320569}
review: A fun take on a retro RPG. If you liked the previous installments, you should definitely check out EBF 5. It has everything you liked in previous Epic Battle Fantasy games, plus it is bigger and has better combat mechanics. (I particularly like how they moved everything away from magic points and toward cooldowns. Also, at higher difficulty level, the use of captured monsters and in-battle summons adds some nice depth to challenging fights.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091847628', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3227, 'last_played': 1665149660}
review:
Absolutely LOVE the game! Have been waiting for it since it was announced, and it doesn't disappoint even the slightest bit.
The mechanics are simple and easy to learn, the story is exciting, the characters funny and No Legs cute. (Yeah, he's also a PC, but he deserves a special mention).
As always, I really love the customization; SO MANY EQUIPS! And so many skills as well this time! The new summon system is also fun to play with.
The many references there are in this game are solid fun as well; had many laughs because of it.

Now it's time for the other achievements, because there are plenty.

edit: whooo! customisable runs! random equips, foes; you name it! makes the replayability even greater!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039192925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2463, 'last_played': 1675397689}
review:
Though the age of Flash games is nearing its end, that isn't stopping Matt Roszak just yet.

As the latest in the Epic Battle Fantasy series, EBF5 is the best one yet, featuring improvements in just about everything possible. New features include the familiar cat Nolegs as the fifth playable character, capturing foes to unlock an incredibly diverse and powerful array of summons, and the forgoing of the dated MP system usually found in RPGs in favor of a more strategically-oriented cooldown system.

The main focus here is to have fun, and EBF5 does that wonderfully, as EBF3 and EBF4 did before it, with humorous quotes from the characters at every turn, a world that's self-aware of its mechanics, and an epic soundtrack with beautifully animated combat. Don't expect a serious story, though. That's for serious games, what do you think this is? F*nal Fantasy?

Recommended for RPG fans and anyone who just wants to have a good time playing a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038842047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2149, 'last_played': 1676219035}
review:
J'était déja un grand fan de la série Epic Battle Fantasy depuis un moment, et j'ai découvert le jeu en gratuit.

Le jeu est véritablement marrant, j'ai terminé l'histoire "principale" au moment de cette évaluation en normal, et vais recommencer le jeu en Epic.
Une chose simple a dire, le jeu n'est pas forcément payant, la version payante permet par contre d'obtenir des donjons spéciaux avec des boss uniques qui montent en niveau avec vous.

Les principales qualités du jeu sont évidemment son humour, sa musique et ses petites références mises littéralement partout et ses dialogues qui font souvent rire (passant simplement d'un bonhomme de neige à la forme peu particulière à un miniboss "importé" en passant par les PNJ aux noms et rôles détournés )

Coté gameplay, on est toujours à peu près sur la même recette que sur EBF4, avec des changements massifs sur les status, les buffs et les debuffs, ce qui à pour tout de pimenter les combats. La nouvelle mécanique de capture d'adversaire rajoute aussi un aspect "attrapez-les tous!" où vous vous maudirez très souvent pour avoir équipé quelque chose qui invoque automatiquement une attaque quand vous avez besoin de tout sauf de ça.

L'histoire est elle aussi très interessante, on est un peu déboussaulé au départ si on à joué a EBF4, mais le train accroche vite (si vous n'avez pas encore joué à EBF4, ça ne fera pas grand chose, vous perdrez grand max 2/3 petites références à des mécaniques ou ennemis rencontrés précédemment) 
Chaque personnage à quelque chose à dire à propos de tout !
Que vous mettiez une nouvelle tenue sur un personnage, que l'un deux se fasse taper ou tuer où même de simplement se prendre un débuff, il y a des commentaires à tout, oui monsieur, à tout.
il y aura des petits moment de feeling parfois (un des boss m'a vraiment fait me sentir mal à devoir le finir, et pour combler le tout, un des passifs d'un équipement à proc au mauvais moment, le tuant ;_; )

La musique, ensuite ! Si vous reussissez à jouer à ce jeu et que vous arrivez à ne pas vous mettre à chanter une de ses musiques durant votre partie, je vous dis chapeau !

Le prix, finalement, est pour moi très bon. J'aurais même pu y mettre 20€, mais je pense que la c'est le fan qui parle :)
J'espère que cette évaluation vous aura aidé a choisir, les commentaires son activés, hésitez pas à réagir ou répondre !

author: {'steamid': '76561198259456800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2981, 'last_played': 1594309775}
review:
Erstmal, ich bin gerad beim Endgame ca. 44h Spielzeit gerade und ja das Game ist nicht ohne grund mein Lieblingsgame :D

also:
Die Story ist gut, das gameplay ist flüssig und macht spaß, die Rätsel sind gut (manche sind sogar sehr kniffelig) find ich.
die level-kurve ist gut angepasst (ich hab bis jetzt auf normal gespielt) 
und wenn einem das zu schwer/zuleicht ist passen die leichteren oder schweren stufen gut das gameplay an (ist für jeden was dabei). Und die Musik ist wieder toll vom Game. 
Die Errungenschaften sind Gut bestückt, manche halt leichter und manche kniffelig zubekommen wie man es so kennt von den vorgängerteilen von den EBF-Games.
ach und die Dialoge sind Gut.

Ja mein Fazit ist positiv vom game da ich nicht wirklich was gefunden hab zum mekern ^^
Hoff diese Review ist hilfreich.

L.G. Snougdut

author: {'steamid': '76561198035314665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2505, 'last_played': 1573146327}
review:
정말이지 이 게임 1편을 꼬꼬마때 접했다가 나올때마다 계속 하고있네요.
그리고 어른이 되서 5편을 사서 하게되었습니다.
드디어 완결이 난거 같네요. 정말 즐거웠습니다....하하...

...그래서 다음은 진짜 리부트 해서 6편 내실꺼요!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198047951576', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1690755623}
review:
I've been playing this series for about a decade now, and it's amazing to see how much it's grown.
Each game is better than the last, and Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is no exception. 

EBF5 has several new and improved mechanics that significantly improve the overall experience. For starters there's the new summon capture system that allows a large variety of options, the fact that swapping party members mid-battle no longer uses up a turn, as well as optional skills now being able to be  moved from character to character. That last change is nice because it means that you can more freely use all five characters as opposed to the previous game where most people just stuck to using 3. 

My favorite change by far has to be the removal of MP and the addition of skill cooldowns. Removing MP means there's one less stat, an entire meter, and a set of items the player no longer has to deal with. The overall purpose of MP is usually to stop players from spamming high-level attacks, but it also forces the player to micromanage their MP bar as well. Replacing MP with skill cool downs makes it so the player still can't spam, but also doesn't have to manage a bar.

There's also some great cameos from classic flash games like Chibi Knight and Sushi Cat.

This is a fantastic game with a huge amount of content and I hope to see the creators continue to make great games in the future.

developer_response: Epic-difficulty achievements cannot be unlocked on Newgame+, as it would make most of them too easy. Your best bet for getting those is beating the boss-rush modes at the end of your first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072270271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 6754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1681013209}
review:
I am seriously addicted to this game.

As many others have said, Matt's games keep steadily improving with each iteration.  The only turn-based RPGs that seriously satisfy my need for strategy and tactics are his EBF games and ATLUS's Etrian Odyssey games.  Nothing else comes close to these with the insane amount of synergies, combos, buff/buff shenanigans, status ailments actually mattering and being good on bosses, etc...

EBF5 makes several core mechanic changes since the older games, and it results in a much HARDER experience but the enemies are toned down to compensate.  There's no more MP, so strong abilities are balanced by cooldown periods.  Strong healing items also "stuff" the player resulting in a cooldown on more items.  This means you literally cannot spam party heals and AoE Pizzas (Mega-Elixers) on back-to-back turns to survive certain death.  Backup party members are now more important, NoLegs is finally playable, several status ailments have been added or reworked, a weather system has been added, and there's a huge Pokemon-esque capture system meaning you can catch 99% of enemies.

There's an absolute ton of content if you decide to do it all.  Like in EBF4, much of the really hard optional content will scale to your level so it never really gets any easier.  You beat it by getting better, by thinking harder, and with a superior plam going into the fight.

It goes without saying that the music is awesome, as usual thanks to Phyrnna.

I bought this instantly and it's hard for me to make time for my other games at the moment, even Smash Ultimate...  I don't know what other praise I can give.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240398516', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1709086456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070853987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1585218191}
review: First of all I'd like to begin with saying that I'm a huge fan of the EBF series and I think this one is the best so far and really well-made. The combat seems much better with mana is now removed and there are cooldowns instead, the capture system is a lot of fun to use and NoLegs is now a playable character and he's pretty fun to play as. I definitely recommend buying the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002750569', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3600, 'last_played': 1682285535}
review:
Captures the charm of EBF3 and EBF4 with more stuff added.  
Very fun strategy gameplay in epic mode, where proper syngery and execution truely pays off in a satisfying feel, very few boss fights were won on the first try even after preparing but as you repeat the fights over and over you start to notice some cracks in the enemies defense that you can exploit which is one of the best feelings in a stragety game. The new cooldown system I think is definetly better than the MP system used previously although I think cooldowns should instantly be reset to 0 if we exit a battle by either feeling or winning, it seems pointless to have it outside of combat. Overall this game is definetly worth its asking price. 

Now that being said this is obviously going to be compared to EBF4 which in itself is still a great game.  
The music in this game has a bit of a different tone compared to EBF4 and while its still great I think it has lost some of its catchyness, I still listen to almost all of the sound tracks from EBF3 and EBF4 especially the boss themes, but the theme here doesn't seem to stick as close to me in this one.  

Second is that I think certain animations take way too long to finish specially some death animations and equipment effects. A signficant amount of gear in the game has a specific effect that activates between turns be it dropping random missles or getting a free summon these often take alot of time and bog down the overall pace of the fight if too many are equiped. This isn't a significant problem but its definetly something you start to feel late in the game when these start stacking up.

Third is the surrender system, in principle I get it, it keeps the pace of battle going if an enemy is really low health. But there are several ocassions where the new wave of the enemy is obviously very strong and the enemy just suddenly decides to surrender without any prior notice and you find yourself facing the full unimpeded volley of a new enemy wave. This can sometimes spell a instant game over in some battles. I think surrender should take a enemies turn then they run away, or at least if the last enemy if removed by surrender then the turn order should go back to the players.

 Last thing is the crafting requirements. The requirements to upgrade your entire arsenal is very very high and basically forces the  player to spend a good amount of time just stealing loot from enemies then fleeing then stealing again to properly keep all your gear in the general same level. This is very tedious and I feel a bit of a step back in terms of EBF4 where you still only had to do a small amount end game to level up all the gear. But in this game if you don't dedicate a bit of time to stealing a specific enemy dozens of time (earth dragons, lime squids and mirrors come to mind) then you are very starved for materal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253534355', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1582588201}
review: Although it might not be anything revolutionary in terms of rpg mechanics, this is a truly excellent game with tons to do without ever feeling overwhelming. New mechanics like the neutral status effects that increase the damage of certain elements and capturing enemies for unique skills (one of the most unique captures is one that can switch the buffs and debuffs of the target), and the removal of mp for cooldown based attacks (which really helps to encourage party member switching) are truly great additions that add a lot to the game. I recommend playing in epic mode if you are familiar with rpgs, it really makes the game more fun with the added challenge and helps force you to use these new mechanics to their fullest extent without being overwhelmingly difficult

author: {'steamid': '76561198146379403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1544470706}
review: So let me start out with this review that I believe this is a great game. If you have not yet played a game from the Epic Battle Fantasy series this is a fine place to start. It has a lot of fun jokes, good gameplay, good music, and fun characters. If you have played games from the series before this is still a fine game to play. A lot of the things you liked about the earlier entries return and the game is a lot more balanced now than it used to be re-introducing challenge for some veteran players. Now my dislikes for the game which will all be spoolered for new players who might not want my personal opinions to affect them in any way. [spoiler] Okay so first off I'm not a major fan of the changes to the combat personally. Now, it's far more balanced, that is 100% true, and that's great. However, I very much prefer a MP cost system over a cooldown system especially when the series has always kind of been about the fact that the characters are supposed to be the super OP bullshit characters that everyone wishes they could be. Of course I understand that in the previous games of the series the ability to infinitely cast regen, massive damage aoe clears, and always buff was a little bit easymode. This is really just my personal preferance on the combat system changes and honestly I understand why the direction was taken the way it was. The other issue, which is a very, VERY, minor one, that I have with the game is I don't feel the music is as good as it was in 4. That's really just my personal preferance in music, I'm personally a much bigger fan of rock and roll and metal than I am of the more kind of techno remix feel the game went with this time. [/spoiler] For those who actually took the time to read this wall of text thank you, (This is the first review I've written for a game and uncomfortable with steam's formatting considering everything.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198373029216', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1544619434}
review:
游戏真的是好游戏，很有意思，难度设计得很好

但是有恶性bug导致我不能玩下去了，怎么搞也解决不了

每次存档或者战斗结束都会跳出Adobe Flash Player设置问我允不允许在计算机上储存信息，点不了那个框游戏只能强退

退了也没用还有这个问题，重装过了

解决了这个问题再给好评

解决是解决了，但是我是禁止了flash的保存允许，也就是自动存档和手动存档都不行，只能用备份存档文件，反正先通关了再说吧
developer_response:
The Adobe Flash pop up usually appears after you've saved a few files and Flash needs permission to make more. Unfortunately the pop up is frozen for a few people.

Some possible solutions people have found: 
You may have "Flash player" settings in your Windows control panel, where you can allow local files, and that could stop the pop up from appearing. 
Some people have also mentioned that the pop up is not frozen if they try a different screen mode (fullscreen, etc). 
You can also try running the Flash version of the game, and the pop up might not be frozen there. In the installation folder you can use "Flashplayer Windows.exe" to run "Epic Battle Fantasy 5.swf", if you want to try that. To find the folder, you can use Steam Client > EBF5 > Properties > Local Files > Browse Local Files 
If all else fails, you can delete some of your extra saves and use the save backup feature to save instead. Just delete some of the .meow files from the installation folder (file2.meow etc).

Let me know how it goes. Hopefully in future I can find a simpler workaround to this.

Sorry for the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053073822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 8390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1657928591}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984867362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1698375836}
review:
If you've ever played an Epic Battle Fantasy, you nkow what to expect. This one is a sequel, and follows a lot of the same formula as EBF4, but with some very welcome changes and improvements that make it far more than a simple rehash. 

If you've never played an Epic Battle Fantasy, this is a great time to start! The story is completely new, so you don't need to know what's happened before. It's a light-hearted take on the classic RPG formula, and not afraid to poke fun at itself or others of its ilk. 

If you enjoy RPGs (particularly the old-school RPGs), this one's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088093148', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 6713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6697, 'last_played': 1667681350}
review: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this game yet! EBF is the best indie RPG I've ever played. It's got a cool artstyle, bangin' OST and some seriously entertaining writing. But most importantly, the gameplay is super fun and pretty deep. I'm a JRPG veteran and the highest difficulty still gave me some trouble in a few places! You get a hell of a bang for your back here -- you can expect to spend around 40 hours if you're just cruising through the main game and around 80 if you're going for 100%. For €17/$20 or €11/$14 on sale that's an amazing deal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017411925', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1632460483}
review:
10 hours in right now.

The game is amazing, not that I had any doubt it would be. The 98% approval rating speaks for itself just like it did for EBF4.

The Story is nothing amazing, but the author knows that and makes the best out of it, using the story to bring out the characters' interactions with one another, which is one of the best parts of the game. The comedy is absolutely top notch.

The real star of the show is the combat though. The combat is extremely strategic and rewarding, there is some randomness but it's always partially in your control. Hands down one of the best combat systems I've ever seen, and Matt still found ways to improve it even more. Once you get the full party of 5 members, that's when the combat really opens up. The best points for those who've never played any of the games in the series (considering I'm playing on Epic difficulty, which is where the real challenge is at):

- Traditional turn-based RPG combat.
- No random battles. The game is entirely focused on rewarding good gameplay and not annoying you.
- Every fight is a challenge, and I mean it. Bashing the attack button is a one-way ticket to getting absolutely destroyed by the weakest of enemies.
- You can keep 3 players at the front and 2 at the back, however you can switch freely who is at the front and back with no cost. This alone is one of the best parts since it can really reward or punish your choices by letting you choose who takes damage in favor of using their skills.
- Each player comes with a set of skills that you cannot change (about 60% of their skills), but along the adventure you get a TON of skills which you can distribute among your party. Once again, very rewarding for good players who build their party well.
- Each character has a set of gear to choose from, each gear having different skills, stats and resistances, which is absolutely fundamental for each fight you go into. Having the right resistances will make or break your fights.
- The new weather system is awesome as hell, every new area I get into has a completely game-changing twist you gotta adapt to. When you're nearing the end of the Fort area, there are some fights which can reduce your Max. HP, Def. and M. Def. by a whole 25%, which believe me is an absolutely huge deal. Suddenly you need to play more defensive than ever because you can get one-hit KO'd outta nowhere.
- The new summon system is even better and also more rewarding somehow. Just like how you choose your skills, you can choose your set of summons, and having the right combination of damage and support summons is key.
- The new cooldown system is also amazing. Once again, manages to be even more rewarding to a good player. Also removes the MP system that in the late-game of EBF4 ended up being pretty useless due to you having way too much MP.
- NoLegs is an awesome new party member. Provides an amazing amount of versatility to your attacks.

However, the game features 5 different difficulties, so in case you're not interested in the challenge, you can also play the game just for the fun that is to see the party going on an adventure.

Music is also awesome as hell. EBF4 had a lot of good tracks, but they didn't really fit together in an album. The EBF4 Bonus version had better tracks in that sense, but EBF5's Soundtrack is better than EBF4's, just as good as EBF4's bonus version, and is much more well-rounded off as a soundtrack.

Also, even though I talked about how combat is rewarding to the good player, the game also features A LOT of "Avatar Strength Progression" (aka Super Metroid where you find more skills), in the form of levelling your skills, finding new skills, weapons, items and summons. This also makes it an amazing game to 100%, as there are a ton of secrets from the little I have seen.

Fantastic game for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065219678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1599512333}
review:
This is by far the best turn-based RPG I know of. The game is very polished. There is a lot of content, the world is densely filled with a large variety of enemies, treasures, puzzles, gags and more. The sound effects and music really add to the enjoyment. On the highest difficulty the game can be challenging at times but never feels unfair, albeit the combat is a bit tedious and slow. I particularly love the removal of mana and the seamless character switching. The issues I have with the game come down to personal preference or the limits of this genre.

Don't be intimidated by the 5. This game is self-contained and having played the previous games is not required. I recommend this game to anyone who does not hate turn-based RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340700124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1688307384}

author: {'steamid': '76561198438887203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1584478310}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015890349', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 13406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1702059868}
review:
Now as I reached to the part where Natalie got captured and imprisoned by Lance, I just experienced way too many great features which makes this episode of the entire game series pretty unique and golden.

These features compare to EBF4 are:

- The smooth and gentle sounds rocks for skill usage just as much as their new animations

- Every elemental related negative status effects are grouped into one type which takes 2 different negative status effects so whenever you get any of those status effect resistance you resist to one sort of these types instead of a specific one, which is a great addition to this game

- The new "Lovable" positive status effect shall prevail in later games because a lot of one shot abilities from the foes can be prevented on low healthed members of the crew. So far, I did not experience that foes actually could provide the same status effect on other foes, so I can't target them unless it's an "all of enemy" targeting skill. At this rate, you hurt the lovable target whether you love it or not. xD

- As the mana consumption system disappeared and replaced with cooldown system, the game became more justified skill-wise than how it was in the rest of EBF games. Glad that we got some food items which helps decrease the cooldown timer, during cooldown time we can use buffs or debuffs as well. The roles of these kind of skills will increase and becomes more important. Very nice addition in my honest opinion.

- The brand new detailed still simple and tasteful skill ladder is something must be mentioned right here. The way this game allows the player to choose which skill goes to which crew member is precious and can be overviewed easily unlike in EBF4. Every skills are sort by their own type.

- The new monster catching system is a huge difference. It's totally like Pokémon, but with boxes instead of Pokéballs. It's kinda hilarious especially the Pokémon related jokes coming from the story itself. The more monsters you collect the more versatile your arsenal becomes depending on the support situations we need the most. That's one of the best thing could ever happened to this episode of EBF in the history of turn-based rpg games.

- Sometimes even foes can provide you any special posivite status effects besides negative ones. That's pretty unusual compare to what we got used to. In EBF4 100% of the time you suffered negative status effects. This addiition is odd, but the way how it looks just makes EBF5 look even more EBF-ish.

- Natalie's "Kyun" overdrive is obviously something which has the richest pun and joke potential, but besides this, we can now see a fully grown anime woman animation. Thank you Matt! It's really astounding to experience the offensive jokes right after she cast it. Natalie's fanservice appearance never gets old and so as herself.

10/10 would come again

author: {'steamid': '76561198118823406', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1700357455}
review:
Only played for 9 hours so far, but I didn't realize it was already 4 am!

Really seems like a big step up from the 4th one, but I may be biased because I've loved the series ever since the first one came out on some Flash website like a decade ago.

The Blessed buff was definitely necessary, Blessed just seemed extremely underwhelming in EBF4.

I definitely like the removal of mana as an aspect and the replacement with cooldowns. It just seemed a bit much in EB4 to constantly spam the same strong abilities over and over while spam buying high MP regen food items. Now there is actual strategy involved as to whether or not you should use a skill that has a cooldown because another combo might be better.

The weather addition is also interesting and adds more complexity to the game, but not too much. I also like that you can purify enemies of their status conditions such as the self burning enemies being healed by their burns or the self poisoning enemies being healed by their poison damage. It makes you do strategies you never ever would've thought of doing in EBF4.

I also like all of the mixed damage enemies can deal now instead of enemies of the same type doing the same element of damage so when you have upgraded gear you basically just take no damage from their attacks in EBF4. Now there's more of a challenge as they might do several types of damage instead of just one singular element of damage that can be easily negated/absorbed.

The summon and surrender aspects are also pretty interesting. If all enemies are surrendering, it allows you to get some buffs up before the next wave of enemies shows up.

One thing I do wish though is that Anna's Bow Smack ability or whatever it's called has a final upgrade where it deals 0 damage and instead just has a high chance to do the bow's effect and make the foe surrender. This would allow for an actual method of capturing bosses. Right now it's just pray to god that you can capture them because there's no way to inflict statuses without doing damage that might kill them. I mean, it makes sense, Anna is a hunter is she not? Anyway, that's pretty much my only gripe with the game so far. Haven't died yet on normal difficulty besides that one story scripted part obviously. 

All in all, pretty good game. I'd pay full price for it (got it %20 off since I owned the previous game). If you're into JRPG's (which if you've gotten this far down into the comments on a JRPG game you'd have to search for anyway), I definitely highly recommend this game and all of the other games in this series. Matt Roszak is a brilliant developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004966126', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1932, 'last_played': 1559046523}
review:
我沒有碰過前作，只是略有耳聞
這作在有中文的情況下再加上前幾作在國外的大量好評
而美術雖然比較陽春，但我覺得還蠻挺可愛的(Natalie的ㄋㄟㄋㄟ讚)
於是就買來嘗試，完全是出乎意料的超棒作品
5代雖然剛出來沒多久，但我已經開始期待續作了
(雖然可能要等個4~5年以上就是了，畢竟製作團隊只有2人)


良好的遊戲性
(戰鬥和解迷難度把握的很棒，整體流程很舒服)

戰鬥玩法豐富
(每種武器裝備都有所作用，經常要適時地更換搭配，而捕抓怪物以及招喚怪物幫忙增加了更多的可玩性)

幽默的劇情
(吐槽遊戲橋段，黃腔髒話完全不少)

大量的ACG梗
(從遊戲到動畫漫畫，知名作品等等彩蛋到處都有)

非常耐玩的戰鬥機制，遊戲時數絕對遠超官方說的30小時
(有大量的技能，以及裝備，外加各種輔助道具讓玩家搭配，讓挑戰史詩難度的成就非常有樂趣)

如果不在意畫面的玩家完全非常推薦入手
各方面完成度都極高的一款遊戲

author: {'steamid': '76561198115112275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1684343733}
review:
[h1]8.5/10 即将被淘汰的Flash Player也难掩其光芒 良心满载的史诗冒险[/h1]

从12年开始接触EBF系列，当时玩的还都是Matt个人网站上的免费版...每个作品我都尽可能地尝试挑战了一下全成就...果然还是很有意思的。

这一作也是在大概三个月之前才得知已经临近完工了，于是就挂了个Patreon支持，陆陆续续玩了近九十个小时的beta版...存档引继到steam正式版之后就没怎么玩了。

EBF5的精致程度比我期待的还要高上一大截，游戏介绍里30+小时的游戏时长没什么水分，被主线和史诗挑战安排得明明白白的...
[spoiler]其中至少有1/3的时间沉迷解谜和找隐藏[/spoiler]
[spoiler]翻译虽然有些许瑕疵，不过里头梗太多了，信息量巨大...汉化人员辛苦了。[/spoiler]

+ 一如既往优秀的原声音乐 [spoiler]赞美Phyrnna！[/spoiler]
+ 比前几作更为神奇的小解谜 [spoiler]不过解谜实在是太多了...有些还有点阴险，甚至诡异？[/spoiler]
+ 设计严谨，由浅入深的游戏机制 [spoiler]闪避套实在是太imba了[/spoiler]
+ 全程欢乐却又不乏深度的游戏剧情 [spoiler]和一度让我怀疑人生的史诗难度[/spoiler]
+++ 掺杂了过多neta和隐藏要素的游戏内容 [spoiler]还是熟悉的配方，熟悉的味道。[/spoiler]

± 心情复杂，不知该作何评价的宠物系统 [spoiler]满图鉴后：“真香！”[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065983500', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1641442681}
review: I'm honestly just posting this to help this game get to overwhelmingly positive, it deserves it.  This is by far the best epic battle fantasy yet.  If you liked the previous, you'll like this.  If you like turn based RPGs, you'll like this.  If you don't, then you probably wont.  It knows what it is, and pushes that mechanic as far as it can.  If you play on a light difficulty, the games a breeze that a casual player can enjoy, but to get a few secret bosses and items, you HAVE to play on Epic, which makes the game brutal.  You have to optimize your skills and resistances perfectly, learn what attacks work best in groups of enemies, and maintain a staggering number of status effects.  Like I said, it knows how to do turn based RPG and goes all in on that one singular gameplay element.  This means its a bit of a niche game, but so long as you fall into that niche, you'll adore it.

review:
从第二代的回合战斗入坑，之后看着从简单的两人组合到三人四人到现在的五人，五十块对老粉来说还行，新人推荐等打折吧。
简单带来说还是很推荐这款游戏的，跟市面上那些庞大的设定观繁杂的人设相比，这款游戏单纯就是以战斗为主的rpg，单纯要变强而战斗，不过五代还加入了大量的彩蛋以及对话，比如用无腿扫描画面会有一句“not a cat”，能带给你单纯的因为强大而快乐的感觉。
……不过法师的第七天堂怎么感觉立绘还不如第三第四代。

author: {'steamid': '76561198346915150', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2248, 'last_played': 1544178537}
review:
EBF都出到5了，结果他还是个Flash游戏还行...场景里东西多就有点卡
除了战斗有点冗长，战斗动画看着累，别的都可以
画风魔性，提示很多，最喜欢的还是乱码怪场景的设计（毕竟别的怪都看吐了
数据大部分都摆到台面上，不需要什么数据库似的wiki攻略网站
一个鼠标移动点点点找感叹号不藏着掖着的RPG根本无法拒绝（
全通了之后看了一下Beta版的收集视频把剩下几个东西都集齐了，彩虹下面有道具可还行...目前一共开了634个宝箱，183个秘密，226件装备。
终Boss打完直接就二周目了还行，根本不想二周目，告辞
翻译，每种翻译都有点私货，看得懂就行吧...

review: Before I write about this game, I would like to say that I have been following this series since Brawl Royale and absolutely love every game that has come out since then, This game is no exception! The story is great! The controls that were changed are very easy to pick up on. The abilities still feel the same while having some new affects to them. But what really had me in love is that it doesnt feel like you can complete each fight with only three of your party! It allows for quick changes in formation mid-fight that can make or break some of the tougher bosses and fights. Overall I feel this is a fantastic game.

review:
Once upon a time I played a really excellent flash game called Epic Battle Fantasy 3, a bit later I played an even more excellent game called Epic Battle Fantasy 4. 
Years later I happen to see a familiar art style while browsing the steam store... Is it?    Could it be?!     IT IS!!

EPIC BATTLE FANTASY 5

With every game, the Matt manages to make an already amazing game, even better. 
If your not sure you want this game, play Epic Battle Fantasy 3 & 4.... then buy 5 becuase its worth every penny.

review: An absolute masterpiece. Much more cleaner and funnier than the previous ones. The jokes, puns and comedy are hilarious and the action animations are much more beautiful. With the added Pokemon-like catching mechanism and an increased variety of this beautiful music is just tooooo good. Gameplay is smooth, fun and story is beautiful too. author: {'steamid': '76561198012067179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1585011441}
review:
If you enjoy playing old-school style RPGs, this is the game for you. If you like collecting stuff, doing massive combos, and upgrading all your gear, this is also the game for you. 

I love the reboot of this series, its fun to see everyone encounter each other for the first time. The gameplay is solid and there are very few bugs. The ability to also change difficulty mid-game is nice, as I found normal a tad too easy so I bumped it up to hard, which feels just right. The battles, as a result, feel challenging, but not impossible. Everything is a matter of strategy. A big improvement from the previous series is the puzzles. In the earlier games, the puzzles felt way too easy and almost a waste of time as a result. This time around, though, the puzzles are challenging AND rewarding. 

All in all, I love this game.

review: 我的童年回来啦！
developer_response:
This may be related to windows' Display Scaling. You can turn this off for EBF5:
Go into the installation folder: "Steam Client > Epic Battle Fantasy 5 > Properties > Local Files > Browse Local Files"
Right click on "Epic Battle Fantasy 5.exe" and go into "Properties > Compatibility" 
Tick "Disable Scaling on high DPI settings"

In a few days I will release an update that should fix some window and fullscreen related issues.

Sorry about that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057492815', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 5209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2214, 'last_played': 1706754970}
review: This doesn't have the production value or obsession with narrative of modern JRPG's, but it's very obvious that the developer of this game understands what makes a JRPG fun. It's clear that an immense amount of time and effort went into the game and I absolutely reccomend the game if you have any interest in turn-based RPG's at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284359790', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4329, 'last_played': 1544269254}
review:
시리즈 최초로 한글화된 작품인데
부호들까지 싸그리 한글화 했을줄은 생각못했었음.

그거 깨닫고 부랄치면서 갓글화 ㅇㅈ합니다

게임 자체는 뭐 jrpg 재밌게 하는 사람이면 웬만해서 재미있으니 
더이상의 자세한 평가는 생략한다

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1회차 엔딩완료.
첫 전투부터 노빠꾸 에픽난이도로 달렸는데

제일 끄트머리 토끼슬라임 장비 먹는거랑 최종보스 그부분에서 살짝 현타와서 
거긴 제로난이도로 빠르게 패스했음.

모든 전투를 에픽난이도로 하는건
게임 볼륨이 커져서 상당한 피로감과 현타를 불러일으키니
업적따는 전투만 에픽으로 하십셔

author: {'steamid': '76561197968613788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2250, 'last_played': 1619845154}
review:
ずっと心待ちにしていた作品。
興奮のあまり、本レビューも多少のネタバレを含む可能性があります。

前作である4は英語だったため、内容がわからないまでも、ゲーム性が肌にあったのかクリアまで一気にプレイしてしまった。
ついに5作目となった今作をどれくらい楽しみにしていたかというと、発売開始とほぼ同時に開発したため、前作所持者に配布された値引きクーポンが到着する前に購入してしまったくらい。

Epic Battle Fantasyが今のようなRPGの形態を取り始めたのは3からですが、最初は3人だったパーティメンバーもひとりずつ増えて、
今作では5名で世界を救う旅に出ることになります。前衛3人に交代要員2人という構成になります。
戦闘は画面上の敵に隣接して話しかけると発生し、強制戦闘は極稀にしか発生しません。
この戦闘が今作のウリというか、開発者側も推したい部分なんだろうと思いますが、以下のような特色があります。

・100％逃走可能（ラスボスからも）
・敵はスキャンすることで、属性・状態異常の耐性をすべて見ることができる。
・キャラごとに用意された様々な属性、耐性、効果をもった武器防具およびアクセサリー

以上のことから、まずは突っかかっていって必要に応じてスキャン、有利になる属性を確認し一度逃げて装備変更し再突撃、が基本になります。
というより難易度ノーマルでもそれを怠るだけであっさり壊滅したりするため、これがベーシックな戦術として想定されているのでしょう。
ゲーム中でも各キャラが「一度逃げてもいい」みたいなことを頻繁に発言します。
ローグライクゲームであるような「耐性パズル」に近いことを、必要に応じて各戦闘ごとに求められる為、
一見面倒に感じますが、適切な準備で戦闘が早く終わるわけで、結果として時間短縮と安全確保に繋がります。

やりこみ要素についても、前作の装備品やスキルの収集、サブクエストに加え、今作ではモンスターの捕獲が追加されました。
この捕獲したモンスターは様々なスキルを持っており、戦闘中に召喚することが可能です。
適当にやっても成功しないのでHPを減らしたり、状態異常にかけたりすることで成功率が上昇します。
ポ○モンみたいなシステムですが、なんとこの捕獲、ごく一部の敵以外すべての敵に通用します。
流石にラスボスは無理でしたが、通常ボスは捕獲可能であり、ボスと言うだけあって攻撃も激しく状態異常も通りにくい状況で試行錯誤するわけです。
最終的に必死にHPを削ったところで、敵の攻撃で発生したカウンター攻撃で倒してしまうところまでがテンプレです。

宝箱や隠しオブジェクトが非常に多く配置されているのも特徴で、建物の裏や岩の陰といったところにひっそりと配置されています。
大体どの画面にも複数存在しており、宝箱を開ける事自体が大好きな私のような人種にはたまらない感じになっています。

※以下追記予定・・・

author: {'steamid': '76561198087454381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1691775340}
review:
If you fan of the game series, then this is the game for you..
if you fan of RPG, strategies and etc.. this is the game for you

the game changes the option from last series of the game to make more look unique.
Alot of jokes and fourth wall breaks..
Epic mode is really pain the ass ( I'm not joking, I got killed from slimes 40 times..)
Save game before boss or enemy start battle. depends...
No stacking buff at this version game only temporarily time ( Enemy will try to be a dickhead steal your buff, be warned )
Achievement in this game just need you to grind to get unlockables on gallery.

Fantantasic moments in this game though. 
Relaxing
Intensive combat ( literally )
Sexual content ( go ahead and find it yourself, no spoliers )
There's Zero,Easy, Normal, Hard, Epic Difficulty..so choose wisely
Puzzle and stuff just take your time.
Alot of "WASD" walking
Final boss is really annoying piece of crap.. even in normal difficulty ( i tried on epic )
Buy every single armor and weapon and upgrade to Max 
Enemy have "Surrrender option" so you don't have to punch and kill it, Just use defend.. just in case.
Have patience 
Don't rush unless that enemy trying to be douche bag.
Regen is your option no matter what.. ( resurrection always )

Good game.
I enjoy every second of the game and details.
( I love the character have self-aware ingame )
                 Thank you for reading..
seriously people don't even care reading this,

author: {'steamid': '76561198123125282', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1544429242}
review:
For all that's worth, EBF5 is basically EBF4 on steroids.

It's largely the same gameplay and world exploration, but double the amount from the previous game. Now, I have enjoyed EBF4 a lot, so it's only natural for me to like this game a lot too. If someone doesn't like EBF4, then they will probably not like this game much since it's just more of the same thing.

Not saying that more of the same thing is necessarilly bad. However, there will always be a diminishing return to the same product. And for me, I think I'm nearly reaching the break even point. If Matt's next game is more of the same thing, but bigger, then I might be turned away.

I hope that matt makes a new game or take the series into another genre. Because there is only one Matt, and building bigger RPG games will probably be not sustainable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130128202', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 7300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1703571273}
review: Matt Roszak more than delivers with this newest and most expansive of the Epic Battle Fantasy series yet. Boasting a much larger map, new game mechanics, gorgeous graphics, lots of loot, simple puzzles, and much tighter turn-based gameplay, Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is more than worth your money for the amount of care and consideration put into every pixel of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079423421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1674286212}
review:
If you told me back in the early days of Newgrounds that a simple little wave based game would eventually be a full rpg that calls back to classiscs and is sold as a great example of indie gaming, I would ask what you were talking about because I was an ignorant little midget.
Whatever, anyways heres whats good and bad.
The Good:
The music, as always, is good. Phyrnna has done it again
The cooldown system, Lance doesn't burn out in the middle of a fight anymore, he does however need to be switched out every other turn though.
Nolegs, great at clearing weaker beasties
The story, Its basically a sped up version of Ebf 1-4 but the characters mesh together a lot better this time around and the "cutscenes" are cute and effective.
The Weather, I like the effects, and they add a new spin to battles. It may be a good idea to nerf the damage done to players and enemies though.
The new and improved Kyuun ability.
Squishy
The Neutral:
The cooldown system, again. Its a hit or miss really.
The catching system, it works but... eh
The Bad:
The maze. Fuck the maze
The puzzles in that maze.
The boss of the maze was (Literally) Tanky as Hell and took about thirty minutes to take down. 5 seventh Heavens, Four Cleavers, 3 WRRYYYYYYs, and two Old Oaks, and a partridge in a fuckin pear tree.
The buff system. Buffing and then immediately being debuffed is annoying as Hell
THAT FUCKIN MAZE. LIGHT UP PUZZLES FROM HELL. MAY GODCAT STRIKE THEM DOWN
OPTIONALITY ISN'T AN OPTION MOTHER-

deep breath man, 1, 2, 3.
Overall, the game is good. Well worth the wait and money. Glad I'm supporting such a dedicated developer who actually completes his games. Need more of that these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961452084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1564022393}
review:
I waited until I put about 11 hours into EBF5 before writing this. I've played every game since 2.  It's everything I hoped for and more!! My favorite part so far is the Grand Gallery. The fact that Matt put all of this fan art in the game is a testament to why it was made in the first place.

I meant, Epic Battle Fantasy FIVE. 5. 5.0 (or 5.4 or whatever)... He works tirelessly because he knows there is a legion of fans out there waiting for his next masterpiece.

It's a Masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028076146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1558894480}
review:
You should stop reading here and go buy and enjoy this right away, but here goes :

Only a few hours in so far, but I really like what I'm seeing. I've played all the previous iterations pretty heavily and this new one just just like picking back after the 4 and going for more nonsense, cheesy one-liners, context reactions and overall laughs.

From a technical point of view, it feels just like EBF4, same colorful environments with a very cartoony design, running pretty smoothly. The world has many thing hidden in not-always-obvious places often being required for quests offrered by npcs everywhere. Same kinds of shop as EBF4, same upgrade system too.

It's a bit early to really appreciate how replacing MP by cooldowns will impact the gameplay, but for now it's nice. The skills feel a lot like EBF4 with core skills and limits for all chars, but extra skills can be unequipped and swapped to other chars now (I do believe it was a final decision in the 4).

Kinda wondering where the scenario will be going though, it looks like it'll retcon/retell/whatever all the previous titles. So far Matt has chasen Nolegs away from his garbage and decided not to eat it right away, embarked on a killing / looting / stealing journey (same old there...), stolen more stuff from a market and being confronted by Nathalie (Squish...) for it, whacked her good then agreed to accompany her to rid the world of a nasty creature preventing entering a cave, killed and looted more, and some more, enslaved a boss (because merely killing is overrated), find a fascist army hell-bent on dominating the world on the other side, learning that was Nathalie's real objective but not caring a whole lot, and ending up getting tank-rolled by Lance. That's about where 3 hours led me, but I'm not exactly speedrunning here.

Last, I will (partially) quote a NPC guarding a slime cat : "Only legendary heroes who have defeated the five super bosses of all four optional dungeons can pass here". Game on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013769403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1700070269}
review:
Matt and Phyrnna have both outdone themselves once again!
I kind of preferred EBF4s setting, but in all other aspects this is even better than its predecessor.
The writing is especially noteworthy, with Ana's dad winning the grand prize (for now, since I havent finished it yet!)
"So which one is the boyfriend?
Is it the homeless tramp or the school shooter?"

Oh, and smug nolegs is the best thing Matt has ever created,

author: {'steamid': '76561198426525846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1593282672}
review:
J'avais déjà poncé le 4 que j'ai surkiffé !! Mais là, ça fait à peine 8h que j'ai joué au 5 et je trouve que c'est le meilleur de tous ^^
Même si certaines mécaniques ont changées (plus de mana, capture des ennemis etc...), l'esprit Epic Battle est toujours présent, et ça ça fait plaisir ^^ 
En plus, les easter eggs sont tous plus gratifiants à trouver les uns que les autres (mension spéciale pour Madness Combat / Le sbire Rocket du casino ) :D 
Pour tous ceux qui ont joués aux précédents jeux, vous allez adorer

author: {'steamid': '76561198103271081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1557761754}
review:
뭔가 마이너한 게임이라 모르는 사람에게 자신있게 추천하기 어렵지만,
게임을 하는 사람들에겐 충분히 매력적인 게임이라고 소개할 수 있겠다.

많은 게임을 해본 건 아니지만 나름 여러 게임의 착안점을 대놓고 어필하여 미워보이지 않았다.
턴제RPG의 재미도 충분하고, 느긋하게 즐기기 좋은 게임이었다.

얼마 안 했지만(사실 모든 게임을 다 얼마 안하고 아껴두는 편이지만)
앞으로가 기대되는 게임이다.
엄청 적은 용량(메가급)을 보고 처음엔 심히 당황스러웠지만 그 이상으로 뭔가 많이 들어있어 좋은 배신감을 느꼈다.
