author: {'steamid': '76561198019219353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2867, 'last_played': 1583466232}
review:
Amazing game. As someone who played through EBF2-4 and some of the other spin off games like Bullet Heaven, I have grown to expect a nice story, which doesn't take itself very seriously, full of funny and intelligent jokes and remarks, and this game doesn't disappoint. Matt managed to make another (imo) masterpiece.

The combat is turn-based, and as the battles get tougher, it actually can require quite a bit of preparation and strategy (and maybe a little luck with a crit or a bad attack choice by the AI). You have a party of 5, each character being very different to the others in terms of playstyle, so you can choose which suits you better for your strategy.

As one would expect of a quality RPG, it has quite a bit of sidequests and side dungeons, the later which scales to your level, so they always can show some challenge instead of a rofl-stomp.

All in all, I fully recommend this game. This saga certainly deserves more recognition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122721506', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1543917918}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]

我极其推荐大家尝试这款游戏。或许这不是最具创意的游戏，也不是剧情最感人的游戏，但它是一款玩起来最舒服的游戏。很多游戏虽然好玩，但玩久了容易累，而这个游戏不仅有趣，玩的时候还感觉很放松，不知不觉就沉迷进去了，这是它最大的优点。

[h1]轻松愉快的旅程[/h1]

这个游戏最大的特点就在于轻松。轻松并不是指难度低，而是指制作者没有在奇怪的地方增加难度。正如作者在游戏简介中提到的，这款游戏没有不厌其烦的地雷战，没有处处受限的存档点，更没有一去不返的事件点。

怪物都是明确出现在地图上一动不动的，必须要你主动点击才会开启战斗。而且凡是会阻挡道路的怪物都不会刷新，这意味着你路上完全没有必须要打的重复怪，非常节省时间。当然，如果你想要刷刷刷（虽然没有必要），部分不阻碍道路的小怪是能无限刷新，刷怪是你的自由，而不是一种强迫性的任务。

其次是存档点，不仅任何地方都能存档，而且每当你战斗胜利后都会自动存档一次，所以即使一次战斗全军覆没可以从自动存档处重来。并且这个游戏没有一去不返的事件点，一方面是你之前错过的东西之后也能再次触发，另一方面是不用担心卡关，如果你发现boss打不过，完全可以先去其他地方玩耍，之后再来打boss。所以也不用担心自动存档时已陷入死局，导致要完全重来的情况。

然后是难度问题，这款游戏的难度是随时可以调整的，有足足五个难度供你选择，你完全可以找到自己适合的难度。而且这个游戏的难度在于战斗的策略，技能的搭配上，而不是恢复困难上。一方面游戏里没有了mp的限制（有冷却时间限制），你只用考虑最适合现在的技能是什么，要不需要为蓝量精打细算，另一方面游戏里的血量会在非战斗状态下回复，你可以保持每次面对敌人都是满状态。所以，你享受到的是技能组合以及战胜强敌的乐趣，而不是浪费精力去维持状态（比如有的游戏里要刷钱买补给品，有的游戏里要故意留一只怪然后大家用技能恢复）。

最后是极其有趣的对话，这个游戏的剧情可能并不是很优秀（因为还没通关所以不能下定论），但对话的趣味足以能让人忘掉主线。这里的对话分三个部分，第一部分是主线剧情相关的对话，主线剧情是以轻松欢乐为主的，虽然可能并不煽情，或许也不够严谨，但能让人感觉很愉快。第二部分是各种吐槽，对游戏技能的吐槽（比如主角会吐槽自己的技能为什么砸地板会出现水），对游戏设定的吐槽（比如主角吐槽npc每次都要他帮忙跑腿，找这个那个的），对游戏剧情的吐槽（比如主角偷了铲子，然后对因为盗窃抓他的人吐槽说，“这我也没办法啊！没有那铲子这游戏就打不下去了啊”），当然还有一些和其他电子游戏有关的梗（比如宝*梦）。最后一部分是特别有创意的一点，这款游戏在战斗中主角也会根据你的行动进行各种对话，比如抓怪物失败的时候就会吐槽说还不如直接击杀呢，又比如一些帅气的大招，会有各种不同的相关对话，总之，这些对话能够让你的战斗过程充满了趣味。

PS：游戏内可以采用传统的键盘WASD键移动，也可以鼠标移动。游戏内有很多密道和暗室，利用前者的话能享受到传统JRPG找密道的感觉，利用后者的话可以省去麻烦的试验密道操作，因为主角的自动寻路是会走密道的哦~

[h1]丰富多彩的内容[/h1] 

如果说上一部分是让你玩游戏感觉到轻松愉快的话，那么这一部分就是吸引你继续玩下去了。我大概总结下，这款游戏里最有趣的是三个部分，第一是装备收集和锻造升级，第二部分是技能组合，第三部分是丰富的怪物和捕捉怪物，第四部分是解密小游戏。

首先是装备的收集和锻造升级，游戏内的装备是特定的，你可以从各种宝箱中搜刮出来。这些装备不仅有各自的优缺点和特色，还能改变游戏里角色的造型，无论是挑选最适合的战斗装，还是挑选最喜欢的打扮，都能在游戏中做到。其次是装备的升级了，装备的升级不仅能带来更强的属性，还能带来各种各样的新能力，攻击时偷窃武器，回合间召唤蘑菇，防御时给予再生buff，这些效果不仅能让战斗更加轻松，还能让战斗更加华丽。

其次是技能组合部分，游戏里有超过120种可用技能（技能可以用刷怪获得的ap点随意学习和升级），10种不同属性的元素类型，12种不同类型的负面效果，潮湿+电击，变轻+狂风，合理运用状态和技能，打出更高的输出。除此之外，游戏里的不同环境有不同的天气，利用天气，或者用特殊技能改变天气，来帮助你更好的取得胜利。

然后是怪物系统了，游戏里有170种不同属性、技能、模式的怪物，而这些怪物（包括头目）都是可以捕捉的！不同的怪物能在战斗中用sp点（召唤点）召唤出来使用一个技能，然而相比于使用这些怪物技能辅助战斗，捕捉这些可爱的怪物本身更让我沉迷。

最后是解密小游戏了，游戏里有很多小谜题，甚至还有由解密小游戏组成的分支迷宫，虽然和主线剧情没有关联，但挑战这些迷宫本身就是极具趣味的一件事了。

[h1]综合评价[/h1] 

因为本身文笔太差，不能很好地表现出我对这个游戏的喜爱，所以还是直白一点吧，这个游戏我吹爆了，强烈建议大家购买！

更多游戏推荐请关注[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly]2P萤火虫[/url]以及[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31716674]2P萤火虫鉴赏家[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198142755246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1701497616}
review: This is likely the only traditional turn-based RPG that I will ever be able to play to any meaningful capacity.  All of the game's mechanics are simple to understand, and many of the more confusing elements are expertly explained at appropriate times.  This is, of course, not even mentioning the outstanding artwork and the funny, lighthearted tone with dialogue to match.  Overall, this game is an absolute joy to play, and I highly recommend it to anyone who may have had trouble getting into the genre before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122662894', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1543911944}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]

[h1]这可能是近来最完美的JRPG[/h1]

先划重点！物超所值的好玩！（我的意思是无视折扣的买爆推荐！）
[list]
[*]虽然这个游戏看上去偏向FLash页游(其实也确实是Flash制作的233）
[*]人物角色道具UI等等看上去偏向小可爱形态的幼稚画风（别，我超爱的）
[*]其中内含了特别有趣生动的游戏梗，主角突破次元壁式的吐槽（喂喂喂，不要给我插游戏教程和内容啊，谁看啊！我自己会玩！）
[*]添加了对于怪物的捕捉系统，十分有趣的收集要素，堪比NS上的宝可梦了（没NS玩的我，这个也能肝爆全收集！）
[/list]
一款EASY模式轻松愉快欢乐的JRPG，笑到锤墙推荐了！

你问我为什么说EASY，如果说你调整到困难模式，你就会知道作者硬核到严谨的属性和技能设定了.困难模式就是挑战者的天堂,沉迷研究敌人属性和技能搭配，通关才没你想的那么容易！

[h1]关于游戏内容[/h1]
[list]
[*]30小时+的游戏时间，还有无限挑战模式等支线玩法。（主线就够有趣了好么！）
[*]特别多的技能组合（更有趣的是，不同技能使用时的动画和主角们的吐槽）
[*]多种多样的装备搭配与升级锻造功能（妈耶！不同衣服替换上去有不同服装展示效果，锻造后感觉更厉害了~）
[*]宝可梦式的收服对手吧！！（我已经沉迷抓敌人了，最有趣的你知道是什么吗，主角看我好多次抓不到，吐槽说我更想痛快的杀掉他们。）
[*]史诗战斗幻想系列精髓恒久远（Ru摇设定犹存，甚至你可以在查看女主状态时尝试点击一下2333，你会获得更多欢乐~）
[*]没有突如其来又永无止境的【地雷战】（怪物都是点击或者对话后开始战斗）
[*]随时存档，随时关掉，从不硬核（本作存储自由，硬核也不是卡存档点，而是数据的对决）
[*]游戏内附有各种解密的内容，为回合制RPG丰富了趣味性（最常见的是为了箱子而开始的华容道，为了通关走的点灯一笔画等等）
[/list]

[h1]开始游玩[/h1]

一个游戏里疯狂死亡的Matt，终于在最后击败了游戏里最终Boss（画面闪过了塞尔达的三角符号）得意洋洋的吐槽着通关死亡次数（2333 硬核游戏死亡数），忽然地震了一下，Matt的棒球棍击碎了电视（oh！！noooo！你懂千辛万苦通关连结局都没看成的痛苦）
怒气冲冲的Matt准备收拾好行囊来场复仇冒险！（等等，你都不知道敌人是谁）我们的冒险就此展开！！

桌面和冰箱里的食物还有材料要带上，嗯，对！别忘了，旁边有一个小房间藏着一个宝箱，记得顺着桌子走，有个墙壁暗门可以走过去。（本作一如既往的希望藏匿宝箱， 全宝箱点击可不容易哦~这个是第一个藏着的宝箱，在房间边缘顺着走就是了）

出门后，Matt就开始吐槽说游戏操作怎么还能是wasd这样疲倦的玩法呢，现在鼠标也可以操作，挺方便的！试试看吧！（鼠标显示可以位移的地方基本都能去，除非被阻挡或者道路间断了。一开始的房间宝箱区域用鼠标点击，人物自动进入暗门到点击处）从此鼠标显示感叹号的地方，可别遗漏了宝箱和道具了。

有人告诉Matt老有猫翻食他的垃圾，顺便吐槽Matt差不多了几个月没有出门。Matt听完往外一看，我擦天上怎么有一个巨大的火球，哦...那是太阳（死宅真可怕 不是么...宅到忘记常理）一路右走展开了剧情。这世界里的怪物战斗都需要主动去对话才能开始，多好的世界啊！哈哈哈，再也不担心濒死踩雷了。经过练习式的几场战斗，发现当停止的时候血量会随着时间而自动回复。（我是简单模式，可能是因为这个，本作有大量的回复道具供给玩家战斗内外使用）

猫咪就躲在了桥边！过去一场遭遇战~这次是自动开始的~打完之后我就收服喵喵了！之后和猫猫一路走过去到了村子接受村民的任务（连Matt都在吐槽！Oh我讨厌这群人，我只要走过去就有莫名其妙的任务给我）之后一路为了拿铲子去了菜场那边，顺手牵强铲子和几个农副产品后，我们见到了女主！女主的正义感极强，为了抓捕Matt和猫被打到短暂失忆2333，而后想了想实力不错，便被【邀为同道】。

Ps：Matt家出门往上方小路走进图后有一个小人偶可以拿，第一个道具店有个辣椒框记得获取辣椒，店内楼梯上去有一副宝石画，其实宝石是可以拿下来的，床铺下方藏着一个箱子。羊和鸭子可以骚扰，双羊拱仙人掌的左边那只多骚扰会整个翻转过来—【你是魔鬼】成就解锁，开始画面可以点击100个史莱姆解锁成就，多抓几次小精灵雾解锁非宝XX梦成就。游戏内含大量游戏梗，例如以撒飞行苍蝇，块魂的王子主角等等。

还有太多太多内容我想要讲了，可是我沉迷挑战宫殿的支线Boss，一路也是死的不要不要的~实在是非常有趣~看了内容简介的朋友有兴趣，真的值得买来试试看。玩着不知为何有种小时候玩RPG的快乐，它和其他RPG真的不一样，没有王子救公主的烂俗，也没有复仇的负面执念，就是一场吐槽和玩梗的快乐无厘头冒险。

[h1]小评 -好玩到爆！停不下来的快乐RPG”-9/10分[/h1]

我评分的话游戏性，操作，内容等等我都吹爆成10分了~实在是有趣。整体游戏已经非常完善了，游玩几乎没有遇见bug。相对而言不足的地方可能是鼠标点击判断在推石头上和购买商品的时候容易出误差，那时候用键盘确认会更好。音乐可能是我唯一要扣分之处，相对其他方面的完善，音乐可以说是洗脑式循环2333，有点魔性和过于单调了。

这游戏系列一共5部，从最早游戏到的网页版本开始就圈粉无数，当时的游戏也并没有中文版本，全靠玩家为爱发电式查阅翻译之后才开始有中文内容的改版。别看画风可爱，但是获得了游戏性为主的玩家们一致好评，Wiki上也有本系列的内容，以及国外爱好者的同人本等等。

有兴趣的话，来玩玩看吧！你不会后悔的！

[h1]额外的拓展阅读[/h1]

此内容为1-4代的完整故事剧情，不过是否知道剧情与史诗战斗幻想5的游戏体验没多大影响。

[quote=fibonacci论坛老哥和wiki的内容] 
这个故事要从Matt和Natalie一起闯荡江湖开始讲起。他们在旅途中斩杀各种各样的怪物，最后在一片墓地里遇上了僵尸孙悟空（最终BOSS，孙悟空曾经在非正传No Name和FF Battle（两部都是Flash动画）中出现，但被Matt杀死），经过一轮艰苦的战斗后，他们终于打败了僵尸孙悟空，气数已尽的僵尸孙悟空却在这时候自爆了，我们的两位主角也在这场自爆中不知所终。（第一部结束）

原来两位主角被Kitten Kingdom的猫星人给救了。当时僵尸孙悟空自爆的威力实在过于惊人，不但引起了使地球为之四分五裂的大地震，还产生了大量的有毒气体和辐射，使动物产生变异，气候也变得非常混乱，人类苦不堪言。虽然地球正在慢慢地复原，人类也有了重建社会的希望，但这时却出现了一个叫做Lance的人，他立誓要破坏整个世界，然后再建立新的秩序。他集结了一个由怪物和机器人组成的军队来实现他的目的。主角们得知这一消息后，立刻离开Kitten Kingdom，去寻找这个人并打算消灭其野心。主角们经历了一番冒险（中途还死了次，但被一个名为Deus Ex Machina的天使救了），最终粉碎了Lance的野心，世界也因此和平。Lance也从这次战斗中认识到了生命的重要性，并和主角们成为了好朋友。（第二部结束）

Matt、Natalie和Lance一直在世界各地搜寻宝物和对抗新的敌人。有一天，他们听说了一个关于上古恶魔（Akron）的传说并来到传说中恶魔身处的墓地，发现这个恶魔竟然还活着，但是被封印（陷入沉睡之中）住了。Matt用剑戳恶魔以求证它是否还活着的时候，这个恶魔却苏醒了，它发出强大的震荡波将主角们震慑住，并开始吸收他们的能量。幸好主角们能量过剩，没被吸完，醒来后发现自己在一个陌生的地方（the town），他们本来几乎是无敌的存在，现在却变成了普通的探险者，连武器也不知道去哪里了。这恶魔因为吸收了主角们的能量而变得更加强大，它开始摧毁空间和时间，企图把世界成为虚无的存在。主角们决心要恢复自己失去的力量并打败这只恶魔。他们经过与Forest、Rock Lake、Glacier Valley、Kitten Kingdom Ruins和Volcano Peak里的敌人战斗后，最终恢复了原来的力量，而且比以前更厉害了。他们走进Akron所制造的黑洞，与Akron决一死战，最后消灭了Akron，地球又恢复了和平。（第三部结束）

Matt、Natalie和Lance因为消灭Akron、拯救地球而名声大振，无所事事的他们却干起了以偷东西维生的行当。有一天，Greenwood Village里的一块神圣宝石（Greenwood Jewel）被偷了，刚好我们的三位主角也来到Greenwood Village里偷东西。Greenwood的居民兼弓箭手Anna听说镇村之宝被偷后，就立刻追踪起我们的三位主角。Anna在Ashwood Forest里打败了Matt（很简单地就把Matt给打败了有没有！），却发现Matt没有偷那颗宝石，便怀疑是他的同伴拿走了。就这样Anna便和俘虏Matt一起寻找Matt的伙伴，寻找宝石的下落。他们相继找到了Natalie和Lance，却发现宝石也不在他们的手上，最后Anna向3人托盘出这些宝石的重要性——传说这些宝石聚在一起的话，神秘的Godcat就会重生并摧毁世界。4人立刻组队，前往剩下的宝石的所在地并打算保护这些宝石，但可惜他们每次都比宝石大盗慢一步。最后他们在Godcat Temple里，亲眼目睹了偷宝石的幕后黑手——众猫星人将Godcat复活。原来Godcat是创造世界万物的神，它创造了猫星人（cat）和人类，而且把人类作为奴隶赐予给了猫星人。但是却没想到猫星人那么不争气，反倒让人类主宰了世界，它不满意猫星人，所以摧毁了猫星人的文明，并在离开的时候制造了Akron，以此来消灭人类，不料Akron被人类封印并在最后被我们的主角消灭了。主角们努力对抗Godcat，就在他们快要输掉这场战斗的时候，Godcat被主角们的努力感动了，发现人类是有能力改变自己命运的一种生物，而它自己早就不属于这个世界。所以Godcat最后离开了这个世界，去宇宙寻觅新的世界，创造自己理想中的真正属于猫星人的世界。（第四部结束）	[/quote]

review:
I absolutely loved this game. It brought back all the nostalgia from ebf3 and tossed everything up with fancy new battle mechanics, as well as making swapping actually relevant! The only major criticism i have with the game is in the keyboard movement, since it feels clunkier than ebf4 (or maybe i'm just remembering it wrong.)

At least try the free web version, it's really worth it to play this game, since it does nothing but add to the joy of the past games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198369945134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1682857240}
review: I have been looking forward to this installment in the series for quite a while. I also purchased the steam version of EBF4 and was very pleased with my purchase as well, but this installment far exceeded my expectations. If you are on the fence about this game, please go and try EBF4 or EBF5 when it releases online. It is free and it will most definitely give you an idea as to how the game feels and plays. I would also like to say that if you do purchase a copy of EBF4 or EBF5 it would greatly help the people who developed this amazing game! Shoutout to all who helped in the creation of this game. 10/10 would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024933857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1552767961}
review:
Der fünfte und bislang beste Teil des kuriosen Abenteurer-Quintets Matt, Nathalie, Lance, Anna und NoLegs. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1581915686
Es ist klar für Fans des Genres und des Stils gemacht und genau das wird geliefert. Ein RPG mit rundenbasierten Kämpfen. Leveling, Aufrüstung, Buffing, Forging, ... Es ist alles da zusammen mit sehr liebevoller (mangels eines besseren Wortes) Grafik, toller Musik und einer schwarz gewürzten Prise Humor.

Das Spiel braucht keine Vorkenntnisse, der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist (zumindest zu Beginn) so einfach, dass selbst Neueinsteiger reinkommen und die Geschichte ist auch unabhängig von den Vorangegangenen Versionen.

Sehr angenehme Game-Dynamik, Nach den vorangegangenen Teilen ist vieles fast selbsterklärend und einige Dinge wurden deutlich vereinfacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995194212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2746, 'last_played': 1548235812}
review: This is such a perfect game and sequel, the jrpg style combat adapted into a western format. No one has ever reimagined this genre as good as the developer of this game. The characters are all fun and their interactions with each other feels like I am playing a visual novel, while keeping the pace of the game going fast as usual. Combat is extremely fun the myriad of abilities some of which can be traded among characters makes for a deep party customization. The challanges are hard as you would except (playing "hard" on my first playthrough). The story never takes itself seriously but still manages to grab my attention and motivate me to play further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011097396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1590381489}
review:
EBF5 brings back everything loved from earlier iterations. Now with NoLegs added to the party you can play as an astronaut cat which is awesome. The witty dialogue remains one of the high points of the series. If you were a fan of this in EBF4, then you will not be disapointed. The world is also full of references to RPG classics that clearly inspired EBF5. Always glad to see another Golden Sun reference out in the wild!

Despite being flash, it runs completely smooth on max settings. No technical issues there.

The one negative I have encountered is the lack of 1440p fullscreen support. Playing in 1080 results in some bluring which gives me eyestrain faster than normal, preventing long gaming sessions.
Update: Best fit fullscreen added in a week 1 patch. Solved the issue!

My verdict: If you enjoyed EBF4, you will enjoy this game. If you haven't tried 4, give it a shot for free on flash game sites first. It is very representative of what you get with 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011724812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1627156858}
review:
BEFORE I START
NERF EVASION
Holy fucking shit. 
It's the one thing that is making me dislike this game. It feels like enemies dodge every single attack I make, making me need to spam out bind just so I have more than a 50% hit chance.

TL;DR at bottom.
I've played every Epic Battle Fantasy since his first game back in 07 I believe and I've enjoyed every single one. The combat flows much differently due to no MP, and honestly it's a very welcome change. The "pok*mon" summon style is amazing, making capturing some of the enemies worth it. Those being the two biggest draws for everybody who has played the previous games.

If you are new to the series, here is what EBF does well.

Turn Base Combat
Item Upgrading/Trading
Easily found hidden loot
optional dungeons that I still haven't tried out of fear.
Amazing bossfights with characters that are geniuely enjoyable.
Stupid Comedy that is great, I mean hell Lance is basically a grefreiter (Okay seriously Matt, why is he wearing a grefrieter patch? He should at least be generalmajor, honestly more like a generalfeldmarshall..) fascist soldier who is honestly a great meme.
Bullshit levels of evasion. 
Nonsensical Story
non-bullshit medals for beating bosses on hard. You can run through the entire game on normal, turn it on hard for boss medals.

What does it do poorly?
The Music. There simply is not enough of the music, there needs to be more tracks in the future. 
Please add in a faster combat, it does take a while even on a high end computer. Maybe a 2x speed? 
Enemy levels. They always feel like a goddamn bullsponge, quite literally for Lance, there are some exceptions. Not noly that but recently I fought level 32s against my level 28 party. It was worse than most of the bossfights.

TL;DR
If you've played EBF before, or never thsi is easily worth the 15$s. Hell, buy the fourth one if this is your first game and play that first. It's just as good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204910624', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2093, 'last_played': 1630133214}

You're a Fan of RPG´s? -Yes!

You like Achievements? -We have Achievements!
You like challenging Bosses? -We got them too.

If you answered at least half of this Questions with a "Yes", you should definitely give any "Epic Battle Fantasy" a Try.

You WILL spend a lot of Time with this Game, you WILL try to get all Achievements and you WILL love this Gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031905307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2389, 'last_played': 1585810529}
review:
If someone liked EBF 4, I can't imagine them not liking this game. 

It is very polished, and the addition of the monster capture system (with the sheer variety of monsters) adds an extra layer whenever you encounter a new monster. 

The fact you can change difficulty on the fly from Easy to Epic virtually at will let's you decide what type of fights you want-- especially if you want those epic boss achievements. 

All in all, consistent quality and very polished. Enjoying it quite a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122114812', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 3227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1595975258}
review:
Started at Newgrounds, now we're here!

I love the art style, the humor, and the borderline fetish-level of sword love.
MP is gone and I'm actually digging it.
The creepy parts come off so well i actually want more glitches and far off nightmares to pour in.
The fascism bit came off way too heavy handed.
The monster hunting is a pain in the crotch (albeit an interesting way to do summons, I just wish I picked it up before getting halfway through the game).
But, best of all....

Nolegs, you righteous badass and yet, you horrifying creature. 
Taking a captured being, roasting it alive on a barbaque fork, covering it with tabasco sauce and beating your fellow cat-kind to death with it as a fire weapon... 
Not Important would be impressed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081227593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 9341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1703379850}
review: If you like RPGs, this is a must-buy. While there's nothing particularly groundbreaking, the sheer amount of polish and humor makes this one of the most fun games I've played in recent memory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008193835', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1697762283}
review:
11/10. Plain and simple.

This series has been near and dear to my heart, since 2009. A passion-project filled to the brim with amazing gameplay, cheeky stories, and homages to many things RPG fans know and love. Epic Battle Fantasy 5 oozes with fun, style, humor, nods to real life issues, references to you name it, and above all else... QUALITY. You get as much out of the game as you put in, and believe me, there's always something exciting to discover if you really explore and fiddle with all the game has to offer.

If you're a fan of RPG's, designing character/party builds, collecting monsters, secret areas, turn-based battles, strategy, and fancy a bit of whimsy, then look no further. This game has it all.

I'd have happily paid around $40, USD. Outstanding, amazing content and developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020684152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2442, 'last_played': 1659466260}
review:
[h1]The long awaited sequel[/h1]

At first, I was hyped about EBF5 "comming soon", but it has been quite some time since I last played other episodes. And so, I kinda hesitated when I was about to buy this game. First few moments of gameplay has shown me how wrong I was.

As the name Epic Battle Fantasy suggests, the game is awesome. Fights, gameplay, awesome dialogues... that's all amazing. But music... that really gets me. Absolutely gorgeous.

Let's talk about changes and gameplay...
Instead of mana, you now have recharge time. I can't say if it makes the game easier or harder, it just changes it.
Abilities have been reworked as well. Every character now has 13 abilities, which can evolve as you level them up (becoming AoE, hitting more time, etc.)
Many new status effects appeared.
Wheather was added to combat (every round, event happens).
You can play the game on variety of dificulties, making it fun for everyone.
The deluxe (steam) version offers bonus content, like dungeons that scale to your level and are more difficult than normal "story-mode".
And a lot more, making the game completely amazing.

One last thing I have to add:
Considering that the game was released not so long ago, I have not yet encountered a single bug. I dare say that this game is [b]bug free[/b].

Summary:
This game is really fun to play if you get to it. If you are hesitant about buying it, try EBF3 or EBF4 (or EBF5 once it gets released) in browser.
Pros:
[list]
    [*]You can try the game for free (now only older versions)
    [*]Game is bug free
    [*]No microtransactions
    [*]Ice-cream slimes!
[/list]

Not only I recommend this game, I highly recommend it. The comparison of price and gameplay time/fun it gives it just amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978797255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2891, 'last_played': 1544479767}
review:
The original Epic Battle Fantasy was basically a parody of the JRPG genre - cutting away everything except the turn-based combat, and just basically pitting you against wave after wave of enemies, while poking fun at various classic games along the way. Enough said, the series has come a LONG way since then. Like in a few other cases I can think of, this parody has risen to become a viable alternative to the very games it once riffed.

On the surface, EBF5 is an extremely straightforwards, highly-accessible JRPG - one that does not require hours of tutorializing, but basically gets all that out of the way within ten minutes or so. It does nothing new, but it DOES do a lot of OLD things exceedingly well. A finely-tuned battle-system, various elements to be weak or strong against, status-ailments to juggle, mind-twisting sliding-floor and block-pushing puzzles, and a brand-new monster-catching system that's ripped straight from classic Pokémon and then made BETTER. The characters are archetypical, and don't have any overly-long introduction-arcs or personal sidequests - you basically just get to know them from the battle banter, and they're tremendously likeable... especially compared to your average 'complex' JRPG-character.

Mind... that's 'on the surface'. If you're willing to dig into the hidden corners of the game, you might find that it actually DOES have a kernel of originality. There are things that can genuinely surprise, if not outright frighten, anyone who goes into it spoiler-free. The fact that the game is so cheerfully cookie-cutter on the surface only increases the impact. I will say no more of this - only know that this is a "Come for the easily-digestible JRPG fun, stay for the creepy surprises" situation.

review:
待望の日本語化！！
前から気になっていた作品でこのタイトルから日本語化ということで
購入してみました。内容的にまだそれほど進めていませんが、様々な
装備やスキルが豊富にありやりこみ要素、パロディやネタ系も多くあり
従来のRPGにはない面白さがあります。
PCだからこそ許されるコンシューマにはない面白さが詰まっている
作品だと思いました。

前作もプレーしたいのですが英語が苦手でやっておりませんが
これを機に前作も日本語化してもらえればなと思います。

価格もお手頃なのでとりあえずやってみる価値はあると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198128018130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1707952331}
review:
Un jeu qui vaut plus que son prix, qui fera le bonheur de tous les aficionados du RPG tour par tour, et aux amateurs d'humour osé et décalé.

Le gameplay est très simple et accessible, mais fignolé aux petits oignons. La variété des ennemis et de leurs shémas d'attaques, combinés aux nombreuses altérations d'états, le nombre immense d'invocations (chaque monstre, y compris les boss peuvent être capturés et invoqué en combat), rendent les combats tous différents les uns que les autres, ne laissant place à aucune redondance. Les stratégies à adopter sont innombrables, et le challenge est au rendez-vous.

La fin réserve aussi une petite surprise pour les fans de la série.

Malgré quelques étourderies, la traduction française est d'une qualité quasi-professionnelle qui a elle même impressionné Matt (le développeur) par ses retours positifs. Ce qui est indubitablement une force, et permet aux fans de jeux indépendants d'avoir le loisir de jouer avec enfin une traduction française disponible qui dépasse la simple fan-trad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046040152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1544581847}
review: EBF4 set an incredible precedent for the series, and so far (22 hours in) EBF5 has absolutely smashed it.  Complex combat, hilarious writing, wonderful pacing and the type of polish that makes it extremely apparent that Matt really cares about his series and his audience. Will 100% live up to the expectations of fans of the series, while also being a great starting point for those who are new to it. Do yourself a huge favor and buy this game instead of reading reviews!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052438209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1689121660}
review:
What to say? Just a direct improvement over EBF4, like EBF4 was to 3 and 3 to 2...also 2 to 1.
The same, simple formula once again improved and enriched with new stuff.
The pros
-over 200 equips and 140 summons for tactical use
-tons of skills for all chars
-shared skills that can be easily swapped for easy experimentation
-the overworld is very nice looking and the level design is on point
-graphics are very nice overall
-the characters are even more likable and the dialogue is fun to read
-the soundtrack is leet

The bad
-a few balance issues thare are constantly addressed however
-the game runs about as good as Stephen Hawking for many players so you may need to lower the settings

A solid 9/10 from me

Despite owning over a thousand different games on Steam, I regularly come back to the EBF series as my go to RPG pick when recommending games to friends. There's nothing particularly groundbreaking about this game, but that doesn't matter because it takes an established RPG formula and polishes it to a mirror shine. Everything about this game is fun, from the battles to the puzzles to interacting with NPCs and that's essentially all this game is: [i]fun[/i].

Is this the most satisfying game you'll ever play? No. But unique among all games I've played, the EBF series are a joy to play through from the moment you open the game window till you close it and that - in my eyes - makes this one of the best games to ever exist.

review: 网页测试版和steam版（付费部分）玩了总共54个小时，除了打赢猫神后的bossrush和小怪rush，无尽模式还没打，其他全成就全装备拿到，为了找到隐藏的宝箱点，屏幕上每一个格子都用鼠标点过去。。。以前的EBF4 ，通关了5，6遍，还有更久以前的EBF3，虽然相比后两代粗糙很多，但却也无法忘记。没有什么能表达我对EBF系列的喜爱，游戏体验之极致不亚于大作，还有每一代每一个场景的背景音乐，也都是无比喜欢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102935474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1575861662}
review: Man, what a refreshing, surprising wave of nostalgia this game is proving to be. Been playing Kupo's games since Brawl Royale was a flash game when I was a kid lol. Games like these always strengthen my love for indie game developers. Fair asking price, no grindy b******t, a good sense of humor, a great soundtrack and most importantly simple, satisfying gameplay. Of course the concept of turn-based rpg's is one that's been used for decades, but the game does a good job of both poking fun at the stereotypes that come with the genre as well as mixing a bunch of great mechanics from other series into one, nice package. Didn't know this game was even going to come out, but boy am I glad it did. Great job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097531401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2469, 'last_played': 1681253867}
review:
Improves upon its predecessors in every single way. Viewed on its own, it's got a charm that follows you throughout the entire experience, and is full of content and polish to be enjoyed. The developers deserve every bit of support they can get for their dedication towards making EBF what it is today.
Now bigger and better in 2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091587775', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 8885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2795, 'last_played': 1561765422}
review:
J'ai été surpris en plusieurs points:
-Déja 20% de réduc car je possédais la version deluxe d'EBF4. Même sans cette réduc', j'aurai acheté le 5 de toutes manières
-Les dialogues sont de loin plus familier qu'auparavant. Ca change et je trouve pas cela si mal. J'ai eu du mal au début, je me disais que le jeu avais bien changé, mais avec le temps je m'y suis fait. C'est plus raisonable ainsi. Et le jeu n'est pas "si" différent qu'EBF3 et EBF4
-Les OST sont du même genre que les OST des précédant opus, qui me plaisaient deja énormémément. J'aurai pensé que l'EBF5 aurai changé de type de bande son, mais honetement je suis content qu'il en soit ainsi.
-Je suis étonné que les personnages joueurs ne se connaissent pas ! ils ont quand même eu des aventures EPIQUE ENSEMBLE dans les précédent EBF. Ca m'a choqué, c'est comme si EBF5 etait EBF Pre sequels. Choqué, mais agréablement. J'aime les surprises
-Je croyais que jouer PadPat (Aka NoLegs) etait un mythe, mais non, on peu vraiment jouer ce petit chaton qui nous aura suivi dans chacune de nos précédentes aventures. Un nouveau personnage avec un style de jeu qui est lui aussi nouveau. Il est très agile et a une esquive élevé, mais vie basse et défense basse. Et attaque modéréments bonnes
-Je m'amuse bien plus que je ne l'aurai pensé
-Une nouvelle mécanique de combat: Les MP N'EXISTENT PLUS, maintenant les skills ont un cooldown. Et pleint de nouvelles altérations d'états
-Plein de donjons et zones secondaires pour des loots spéciaux et du CHALLENGE, OUI DU CHALLENGE

Points négatifs:
-Des fautes de français, de frappe et d'orthographes (Surtout de frappe) à droite à gauche. Pas trop violentes néanmoins, si vous lisez vites, vous pourriez les louper, un peu comme les miennes :3
-je trouve dommage que les sorts de heals aient un temps de recharge, c'est grace a elles que l'on survie. Alors on peu compter sur les bonus de def, mais j'ai l'impressions qu'il NE SONT PAS CUMULABLE. Je m'explique, si blindage vous donne 30% de def, et que vous le réutilisez lorsqu'il vous reste que 15%, on est sensé monter à 45%, mais on revient a 30 >:(

Fans d'Epic Battle Fantasy de Matt Roszak, vous allez aimer.
Amateur qui ne connaissent pas trop la série, considérez ce jeu comme un baptème du feu ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198067637221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2716, 'last_played': 1651088952}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is definitely high up there in my favourite RPGs of 2018, possibly of all time, even.

The combat is fun, the characters are utter douchebags (specifically Lance) but still likeable, and the dialogue is brilliant; this is one of those games where you just have to talk to everyone / interact with everything to fully appreciate every little detail in this game.

The game allows you to change its difficutly on the fly. I played through game on Normal, swapped to Epic for the bosses, and swapped to Zero when I wanted to grind. The bosses are a great challenge on Epic difficulty; most of them, especially in the later half of the game, have unique attributes that require you to think of a strategy beforehand, causing to gain newfound appreciation for some otherwise niche equipment or mechanics. For example, I didn't truly appreciate the Virus debuff until the [spoiler]Matteus[/spoiler] fight, where it really shines.

After following the development of this sequel since day one, it was well worth the wait.

Absolute masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140535369', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1591020168}
review:
В Epic Battle Fantasy 5 вам НЕ встретятся...
Раздражающие случайные битвы.

My реакция: Ну да конечно....
Оценкa: 9,9/10

Давайте о самой игре, играл я кстати во всееееееееееееее части.
ПЛЮСЫ!
+Появился русский язык, дождались!!! И..и много других языков.
+НЕТ МАНЫ! ТОЛЬКО ПЕРЕЗАРЯДКА СИЛ! Весьма оригинальная система, но какая же прикольная! P.S Получше чем мана.
+Тактика или СМЕРТЦ! Тут нужно думать не сердцем, не 5-той точкой, и не ногами! А ГОЛОВНЫМ МОЗГОМ.
+Просто плюсик.
+Система пок*монов, с это системой вы можете: Захватывать врагов/боссов себе! Кроме обычных людей конечно.
Думаю в этой игре НАМНОГО больше плюсов, давайте теперь о минусах!
-Epic Battle Fantasy 5 НЕТУ МИНУСОВ! Это шЫдЫфр!

Уже итоговая оценка: 9,9/9,9))))))

author: {'steamid': '76561198030415682', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1544634316}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053348539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1674911514}
review:
If i'll be honest, i expected the game to not live up to the series, with it now being sold for $15 and being developed for so many years.

But im excited to say that the game is much more than i hoped for, taking the good of EBF4 and improving on that, while adding more content and a certain level of diversity to it that's hard to get in something with this many sequels. The humor is just as good as ever, the enemies just as fun to fight, and the characters the same ones you grew to like over the other games.

If y'all want a con for this game, i'd really only say that it can occasionally lag a tiny bit when doing certain things with particle effects. But i'm pretty sure you can just turn that off

Really worth the wait and $15

author: {'steamid': '76561198258534215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18584, 'last_played': 1705865686}
review:
Du haut des mes modestes 300h de jeu, je peux vous affirmer qu'il en vaut le prix. On retrouve dans cet incroyable RPG tour par tour, un level-design très intéressant, des mécaniques de combats très agréables avec les bonus, malus, effets. La difficulté est totalement ajustable si vous préférez une expérience de jeu calme et narrative, ou un véritable défi ; car oui, c'est un défi d'accomplir tout les objectifs et battre tout les boss en hardcore. Le jeu ne présente (à ma connaissance) aucun bug ou défaut qui pourrait vous faire regretter votre achat. On y trouve de grandes diversités d'équipement, un gameplay 5 joueurs, un système de capture innovant, pour combler les faiblesse de l'équipe, un humour décalé et agréable, des persos principaux à fort caractère, et des musiques riches. (Bonus nostalgie des persos de EBF4 et bonus pour PadPat, le chat, qui est un perso jouable.)

Pour moi c'est un coup de coeur, il fait parti des jeux dont je ne me lasse pas, malgré le fait de l'avoir fait et refait.

En résumé : Un RPG au tour par tour extrêmement divertissant et possédant de nombreux atouts qui devrait vous faire lâcher 20 balles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169496727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1709917329}
review: Another solid entry in the Epic Battle Fantasy series. This game has enough new concepts that it will still be a fresh and entertaining experience for returning players, but it also serves as a good entry into the series for beginners. As ever, EBF5's strongest point is its battles. The EBF series is my favorite turn-based battle series, period.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042033240', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 13043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1619638739}
review:
It's good.
The Epic Battle Fantasy games really show how good JRPG Combat Systems can be.
There is a story, but the focus is on the great gameplay of said system.
Building together different items and skills in different combos is the name of the game. And if everything fails, just grind for 10min (yes, not hours).

author: {'steamid': '76561198079651814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1592657443}
review:
Absolutely delightful. Captures the essence of what makes Epic Battle Fantasy epic. Gameplay is smooth, haven't found any bugs yet. Phrynna's music is, as always, sublime. The story confused me at first (considering the prior EBFs), but the ending hit me like a truck.

As a long-time fan of EBF, this was a must-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243735148', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1605765368}
review: I'm so happy that this game is finally out! It's safe to say that the wait was well worth it! Basically an upgraded version of EBF4, which was already such an amazing turn-based RPG. Love this one, hope more are made like this in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141594524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1575751171}
review:
Jeśli EBF3 i 4 były 7/10, ta gra to 9/10, a to tylko dlatego że perfekcyjne gry nie istnieją. Przed resztą warto wspomnieć, że za jakiś czas powinna wyjść też darmowa wersja na przeglądarki - potraktujcie ją jako kilku-godzinne demo, a to jako DLC jeśli wam się spodoba.
Jest bardzo wiele sposobów podejścia do gry, szczególnie dlatego że ekwipunek jest bardziej zróżnicowany niż tylko "wybierz to które daje ci odporność" z 4-ki, głównie dlatego, że mogą one teraz m.in zwiększać bufy i debufy, mogą spowodować że przeciwnicy celują w gracza, dodają efekty przy obronie itp.
Skille są teraz uproszczone - MP zostało usunięte i zastąpione cooldownami, które o wiele lepiej spełniają funkcję ograniczania spamowania skilli, a te które były bezpośrednio gorsze są po prostu zastąpiane lepszymi wersjami przy polepszaniu.
Co do przywoływania stworków, chociaż ja aż tak na tym nie polegałem i wiele z nich zdecydowanie jest gorszych od reszty (czego trudno uniknąć gdy jest ich ze 100-150), to sprawdzają się one, głównie z zadawaniu rzadkich statusów. Ogólnie nowe funkcje są świetne.
Przede wszystkim lepiej działa system wsparcia - bufy działają na całą drużynę, a wraz z dodaniem ograniczeń na skille o wiele bardziej warto zmieniać się między członkami drużyny. Tempo gry też zdaje się być trochę szybsze niż w 4 - ogólnie choć w tamtą raz czy dwa przestałem grać bo nudziła trochę, tą chętnie przeszłem od początku do końca i chętnie zaczynałem jeszcze raz (w publicznej becie, dlatego mój czas gry i osiągnięcia na Steamie mogą się jeszcze nie zgadzać)
Gra jest też lekkim rebootem serii, więc postacie mają lepsze wprowadznie i rozwój w czasie gry, chociaż to nigdy nie była i nie musiała być mocna strona tych gier.
Świetne są tu też lochy i tereny poboczne - w przeciwieństwie do Battle Mountain które miało betonową ścianę w postaci 2-go bossa, tutaj są one porozkładane na mapie, więc jeśli na którymś utnkniesz, możesz spróbować inny. Bardzo dobry jest też powrót nagród za osiągnięcia z 3-ki w postaci galerii, która odblokowywuje się powoli z osiągnięciami i zostaje otwarta pomiędzy różnymi zapisami. Chociaż nie przeszłem jeszcze większości z nich bo grałem na darmowej becie (zaktualizuję recenzję gdy do nich dojdę), to po pierwszym z nich te z płatnej wersji zapowiadają się świetnie, głównie dlatego, że walki nie trwają 8 fal, a najwyżej 5.
EDIT: Tak właściwie tylko edit do Steam Awards, ale by dopowiedzieć to co zacząłem, dodatkowi bossowie z pewnością są najlepszymi w serii. Są bardzo trudni bez dobrej strategii, ale dają kilka sposobów na poradzenie sobie z nimi poza jedną OP kombinacją, chociaż min-maxowe strategie na pokonywanie ich w 1.turę wciąż istnieją.

review: Игра очень годная, с юмором тут очень складно, приятная и спокойная атмосфера. Интересный геймплей и не напрягающее прохождение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098035317', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1661803545}
review:
Another Epic Battle Fantasy game has graced the Steam Store (if it isn't obvious enough, this review will be biased).
It's been a while since we first heard the news that a fifth game is in the making, and oh boy was it worth the wait.
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is a turn-based RPG game filled with refrences, hillarious and cute enemies and lines and a soundtrack that would make most AAA games have a run for their money.
Phyrnna you did an amazing job once again, especially with the returning themes which were given a fresh coat of paint.

Yes, the fullscreen at the time that I'm writing this is a bit buggy, and yes the framerate I'm getting is lower than the previous games (I own all of the ones on steam and they run perfectly fine), but I'm sure it will get fixed, so that's not something to really worry about.

TD;DR - If you want a great experience with a nice RPG system and an awesome OST get this game, it is worth the money, and if you're in love with the soundtrack I suggest you buy the OST on steam since it's a great deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086123811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1544881478}
review:
So... I've got some games in my Steam Account, but this is my first review ever.
Why? Because this Game and the Dev just deserve to get a super positive feedback!

I've played EBF since the first one back at Kongregate. Every game so far was great and got even greater.
But with EBF 5 this get's on a whole new level!
My english isn't the best, so I make it short:

Pros:
- awesome and lovable character design
- clear and detail-loving art
- cool story with many, many funny moments and references (just like the previous games)
- fantastic weapon, outfit and map design
- nice soundtrack
- great battle system and balance, easy to learn, yet very challenging
- very many secrets and other things to explore
- replayable and challenging for many hours
- the Dev is awesome ;)
- just everything

Cons:
- none

Just buy it and have fun! :D

review: The fifth installment of the classic flash series with cute artstyle and JRPG-like turn-based fights. New playable character, new equips, skills, buffs and debuffs. Story is rebooted so you can hop straight in without the need to play previous games. Awesome music, as usual. Must play for the fans of the series, worth checking if you like turn-based RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346602146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1656516716}
review:
I've been waiting for this game's release for years, now, and lemmie tell you, it did not disappoint.

The graphics are phenomenal, everything just comes to life on your screen. The soundtrack is just GODLY. Seriously. I've heard it to death, and I'll do it again in a heartbeat.

Then there's the gameplay. The TONS of equips you get really encourages you to experiment and see what works, and the MASSIVE enemy variety gives you tons of leeway to do so. You can adjust the overall difficulty whenever you want, too, from the no-danger, casual Zero difficulty, to the nail-biting tension of Epic difficulty.

The writing doesn't take itself too seriously, but it's still consistent, following the characters' personalities and development throughout the game.

Then, we got the bosses. Oh boy. The bosses are just MWAH. Amazing and unique fights that keep you on your toes, and have a nice difficulty progression from one to the next. Two-thirds of them are optional, so it's not going to get repetitive if you really don't want them to be.

All of the secret areas found in the game are designed to be done whenever you want to, which is a great way to break up any dungeons if you think they're getting too repetitive.

So, basically, I'd recommend this game to RPG fans, people willing to have a good chuckle, strategy gurus, and completionists. Probably more people, too, but I can't think of any more right now. 

As a reward for reading this far, you may or may not have heard that there's going to be some pretty huge updates on the horizon for this game, but you didn't hear that from me. (What? I can't offer much in a steam review).

author: {'steamid': '76561198047159328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1546064643}

author: {'steamid': '76561198149378659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1694462871}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is great, both as a part of the series and in its own right. There is so much to praise about this game and so little to criticise, it's a genuinely enjoyable experience from the very first moment - and I'll preface this review by saying you don't need to own any of the other EBF games to enjoy this one.

The gameplay is simple on the surface, but there are so many ways to play, and you can do a [b]lot[/b] with the five characters you're given. Each character has their own interesting personality and attitude, even NoLegs, who is literally a cat. If you've played the previous 4 games, you'll know the characters, but given that this is a reboot of the series, they're all much different - less trope-y and cliche and more fleshed out this time around. Except for NoLegs, who is still a cat. 

I haven't completed the whole story yet (not even halfway), but it's certainly interesting. It's nice to see one of the series' most popular foes actually given some lore. The writing is really good, and there's a lot of witty dialogue. There's no big exposition dumps at least, so thank god for that.

The game LOOKS amazing. Everything looks very clean and colourful, which matches the tone of the game very well. The paper-cutout cutscenes look much better than they did in EBF4 (where they looked pretty good already), and each piece of weaponry, armour and flair is creative and unique. I'm pretty sure this is the only game on Steam where you can dress a cat up in riot gear, viking fur and a ninja headband at once, accompanied by a small drone and a fake mustache. So that's something. Did I mention he could summon literal gods?
Attack animations are where the game really shines. You can really feel the weight of your attacks hitting the target, especially with skills like Judgment and MOAB. Not to mention the awesome Limit Breaks - if you've never played this game before, use Cleaver as soon as you get it. It looks awesome.

Most importantly, I should highlight how much love and care went into this game. There's 5 of them for a reason, and this is by far the definitive game in the series. Fan feedback didn't fall on deaf ears with this game (some of the [b]enemies[/b] were designed by fans and hand-picked to be in the game!) and many features have been added, removed and tweaked based on feedback given to the developer. That, to me, is the difference between a good game and a great game.

A 10/10 from every front for me. Been waiting three years for this game, and before I've even completed it, I know I love it from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159432094', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 68, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1711610572}
review:
How do I even start... I've been playing this series ever since the 3rd game, when I was a child; basically this is my FF7. Just like the theme of the series, there's a lot of 4th-wall breaking, hidden secrets, great storyline... could go on forever. 

If you're on the fence on whether this game is worth a purchase, there's definitely nothing to hesitate on. There's a reason why this series has such a strong community after so many years and people immediately purchase the game when the newest one is released.

 You WILL sink a lot of time into the game, you WILL aim to get all achievements, and you WILL love this game. I seriously cannot vouch for it more enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102283989', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1544623651}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988784261', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1574427099}
review:
A game packed with Scottish Culture
The currency is £, there's irn bru and weed and tenant's lager to be found everywhere. 
I've never met the creator personally, but he lives in the same city as me. I've followed Matt's games for most of my life, and i feel like we'd get along pretty well maybe.

EBF 5 is the latest in a mature series of turn based JRPG style games. It started out as a work of self insert fanfiction for the creator, glasgow based Matt Roszak, and a recurring cast of characters i can only assume are based on his friends.

Based on a long history of Final Fantasy and related games. It's been refined, improved and perfected over the years, and the result is an enthralling game that has at least complex - if not deep - combat, focused on managing skills, equipment, statuses and elemental weaknesses. It's clear that it's made by someone with decades of playing turn based RPGs, and it takes all the best aspects of them while leaving the bad ones behind.

Storywise, EBF is also a reboot. Not sure how i feel about this, maybe its for the best. But it certainly makes it more welcome to newcomers. The entire old cast of characters is here, but the story starts off with them not knowing each other and meeting up gradually as they go. It essentially retcons the story of the previous games out of existence. But that's not really such a loss, in EBF the story has always been a shallow framing device for adventures and memes anyway. 

That's one aspect that doesn't change here. Matt wakes up from a life of videogames to find that the world is in some kind of vaguely defined danger, and immediately sets out on a quest to stop it, recruit characters and pickup tons of loot along the way. At the time of writing, i'm 10 hours into the game and no main villain or storyline has showed up, other than keep exploring and gathering loot. But that's still enjoyable

The core gameplay of EBF games is exploration and collecting. Each character has a vast array of weapons, armor and acessories they can use. But each one is predesigned with fancy art, no random generation. And more significantly, each one is balanced. Every piece of equipment you find offers a new sidegrade - a new option that allows you to adapt your tactics to the challenges ahead.  Very rarely does something just become obsolete and get entirely replaced. Everything fills a niche, and even your starter gear can remain useful in the endgame.

The combat is hard and complex, mostly consisting of crushingly difficult enemies that will kick your ass the first try or two. The real meat of the gameplay is retreating from a boss, thinking about the attacks they used, and carefully customising your equipment and attacks to counter their tactics perfectly. There's a real feeling of catharsis when you go back to a boss, properly prepared, and win where you lost miserably before.
I strongly advise turning up the difficulty to the max level, in order to enjoy the game to its fullest

Aside from that there are some interesting mechanics. There's a surprisingly complex pokemon minigame, where you can capture almost any enemy you encounter, and them summon them in battle afterwards. For the most part, summons are like weapons - each one a sidegrade that offers flexible new tactics you could use. It feels worthwhile to try to catch em all, since it brings you more options for the harder fights

Despite the crippling difficulty of the fights, EBF doesn't feel unfair, because its forgiving in many other aspects.  Magic basins that fully heal you are plentiful, and you regen out of combat anyways, so you're usually at peak condition when starting any battle. You can save anywhere, anytime, and there's an autosave every time you win a fight just in case you forget. So when you inevitably die horribly facing an insurmountable foe, you're never more than 30 seconds away from giving it another try. Dark Souls could learn a thing or two from matt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163712911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1936, 'last_played': 1653063827}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072882121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1612782730}
review:
For starters, I have played the game through before its Steam release, and am now replaying it on Steam.

As other EBF games, this one is packed full of humour, cheap and clever. The combat feels good, every enemy, from the first crab you fight to all of the bosses have clear weaknesses, strenghts and personality (if you count hilarious move set as personality)
The soundtrack is better than ever, and all the areas are colorful and distinct from one another.

And, as a new feature in EBF 5, ALL FOES ARE CAPTURABLE. At first I thought there would be many filler summons with same abilites, but as it turns out, all of the summons are unique, and 90% of them fill some nieche.

The game is rather long, on Epic difficulty WITHOUT DLC main story only it is around 40 hours, and well over 60-70 with DLC and optional bosses and areas.

Definetly recommend for anyone who likes turn based RPGs that dont take themselves that seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051950216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1545834745}
review:
I enjoyed Epic Battle Fantasy 4 very much. 
I do not enjoy #5.

It does a lot of things right like EBF 4:

Lots of Items, equip, damage types, status effects, etc...
Lots of cleverly hidden chest, secrets, etc...
A lot of game time for your buck


BUT the negative parts are too much for me right now and so i stopped playing after 8 hours.
I played on hard for 5 hours and switched to normal difficulty afterwards because the battles grew increasingly boring/tedious

-Cant speed up Battle/Battle animations. feels like every fight takes 10mins.
-Cant feel any character progression. enemies seem to grow stronger faster than you can level up and therefore it takes 3 rounds to kill one enemy.
-Cant stand the "funny" character dialogues every second move in battle
-dont enjoy the fascist and sexist jokes. its not that i can´t laugh about sexism and fascism when done "well" but it feels like a 12 year old got his hands on the script most of the time which is really sad.
developer_response:
Are you sure the slow game speed isn't caused by lag- have you tried lower settings?
I don't think the humour is much different from previous games, but you also have the option to turn a lot of it off in the options.

I hope you give the game another try, maybe on Normal difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346739466', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1685052963}
review:
能不能把闪光特效去了，能不能把闪光特效去了，能不能把闪光特效去了，重要的事情说三遍！ get rid of the flash！my eyes are paining because of this

ALRIGHT, i should have checked the settings before my adventure. After turning off the flash my eyes finally can keep looking the screen without the danger of being blind.
So, what should i say now? I love this series since my childhood, when i dont even know much about English, yeah, i even can't understand the English menu of EBF1 and EBF2, bust i still beat gouku and lance, i simply choose swords by its appearence at first then by memory after knowing the performance of them, i didn't hear about what is called "elements""skills""buffs"or anything like those. I was attracted by the interesting acts of players and the beautiful grapic. It was after I found the forum of a group of Chinese fans of the game that i gradually know about the name of Matt and Natalie, right, i didn't know about the main characters names even after i beat the game, but i still beat it, because its fantastic.
So you can imagine how astonished i was when i found EBF3 when i almost forgot about the game.wtf?! And when i started to play, WTF?!!! It was completely a new game! Instead of kiliing enemies getting in my way with main characters already lv100 at the beginning, now the game is a real rpg with the shining points of itself. The intersting acts and beautiful graphics are dozens times more than EBF2 while the battle system is far beyond perfect for a flash game, i got to say even now it's still a outstanding individual game.And by that time i can read english text without much difficulty. so i started to know about the story, the dialogues, and how to beat enemies with best tactics. that's faqing good.
Since then i started to track the news of the series so, bulletheaven and adventure story and EBF4, EBF5 didn't make me astonished like EBF3.
And at the end of the comment, i got to say, I WANNA E——B——F——6！！！Do you hear me?!!!Matt!!(From the bottom of the graveyard)
developer_response: You can turn off flashing lights in the options. Hopefully that helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281265539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1565581850}
review:
过去我在一些小游戏网站上面玩到了EBF3 4，那时我立刻就被这个富有独特魅力的系列游戏吸引了，优秀的战斗系统，战斗时的风趣吐槽，一些有趣的梗，时不时令人一笑的幽默对话，益智谜题小游戏[strike] Matt暴怒	[/strike]以及超级好听的音乐[strike] 当然还有Natalie的奶子 [/strike]。由于当时4作没有汉化所以并没有入正，不过这次5作简中和繁中都有了，想都不用想赶紧就买了，虽然简中不如人意，可能的话还是希望能改进一下。

也不多说了，反正我是非常推荐这款优秀的rpg游戏给大家的，还有顺便推荐一下这作的ost，EBF每一作的音乐都非常棒，希望有能力的人都可以去支持一下。









最后我要说：P姐牛逼!!!P姐天下第一!!!(震声)

author: {'steamid': '76561198180220299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1624538232}
review:
2018.12.9已修改

我是史诗幻想系列的忠实粉丝，EBF4的通关，不下20遍，（后来才买的steam版，不然，你可以看看我的EBF4成就和游戏时长，或许你会惊讶我居然有两个成就没完成但你仔细看看那是那两个成就）
但这可真是糟糕，可我要给出这个差评，当然这份差评不止是为了批评这个游戏，也是为了让作者和中国人了解这个游戏的优缺点。（不看差评的就实在没办法了……）

首先给作者看的是，这份游戏不需要steam就可以启动！
不同于EBF4，steam版的EBF5和免费游戏EBF3一样，.swf是暴露再外的，而.swf文件可以直接被flash独立播放器读取从而绕过Steam的检测（如果你的浏览器安装了flash播放器插件应该也可以打开，至于中国大陆的flash插件嘛……），如果再不采取措施，这个游戏破解都不需要，全世界免费资源漫天飞。

接下来是针对玩家看的

本次先登录了steam，已入手EBF4的玩家可以获得一张折扣卷（重点！）
ps:不少欣喜的吧友忘记这一点然后50大洋买了……

故事情节
死宅Matt在游戏里打到最终boss的时候，突发地震，有一颗流星落在远方，于是Matt觉得，抄起家里的撬棍，踏上旅途，与伙伴们相遇，结下深厚的友谊[strike] （物理）	[/strike]的故事。

（可是，这奇妙的既视感，是究竟是怎么回事……）

本次EBF5相比与EBF4，首先，正式将画廊作为游戏内部的地图，给予玩家一边探索游戏一边获取成就一边欣赏来自全球各地EBF爱好者的arts。

同时，解密的难度相较于EBF4有了更大的提升，解密里，穿插着根本不必要的战斗内容……
此外，恢复了EBF3中利用地图遮挡道路来隐藏宝箱的独特收集方式，再宝箱收集上增加了遍布全图的钥匙收集，以及……令人抓狂的采用隐藏拉杆，遮蔽物挡起来的宝箱。

当然，EBF4的秘密没有取消，只是无法想象没有steam附加的扩展内容能不能完成600宝箱成就这一问题。

游戏地图总格数虽然不变，但单个区域格数扩大到了将近两倍，此外各种隐藏地点的加入，史诗幻想系列的地图空前巨大，另外，扩展包内容矿井迷宫，就快追上EBF4主世界的地图大小。

游戏的BGM上，依旧是有phyrnna小姐为我们带来的幻想系bgm，游戏里，我们可能会发现一些留声机，这些留声机里将播放过去EBF系列与其相关游戏中出现曲子的新编曲，你能认出多少。

战斗机制上，取消了以往的MP，改为了CD机制，第五者，NoLegs加入战队

宠物召唤，这次所有的宠物，都必须由玩家亲自捕捉，This is not P**emon……

角色培养上，每个人物都有自己的专属道具，不用再为过去繁琐的稀有道具发愁

总而言之，在游戏性上这个游戏非常不错，剧情上，有点单一，EBF系列一贯的缺点

接下来是缺点部分
关于情怀，人物ooc较为严重[spoiler] ，虽然这和剧情有关，但主线剧情真的太过平淡	[/spoiler]，Anna从元气少女的感觉变成了电玩爱好者的幼女，Lance的隐藏hentai与在四代就消失的中二病完全消失。（看看Lance厂长抓人的动机岂能和2代作为最终[strike]DIO-THE-WORLD	[/strike]BOSS的霸气相比。）也没有4代那种和Matt讨论变态内容时候一本正经(各种微型摄像头)，最终要的是枪刃成为了路过的摆设——
以及4代里，面对地图上各种不同的场景细节，不同角色作为leader会有不同的对话，比如4代工厂的秘密房间墙上的密码，还有盘根丛林（仍然觉得4代中文非官方的地名和技能名还有装备名翻译很到位），而这一点在5代被取消了。
（至少在World Demo里我没看到有Lance厂长关于枪刃的对话）



关于翻译
日语翻译非常厉害，招式名称非常霸气
繁体中文也不错，文言句式比较到位
接下来

但是，简体中文，至 少 我 不 敢 说 是 能 直 接 给 中 国 知 识 分 子 看 的 水 平 。
[strike] （这不是玩inm梗，只是强调）	[/strike]

（如果只是为了简体中文，还请谨慎购买）

能不能表现出中国的“傻屌”网友们（非贬义，莫黑）日常用的梗……这个得认认真真的看过全部文本才能下结论。

就由我，史诗幻想4吧的吧主，讲述关于翻译背后的故事。

EBF5的测试内容，实际上半年前就已经出了，在地图测试的时候，文本中已经夹带了现在绝大部分文本。

由于作者很早就放出EBF5要使用中文的消息，我们吧的另一个吧主（也是史诗幻想5吧吧主），网名莫微微，希望参与翻译，多次找作者协商，作者（Matt）表示谢谢她对游戏的喜爱，不过现在游戏开发要紧，希望将游戏开发完成后翻译。
但这个时候微微已经到了高二下学期，即将高三，如果不提前汉化，到时候汉化组会更快弄完。

于是我向微微提供了由地图测试中提取出的游戏文本，随后在我与其他人断断续续的提供从当时最新版本中提取的文本的情况下，微微一个人完成了除了技能介绍外几乎所有汉化，（少数后来的文本没有汉化），并在他男朋友（我们把的小吧主）的校对后整理成了doc文档，（Skill相关只完成了部分）

这时作者Matt宣布启动多语言工程，开始从粉丝里招募并组成汉化团队，然而微微因为高三的学业繁杂，错过了招人，等到微微联系官方汉化团队的时候，迎来的是作为leader的加拿大华裔所谓的汉化组不招新人，被拒之门外。此时，认识微微的已加入汉化组的网友，向leader，RegalStar推荐微微，并拿出了微微公开的一部分翻译，但RegalStar却说：“根本不能拿来用。”

但Matt却在公告里写，希望更多的人进入汉化团队。于是微微联系作者，由于先前几次的邮件，Matt知道微微的能力，自作决定让微微进入了汉化团队，但不知为何，微微和其他的中国大陆人，中国台湾人，中国香港人一样，简体汉化团队中，最多拿一个校队，整个汉化的主力，除了leader加拿大华裔RegalStar以外，均为没有到过中国的华人与华侨，在这种情况下，
这群人通过Google等渠道，做完了这个他们自认为适合全世界中文使用者的翻译——

然而没完，我在游玩EBF5的时候，发现了大量语句不通，语法混乱，感受到了违和感，某些位置的翻译特别突出，成就单里，某些BOSS的名字和微微的翻译一致，虽然boss部分是处于典故，找到典故相同的汉化不是没有可能，此外，某些成就名和微微的汉化基本相同，当然，成就就那么几个字，撞一下没问题。

但看到了“秘密关卡，用三颗灵魂宝珠打开...时之门？”这里我产生了怀疑，因为微微的翻译是“秘密世界， 用三颗灵魂宝石打开……时光之门？”而在体验版v0.16里，该处文本还残留一句英文。

而微微翻译的时候，对不确定没把握，或者需要交流讨论的地方会留下英文，校对的时候由我与他男朋友共同解决。

当然没有这里仍然办法证明微微的翻译被使用，但伴随着怀疑加深，我再一次解包，发现了微微的翻译被大量使用。

npc对话和战斗中对话中有明显以微微翻译为蓝本修改的痕迹，而在波塞冬等BOSS战中，居然直接照搬了微微的翻译！

然而当我们几个吧友在欣喜的打开EBF5时，在最后的致谢名单里，没有看到她的名字（Steam版本v1.0与v1.1）……

https://tieba.baidu.com/p/5966948721

证据在2楼


后续的补充
从微微哪里了解到，在将自己的翻译公布后，微微拿着Google Doc的权限，校队了部分文本，由于学业问题，微微长时间不能参与校队，在以个人理由回家后曾经想继续帮忙校队，但这个时候没有权限，Discord上也没有黄名，再后来大概11月左右因故回家再看也没有新的权限，便以为被汉化组除名，虽然联系过作者但没有下文，再看翻译的制作进度，也没有收到作者十几号发来的credit通知。
当然最后微微也不知道他的翻译被用了，认识的另外汉化组成员（可能和校队没完成有关）也不知道汉化文本有微微的部分。

我是觉得如果不声明一下，或许没有人会记得微微的名字，（尽管名单里名字还是打错了，Not薇薇，it should be 微微。），当然v1.2更新后莫微微的名字已经出现在了credit里。

但最后关于swf暴露在游戏文件里的问题还是不解决吗……我不觉得一个游戏破产前他的爱好者的人品有很高。（经历过Hero Fighter后的看法）

不改回好评的原因——好评太多了，会被掩埋的……

author: {'steamid': '76561197985708795', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1620541837}
review:
If you like any of the previous EBF games you will probably enjoy this one even more.

To sum up the game: A turn-based RPG with scalable difficulty that goes from everything being free, to it being a proper challenge that gives achievements and frustrating resets during boss fights (if unprepared). Nice artstyle, animation, music, interface, humor, sense of progression and so much more. I'd say one of the best parts is the soundtrack, i only needed about 20 minutes in the game to know i had to buy it.

I started off playing the first EBF as a flash game many years ago, and this dev unlike many in the industry has only grown and made improvements to their style. Im actually surprised to how much of an improvements this in every way to EBF4.



The only con's i can say about the game is a minor oversight in the interface (that will probably be fixed). When in equip and trying to upgrade gear from the small icon, there is no obvius easy way back to the equip menu where you were. The forge menu is a bit of a hassle to navigate through because even if sorted by male/female/helm/armor/whatever, it really doesnt matter, i want to look which of the gear i have i can upgrade.

Another small con is the minor hint of political commentary during Facist Fortress, nowhere near SJW or anti-SJW, but i dont really feel like being reminded how fucked the real world is while being sucked into a rich world like this.


Overall i give this game a 9.5/10, a must buy for any RPG lover for it's full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178801217', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1679621633}
review:
A worthy successor. Not revolutionary if you've already played EBF 4, but the enemies, equipment, map, music, writing, plot, etc. are all sufficiently original, and there's many common-sense QoL improvements that make it more enjoyable to play.

It's a better buy than 4 if you don't already own either of them, and if you have already played 4, it's not gonna rock your socks off but it's still great fun. Kudos and thank you to Matt for keeping this series alive and well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308890486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1676037108}
review:
This game is a masterpiece. [b] I have played 6 hours in 1 day lol [/b]. 
I have been waiting for this game for 4 years and it is really worth it.

The developer adds a lot of stuff inside such as summon creatures, statuses, puzzles, NoLeg (very cute <3). which works really well. Also the MP has been removed and replaced by cool down system which I think it makes game more balanced.

The game still conserves what EBF series has like secret treasure boxes, jokes between characters, epic story line. I'm certain that EBF fans will like it.

One only down side is the apperance of Natalie when using her limit break. I am not quite impressed and I think it can be more beautiful(Sorry everyone).

Lastly, I would encourage anyone who is looking for casual quality game to buy it. You won't regret!!

Matt please makes EBF6 immediately lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198345943928', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 27690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4481, 'last_played': 1699294865}
review:
By all means, this game is a better version of Epic Battle Fantasy 4. Which is saying something, given that I have 272 hours in EBF4. The writing is leagues better; Matt is more than just a stupid, hedonistic asshole. Lance has more depth than just being an edgy pervert. Anna has traits other than being a Goody Two-Shoes. The balance is also a lot better. Instead of weapons being "This one deals more Fire damage, this one deals more Water damage", etc, weapons often have more than one use. Take for instance, the Paper Fan, one of Natalie's staves. It boosts the damage of Wind skills, but it also has high magic attack, and it has a chance of giving Natalie an extra turn, as well as resisting 3 elements at once, making it an all-around useful offensive weapon. All players are useful now in EBF5; benching Anna or Lance like you did in EBF4 [i]will immensely fuck you over.[/i] Just about all weapons, hats, and armors have useful secondary effects, allowing for tons of different strategies when it comes to obliterating your foes. The new status effects allow you to pile even more damage onto tough foes; Haste even gives you additional turns, meaning if you know what you're doing, you can eviscerate bosses before they can even attack you. Hell, with Invisible and Target, even if they do attack you (assuming it's not a magical attack), they can't even hurt you. I made the game sound easy, but honestly, it isn't. Gimmicky strats can only carry you so far on Epic difficulty, and eventually, you'll just have to git gud. 

"But I don't care about the previous games, so your previous points don't matter to me", you say. Well, if you don't care about good writing, and satisfying, balanced gameplay for some reason, then I suppose you have the visuals and music to look forward to. Phyrnna apparently composed the soundtrack with the Flame Titan, because it's definitely Fire. Whether it's the bounciness of Nymphis Fae, or the awe-inspiring organs of Blaze of Iris, nearly every song in this game is a banger. Also, Matt really improved this game's visuals. EBF5 sheds the series' "old Flash game" look for a newer, colorful and cartoony look. It's essentially Bullet Heaven 2's graphics, but even more polished. The map areas and backgrounds are beautiful and heavily detailed. The cartoony graphics don't make scary looking foes appear cutesy and harmless, though. It also doesn't detract from the eeriness of certain locations. To add onto this game's good visual design, some equips change colors when used with other equips in order to avoid clashing horribly. For example, the Sharanga, a blue and black bow, turns red and black when used with the Red Dress or Obsidian Armor. 

Also, the game handles really nicely. Many things are just... convenient. Instead of using keyboard controls to walk around, you can also just click to where you want to go on the overworld. Instead of having a weaker skill then learning a stronger version of the skill alongside it, the weaker skill becomes the stronger skill, which won't take up space, and you won't have to ignore the weaker skill's existence. Switching a player's turn in battle can be done by just clicking on that player. There's a menu for recently used skills, making using a skill over and over much easier. You can make make, save and load equip loadouts so you don't have to take 10 years equipping and reequipping everyone's things. Special Skills can be unequipped, moved, and re-equipped to players for no cost at all. You can change game quality in battle. Instead of having both a single target version of a skill and an AoE version, you can choose to target a skill as either single or AoE. 

Weapons and armor in this game aren't just "Shit sword, slightly less shit sword, okay sword, good sword" until you get "Super OP God Sword". Each equipment piece has a specific purpose, and none are really a straight upgrade from the other. You can also choose to spare the pitiful lives of your enemies, if you wish, by allowing them to surrender and flee. Alternatively, you can enslave them and summon them in battle later. Summons allow you to fill in a lot of gaps in your current loadout, and you can also name them stupid things (if you're playing in English), like naming that one thing that killed you over and over "Bitch-Ass Ho". You can even capture bosses, if you have enough negative status effects on them. Some equips boost your capture chance, and Good Luck increases it as well. Also, this game has no MP. There's cooldowns. You may think "Excuse me, what the fuck? I don't want to plan out every single move I make! Why can't I just have MP?" Well, most moves don't even have cooldowns. Only the more powerful ones do. You can spam Seiken all you want with no repurcussions, but don't expect to drop a MOAB every two seconds. No MP also means you don't have to worry about running out of it, nor does it mean buying MP refilling food. Some foods reduce cooldowns, but you get Stuffed (can't eat items) if you use anything that reduces cooldowns by 2 or more turns. The cooldown system makes things easier, but it also requires more thinking and strategizing about use of powerful attacks/buffing moves. Oh, did I mention that healing items are percentage based instead of value based, meaning those food pickups you got at the beginning of the game could still have a use against the final boss? This game also lets you censor things like cleavage, blood, and even stuff like screen shaking and flashing. Perfect for your epileptic Christian children.

If you're still on the fence about getting this: Natalie's boobs jiggle when you click on them. There's even an achievement for doing this. You can also wave Anna's bangs. Or, [url=http://kupogames.com/public-beta/]just play the free version,[/url]which lacks the extra dungeons, but is still basically the full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357781779', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1690229395}
review:
"So, which is the boyfriend?  The school shooter or the homeless tramp?"

Amazing.

This game has became one of my favorite games so far in this year, and maybe of all time.  Since I've played the previous EBF (Epic Battle Fantasy) series' (1-4), obviously this is also gonna be another one of my favorites.  I've been waiting a few years for this, and since it's mostly developed by a single person (Matt), it's pretty impressive that he could release a new game in just 5 years.

The combat has been reworked a bit.  Mana has been removed and changed into turn cooldowns.  Could be better, could be worse, depending on your playstyle.  Capturing foes is also a thing, gives the game a pokemon-esque feel.  Summons of captured foes are also pretty powerful and can change the tide of battle a lot.  I actually didn't liek this change at first, because it would've taken more time to capture all,  but now I can see that it's for the better.  Really adds variety and a collectible feel to the game.

Besides gameplay changes from the 4th game, the graphics have been as simple as always.  Not 3D, not very polish, but simple.  This simplistic art really fitts the game theme as a lighthearted turn-based RPG game.  I also really like the new and old music provided within the game, especially the map music.  It's just really cool to listen to and also gives the feel of different environments and areas.  

Lastly, I'd definitely recommend playing this game at least once.  I also encourage turn-based RPG players to really try this out.  From it's humble beginnings on Kongregate as a flash game, to Steam Greenlight, and finally into Steam with all it's DLC.  For my personal opinion, a 10/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044079629', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2216, 'last_played': 1704594038}
review:
In my opinion, EBF has consistently provided amazing turn-based battle experiences, and EBF5 polishes and updates the formula to prefection. There are a ton of quality of life changes, and I'm thrilled with almost every mechanical change that I've seen so far. 

Changes to how skill assignment and stat boosters work mean that character's have much more flexibility than previous titles, and can slot into any role you wish them to, while still maintaing uniqunesses. The new summon system is actually a quite fun addition, allowing you to catch monsters during combat so you can summon them later. Buffs now apply to backup characters, so backup characters can actually see use during boss fights. I can already tell that last change is going to lead to some interesting swaps and combos during tough fights.

 Its clear a great deal of love and attention was put into the character and armor designs and all the animations. Animations are crisp and flashy, and the game is just generally pleasant to look at. The writing is light and fun, eliciting a couple chuckles at times. Characters love to gently lambast common RPG tropes, which is always fun.

The game continues to reward careful attnetion to detail during exploration, and leaves almost all its puzzles as optional, granting extra rewards for those who wish to take them on.

 I'm nowhere near finishing, but this definitely a great game. For veterans of the series, definitely consider starting on Hard. If you're new, there's no shame on playing on normal or even easy while you get the hang of the mechanics - and difficulty can be changed at any time, an awesome touch that allows you to change difficulty on the fly to match your desired level of challenge. To put it simply: if your looking for a great turn-based battle RPG experience, then EBF5 will fufill that better then just about any other game.

TL;DR: Superb Turn-Based RPG experience, highly recommended.

I'll try to keep this review updated with anything else relevant I discover while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171286851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2151, 'last_played': 1614975828}
review:
i bought this game the moment i knew it was out (thanks to a coupon from a warframe purchase) and i can't say close to dissappointed. 12 hours in and half the map is still a mystery, not including all of the optional area's i've skipped over.

one thing i can say is that it's not a good game to start the series with. there are jokes and references to previous games, even to old classic flash games, things you just wouldn't get unless you were invested in not only the series, but flash gaming as a whole. That being said, it's still undoubably a fantastic game, with satisfying and improved combat. buffs of the same type overwrite now, and there's no more mana. Replaced instead with cooldowns that truly seem fair and enjoyable to work with and around. 

if you liked the previous games, you'll love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082076705', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1711166437}
review:
After following the production of this game for about 2 years, I can safely say it was worth the wait. 
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 was one of my favourite games of all time, and now with the 5th one out I don't think I can go back to play it simply from how good this one is compared to it. Everything in this game is an improvement, and the addition of capturing monsters, as well as changing the use of mp for skills to waiting for skills to recharge was an excellent choice, shaking up this experience to be far more engaging and fun than any of the others in the series. 

So far I am only 8 hours in, and every second I'm not playing this game I'm eager to get back to it. With my playthrough I take most of the optional routes and I feel sure that it will live up to the 30 hour experience it promised, but I will confirm this once I have finished the main story.
